commentary.comment: The first half has started.
Good team movement sets up Aaron Seydel (Holstein Kiel) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post.
The goal by Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) won't count as it has been disallowed on the advice of the video assistant referee!
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Felix Uduokhai (Wolfsburg) for his blatant foul. Holstein Kiel win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
Patrick Herrmann (Holstein Kiel) has tested the patience of referee Daniel Siebert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Daniel Siebert has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.

Kenneth Kronholm pulls off a great save to deny Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the left side of the goal. Wolfsburg have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.

Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) jumped highest inside the box to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Maximilian Arnold. His header was precise and ended up inside the left post, leaving the goalkeeper flapping in the wind. The score is 0:1.
It is time for a substitution. Ignacio Camacho (Wolfsburg) is on for Yunus Malli.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Manuel Janzer (Holstein Kiel) will replace Tom Weilandt.
Marcus Anfang has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Dominic Peitz (Holstein Kiel) replacing Patrick Herrmann.
Maximilian Arnold slides a brilliant pass into Divock Origi (Wolfsburg), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.
Substitution. Divock Origi leaves the pitch and is replaced by Nany Landry Dimata (Wolfsburg).
Goal, no wait. Daniel Siebert blows his whistle for handball and Rafael Czichos (Holstein Kiel) can't celebrate. Disallowed goal.
John Brooks (Wolfsburg) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.
Dominic Peitz (Holstein Kiel) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Josip Brekalo will be replaced by Jakub Blaszczykowski (Wolfsburg).
Marvin Ducksch (Holstein Kiel) goes into the book for bad language. His vulgar comments could have made it worse. Luckily for him, it's a yellow card.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
Goal! Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
Kingsley Schindler (Holstein Kiel) latches on to a precise pass inside the box and drills in a superb strike that finds its way into the middle of the net.
Goal! Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot into the top right corner. It's 2:1.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Dominick Drexler (Holstein Kiel) hammers a powerful first-time shot from close range, sending the ball towards the right side of the target, but the goalkeeper stops it with a miraculous save.
Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) runs on to a clever pass from Divock Origi and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He still has work to do but finishes with aplomb into the back of the net.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Aaron Seydel (Holstein Kiel) is coming onto the pitch as Steven Lewerenz cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Marcus Anfang decides to make a substitution. Dominic Peitz (Holstein Kiel) will be replaced by .

Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Holstein Kiel.
Dominick Drexler (Holstein Kiel) links up with , who fires just wide of the right post from the edge of the box.

What a chance! Aaron Seydel (Holstein Kiel) squanders a promising opportunity as he latches on to a perfect cross from the wing. He produces a bullet header from around the penalty spot which goes just wide of the right post!
Substitution. Renato Steffen walks off the pitch and Jakub Blaszczykowski (Wolfsburg) comes on as a substitute.

Marvin Ducksch (Holstein Kiel) doesn't hesitate to shoot inside the box after a neat pass from Alexander Muhling. It's a good effort but just misses the left post. The ball goes out of play and Wolfsburg will have a goal kick.
Aaron Seydel (Holstein Kiel) peels away from his marker to receive a lofted pass, but sends his rocket of a shot just wide of the left post from inside the box.
Here's the change. Yunus Malli leaves the pitch and Ignacio Camacho (Wolfsburg) comes on as a substitute.
Divock Origi is being substituted because of an injury. Bruno Labbadia sends Nany Landry Dimata (Wolfsburg) on the pitch.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a well-taken defence-splitting pass inside the box and scores! He fires the ball into the top left corner.

Sebastian Maier (Hannover) carelessly slides into the feet of his opponent and he'll be lucky to avoid punishment. Guido Winkmann blows for the foul but keeps his cards in his pocket on this occasion. The referee makes a quick call and points to the penalty spot. Big scoring opportunity for Bayer Leverkusen.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) can't convert the spot kick. It goes narrowly wide of the right post.
Today's referee Guido Winkmann rightly decides to book Timo Hubers (Hannover) for his harsh tackle.
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 2:0.
Substitution. Julian Baumgartlinger is replaced by Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen).
Martin Harnik (Hannover) latches onto a cross inside the box but fires a poor effort high over the bar.
Tempers flare after a clattering challenge by Matthias Ostrzolek (Hannover), who receives a yellow card from the referee. It could have been worse for him!

Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot low towards the middle of the goal. However, Michael Esser anticipates the shot and makes an easy save.
Guido Winkmann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half gets underway.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Andre Breitenreiter gives a chance to Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) and Josip Elez is off.

What a save from Michael Esser! Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
Goal! Lars Bender tees up Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) inside the box, and he keeps his cool to find the left side of the goal. 3:0.
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Substitution. Linton Maina (Hannover) replaces Sebastian Maier.
Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Guido Winkmann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a neat pass inside the box and instantly thumps the ball goalward, but a defender makes a last ditch block to deny him.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Iver Fossum trots off the pitch and is replaced by Miiko Albornoz (Hannover).
Heiko Herrlich has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) replacing Aranguiz.
Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Substitution. Lars Bender will be replaced by Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen).
Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) produced a promising shot towards the right side of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Bernd Leno thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same.
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) unleashes a shot straight into the bottom left corner. Good team effort!
Goal! Linton Maina rounded the goalkeeper and sent a sweet pass to Martin Harnik (Hannover), who had an easy finish to put it into an empty net. 3:2.
Guido Winkmann is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
Goal! Anastasios Donis passes the ball to the feet of Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 0:1.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski puts the ball on a plate for Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 1:1.

What a save from Ron-Robert Zieler! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.

Goal! Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom left corner. Sven Ulreich had no chance of reaching it. The score is 1:2.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) will replace Corentin Tolisso.
Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) scores from quite a difficult position as he leaps high to connect with a cross and powers his header into the roof of the net. Excellent finish.
Goal! Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) slots the ball into an unguarded net from close range after a shot rebounds off a defender. 1:4.
Today's match ends for Thomas Muller who will be replaced by Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich).
Tayfun Korkut has decided to make a change. Marcin Kaminski (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Daniel Ginczek.
Substitution. Sebastian Rudy (Bayern Munich) on for Franck Ribery.

Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) bursts into the box after a fine solo run. He looks up and tries to place a shot into the bottom right corner, but Ron-Robert Zieler makes a great save to deny him his moment of glory. Corner kick. Bayern Munich will have an opportunity.
Tayfun Korkut prepares a substitution. Chadrac Akolo is replaced by Jacob Bruun Larsen (VfB Stuttgart).
Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) has tested the patience of referee Sascha Stegemann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Substitution. Anastasios Donis did his best and is replaced by Matthias Zimmermann (VfB Stuttgart).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

A sweeping move ends with a pass to Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg) inside the box. He lets fly towards the left side of the goal, but Alexander Schwolow was watching it all the way and makes a comfortable save. The referee blows his whistle, Augsburg are awarded a corner kick.
A yellow card is awarded to Martin Hinteregger (Augsburg).
Manuel Gulde (Freiburg) rises above the defence and heads a precise cross towards the left post. His effort, however, is blocked by Andreas Luthe, who pulls off a stunning save!
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Bastian Dankert starts the second half.
Goal! Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) unleashes a first-time shot from inside the box and beats the goalkeeper into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Rani Khedira leaves the pitch to be replaced by Sergio Cordova (Augsburg).
Christian Streich decides to make a substitution. Mike Frantz will be replaced by Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg).
Manuel Gulde (Freiburg) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post.
Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg) scores as he latches on to a pass inside the penalty box and fires a perfect low shot that goes into the middle of the goal and past the goalkeeper.
Close! Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.
The manager makes a subsitution with Robin Koch (Freiburg) coming on for Nils Petersen.
It's time for a substitution. Simon Asta (Augsburg) comes on in place of Jan Moravek.
Marco Terrazzino (Freiburg) is booked by the referee.
That's the end of the game for Janik Haberer, who is replaced by Caglar Soyuncu (Freiburg).
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) for a tough tackle.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
The game is interrupted, a clear handball by Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach). That's a penalty to Hamburger SV! They have a good chance to score now.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach).
Goal! Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) puts the ball into the bottom right corner past the outstretched arm of Yann Sommer.

Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Julian Pollersbeck is just a bystander as the ball flies into the left side of the goal. The score is 1:1.
Bobby Wood (Hamburger) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
Lewis Holtby slides a brilliant pass into Bobby Wood (Hamburger), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the left post.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Douglas Santos (Hamburger) is given a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Dieter Hecking prepares a substitution. Denis Zakaria is replaced by Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach).
The substitution has been made. Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) has replaced Jonas Hofmann.

Filip Kostic (Hamburger) gets to the rebound inside the box and shoots to the right post, but his sidefooter is blocked by an alert Yann Sommer. What a save! Hamburger SV force a corner. They send men into the box.
Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and drills a shot into the bottom right corner in trademark fashion.
Bobby Wood (Hamburger) is removed from the game! After his second caution from the referee the red was ineviatable!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Matti Steinmann trots off the pitch and is replaced by Albin Ekdal (Hamburger).
Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Vincenzo Grifo (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Thorgan Hazard.
Filip Kostic will be replaced by Bakery Jatta (Hamburger).

Bakery Jatta (Hamburger) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom right corner. Yann Sommer guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Hamburger SV.
Christian Titz is forced to make a change. Lewis Holtby is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger).
The match is interrupted due to the unacceptable behaviour of the fans in the stadium.
Everything seems to be alright after the game was interrupted, the referee blows his whistle and the match can continue.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.

It's in the back of the net! Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig) gets on the scoresheet after converting a chance from the resulting corner kick. He finds himself some space inside the box and plants a perfect header into the top of the net. 0:1.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the right side of the goal. The score is 1:1.

Ademola Lookman (RB Leipzig) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Rune Jarstein is just a bystander as the ball flies into the left side of the goal. The score is 1:2.
Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) latches on to a brilliant pass and hits a poor shot towards the middle of the goal, but the ball goes into the back of the net after the goalkeeper makes a howler!
The corner kick falls to Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin), who does his best to finish. The snap shot, however, only marks the left post!
Ademola Lookman (RB Leipzig) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Sven Jablonski ignores the protests.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
Goal! Jean-Kevin Augustin produces a great pass that finds Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the right side of the goal. 1:4.
Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) receives a delightful pass inside the box and smashes a low shot into the bottom right corner. What a clinical finish!
It will be a substitution. Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin) is ready to enter the pitch as Peter Pekarik walks off.
Ralph Hasenhuttl prepares a substitution. Ademola Lookman is replaced by Bruma (RB Leipzig).
Goal! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) makes the score 2:5 after burying a close-range header into the roof of the net after a good run and cross by Marvin Plattenhardt.
The substitution is prepared. Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Fabian Lustenberger.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his shot goalwards, but the keeper produces a decent save!
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) replacing Naby Keita.
It's time for a substitution. Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) comes on in place of Timo Werner.

Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) receives a diagonal pass, bursts into the box and shoots towards the middle of the goal. Rune Jarstein is well positioned, though, and it's a comfortable save. RB Leipzig force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.

Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Bruma (RB Leipzig) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper into the right side of the net.
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin) replaces Davie Selke.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Great save! Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot towards the left side of the goal was brilliantly saved by Oliver Baumann.

Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) receives a precise pass in the box and takes the shot early. The ball heads towards the bottom left corner, but Roman Burki shows off his skills and makes a brilliant save to deny him.
Goal! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) seizes on the loose ball after a huge error from Roman Burki and finds the back of the net from inside the box. 1:0.
Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Manuel Grafe blows his whistle to start the second half.
What a sweet touch by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Roman Burki to hold.
Goal! Raphael Guerreiro tees up Marco Reus (Dortmund) inside the box, and he keeps his cool to find the bottom left corner. 1:1.
GOAL - 2:1! Andrej Kramaric found Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) inside the box, he spotted goalkeeper Roman Burki off his line and chipped the ball into the net. What a cheeky lob!
We are about to witness a substitution. Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) is replacing Steven Zuber.
Goal! The rebound fell to Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) and he fired home from close range. The score is 3:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch for Andre Schurrle.
Julian Nagelsmann prepares a substitution. Andrej Kramaric is replaced by Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim).
Substitution. Mark Uth did his best and is replaced by Robin Hack (Hoffenheim).
Peter Stoger decides to make a substitution. Roman Burki will be replaced by Roman Weidenfeller (Dortmund).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.

Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper into the bottom left corner of the net.
Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) gets on the end of a long pass that is slotted through the defence and easily sends the ball into the bottom left corner!
Sebastian Langkamp goes off the pitch and Jerome Gondorf (Werder Bremen) comes on.

Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) blew a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross deep inside the box, but his shot flew just over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Werder Bremen will have a goal kick.
Martin Petersen has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Nice move, nice attempt! Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) is teed up with a simple pass after a nice flowing move. His first time shot from mid-range looks like it's going in but curls just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Mainz.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) replacing Nigel De Jong.
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) fires the resulting free kick to the left side of the goal from the edge of the box, but Florian Muller pulls off a superb save to deny him.

Levin Oztunali (Mainz) latches on to a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a brilliant shot towards the goal, but he hits the crossbar! The ball goes out of play and Werder Bremen will have a goal kick.
The substitution has been made. Gerrit Holtmann (Mainz) has replaced Levin Oztunali.
Substitution. Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen) has come on for Milot Rashica.
Gerrit Holtmann (Mainz) misses an absolute sitter after connecting with a cross inside the penalty box. The ball goes out of play and Werder Bremen will have a goal kick.

Marco Friedl (Werder Bremen) collects a wonderful lead pass and creates some space to smash the ball goalwards from long range. His shot goes painfully close to the right post! The ball goes out of play and Mainz will have a goal kick.

Florian Kainz sends over a killer cross from the resulting corner and expertly finds Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the top left corner. It's 1:2.
We are about to witness a substitution. Robin Quaison (Mainz) is replacing Giulio Donati.
The booking goes to Jerome Gondorf (Werder Bremen).
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to substitute Florian Kainz and he is replaced by Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen).
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
A long pass into the box is latched onto by Yoshinori Muto (Mainz), who looks up and slams a terrific shot past the keeper but onto the left post. He did everything right but score!
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Schalke will have a goal kick.

Goal! Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) peels away from his marker to meet the resulting free kick from Daniel Caligiuri, and he steers a powerful header from the centre of the box into the top left corner. What a finish that is - 1:0!

Amine Harit (Schalke) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Amine Harit (Schalke). This could have been a legendary goal. The ball goes out of play and Eintracht Frankfurt will have a goal kick.
Carlos Salcedo (Eintracht Frankfurt) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Frank Willenborg has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
Niko Kovac has made a change at the break. Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt) has come on in place of Gelson Fernandes.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Domenico Tedesco gives a chance to Alexander Nubel (Schalke) and Ralf Fahrmann is off.
Half-time substitution. Niko Kovac decided to make a change. Mijat Gacinovic is replaced by Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Abdul Baba Rahman (Schalke) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Evgen Konoplyanka.
That will be all from Sebastien Haller who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Omar Mascarell (Eintracht Frankfurt) was quite harsh and Frank Willenborg didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Lukas Hradecky was forced into action to thwart Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom left corner but couldn't beat the keeper.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Cedric Teuchert (Schalke) replaces Bastian Oczipka.

Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) accelerated away from the defence and took his shot early from the edge of the box. The ball flew towards the bottom left corner, but Ralf Fahrmann made a superb athletic save to deny him. The linesman makes the right call and Eintracht Frankfurt will have a corner.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) scores! He latches on to a pass and produces a perfect strike from the edge of the box that goes inside the left post and past the goalkeeper.
Jannes-Kilian Horn has picked up an injury and is replaced by Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln).
Bruno Labbadia has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Yannick Gerhardt (Wolfsburg) replacing Paul Verhaegh.
Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) shoots from inside the box after his amazing individual effort. He beats the goalkeeper, but hits one of the defending players and it bounces away.
Goal! Jonas Hector (1. FC Koln) dribbles into the box then perfectly lifts the ball over the goalkeeper and into the net. He couldn't do anything to stop that cheeky lob. 1:1.
Markus Schmidt has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
It's in the back of the net! Yunus Malli sprays a pass out to Divock Origi (Wolfsburg), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 2:1.
The referee gives a yellow card to Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg).
The referee signals a substitution. Christian Clemens (Koln) is brought on as a substitute for Milos Jojic.
The game is interrupted. Vincent Koziello (Koln) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Jonas Hector (Koln) is given a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Renato Steffen departs the field of play to be replaced by Jakub Blaszczykowski (Wolfsburg).

It's a goal! Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) alters the score to 3:1. He latched on to a good cross into the box from Josip Brekalo, steering his header from close range off the post into the top left corner. Timo Horn was helpless.
Stefan Ruthenbeck prepares a substitution. Claudio Pizarro is replaced by Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln).
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) receives a yellow card.
The substitution has been made. Elvis Rexhbecaj (Wolfsburg) has replaced Yunus Malli.
Jorge Mere (1. FC Koln) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Timo Horn with a strike into the bottom right corner. He makes it 4:1.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Thilo Kehrer (Schalke). Guido Burgstaller plays a fantastic through ball and finds Thilo Kehrer (Schalke), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom right corner. 0:1.
It's a goal! Philipp Max (Augsburg) introduces himself with a fine finish.
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) is penalised.

This is really unlucky! Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) attempted to clear the ball away after the oppositions corner kick into the box, but instead miskicked the clearance and put it into his own net, specifically inside the right post. He won't enjoy watching the highlights later.
Robert Kampka has issued a yellow card to Alessandro Schopf (Schalke).
Robert Kampka has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Marco Richter (Augsburg) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Thilo Kehrer (Schalke) picks up a yellow card.
It will be a substitution. Amine Harit (Schalke) is ready to enter the pitch as Franco Di Santo walks off.
Manuel Baum decides to make a substitution. Marco Richter will be replaced by Jan Moravek (Augsburg).
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Philipp Max (Augsburg).
Substitution. Daniel Baier will be replaced by Sergio Cordova (Augsburg).
Domenico Tedesco has decided to make a change. Bastian Oczipka (Schalke) replaces Evgen Konoplyanka.
Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) is given a yellow card.
The manager makes a subsitution with Cedric Teuchert (Schalke) coming on for Guido Burgstaller.
Manuel Baum prepares a substitution. Rani Khedira is replaced by Kevin Danso (Augsburg).

A short pass finds Cedric Teuchert (Schalke) in acres of space on the edge of the box and he decides to go for glory. His efforts looks in for all the world but just creeps past the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Augsburg.
That's it for today, Robert Kampka has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.

A brilliant cross into the box finds Nils Petersen (Freiburg), who directs his header towards the left post, but the goalkeeper shows all his agility and makes an astonishing save. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Freiburg.
Spectacular goal! Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) brilliantly darts into the box to latch on to a cross and buries the ball into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper stunned!
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the right post.
Christian Streich is forced to make a change. Julian Schuster is unable to continue due to injury, Janik Haberer (Freiburg) comes on.

What a chance that is! Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross, but he sends his header narrowly wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for B. Monchengladbach.
Matthias Ginter (B. Monchengladbach) rises high to connect with a cross from the corner kick, but his powerful header from near the penalty spot crashes against the crossbar!
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) is given a yellow card.

Goal! The ball is swung into the box from the resulting corner kick and finds Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach), who jumps highest and tries his luck with a header from around the penalty spot. His effort is both strong and precise enough to go into the top left corner. The score is 2:0.
Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg) hits a powerful volley from close range deep into the bottom right corner.

Goal! Tony Jantschke clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach), who jumps highest and steers a bullet header from the centre of the box into the left side of the goal. Alexander Schwolow had no chance of stopping that. 3:1.
It is time for a substitution. Reece Oxford (B. Monchengladbach) is on for Tobias Strobl.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Lucas Holer (Freiburg) comes onto the pitch so that Mike Frantz can be given a rest.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Yann Sommer makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the left side of the goal.
It's time for a substitution. Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) comes on in place of Josip Drmic.
The whistle blows and Marc-Oliver Kempf (Freiburg) is booked for an infringement.

Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) picks up the ball and goes on a great solo run. He decides to shoot from mid-range but his attempt is comfortably blocked by a defender. The ball is out of play. B. Monchengladbach will have a chance to score from a corner.
Substitution. Thorgan Hazard makes way for Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).
Christian Streich prepares a substitution. Marco Terrazzino is replaced by Robin Koch (Freiburg).
It's a yellow card for Lukas Kubler (Freiburg).
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
What a goal! Jean-Philippe Gbamin plays it to Bote Baku (Mainz), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Roman Burki into the roof of the net. 0:1.
Goal! Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) ran onto a clever lofted pass from Pablo De Blasis and easily beat the keeper with a header into the roof of the net from close range. 0:2.

GOAL! Superb work from Jadon Sancho, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund), who beats Florian Muller with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner. 1:2.

Alexander Hack (Mainz) picks up a sweet pass and fires one in from distance towards the right side of the goal, but Roman Burki is alert and makes a decent save. Good work from Mainz as they win a corner.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Bote Baku (Mainz) was quite harsh and Daniel Siebert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Omer Toprak is being substituted because of an injury. Peter Stoger sends Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) on the pitch.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Julian Weigl (Dortmund) receives the caution after an awful tackle.

Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) jumps for a cross and produces a fine header from near the penalty spot, but it goes narrowly wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Dortmund.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) picks up a yellow card.
Substitution. Bote Baku makes way for Alexandru Maxim (Mainz).
Peter Stoger decides to make a substitution. Christian Pulisic will be replaced by Andre Schurrle (Dortmund).
Mario Gotze (Dortmund) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Mario Gotze (Dortmund) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
A substitution has been made. Levin Oztunali is replaced by Karim Onisiwo (Mainz).
Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Daniel Siebert had an easy-decision to make.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch so that Mario Gotze can be given a rest.
Sokratis (Dortmund) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
Stefan Bell (Mainz) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Giulio Donati (Mainz) replacing Yoshinori Muto.
What a save from Florian Muller! Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
That's it for today, Daniel Siebert has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Niko Kovac has decided to substitute Timothy Chandler and he is replaced by Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt) goes in the referee's notebook after being shown a yellow card.

What an excellent finish! Marius Wolf (Eintracht Frankfurt) latched on to an inch-perfect cross into the box and rifled an unstoppable low drive into the middle of the net and past the helpless goalkeeper.
Carlos Salcedo (Eintracht Frankfurt) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
The match has reached half-time.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Tatsuya Ito goes off the pitch and Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger) comes on.
Here is a change. Albin Ekdal is going off and Christian Titz gives the last tactical orders to Filip Kostic (Hamburger).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Marius Wolf.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Goal! Omar Mascarell (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot into the top left corner. 2:0.
A substitution has been made. Gotoku Sakai is replaced by Nicolai Muller (Hamburger).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sebastien Haller trots off the pitch and is replaced by Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Goal! David Abraham puts a cross into the box and finds Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt), who latches on to it and strikes the ball inside the right post. He makes it 3:0.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.
Simon Terodde (Koln) misses a good chance to score. A perfect cross into the box finds Simon Terodde (Koln) who rises for a header, but he sends the ball well over the bar.
Good chance! Simon Zoller (Koln) nicely turned his man inside the box but placed his effort just wide of the right post. He should have scored!
Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Bibiana Steinhaus had an easy-decision to make. Bayern Munich are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
Marcel Risse (Koln) pounces on a pass inside the box but flashes his shot just over the bar. That was a great chance!
Niklas Sule (Bayern Munich) attempts to make a clearance and accidentally puts the ball into his own goal.

What a save from Timo Horn! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out. Bayern Munich will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Bibiana Steinhaus has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Jupp Heynckes gives a chance to Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) and Franck Evina is off.
GOAL! Thomas Muller meets a cross inside the box and heads the ball across the goal, where James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) lurks and pokes it into the back of the net. 1:1.

GOAL! Superb work from Thomas Muller, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who beats Timo Horn with a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. 1:2.
Here's the change. Simon Zoller leaves the pitch and Jhon Cordoba (Koln) comes on as a substitute.
Substitution. Thomas Muller walks off the pitch and Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
Jupp Heynckes has decided to make a change. Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich) replaces Robert Lewandowski.
Goal! James Rodriguez swings the ball deep into the box and finds Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich) unmarked, and his close-range header flies past the keeper into the right side of the goal. 1:3.
Stefan Ruthenbeck prepares a substitution. Simon Terodde is replaced by Claudio Pizarro (1. FC Koln).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Christian Clemens trots off the pitch and is replaced by Milos Jojic (Koln).

Claudio Pizarro (Koln) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Claudio Pizarro (Koln). This could have been a legendary goal.

Claudio Pizarro (1. FC Koln) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the left post. Sven Ulreich is alert and denies him with a nice save. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for FC Koln.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the right post. Terrific solo effort, though.
Martin Harnik (Hannover) receives a precise pass and quickly shoots. His effort goes into the right side of the goal off the post.
Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) rises above the defence inside the box, but his header flies narrowly wide of the left post.

Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) picks up a rebound inside the penalty area and drills a shot to the bottom left corner, but is denied by a reflex save from Rune Jarstein. Hannover force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he fails to change the score as his effort deflects away off the bar.
A yellow card for a tackle by Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin). Soren Storks doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

It's in the back of the net! Pirmin Schwegler flights the free kick into the box, where Salif Sane (Hannover) peels off his marker and heads straight inside the upright from the edge of the six-yard box. He makes it 2:0.
Brilliant finish! Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Timo Hubers, then produced a nice strike into the bottom right corner. The score is 3:0.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Soren Storks has ended it.
The second half has just started.
Booking. Pirmin Schwegler (Hannover) receives a caution from the referee.
Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) latches on to a superb cross inside the box but only hits the crossbar with a fine header. What a chance!
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Salomon Kalou walks off the pitch to be replaced by Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin).

A neat pass is well received by Martin Harnik (Hannover), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the right post, but the goalkeeper makes an incredible diving save to block his shot.
Today's referee Soren Storks rightly decides to book Karim Rekik (Hertha Berlin) for his harsh tackle.
Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and drills a shot into the bottom right corner in trademark fashion.
It will be a substitution. Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin) is ready to enter the pitch as Valentino Lazaro walks off.
The ball is crossed into the box and Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin) reacts quickest to send a shot flying towards the middle of the goal, but Philipp Tschauner gets a glove on it to thwart him.
Andre Breitenreiter decides to make a substitution. Martin Harnik will be replaced by Waldemar Anton (Hannover).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Palko Dardai (Hertha Berlin) is coming onto the pitch as Mathew Leckie cannot continue after picking up an injury.
A long cross into the middle of the area is pounced on by Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin), but his header curls narrowly wide of the right post.
It is time for a substitution. Noah-Joel Sarenren-Bazee (Hannover) is on for Kenan Karaman.
Soren Storks shows a yellow card to Palko Dardai (Hertha Berlin), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
The referee has issued a yellow card to Rune Jarstein (Hertha Berlin).
Substitution. Josip Elez (Hannover) on for Salif Sane.
Soren Storks is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
Goal! Jean-Kevin Augustin plays a pass to the feet of Ademola Lookman (RB Leipzig), and he shoots into the bottom left corner from inside the box. It's 1:0.
The video assistant referee intervenes and the referee disallows the goal as Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) was in an offside position.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and nets into the bottom right corner.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Marco Fritz has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Bruno Labbadia makes a half-time substitution. Nany Landry Dimata (Wolfsburg) comes on in place of Robin Knoche.

Renato Steffen produces a sweet pass and picks out Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the middle of the net and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 2:1!
The free kick is whipped into the box and finds Nany Landry Dimata (Wolfsburg), who plants a header just wide of the left post from close range.
Goal Ademola Lookman (RB Leipzig)! Ademola Lookman (RB Leipzig) was put through by Timo Werner and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom right corner. 3:1.
Goal! Diego Demme shows great vision to find Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) with a cheeky pass inside the box, and his first-time shot is precise and sails into the bottom left corner. 4:1.
Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) makes an awful challenge on his opponent and can count himself very lucky that the referee didn't issue a red card.
Here is a change. Jean-Kevin Augustin is going off and Ralph Hasenhuttl gives the last tactical orders to Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig).
Substitution. Daniel Didavi makes way for Elvis Rexhbecaj (Wolfsburg).
Bernardo comes off the pitch to be replaced by Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig).
The substitution is prepared. Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Josip Brekalo.

Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) latches on to a lovely pass inside the box and fires towards the left side of the net, but the effort is smothered by the keeper. The referee signals a corner kick to Wolfsburg.
Substitution. Dominik Kaiser leaves the pitch and is replaced by Benno Schmitz (RB Leipzig).
Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the left side of the goal is brilliantly kept out by the goalkeeper.
Marco Fritz is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
The booking goes to Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart).
Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.

Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) reacts well to get to the rebound and takes a shot from the edge of the box, but he fails to get the ball through the players standing between him and the goal. The ball goes out for a corner. Hoffenheim can continue in their attacking effort.
Timo Baumgartl (VfB Stuttgart) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.

Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) gets to the rebound on the edge of the penalty area and fires a shot towards the bottom right corner, but Ron-Robert Zieler gets a hand to it and keeps it out. Hoffenheim have been awarded a corner kick.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) collects a pass on the edge of the box but he slips the ball just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stuttgart.
Lukas Rupp is substituted due to injury. Julian Nagelsmann gives a chance to Robert Zulj (Hoffenheim).
Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) converts a killer cross with a precise low shot that goes into the bottom right corner. What a brilliant finish!
Felix Zwayer has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Tayfun Korkut gives a chance to Marcin Kaminski (VfB Stuttgart) and Holger Badstuber is off.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) receives a yellow card for infringement.
Substitution. Havard Nordtveit did his best and is replaced by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
Kevin Akpoguma (Hoffenheim) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Tayfun Korkut decides to make a substitution. Daniel Ginczek will be replaced by Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart).
Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) is sent off after receiving a second caution from the referee!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Steven Zuber leaves the pitch and Robin Hack (Hoffenheim) comes on.

Goal! Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom left corner. Oliver Baumann had no chance of reaching it. The score is 2:0.
Tayfun Korkut has decided to make a change. Orel Mangala (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Erik Thommy.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) receives a lofted pass from the side and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball flies onto the left post!
Ron-Robert Zieler (VfB Stuttgart) is punished with the yellow card.
Dennis Aogo (VfB Stuttgart) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Felix Zwayer is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
A short pass finds Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) in acres of space on the edge of the box and he decides to go for glory. His efforts looks in for all the world but just creeps past the left post.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Robert Hartmann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The foul by Sebastian Langkamp (Werder Bremen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Robert Hartmann.
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Here comes a substitution. Florian Kainz is given a rest as he is replaced by Jerome Gondorf (Werder Bremen).
Today's referee Robert Hartmann rightly decides to book Jerome Gondorf (Werder Bremen) for his harsh tackle.
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Panagiotis Retsos (Bayer Leverkusen), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen) will replace Wendell.
Heiko Herrlich decides to make a substitution. Dominik Kohr will be replaced by Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen).
A yellow card for a tackle by Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen). Robert Hartmann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen) replacing Philipp Bargfrede.
Heiko Herrlich is forced to make a change. Leon Bailey is unable to continue due to injury, Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) spurns a big chance! He gets to the rebound but only hits the crossbar!
Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Hartmann ignores the protests.
Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen) is booked.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Zlatko Junuzovic departs the field of play to be replaced by Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen).
Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Robert Hartmann is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort.
Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund) gets on the end of a pass and takes a low shot from the edge of the box which is straight at Jiri Pavlenka, who makes a comfortable save.
Goal! Marco Reus (Dortmund) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the left side of the goal. It's 0:1.

Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the left-hand post. Roman Burki is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him. The linesman points to the corner flag, Werder Bremen are going to take it.
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) watches the ball all the way and fires a first-time shot goalwards from inside the box, but the effort flies just wide of the left post.
A yellow card for a tackle by Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund). Felix Brych doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. Werder Bremen win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.

Jiri Pavlenka hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Marco Reus (Dortmund) shoots from the edge of the box towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. Dortmund earn a corner.
Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) wins the ball near the penalty spot and unleashes a header towards the middle of the goal, but Roman Burki is alert and denies him.
Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen) is quickest to the rebound inside the penalty area, and he plants a header directly into the top of the net.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) for his blatant foul.
Substitution. Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) on for Christian Pulisic.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Marco Reus (Dortmund) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.

Marco Reus (Dortmund) accepts a pass deep inside the box and after a nice touch sends the ball towards the right side of the goal. It is a pretty sweet shot, but one of the defenders changes the trajectory of the ball and deflects it onto the post. What an unlucky moment for Marco Reus (Dortmund). He must have smashed a mirror recently.

What a huge opportunity! Manuel Akanji (Dortmund) attempts to beat the goalkeeper with a close-range strike towards the roof of the net. The amazing Jiri Pavlenka deserves an ovation from the fans as he pulls off a spectacular save and pushes the ball onto the bar. The linesman makes the right call and Dortmund will have a corner.
Substitution. Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen) in, Milot Rashica out.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) sends a pass into the penalty area, but the opponent manages to cut it out. Good work from Werder Bremen as they win a corner.
The manager makes a subsitution with Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund) coming on for Maximilian Philipp.

Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Jiri Pavlenka guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Jadon Sancho (Dortmund) places a close-range header from a rebound onto the crossbar!
Sokratis (Dortmund) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Brych had an easy-decision to make. Werder Bremen are awarded a free kick.

Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) rises above the defence and heads a precise cross towards the left post. His effort, however, is blocked by Jiri Pavlenka, who pulls off a stunning save! Dortmund force a corner. They send men into the box.
Substitution. Jerome Gondorf did his best and is replaced by Marco Friedl (Werder Bremen).
Felix Brych is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
What a great touch by Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the bottom left corner, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending.

Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) carelessly slides into the feet of his opponent and he'll be lucky to avoid punishment. Bastian Dankert blows for the foul but keeps his cards in his pocket on this occasion. PENALTY AWARDED to Mainz!
Goal! Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) takes just a short run up and buries the penalty low into the middle of the goal.
Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
Stefan Bell (Mainz) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) is the one to unleash a good effort towards the bottom right corner. His shot, however, is saved by the goalkeeper. What a save!
Here is a change. Yussuf Poulsen is going off and Ralph Hasenhuttl gives the last tactical orders to Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig).
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Bruma (RB Leipzig) replacing Ademola Lookman.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Gerrit Holtmann (Mainz) for Levin Oztunali.

A sweet pass finds Gerrit Holtmann (Mainz) on the edge of the box, and he drills the ball towards the top left corner. Peter Gulacsi is almost caught out but pulls off a brilliant save at the last second. The referee blows his whistle, Mainz are awarded a corner kick.
Substitution. Pablo De Blasis makes his way off the pitch and Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) comes on as his replacement.
Substitution. Nigel De Jong walks off the pitch and Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) comes on as a substitute.
It's 2:0! Yoshinori Muto feeds Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the bottom left corner.
Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) receives a yellow card.
The yellow card goes to Naby Keita (RB Leipzig).
Bote Baku (Mainz) becomes the centre of attention as he finishes a great individual effort with a nice goal. His low shot ended up inside the left post.
Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) sees a second yellow card from the referee and already knows what will come next. It's a red and the match is over for Naby Keita (RB Leipzig).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.
Handball! A player from Stuttgart handled the ball. That is a penalty kick for Bayer Leverkusen.

Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) blows a huge chance to score! He sends the penalty to the left side of the goal, but it's not enough to beat Ron-Robert Zieler who easily stops the effort. The referee points to the corner flag and Bayer Leverkusen will take a corner.
Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
The end of the first half.
Tobias Welz blows his whistle and the second half starts.
We are about to witness a substitution. Berkay Ozcan (VfB Stuttgart) is replacing Erik Thommy.

Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Ron-Robert Zieler is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just over the crossbar.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) attempts to slip the ball through the defence, but is unable to find any of his teammates.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) scores a goal! A great cross finds him unmarked and he outjumps the defence to head the ball into the top left corner of the goal. Stunning header!
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Karim Bellarabi.
It's time for a substitution. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on in place of Julian Baumgartlinger.
That was close by Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.
Here is a change. Daniel Ginczek is going off and Tayfun Korkut gives the last tactical orders to Marcin Kaminski (VfB Stuttgart).
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Ron-Robert Zieler.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
A substitution has been made. Mario Gomez is replaced by Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart).
Heiko Herrlich decides to make a substitution. Lars Bender will be replaced by Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen).

Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) looks very eager to impress, does well to beat his man and force a cross into the box, where one of his teammates gets his head on the ball, but it's too easy for the keeper. (in this sentence the player crosses and heads his own cross!! So I created a different scenario).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Sven Ulreich makes a great save to stop his effort.
Goal! Niklas Dorsch (Bayern Munich) scores after an assist by Sandro Wagner that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:0.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Christian Dingert has ended it.
The second half has just started.
Here is a change after the half-time break. David Abraham is replaced by Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt).
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Jupp Heynckes probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Joshua Kimmich. He is replaced by Rafinha (Bayern Munich).
Meritan Shabani comes off the pitch to be replaced by Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich).
Niko Kovac decides to make a substitution. Mijat Gacinovic will be replaced by Marijan Cavar (Eintracht Frankfurt).
An accurate cross into the centre of the box from Frank Evina gives Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich) a clear sight of goal, but he sends his headed effort narrowly wide of the left post.
Substitution. Branimir Hrgota did his best and is replaced by Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Jupp Heynckes has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Niklas Sule (Bayern Munich) replacing Frank Evina.
Goal Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich)! Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich) was put through by Sebastian Rudy and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. 2:0.
Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) was in the right place to put the ball into the back of the net with his body. It's 2:1.
Rafinha (Bayern Munich) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Lukas Hradecky with a strike into the bottom left corner. He makes it 3:1.

Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the middle of the goal. Lukas Hradecky is alert, though, and makes an easy save to deny him.
Goal! Rafinha displays great vision and sends a pass to Niklas Sule (Bayern Munich), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom left corner. The score is 4:1.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) jumps for a cross and plants a precise header low inside the right post.

Marco Hoger (Koln) manages to dispossess his opponent of the ball, but he commits a foul in the process and the referee blows his whistle. The referee gives a penalty to Freiburg after a quick talk with the linesman, who had apparently seen the situation from a better perspective.
Christian Gunter (Freiburg) sends the penalty to the bottom right corner, but Timo Horn pulls off a wonderful save to deny him.
Simon Terodde (Koln) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails narrowly wide of the left post!
Mike Frantz (Freiburg) did his best to latch onto a through ball, but it was too strong.
The game is interrupted. Marco Terrazzino (Freiburg) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
The whistle blows and Yuya Osako (Koln) is booked for an infringement.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Marco Hoger (Koln).
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, Nils Petersen (Freiburg) unleashes a shot straight into the bottom left corner. Good team effort!
The referee allows time for a substitution. Mike Frantz will be replaced by Janik Haberer (Freiburg).
Substitution. Vincent Koziello (Koln) in, Tim Handwerker out.
Stefan Ruthenbeck decides to make a substitution. Simon Terodde will be replaced by Jhon Cordoba (1. FC Koln).
Today's referee Deniz Aytekin rightly decides to book Jorge Mere (1. FC Koln) for his harsh tackle.
Nils Petersen comes off the pitch to be replaced by Lucas Holer (Freiburg).
The referee signals a substitution. Claudio Pizarro (Koln) is brought on as a substitute for Yuya Osako.

What a goal! Jorge Mere plays it to Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Alexander Schwolow into the left side of the goal. 2:1.
Christian Streich has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Robin Koch (Freiburg) replacing Julian Schuster.
Goal! Marcel Risse plays a neat lofted pass into the box for Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln), who beats the defender in the air and plants a header into the right side of the goal from close range. 2:2.

He should have scored! Janik Haberer (Freiburg) latches onto a pull back in the box right in front of goal, but his shot towards the bottom right corner is pretty weak and Timo Horn makes an easy save.
Lucas Holer (Freiburg) shoots from inside the box after his amazing individual effort. He beats the goalkeeper, but hits one of the defending players and it bounces away.
Robin Koch (Freiburg) is punished with the yellow card.
Claudio Pizarro (Koln) is first to react to a loose pass inside the box, but slices his shot just wide of the right post.
Vincent Koziello (Koln) is cautioned by the referee.
GOAL! Robin Koch meets a cross inside the box and heads the ball across the goal, where Lucas Holer (Freiburg) lurks and pokes it into the back of the net. 3:2.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Martin Hinteregger (Augsburg) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the top of net only for Rune Jarstein to dive and make a save. The ball goes out of play and Augsburg have been awarded a corner kick.
It's in the back of the net! Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) tries his luck from the edge of the box and his shot takes a deflection and goes past the stranded Rune Jarstein. He makes it 0:1.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Marco Fritz starts the second half.
Michael Gregoritsch is being substituted because of an injury. Manuel Baum sends Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) on the pitch.
Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to release a low effort which ends up in the bottom right corner.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) comes onto the pitch so that Peter Pekarik can be given a rest.
Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) finds space inside the box but rifles his effort just wide of the left post.
Today's match ends for Per Skjelbred who will be replaced by Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin).
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. Palko Dardai (Hertha Berlin) replaces Salomon Kalou.
The game has come to an end for Alfred Finnbogason. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Marcel Heller (Augsburg).
Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) picks up a yellow card.
Booking. Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) receives a caution from the referee.
Manuel Baum has decided to substitute Jan Moravek and he is replaced by Christoph Janker (Augsburg).
The referee gives a penalty to Hertha Berlin! Christoph Janker (Augsburg) is penalised for holding. Marco Fritz signals a set piece.
Goal! Andreas Luthe gets a hand on the penalty from Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin), but can't stop it from flying into the bottom right corner.
Gooal! Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) scores with a shot from inside the box after latching onto a headed pass from Vedad Ibisevic. He makes it 2:2.
Marcel Heller (Augsburg) is sent off! He receives a red card and the match ends for him. He attempts to argue, but the referee's decision is final.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) blows an opportunity as he sends a rebound from just outside of the box narrowly wide of the left post.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke).
The referee shows a red card! Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) has to leave the pitch.
Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach) picks up a pass and unleashes a low shot towards goal, but he can't generate enough power to trouble Ralf Fahrmann. B. Monchengladbach will take a corner kick.
Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) picks up a caution.

A sweet pass finds Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) on the edge of the box, and he drills the ball towards the right side of the goal. Yann Sommer is almost caught out but pulls off a brilliant save at the last second. The ball goes out of play. Schalke are awarded a corner kick.

Goal! Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a brilliant pass and fires a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. Lars Stindl assisted in the goal. 0:1.
Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Lars Stindl is substituted due to injury. Dieter Hecking gives a chance to Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach).
Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) probably handled the ball. Joy for one side, despair for the other as the referee gives a penalty to Schalke!
Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) gets a yellow card. The referee Harm Osmers made the right call.
Goal! Yann Sommer gets a hand on the penalty from Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke), but can't stop it from flying into the bottom left corner.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Harm Osmers has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Evgen Konoplyanka as he is replaced by Cedric Teuchert (Schalke).
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes narrowly over the bar. Terrific solo effort, though.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Tobias Strobl (B. Monchengladbach) comes onto the pitch for Denis Zakaria.

A pass travels right across the box to Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) and gives him a sight of goal. He tries to beat the keeper in the bottom right corner, but Yann Sommer denies him with a decent save.
Amine Harit comes off the pitch to be replaced by Weston McKennie (Schalke).
The booking goes to Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach).
Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach) latches onto a pass and lets fly at goal from the edge of the box. The shot beats the keeper but smashes against the crossbar. Good effort!
We are about to witness a substitution. Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) is replacing Justin Hoffmanns.
Booking. Franco Di Santo (Schalke) receives a caution from the referee.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Franco Di Santo (Schalke) will replace Guido Burgstaller.
Here's the change. Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) leaves the pitch and Cedric Teuchert comes on as a substitute.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Bobby Wood (Hamburger) makes room to connect with a cross, but his strike from the penalty spot isn't accurate at all and the ball goes well over the bar.
Bruno Labbadia is forced to make a change. Marcel Tisserand is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Riechedly Bazoer (Wolfsburg).
Paul Verhaegh sprays a pass out to Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg), but he produces a poor effort from inside the box which goes high over the bar.
Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) makes a slide tackle, but referee Daniel Siebert blows for a foul. Hamburger SV are about to take a penalty!
Goal! Bobby Wood (Hamburger) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Koen Casteels into the bottom right corner.
A yellow card for a tackle by Paul Verhaegh (Wolfsburg). Daniel Siebert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Goal! Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) makes the score 0:2 after burying a close-range header in the top right corner after a good run and cross by Tatsuya Ito.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Substitution. Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) has come on for Paul Verhaegh.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) is given a yellow card.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg).
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) receives a lofted pass from the side and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball flies slightly wide, almost brushing the right-hand post.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Julian Pollersbeck (Hamburger).
Substitution. Aaron Hunt walks off the pitch and Albin Ekdal (Hamburger) comes on as a substitute.

Filip Kostic (Hamburger) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick shot to the left side of the goal, but he can't get the power to direct it past Koen Casteels, who keeps it out. Hamburger SV have a corner.
The game has come to an end for Jakub Blaszczykowski. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg).
Christian Titz has decided to make a change. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger) replaces Bobby Wood.
Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) executes the resulting free kick. His knuckleball confuses the goalkeeper and ends up in the back of the net.
The whistle blows and Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) is booked for an infringement.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Bakery Jatta (Hamburger) for Tatsuya Ito.
Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Hamburger) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Daniel Siebert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Bakery Jatta (Hamburger) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range went slightly wide of the right post.
Bakery Jatta (Hamburger) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar.

The referee's verdict is crystal clear. A penalty is awarded to Hamburger SV! An opponent rises to his feet after being downed by Riechedly Bazoer (Wolfsburg). Daniel Siebert saw the sliding tackle and blows for a foul.

Filip Kostic (Hamburger) steps up to the penalty spot. He attempts to confuse the goalkeeper by stopping in the middle of his run up and sends the ball to the bottom left corner, but Koen Casteels keeps his cool to thwart him.
Goal! Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger) fires the rebound into the top right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:3.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Goal! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) scores after an assist by Serge Gnabry that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:0.
Julian Nagelsmann is forced to make a change. Serge Gnabry is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim).
It's 1:1! Pirmin Schwegler feeds Kenan Karaman (Hannover) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the bottom right corner.
Timo Hubers (Hannover) sees a yellow card from Patrick Ittrich after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) scores from the resulting corner. The ball slips through the box to Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) and he smashes it inside the left post, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
The referee signals a substitution. Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) is brought on as a substitute for Julian Korb.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) was quite harsh and Patrick Ittrich didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Here is a change. Mark Uth is going off and Julian Nagelsmann gives the last tactical orders to Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
Today's match ends for Josip Elez who will be replaced by Iver Fossum (Hannover).
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to substitute Kerem Demirbay and he is replaced by Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Martin Harnik (Hannover) will replace Marvin Bakalorz.
Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails narrowly wide of the right post!
Patrick Ittrich shows a yellow card to Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
