Goal! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) receives the ball on the edge of the box and lobs the goalkeeper, who was off his line. He makes it 3:1.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Kevin Vogt (Hoffenheim).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) fires the ball in from a mid-range free kick, but the effort goes just wide of the right post.
Breel Embolo (Schalke) received a delightful pass inside the box before slotting the ball past the goalkeeper. What a brilliant finish!

An amazing individual effort from Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and makes it 0:2. Timo Horn was helpless.
Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and nets into the bottom right corner.
OFF THE POST! Good play from Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) as skips past two defending players and from the edge of the box unleashes a decent strike that smashes the right post!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Frederik Sorensen departs the field of play to be replaced by Dominic Maroh (Koln).

Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) meets an accurate cross inside the six-yard box and attempts a bullet header, but the goalkeeper denies him and makes the save. The ball goes behind for a corner. Schalke will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
The match has reached half-time.
Marco Fritz blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Domenico Tedesco has made a change at the break. Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) has come on in place of Breel Embolo.
A pass travels right across the box to Franco Di Santo (Schalke) and gives him a sight of goal. He tries to beat the keeper low in the middle of the goal, but Timo Horn denies him with a decent save.
Stefan Ruthenbeck has decided to substitute Salih Ozcan and he is replaced by Vincent Koziello (Koln).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) replaces Evgen Konoplyanka.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Tim Handwerker trots off the pitch and is replaced by Jhon Cordoba (Koln).

What a beautiful moment! Marcel Risse (Koln) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way inside the right post. Ralf Fahrmann just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 2:2.
Domenico Tedesco prepares a substitution. Franco Di Santo is replaced by Amine Harit (Schalke).
Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) unleashes a decent effort from just outside the box which goes narrowly wide of the left post.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) wins himself enough space to connect with a cross inside the box, but his fine header goes narrowly over the crossbar!
The ball falls kindly for Marco Richter (Augsburg) inside the box, but it's a poor effort and flies well wide of the right post.

Alfred Finnbogason produces a sweet pass and picks out Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the bottom right corner and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 1:0!
Frank Willenborg shows a yellow card to Philipp Max (Augsburg) for a tough tackle.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
A neat pass is well received by Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball on goal. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot.
That was close by Suat Serdar (Mainz)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.
Robin Quaison comes off the pitch to be replaced by Anthony Ujah (Mainz).
Manuel Baum prepares a substitution. Ja-Cheol Koo is replaced by Christoph Janker (Augsburg).
Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg) has tested the patience of referee Frank Willenborg and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Danny Latza walks off the pitch to be replaced by Alexandru Maxim (Mainz).
The foul by Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Frank Willenborg.
Superb touch by Marco Richter (Augsburg) as he receives a precise pass inside the box. He finds the keeper prepared as he unleashes his shot to the left side of the goal. Wonderful save!
Manuel Baum has decided to substitute Marco Richter and he is replaced by Marcel Heller (Augsburg).
A yellow card for a tackle by Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg). Frank Willenborg doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Substitution. Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) has come on for Giulio Donati.
Manuel Baum has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) replacing Michael Gregoritsch.
Marcel Heller (Augsburg) does well to control a poor pass on the edge of the box then shoots towards the right side of the goal. Rene Adler is out of position but leaps to make a brilliant save.
Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) latched on to a sweet pass and coolly slotted the ball inside the right post.
The referee has issued a yellow card to Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
Great save! Jadon Sancho (Dortmund) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot towards the right side of the goal was brilliantly saved by Ramazan Ozcan.

Goal! Christian Pulisic displays great vision and sends a pass to Jadon Sancho (Dortmund), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom right corner. The score is 1:0.
The goal by Marco Reus (Dortmund) won't count as it has been disallowed on the advice of the video assistant referee!
Panagiotis Retsos (Bayer Leverkusen) is penalised for holding. Markus Schmidt signals a set piece. Dortmund are awarded a penalty kick!

Marco Reus (Dortmund) places the ball on the penalty spot and sends it towards the left post. His effort isn't powerful enough, allowing Ramazan Ozcan to dive and keep the ball out with an excellent save.
Problems for Heiko Herrlich as Jonathan Tah is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces him.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Half-time substitution. Heiko Herrlich decided to make a change. Leon Bailey is replaced by Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen).

What a great touch by Mario Gotze (Dortmund) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the bottom left corner, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending. Dortmund earn a corner.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) is released by Mario Gotze, he surges into the box and smashes a great shot into the top corner after a one-on-one with the goalkeeper.
Goal - 3:0! Jadon Sancho tees up Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom left corner and past Ramazan Ozcan.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Lucas Alario.
Peter Stoger has decided to substitute Christian Pulisic and he is replaced by Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund).

It's a goal! Marco Reus (Dortmund) makes it 4:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Jadon Sancho and planted his close-range header into the left side of the goal. Ramazan Ozcan was helpless.
That will be all from Maximilian Philipp who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Jeremy Toljan (Dortmund).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marco Reus departs the field of play to be replaced by Sergio Gomez Martin (Dortmund).
Markus Schmidt is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Great chance! Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) controls a rebound inside the box. He only has the keeper to beat, but his shot flies just over the bar.
A great pass puts Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) clear inside the box, he sidesteps the keeper but inexplicably hit his shot off the crossbar.
Jonathan de Guzman is substituted due to injury. Niko Kovac gives a chance to Omar Mascarell (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Sascha Stegemann blows his whistle to start the second half.

Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Sascha Stegemann blows his whistle for an infringement. Hertha Berlin are awarded a penalty! The opposing players are protesting, but the referee had an easy-decision to make.
Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Lukas Hradecky to move before slotting the ball low into the middle of the goal!
The referee signals a substitution. Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) is brought on as a substitute for Ondrej Duda.
Niko Kovac has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) replacing Aymen Barkok.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Marco Russ will be replaced by Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Rune Jarstein makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the roof of the net.
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Omar Mascarell (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his blatant foul.
It's in the back of the net! Salomon Kalou slips the ball through to Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent shot inside the left post. He makes it 0:2.
Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) takes out his opponent with an awful tackle and is shown a red card by the referee!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) was quite harsh and Sascha Stegemann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Davie Selke walks off the pitch to be replaced by Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin).
Pal Dardai is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Karim Rekik suffers an injury and Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) comes on.

Goal! Salomon Kalou plays in Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin), who shows great determination to get to the ball before a couple of defenders and from inside the box slots it into the bottom right corner 0:3.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Caglar Soyuncu (Freiburg).
Janik Haberer (Freiburg) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Julian Pollersbeck.
Julian Pollersbeck gets a loud ovation for his save! Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg) meets the rebound and heads the ball towards goal from a promising distance, but the goalkeeper keeps it out.

Nils Petersen (Freiburg) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Julian Pollersbeck. The linesman points to the corner flag, Freiburg are going to take it.
Matti Steinmann (Hamburger) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
The match has reached half-time.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
What an outstanding solo effort by Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) as he weaves through the defence inside the box and rolls the ball into the back of net.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Gian-Luca Waldschmidt leaves the pitch and Bobby Wood (Hamburger) comes on.
Lukas Kubler (Freiburg) picks up a yellow card.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Nicolas Hofler will be replaced by Mike Frantz (Freiburg).
Christian Streich has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Florian Kath (Freiburg) replacing Janik Haberer.
Caglar Soyuncu (Freiburg) picks up his second yellow card from referee Benjamin Cortus and is given his marching orders.
Substitution. Matti Steinmann will be replaced by Albin Ekdal (Hamburger).
Christian Streich has decided to make a change. Robin Koch (Freiburg) replaces Julian Schuster.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Albin Ekdal (Hamburger) receives a yellow card.
Here comes a substitution. Bakery Jatta (Hamburger) is brought on as a substitute for Tatsuya Ito.
Filip Kostic (Hamburger) has a shot blocked from inside the box.
It's a yellow card for Gideon Jung (Hamburger).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Timo Hubers (Hannover) connects with the ball in the six-yard box after the resulting free kick and shoots towards the bottom left corner, but Sven Ulreich makes a magnificent save! Hannover force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Jupp Heynckes probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Arjen Robben. He is replaced by Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich).
It's in the back of the net! Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) tries his luck from the edge of the box and his shot takes a deflection and goes past the stranded Philipp Tschauner. He makes it 0:1.
Here's the change. Martin Harnik leaves the pitch and Noah-Joel Sarenren-Bazee (Hannover) comes on as a substitute.
Jupp Heynckes has decided to make a change. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) replaces Sandro Wagner.
Here is a change. Marvin Bakalorz is going off and Andre Breitenreiter gives the last tactical orders to Iver Fossum (Hannover).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and James Rodriguez walks off the pitch to be replaced by Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich).

The corner kick into the six-yard box is well met by Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who outjumps the defenders and steers a header into the left side of the goal and past the helpless goalkeeper with the aid of the post. The score is now 0:2.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sebastian Maier (Hannover) replacing Pirmin Schwegler.
Oliver Sorg (Hannover) is yellow-carded.
Goal! Sebastian Rudy (Bayern Munich) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot inside the left post. He makes it 0:3.
Martin Petersen is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the right side of the net, but Peter Gulacsi leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Goal 0:1! Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.

Oliver Baumann earns applause from the crowd! He dives superbly to deny a dangerous first-time effort from the edge of the six-yard box. Ademola Lookman (RB Leipzig) was the player who tested the keeper's reflexes. Nice goalkeeping skills. The ball goes out of play and RB Leipzig have been awarded a corner kick.
Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) places a shot from the edge of the box towards the bottom left corner, but Oliver Baumann makes a terrific save to deny him. Nice play all round!
Goal! Serge Gnabry (Hoffenheim) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 0:2.
What a goal! Mark Uth plays it to Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Peter Gulacsi into the top left corner. 0:3.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Tobias Welz blows his whistle to start the second half.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) replacing Stefan Ilsanker.
Half-time substitution. Bruma is replaced by Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig).
Half-time substitution. Benjamini Hubner will not participate anymore and Havard Nordtveit (Hoffenheim) is coming on.
Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) can have an early bath after being sent off by the referee for a tackle that simply has no place in football!
Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Serge Gnabry will be replaced by Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim).
Julian Nagelsmann decides to make a substitution. Florian Grillitsch will be replaced by Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim).
Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) has a sight of goal and fires from the edge of the box, but his strike rattles the left post!
Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) scores after a sweet individual effort. He gets the ball, dribbles towards the goal and from the edge of the box fires a terrific shot in off the left post.
Goal! A great cross from Andrej Kramaric finds Mark Uth (Hoffenheim), who scores with a simple header into an empty net. 1:4.
It is time for a substitution. Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig) is on for Willi Orban.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
It's in the back of the net! Nadiem Amiri plays it into the box, and Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 1:5.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper, but his effort is straight at Oliver Baumann, who is alert and makes an easy save to deny him.
It's in the back of the net! Ademola Lookman is the provider as he slips the ball to Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 2:5.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
The foul by Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Soren Storks.

Emiliano Insua produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) rises high to head the ball into the right side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 1:0.
Dennis Aogo (VfB Stuttgart) takes the free kick from the edge of the box, but Jiri Pavlenka dives superbly to deny him. His low shot went towards the bottom left corner.
Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow card from Soren Storks after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
What a huge chance for Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Marco Friedl (Werder Bremen) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the right side of the goal is brilliantly kept out by the goalkeeper.
Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Daniel Ginczek goes off the pitch and Berkay Ozcan (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to substitute Florian Kainz and he is replaced by Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen).
A short pass finds Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) in acres of space on the edge of the box and he decides to go for glory. His efforts looks in for all the world but just creeps past the left post.
Substitution. Erik Thommy will be replaced by Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart).
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to make a change. Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) replaces Ishak Belfodil.
The manager makes a subsitution with Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) coming on for Jerome Gondorf.
Mario Gomez will be replaced by Marcin Kaminski (VfB Stuttgart).

Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Berkay Ozcan (VfB Stuttgart) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and scores with aplomb inside the right post. What a beautiful finish that is!
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
Goal! Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the top right corner. He makes it 1:0.
The foul by John Brooks (Wolfsburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Tobias Stieler.

Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Koen Casteels to get hold of the ball. B. Monchengladbach will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Substitution. John Brooks makes way for Marcel Tisserand (Wolfsburg).
Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) gets on the end of a cross and unleashes an explosive shot at goal from close range, but Koen Casteels makes a fine one-handed save to deny him.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Koen Casteels. 2:0.

Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) struck with a perfectly taken free kick from the edge of the box. He curled the ball straight inside the left post. There are not enough superlatives that can be used to describe that goal.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

What an amazing save by Koen Casteels! Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot towards the bottom left corner, but fails. The ball goes behind for a corner. B. Monchengladbach will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Riechedly Bazoer.
Substitution. Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) on for Nany Landry Dimata.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Substitution. Jonas Hofmann leaves the pitch and is replaced by Laszlo Benes (B. Monchengladbach).
Dieter Hecking has decided to substitute Denis Zakaria and he is replaced by Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Tobias Strobl (B. Monchengladbach) in, Christoph Kramer out.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Abdou Diallo (Mainz) wasted a huge opportunity! He received a fine cross from the free kick and fired a decent shot in from close range. Unfortunately for him, it sailed narrowly wide of the left post! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Freiburg.
The main referee, Guido Winkmann, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Janik Haberer (Freiburg) is given a yellow card for dissent.
Marc-Oliver Kempf (Freiburg) probably handled the ball. The referee makes a quick call and points to the penalty spot. Big scoring opportunity for Mainz.
Goal! Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) takes a long run up and buries the penalty into the bottom left corner.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Half-time substitution. Christian Streich decided to make a change. Marc-Oliver Kempf is replaced by Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg).
Manuel Gulde (Freiburg) takes out his opponent with a horrible challenge and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
The game has come to an end for Robin Koch. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Julian Schuster (Freiburg).
Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg) latches onto a nice cross into the area around the penalty spot, but plants his header just over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Mainz.
Leon Balogun (Mainz) receives a yellow card from the referee for dissent.
We are about to witness a substitution. Florian Kath (Freiburg) is replacing Lucas Holer.
Goal! Alexander Schwolow makes a huge mistake and Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) has an easy task to put the ball into the back of the net. 2:0.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Nigel De Jong (Mainz) replacing Suat Serdar.
Substitution. Gerrit Holtmann (Mainz) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Levin Oztunali walks off.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) wastes a huge chance as he sends a first-time shot from inside the penalty area straight onto the left post!
Manuel Gulde (Freiburg) makes a terrific run to get on the end of the free kick and powers a header just over the bar from close in. The ball goes out of play and Mainz will have a goal kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Pablo De Blasis leaves the pitch and Anthony Ujah (Mainz) comes on.
Guido Winkmann is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.

Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) executes a nice mid-range free kick. His effort only flies inches wide of the left post. Today is obviously not his lucky day. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for RB Leipzig.
What was Nikolas Moisander (Werder Bremen) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.

What a sweet touch by Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) after latching on to a fine pass on the edge of the box! He finds some space and unleashes a cannonball towards the roof of the net. The goalkeeper makes a brilliant save, pushing the ball onto the post.
Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen) picks up a rebound in the box and unleashes a brilliant effort, leaving the goalkeeper no chance.
Christian Dingert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Ralph Hasenhuttl probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Dominik Kaiser. He is replaced by Ademola Lookman (RB Leipzig).
Goal! Ademola Lookman (RB Leipzig) beautifully controls a strongly hit pass from Stefan Ilsanker inside the box. He cuts inside his marker and rifles the ball into the bottom right corner. 1:1.

A sweet pass inside the box gives Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) time to measure a shot, but it's slightly mishit and goes just wide of the right post. That really was a great chance! The ball goes out of play and Werder Bremen will have a goal kick.
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to make a change. Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen) replaces Milot Rashica.

Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) is untouchable as he tricks his way into the box. His shot, though, lacks a little bit of accuracy and flies a whisker wide of the right post. That would have been a great goal! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Werder Bremen.
Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the right post only for Jiri Pavlenka to dive and make a save.
Kevin Kampl goes off the pitch and Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) comes on.
Florian Kohfeldt decides to make a substitution. Zlatko Junuzovic will be replaced by Jerome Gondorf (Werder Bremen).
Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.

Nice individual effort by Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen). He gets all the way through to the keeper and hits a low drive to the bottom left corner, but Peter Gulacsi does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out.
Substitution. Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) in, Maximilian Eggestein out.
Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) picks up a caution.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.
A short pass finds Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) in acres of space on the edge of the box and he decides to go for glory. His efforts looks in for all the world but just creeps past the left post.

Marco Reus (Dortmund) strikes the ball from a mid-range free kick towards the top left corner of the goal, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save. Dortmund force a corner. They send men into the box.

Nice move, nice attempt! Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) is teed up with a simple pass after a nice flowing move. His first time shot from mid-range looks like it's going in but curls just wide of the right post.
The match has reached half-time.
Manuel Grafe blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Peter Stoger makes a half-time substitution. Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) comes on in place of Maximilian Philipp.

Goal! Great link up play between Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) and Daniel Caligiuri gives the former a clear sight of goal on the edge of the box. He doesn't disappoint and beats the keeper in the left side of the goal. 1:0.
Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Chance! Marco Reus (Dortmund) gets to the rebound on the edge of the box and unleashes a low shot towards goal, but Ralf Fahrmann is alert and makes a great save to deny him.
CHANCE! Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) fires just over the crossbar from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Marco Reus.
Here comes a substitution. Leon Goretzka is given a rest as he is replaced by Weston McKennie (Schalke).
Domenico Tedesco has decided to make a change. Marko Pjaca (Schalke) replaces Evgen Konoplyanka.
A great run by Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) gets him into the box, but his powerful shot is bravely blocked by a defender. The ball goes out of play and Dortmund have been awarded a corner kick.
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Peter Stoger has decided to substitute Mahmoud Dahoud and he is replaced by Jadon Sancho (Dortmund).
What a chance that is! Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross, but he sends his header narrowly wide of the right post.
Naldo (Schalke) can showcase his brilliant free kick ability, particularly from a distance like this. He hits the ball perfectly and it ends up inside the left post.
Substitution. Marcel Schmelzer leaves the pitch and is replaced by Mario Gotze (Dortmund).
Domenico Tedesco has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Franco Di Santo (Schalke) replacing Amine Harit.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) accepts a sweet pass and produces a perfect strike from the edge of the box that goes inside the left post and past the helpless goalkeeper.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) misses a great chance after he found some space in the box! His effort goes inches wide of the left post.
Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and sends a low drive past the goalkeeper.
Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich) heads the ball low inside the left post after a splendid cross. This timely header produces a wonderful moment.
David Alaba (Bayern Munich) takes the resulting free kick from the edge of the box. His effort heads for the right side of the goal, but Yann Sommer denies him.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Jupp Heynckes has decided to substitute Thomas Muller and he is replaced by James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich).
Goal! Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) fires the rebound inside the left post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 3:1.
James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) latches onto a short pass just on the edge of the box and shoots. The effort beats the keeper but comes back off the left post. Close!
Substitution. Josip Drmic walks off the pitch and Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach) comes on as a substitute.
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Vincenzo Grifo (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Jonas Hofmann.

Goal! David Alaba (Bayern Munich) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box inside the right post. Yann Sommer had no chance of reaching it. The score is 4:1.
Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Robert Kampka didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Sandro Wagner walks off the pitch to be replaced by Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich).
Here is a change. David Alaba is going off and Jupp Heynckes gives the last tactical orders to Rafinha (Bayern Munich).
Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
It will be a substitution. Tobias Strobl (B. Monchengladbach) is ready to enter the pitch as Denis Zakaria walks off.
Goal! Joshua Kimmich puts a cross into the box and finds Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 5:1.
The foul by Juan Bernat (Bayern Munich) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Robert Kampka.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) is given a yellow card.

Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) shakes off the attention of a defender and from mid-range lets fly low towards the middle of the goal, but Lukas Hradecky is well positioned to make a comfortable save.
Kai Havertz produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box where Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) rises high to head the ball off the woodwork into the bottom left corner. The score is now - 1:0.
Danny da Costa (Eintracht Frankfurt) picked up a yellow card from referee.

GOAL! Superb work from Marius Wolf, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt), who beats Bernd Leno with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner. 1:1.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.

OFF THE CROSSBAR! Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.

Lukas Hradecky was forced into action to thwart Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the right post but couldn't beat the keeper.
Substitution. Kevin-Prince Boateng walks off the pitch and Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as a substitute.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Jetro Willems will be replaced by Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home into the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Heiko Herrlich has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) replacing Leon Bailey.
Goal! Karim Bellarabi puts the ball on a plate for Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 3:1.
The substitution is prepared. Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Marius Wolf.
It's a yellow card for Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen).
A yellow card is awarded to Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Simon Falette (Eintracht Frankfurt) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
Substitution. Lars Bender did his best and is replaced by Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen).
Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) is cautioned by the referee.
Substitution. Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) on for Kai Havertz.
Goal - 4:1! Karim Bellarabi laid the ball off to Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen), who slots it into the back of the net from close range, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Felix Brych is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.

Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) meets the lofted pass inside the box with a well placed shot towards the right side of the goal, but Timo Horn pulls off a fantastic save to deny him. The ball is out of play. Hertha Berlin win a corner kick.
What a save from Rune Jarstein! Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
Problems for Stefan Ruthenbeck as Simon Zoller is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Jhon Cordoba (1. FC Koln) replaces him.
Goal! Jhon Cordoba gets to the ball and heads it over the defence to Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln), who meets it nicely and fires in into the back of the net. 0:1.
Soren Storks shows a yellow card to Christian Clemens (Koln) for his blatant foul. Another situation results in a direct free kick for Hertha Berlin.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Pal Dardai gives a chance to Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin) and Mitchell Weiser is off.
Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) sends a cross into the box, but the opposition's defence quickly intercepts the ball.
Goal! Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) fires the rebound into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:1.
Tempers flare after a clattering challenge by Jorge Mere (Koln), who receives a yellow card from the referee. It could have been worse for him!
Marvin Plattenhardt plays a terrific cross over to Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin), who finds some space inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.
Here is a change. Vedad Ibisevic is going off and Pal Dardai gives the last tactical orders to Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Claudio Pizarro departs the field of play to be replaced by Marcel Risse (Koln).
Stefan Ruthenbeck has decided to substitute Christian Clemens and he is replaced by Simon Terodde (Koln).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin) will replace Salomon Kalou.
Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his shot goalwards, but the keeper produces a decent save!
A brilliant individual effort! Jhon Cordoba (Koln) tricks his way past challenges into the box and blazes his shot just a few inches over the top.
Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
Marcel Risse (Koln) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has started.
The video assistant referee intervenes and the referee disallows the goal as Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) was in an offside position.
Serge Gnabry (Hoffenheim) receives a killer pass and scores a great goal after finding the back of the net with a simple finish!
Goal Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim)! Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) was put through by Nico Schulz and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. 2:0.
A substitution has been made. Matti Steinmann goes off and Albin Ekdal (Hamburger) comes on.

Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger) latches on to a pin-point pass on the edge of the box and fires the ball into the roof of the net, but an amazing dive from the goalkeeper denies him. The strike bounces off his gloves and crashes against the bar! Hamburger SV have a corner.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.
Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) latches onto a pass inside the box, steps inside his marker and smacks a shot against the right post.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Douglas Santos (Hamburger) was quite harsh and Harm Osmers didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Kevin Akpoguma (Hoffenheim) is coming onto the pitch as Serge Gnabry cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jann-Fiete Arp (Hamburger) comes onto the pitch so that Gian-Luca Waldschmidt can be given a rest.
Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Harm Osmers didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Florian Grillitsch will be replaced by Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim).
The goal by Kevin Akpoguma (Hoffenheim) won't count as it has been disallowed on the advice of the video assistant referee!
Here is a change. Rick Van Drongelen is going off and Christian Titz gives the last tactical orders to Sejad Salihovic (Hamburger).
The referee signals a substitution. Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) is brought on as a substitute for Nadiem Amiri.

Kevin Akpoguma (Hoffenheim) dribbled past his opponents before finding himself in a great position to strike. His attempt from just outside of the box went towards the bottom right corner, but it wasn't dangerous and Julian Pollersbeck made a comfortable save. Hoffenheim have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Gideon Jung (Hamburger) sees a yellow card from Harm Osmers after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Harm Osmers is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) evades his marker in the box and connects beautifully with the corner from Erik Thommy. Unfortunately for him, the ball just zips a few inches over the bar.
Timo Hubers (Hannover) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header just wide of the left post.

Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) weaves through the defence with ease and gets one-on-one with the keeper, but fails to score with his strike towards the bottom right corner as Philipp Tschauner produces a good save. The referee signals a corner kick to Stuttgart.

Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike to the bottom left corner. Philipp Tschauner pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill.

Philipp Tschauner makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart) on the edge of the box and he drills goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the middle of the goal.
Felix Klaus (Hannover) picked up a yellow card from referee.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Tayfun Korkut decided to make a change. Andreas Beck is replaced by Orel Mangala (VfB Stuttgart).

Felix Klaus (Hannover) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the bottom right corner is blocked by Ron-Robert Zieler, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart) received a pass and blasted a beautiful rocket of a shot from just outside the penalty area into the top right corner. He was given an ovation. Excellent finish.
Julian Korb (Hannover) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
Substitution. Felix Klaus makes his way off the pitch and Kenan Karaman (Hannover) comes on as his replacement.
Here is a change. Erik Thommy is going off and Tayfun Korkut gives the last tactical orders to Berkay Ozcan (VfB Stuttgart).
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to make a change. Noah-Joel Sarenren-Bazee (Hannover) replaces Iver Fossum.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) rises high to meet a perfect cross, but powers his header just wide of the left post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Julian Korb trots off the pitch and is replaced by Sebastian Maier (Hannover).
Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) gets a yellow card.
Goal! Miiko Albornoz is the provider and Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) is the executioner, dispatching the cross into the roof of the net from close in with his head. 1:1.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Patrick Ittrich had an easy-decision to make.

Nany Landry Dimata (Wolfsburg) attempts to convert a cross into a goal, but his promising header from near the penalty spot towards the roof of the net is denied by a decent save from Marwin Hitz. The ball is out of play. Wolfsburg will have a chance to score from a corner.
Felix Uduokhai (Wolfsburg) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Half-time substitution. Manuel Baum decided to make a change. Sergio Cordova is replaced by Marco Richter (Augsburg).
It's like he was asking for a caution. Jan Moravek (Augsburg) receives a yellow card.
Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) wastes a great chance as he climbs high around the penalty spot to connect with a cross from the resulting free kick. He produces a header which goes just over the crossbar.
Patrick Ittrich blows his whistle and Jan Moravek (Augsburg) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.
It will be a substitution. Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) is ready to enter the pitch as Riechedly Bazoer walks off.

Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) picks up a pass and tries his luck from mid-range towards the roof of the net, but Marwin Hitz is equal to it and makes an easy save. The ball is out of play. Wolfsburg win a corner kick.
Marco Richter (Augsburg) receives a pass on the edge of the box and attempts a lob as the keeper is off his line, but the effort crashes off the crossbar.
Crossbar! Paul Jaeckel (Wolfsburg) picks up a precise pass and produces a bullet of a strike from distance that smashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal.
Paul Jaeckel picks out Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) on the edge of the six-yard box, but the headed attempt bends just round the right post.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Nany Landry Dimata as he is replaced by Victor Osimhen (Wolfsburg).
The game is interrupted. Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Here comes a substitution. Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) is brought on as a substitute for William.
RED CARD! Felix Uduokhai (Wolfsburg) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Patrick Ittrich. He can have an early bath.
Marco Richter comes off the pitch to be replaced by Gojko Kacar (Augsburg).
That's it for today, Patrick Ittrich has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

A header by Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen) from very close range goes towards the right-hand post, but doesn't get past Peter Gulacsi, who makes a brilliant save. The referee blows his whistle, Bayer Leverkusen are awarded a corner kick.

An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Naby Keita (RB Leipzig), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Bayer Leverkusen will have a goal kick.
Goal! Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) has a shot from the edge of the box which goes past the goalkeeper and into the back of the net. Yussuf Poulsen provided the assistance with a headed pass. 1:0.
Sven Bender is being substituted because of an injury. Heiko Herrlich sends Panagiotis Retsos (Bayer Leverkusen) on the pitch.
What a great touch by Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) as he controls a fine pass into the box and fires the ball to the left post, but the effort is brilliantly blocked.

Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up the ball inside the penalty box and immediately fires a first-time effort that sails well over the crossbar and ends in the stands. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for RB Leipzig.
What a sweet touch by Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Peter Gulacsi to hold.

Kevin Kampl (RB Leipzig) was all set to celebrate a sensational goal after he collected a rebound and blasted a shot in from long range. Unfortunately for him, his effort sailed narrowly wide of the left post. What an unlucky moment for him. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayer Leverkusen.

1:1. Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a pass on the edge of the penalty area and immediately fires a fantastic first-time shot into the left side of the net. What a finish that is! Peter Gulacsi did his best to stop it, but the shot was just too good. Leon Bailey provided the assistance.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a killer pass deep inside the box and coolly puts the ball inside the right post!
Goal! Panagiotis Retsos (Bayer Leverkusen) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 1:3.
Substitution. Bruma (RB Leipzig) in, Yussuf Poulsen out.
Wendell is substituted due to injury. Heiko Herrlich gives a chance to Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen).
Substitution. Lars Bender will be replaced by Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen).
Goal! Julian Brandt manages to prod the ball to Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) after a melee inside the box, and he needs no second invitation to slot the ball into the bottom right corner. 1:4.
That's the end of the game for Timo Werner, who is replaced by Ademola Lookman (RB Leipzig).
The substitution has been made. Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) has replaced Naby Keita.

Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen) zig-zags his way into the box and fires the ball towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a great reaction save to stop the effort. Bayer Leverkusen force a corner. They send men into the box.
Close! A mistake by a defender gifts Bruma (RB Leipzig) a chance inside the box, but his efforts curls just around the left post. The ball goes out of play and Bayer Leverkusen will have a goal kick.
Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Bernd Leno.
Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) has an effort from close range after latching on to a precise pass, but he can't beat one of the defenders who makes a good block.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is strong enough to get to the ball and produces a header from close range. Even though it was aimed precisely towards the middle of the goal, Oliver Baumann didn't have a hard time stopping the attempt as it wasn't powerful enough.

What a miss! Serge Gnabry (Hoffenheim) is left standing right in front of goal with only the keeper to beat after a clever pass, but he somehow contrives to toe poke the ball just past the right post.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) gets into a shooting position! What a long-range cannonball of a shot! His nice effort, however, only crashes against the right post. Aim better, sir.
Daniel Siebert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
Goal! Marius Wolf passes the ball to the feet of Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 1:0.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) for his blatant foul.
The substitution has been made. Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) has replaced Lukas Rupp.
Niko Kovac has decided to substitute Luka Jovic and he is replaced by Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Serge Gnabry (Hoffenheim) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and coolly sends the ball into the back of the net.
Substitution. Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) on for Andrej Kramaric.
Niko Kovac has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) replacing Kevin-Prince Boateng.
It's time for a substitution. Simon Falette (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on in place of Marco Russ.
Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) connects with a perfect cross and blasts the ball towards goal, but his effort crashes against the crossbar.
Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) picks up a yellow card.
The game has come to an end for Serge Gnabry. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
Daniel Siebert is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) leaps high deep inside the box to meet a beautiful cross from the resultant free kick. He glances a header goalwards, but it's not accurate and goes narrowly wide of the left post.
Andreas Beck (VfB Stuttgart) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Patrick Ittrich ignores the protests.
Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) receives a precise pass just outside the box and produces a glorious strike into the top left corner off the post. The goalkeeper was helpless.
This would have been a magnificent goal from Marco Reus (Dortmund), who collected the ball inside the box and prodded a first-time shot on goal that flew just narrowly wide of the right post.
Today's referee Patrick Ittrich rightly decides to book Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) for his harsh tackle.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Patrick Ittrich blows his whistle to start the second half.
Goal! Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund) scores after an assist by Nuri Sahin that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 2:0.
Dennis Aogo (VfB Stuttgart) gets a yellow card.
Substitution. Erik Thommy leaves the pitch and is replaced by Jacob Bruun Larsen (VfB Stuttgart).
Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) gets a yellow card.
Goal! Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 3:0.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jeremy Toljan (Dortmund) will replace Marcel Schmelzer.
Today's match ends for Dennis Aogo who will be replaced by Berkay Ozcan (VfB Stuttgart).
The yellow card is received by Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart).

Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the left side of the goal. However, Ron-Robert Zieler anticipates the shot and makes a brilliant save. Dortmund earn a corner.
Golden chance! Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
Here is a change. Maximilian Philipp is going off and Peter Stoger gives the last tactical orders to Jadon Sancho (Dortmund).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sergio Gomez Martin (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch for Marco Reus.
Tayfun Korkut prepares a substitution. Santiago Ascacibar is replaced by Orel Mangala (VfB Stuttgart).
Nuri Sahin (Dortmund) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the right side of the goal is brilliantly kept out by the goalkeeper.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Hamburger) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.

It's in the back of the net! Daniel Caligiuri flights the free kick into the box, where Naldo (Schalke) peels off his marker and heads it straight into the bottom right corner from the edge of the six-yard box. He makes it 0:1.
It's a goal! Filip Kostic (Hamburger) bursts into the box to get on the end of a whipped in cross from Douglas Santos and scores magnificently from close range into the roof of the net. 1:1.
What an opportunity that was! The ball rebounded out to Lewis Holtby (Hamburger), whose shot from the edge of the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.

Excellent touch by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger)! He latches on to a precise pass deep into the box and produces a low drive towards the right post. The goalkeeper pulls off a beautiful save to deny him. Hamburger SV win a corner.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Christian Dingert has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Domenico Tedesco gives a chance to Franco Di Santo (Schalke) and Breel Embolo is off.
Domenico Tedesco makes a switch. Weston McKennie (Schalke) is coming on in place of Max Meyer at the start of the second period.
The ball finds its way to Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) after a confusing situation inside the goalmouth. He finds some space and easily knocks the ball in with his body and alters the score to 2:1.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Matija Nastasic (Schalke).
Goal! Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:2.
The game is interrupted. Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Matti Steinmann (Hamburger) is penalised.
Here's the change. Matti Steinmann leaves the pitch and Albin Ekdal (Hamburger) comes on as a substitute.
Domenico Tedesco has decided to substitute Matija Nastasic and he is replaced by Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke).
Bakery Jatta (Hamburger) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Filip Kostic.
It is time for a substitution. Jann-Fiete Arp (Hamburger) is on for Gian-Luca Waldschmidt.
Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) goes on a mazy run, perfectly slipping past the opposition's defence. He aims well and places a precise effort behind the goalkeeper! Wonderful goal! Total football.
A brilliant cross into the box finds Franco Di Santo (Schalke), who directs his header towards the left post, but the goalkeeper shows all his agility and makes an astonishing save.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
A long pass into the box is latched onto by Philipp Max (Augsburg), who looks up and slams a terrific shot past the keeper but onto the left post. He did everything right but score!
Niklas Sule (Bayern Munich) puts the ball into the back of the net but, unfortunately for him and his teammates, it's into his own goal!
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg).
Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
Goal! Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich) ran onto a clever lofted pass from Joshua Kimmich and easily beat the keeper with a header into the bottom left corner from close range. 1:1.
What a save from Marwin Hitz! James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save to keep it out.
Goal! A great through ball by Juan Bernat sets up James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) inside the box, and he makes no mistake and bangs the ball into the bottom left corner. 1:2.
Rani Khedira (Augsburg) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Markus Schmidt lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot towards the top right corner, but Marwin Hitz pulls off a brilliant save. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Bayern Munich.
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

James Rodriguez produces a sweet pass and picks out Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the bottom right corner and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 1:3!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marco Richter (Augsburg) replaces Sergio Cordova.
Jupp Heynckes has decided to substitute James Rodriguez and he is replaced by Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich).

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) takes the resulting free kick from the edge of the box. His effort heads for the bottom left corner, but Marwin Hitz denies him. It will be a corner kick for Bayern Munich.
Substitution. Jan Moravek (Augsburg) replaces Michael Gregoritsch.
Here is a change. Juan Bernat is going off and Jupp Heynckes gives the last tactical orders to Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).
Arjen Robben goes off the pitch and Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) comes on.
Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:4.
Manuel Baum prepares a substitution. Daniel Baier is replaced by Christoph Janker (Augsburg).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Nice move, nice attempt! Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) is teed up with a simple pass after a nice flowing move. His first time shot from mid-range looks like it's going in but curls just wide of the right post.
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) collects a pass on the edge of the box but he slips the ball just wide of the right post.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) has a great chance inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.
Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach) finds himself with a great opportunity! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which whizzes just wide of the right post!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Bibiana Steinhaus has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Dieter Hecking gives a chance to Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) and Denis Zakaria is off.

Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the left side of the goal. Yann Sommer shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
The video assistant referee intervenes and the referee disallows the goal as Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) was in an offside position.
Chance! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Vladimir Darida, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the right post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mickael Cuisance departs the field of play to be replaced by Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach).
The foul by Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Bibiana Steinhaus.
Goal! Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the net. He makes it 1:1.
Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) commits an ugly challenge. The referee sees it and immediately blows his whistle. PENALTY to B. Monchengladbach!
Goal! Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Rune Jarstein into the bottom right corner.
Substitution. Vladimir Darida leaves the pitch and is replaced by Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin).
Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Patrick Herrmann.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Salomon Kalou walks off the pitch to be replaced by Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) comes onto the pitch for Arne Maier.
Today's referee Bibiana Steinhaus rightly decides to book Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) for his harsh tackle.
A yellow card for a tackle by Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach). Bibiana Steinhaus doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
That's it for today, Bibiana Steinhaus has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Jonas Hector (Koln) gathers a perfect a cross and nods home. The ball goes inside the right post. No chance for the goalkeeper.
Lukas Klunter (1. FC Koln) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Benjamin Cortus didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Today's referee Benjamin Cortus rightly decides to book Leon Balogun (Mainz) for his harsh tackle.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Simon Terodde (Koln) receives a precise pass in the box and takes the shot early. The ball heads low towards the middle of the goal, but Rene Adler shows off his skills and makes a brilliant save to deny him.
Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) rises high to connect with a cross inside the six-yard box and his well-placed header goes in off the bottom of the right post.
Benjamin Cortus shows the yellow card to Vincent Koziello (1. FC Koln) for a heavy challenge.
The foul by Suat Serdar (Mainz) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Benjamin Cortus.
It is time for a substitution. Robin Quaison (Mainz) is on for Emil Berggreen.
Stefan Ruthenbeck decides to make a substitution. Yuya Osako will be replaced by Claudio Pizarro (1. FC Koln).
Danny Latza (Mainz) takes out his opponent with a horrible challenge and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Robin Quaison (Mainz) misses a great chance to score after his effort hits the left post!
A substitution has been made. Vincent Koziello goes off and Salih Ozcan (Koln) comes on.

FC Koln force their opponents to concede a corner. Claudio Pizarro (1. FC Koln) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the roof of the net. His effort, however, is blocked by Rene Adler, who pulls off a stunning save!
Problems for Stefan Ruthenbeck as Lukas Klunter is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Jhon Cordoba (1. FC Koln) replaces him.
Benjamin Cortus shows a yellow card to Christian Clemens (1. FC Koln), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Sandro Schwarz is forced to make a change. Daniel Brosinski is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Karim Onisiwo (Mainz).
Substitution. Anthony Ujah (Mainz) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Levin Oztunali walks off.
Tempers flare after Giulio Donati (Mainz) commits a foul. He receives a yellow card for his bad challenge and surely must be relieved at not receiving a red card.
Benjamin Cortus blows his whistle and Giulio Donati (Mainz) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.
Salih Ozcan (Koln) has received a yellow card for his foul.
A tremendous drive by Jhon Cordoba (Koln) from inside the box towards the middle of the goal looks like it's in, but Rene Adler makes a brilliant save.
Robin Quaison (Mainz) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot towards the middle of the goal was easily saved by Timo Horn.
That's it for today, Benjamin Cortus has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Alexander Schwolow. 0:1.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Sascha Stegemann blows his whistle to start the second half.
Vincent Sierro (Freiburg) wastes a big opportunity! He controls the ball after a nice low pass and shoots from a promising distance. His poor effort goes miles wide of the left post.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by William (Wolfsburg) was quite harsh and Sascha Stegemann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Christian Streich has decided to make a change. Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg) replaces Florian Kath.
Bruno Labbadia is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Nany Landry Dimata suffers an injury and Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) comes on.
Christian Streich decides to make a substitution. Vincent Sierro will be replaced by Bartosz Kapustka (Freiburg).
Divock Origi feeds the ball through to Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the left side of the goal! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:2!
Christian Streich prepares a substitution. Caglar Soyuncu is replaced by Julian Schuster (Freiburg).
Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) handles the ball inside the penalty area. Penalty awarded! Freiburg will take a penalty kick.
Koen Casteels anticipates the direction of the penalty by Nils Petersen (Freiburg). He attempted to put the ball into the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper was there in time to deny him.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Riechedly Bazoer (Wolfsburg) for Josip Brekalo.
Here is a change. Yunus Malli is going off and Bruno Labbadia gives the last tactical orders to Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg).
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! A great through ball by Miiko Albornoz sets up Martin Harnik (Hannover) inside the box, and he makes no mistake and bangs the ball into the bottom left corner. 1:0.

Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from just outside the box wasn't accurate enough and the ball bounced away off the left post!
Goal! Felix Klaus (Hannover) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 2:0.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to make a change. Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) replaces Florian Kainz.
Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Tobias Welz had an easy-decision to make.
Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen) scores from quite a difficult position as he leaps high to connect with a cross and powers his header into the roof of the net. Excellent finish.
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Sebastian Langkamp (Werder Bremen) for a tough tackle.
Substitution. Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen) in, Maximilian Eggestein out.
Here is a change. Josip Elez is going off and Andre Breitenreiter gives the last tactical orders to Pirmin Schwegler (Hannover).
The main referee, Tobias Welz, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) is given a yellow card for dissent.
Here's the change. Philipp Bargfrede leaves the pitch and Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen) comes on as a substitute.
My grandmother could have scored that! Sebastian Langkamp (Werder Bremen) blazed the ball just over the bar from close range!
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Ihlas Bebou as he is replaced by Kenan Karaman (Hannover).
Andre Breitenreiter decides to make a substitution. Felix Klaus will be replaced by Noah-Joel Sarenren-Bazee (Hannover).
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Patrick Herrmann has a look up and finds Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) in space. He wastes no time in trying to test the keeper from distance but the shot is just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Mainz will have a goal kick.
The match has reached half-time.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The game has come to an end for Raffael. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach).
Yann Sommer makes a beautiful save from Alexander Hack (Mainz), who latched on to an accurate lofted pass and produced a timely header. The goalkeeper was able to tip the ball onto the bar and away.
Problems for Dieter Hecking as Nico Elvedi is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Florian Mayer (B. Monchengladbach) replaces him.
Levin Oztunali will be replaced by Robin Quaison (Mainz).
It is time for a substitution. Gerrit Holtmann (Mainz) is on for Suat Serdar.
Dieter Hecking has decided to substitute Mickael Cuisance and he is replaced by Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach).
Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) is punished with the yellow card.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Anthony Ujah (Mainz) will replace Emil Berggreen.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
Lukas Hradecky pulls off a great save to block a header from Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen) after a nice lofted cross. The ball goes out of play and Werder Bremen have been awarded a corner kick.
Florian Kohfeldt is forced to make a change. Ludwig Augustinsson is unable to continue due to injury, Marco Friedl (Werder Bremen) comes on.
Goal! Thomas Delaney plays it to Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen), whose deflected shot from inside the box goes past the helpless Lukas Hradecky. 1:0.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen) was quite harsh and Felix Zwayer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Niko Kovac is forced to make a change. Ante Rebic is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.

Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen) clutches his head in despair after he blew a huge opportunity! He received the ball from the free kick, took a good first touch and unleashed a projectile from close range to the middle of the goal, but Lukas Hradecky makes a nice save.

Kevin-Prince Boateng feeds the ball through to Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the left side of the goal! The goalkeeper was helpless. 1:1!

Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot towards the middle of the goal was easily saved by Jiri Pavlenka. The ball is out of play. Eintracht Frankfurt will have a chance to score from a corner.
The substitution has been made. Taleb Tawatha (Eintracht Frankfurt) has replaced Timothy Chandler.
Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen) drives into the box and hits a tremendous shot that, unluckily for him, flashes just wide of the left post.
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) goes into the referee's book for dissent.
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to substitute Ishak Belfodil and he is replaced by Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen).
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Marco Russ limps off the pitch to be replaced by Simon Falette (Eintracht Frankfurt).

David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) attempts to head the ball away after a cross into the penalty area, but instead he accidentally sends it under the crossbar of his own goal. The goalkeeper was helpless.

Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the left side of the goal, but Lukas Hradecky pulls off an exquisite save to deny him. The ball goes out for a corner. Werder Bremen can continue in their attacking effort.
Zlatko Junuzovic comes off the pitch to be replaced by Sebastian Langkamp (Werder Bremen).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) latches on to the corner kick inside the box, but his header from near the penalty spot crashes against the right post! The goalkeeper would have been helpless.
Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) beats an opponent and drives towards the edge of the penalty area. He steadies himself and hits a tremendous shot that flashes a whisker past the right post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Victor Osimhen will not participate anymore and Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) is coming on.
Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) picks up the rebound from his own attempted pass and decides to shoot from mid-range. He shouldn't have bothered as the ball flies miles over the bar.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) will replace Vedad Ibisevic.
Bruno Labbadia prepares a substitution. Josip Brekalo is replaced by Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg).
That will be all from Arne Maier who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin).

Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Koen Casteels makes a great save to stop the effort going into the bottom left corner. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Hertha Berlin will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
The referee has issued a yellow card to Paul Verhaegh (Wolfsburg).
Here comes a substitution. Nany Landry Dimata is given a rest as he is replaced by Divock Origi (Wolfsburg).
Here is a change. Salomon Kalou is going off and Pal Dardai gives the last tactical orders to Julian Schieber (Hertha Berlin).
The referee gives a yellow card to Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin).

Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) creates himself some space around the penalty spot and connects with the free kick. His header would probably have ended up inside the bottom right corner, but Koen Casteels pulls off a decent save to thwart him.
