Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow card in the hand of Deniz Aytekin. And as it's a second one this game, a red follows and Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) is sent from the pitch.
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives a perfect pass for a great chance inside the box and slots the ball past the goalkeeper.
The video assistant referee intervenes and the referee disallows the goal as Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) was in an offside position.
James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) receives a killer pass and scores a great goal after finding the back of the net with a simple finish!
It's in the back of the net! James Rodriguez plays it into the box, and Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the roof of the net. 3:0.
Peter Stoger has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Julian Weigl (Dortmund) replacing Gonzalo Castro.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) gathered the ball off a rebound inside the box and fired home into the bottom right corner.
GOAL! Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Roman Burki, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 5:0.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Jupp Heynckes probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of David Alaba. He is replaced by Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich).
James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Julian Weigl (Dortmund) goes in the referee's notebook after being shown a yellow card.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
James Rodriguez goes off the pitch and Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) comes on.
Mario Gotze (Dortmund) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort rattles the left post! What a shot that was!
Jupp Heynckes has decided to substitute Franck Ribery and he is replaced by Sebastian Rudy (Bayern Munich).

A sweet pass finds Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) on the edge of the box, and he drills the ball towards the bottom left corner. Roman Burki is almost caught out but pulls off a brilliant save at the last second.
The substitution has been made. Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund) has replaced Christian Pulisic.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mario Gotze trots off the pitch and is replaced by Nuri Sahin (Dortmund).

Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund) had a good chance to change the score. He ran towards the goal and unleashed a low shot from just outside the penalty area which went towards the middle of the net, but the goalkeeper was ready and made an amazing save.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 6:0.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has started.
The defence just can't clear the ball and a rebound eventually falls to Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) deep inside the box, but his well-hit shot flies just wide of the left post.
That was close by Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the right post.
A substitution has been made. Daniel Baier is replaced by Sergio Cordova (Augsburg).
The referee shows the yellow card to Jan Moravek (Augsburg).
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Frank Willenborg blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) runs onto a pass and from the edge of the box tries his luck with a dipping shot. Unfortunately for him, the effort fizzes just over the bar.
Philipp Max (Augsburg) gets a yellow card.
Martin Hinteregger (Augsburg) is furious with himself as he misses a golden opportunity from inside the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post.
The goal by Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) won't count as it has been disallowed on the advice of the video assistant referee!
Today's match ends for Dominik Kohr who will be replaced by Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen).
Manuel Baum has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Christoph Janker (Augsburg) replacing Michael Gregoritsch.
Substitution. Julian Baumgartlinger is replaced by Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen).
Substitution. Panagiotis Retsos makes way for Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen).
Here is a change. Jan Moravek is going off and Manuel Baum gives the last tactical orders to Marco Richter (Augsburg).
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
It's a goal! Timo Werner plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 0:1.
Here's the change. Waldemar Anton leaves the pitch and Josip Elez (Hannover) comes on as a substitute.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Guido Winkmann has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
Andre Breitenreiter makes a half-time substitution. Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) comes on in place of Julian Korb.
The yellow card goes to Diego Demme (RB Leipzig).
It's a goal! Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) does well to meet a cross inside the box and produces a stunning header that goes inside the left post.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Bruma walks off the pitch to be replaced by Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig).
Here is a change. Jonathas is going off and Andre Breitenreiter gives the last tactical orders to Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover).
Oliver Sorg (Hannover) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
Substitution. Jean-Kevin Augustin is replaced by Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig).
Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Guido Winkmann had an easy-decision to make.

Salif Sane (Hannover) displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header home from close range after a fine cross following the corner kick. The ball bounces in off the inside of the left post. He alters the score  1:2.
Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems fires the ball into the back of the net.
Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) reacts well to a deflected cross from Oliver Sorg and places a close-range header beyond the keeper into the right of the goal. 2:3.
The substitution has been made. Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig) has replaced Emil Forsberg.
The goal by Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) won't count as it has been disallowed on the advice of the video assistant referee!
Salif Sane (Hannover) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Guido Winkmann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig) was quite harsh and Guido Winkmann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Pirmin Schwegler (Hannover) has tested the patience of referee Guido Winkmann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover) storms into the box to get on the end of a pass, but smashes his shot straight onto the left post. Unlucky! The ball goes out of play and RB Leipzig will have a goal kick.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) misses a great chance! He latches on to a fine cross into the box, but his effort misses the right post by a whisker.

Marco Hoger (Koln) was the quickest one to orientate himself inside the box and rose high to reach a fine corner kick. He fails to direct the ball past the goalkeeper as it flies narrowly over the bar.
Serge Gnabry (Hoffenheim) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Timo Horn with a strike under the crossbar. He makes it 1:0.
Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Timo Horn pulls off a great save to deny Serge Gnabry (Hoffenheim), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner.

A cross following the corner kick finds its way to Dominique Heintz (Koln) inside the box and he manages to steer it under the bar. He is about to start celebrating a goal, but Oliver Baumann makes a save in the nick of time and maintains the current score. The referee points to the corner flag and FC Koln will take a corner.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Goal! Serge Gnabry (Hoffenheim) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom left corner. Timo Horn had no chance of reaching it. The score is 2:0.

Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) in a great chance! He climbs highest deep in the penalty box and strikes with a powerful header towards the net. Next time he should aim better. His effort ends wide of the right post.
Substitution. Jhon Cordoba (Koln) has come on for Yuya Osako.
Goal! Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and strikes the ball into the bottom left corner.
Stefan Ruthenbeck has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Claudio Pizarro (Koln) replacing Leonardo Bittencourt.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Benjamini Hubner as he is replaced by Havard Nordtveit (Hoffenheim).
Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim) receives a well-taken defence-splitting low pass inside the box and scores! His great effort makes its way into the left side of the goal.
Here is a change. Andrej Kramaric is going off and Julian Nagelsmann gives the last tactical orders to Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim).
Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and coolly sends the ball into the back of the net.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Lukas Rupp leaves the pitch and Robert Zulj (Hoffenheim) comes on.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Frederik Sorensen (Koln) comes onto the pitch for Jonas Hector.
Goal! Mark Uth plays a pass to the feet of Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim), and he shoots into the back of the net from inside the box. It's 6:0.
Robert Zulj (Hoffenheim) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
That's it for today, Robert Hartmann has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
What a chance that is! Bastian Oczipka swings the ball into the box, and Naldo (Schalke) gets in front of his man and powers his header just wide of the left post.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Domenico Tedesco has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Amine Harit (Schalke) replacing Franco Di Santo.
Bastian Oczipka goes off the pitch and Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) comes on.
Vincent Sierro (Freiburg) receives a pass on the edge of the box and attempts a lob as the keeper is off his line, but the effort crashes off the right post.
Manuel Gulde (Freiburg) was too forceful with his tackle and Tobias Stieler interrupted the game to signal a free kick. Schalke are awarded a penalty. What an opportunity to score!
Goal! Alexander Schwolow gets a hand on the penalty from Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke), but can't stop it from flying into the bottom left corner.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) picked up a yellow card for saying too much to the referee.
Was it necessary? Nils Petersen (Freiburg) is shown a second yellow card for dissent and has to leave the pitch. Tobias Stieler had no hesitation in issuing a red card!

Goal! Nabil Bentaleb finds Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) with a clever pass. He steps inside his man on the edge of the box and whips a tremendous shot into the bottom left corner. Fantasy football! 2:0.
Breel Embolo (Schalke) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Christian Streich prepares a substitution. Pascal Stenzel is replaced by Lukas Kubler (Freiburg).
The manager makes a subsitution with Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg) coming on for Florian Kath.
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
It will be a substitution. Cedric Teuchert (Schalke) is ready to enter the pitch as Breel Embolo walks off.
Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Goal 0:1! Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) picks up a pass and unleashes a strong shot from inside the box, but the goalkeeper is equal to it!
Goal! Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 1:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Marcin Kaminski (VfB Stuttgart) is replaced by Chadrac Akolo.
The game is over for Stephan Kofi Ambrosius. Rick Van Drongelen (Hamburger) comes on for the second half.
Dennis Aogo (VfB Stuttgart) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Gideon Jung (Hamburger) for his blatant foul.
Christian Titz has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Tatsuya Ito (Hamburger) replacing Mohamed Gouaida.

Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger) receives a clever pass and shoots from mid-range. His shot looks like it's going inside the right post, but Ron-Robert Zieler has other ideas and makes a brilliant save. Corner kick. Hamburger SV will have an opportunity.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Andre Hahn (Hamburger) will replace Matti Steinmann.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jacob-Bruun Larsen (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Erik Thommy.
Dennis Aogo will be replaced by Orel Mangala (VfB Stuttgart).
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Marcel Sabitzer leaves the pitch to be replaced by Timo Werner (RB Leipzig).

Goal! James Rodriguez hands Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich) the simplest of tasks from close range after the cross evaded the keeper, and he makes no mistake with his header into the bottom right corner. 0:1.
Lovely run from Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig). He finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper, lines up a shot, but the keeper boldly launches himself to intercept the ball.

Bruma (RB Leipzig) sends a direct shot in from the free kick that's in a promising position. The ball sails towards the underside of the crossbar, but the goalkeeper prevents a goal with a quick save. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to RB Leipzig.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Kevin Kampl (RB Leipzig) was quite harsh and Marco Fritz didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Goal! Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:1.
Sebastian Rudy (Bayern Munich) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
Niklas Sule (Bayern Munich) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Kevin Kampl (RB Leipzig) takes the free kick from the edge of the box. His decent attempt goes narrowly wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Bayern Munich will have a goal kick.
Marco Fritz has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Kevin Kampl plays a lovely pass into Bruma (RB Leipzig), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayern Munich.
It's 2:1! Naby Keita feeds Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the bottom left corner.
Naby Keita provides the assist in the box, but Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) places his shot a fraction wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayern Munich.
Substitution. Juan Bernat makes his way off the pitch and Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) comes on as his replacement.

Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) is quickest to the rebound inside the box and produces a sweet strike towards the left side of the goal. Nevertheless, the goalkeeper pulls off a spectacular save to keep the ball out of the net. Great goalkeeping! The referee points to the corner flag and Bayern Munich will take a corner.
Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) receives a yellow card for infringement.
Caution goes to Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).

Great ball in from Joshua Kimmich. Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for RB Leipzig.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Naby Keita trots off the pitch and is replaced by Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig).
Jupp Heynckes decides to make a substitution. James Rodriguez will be replaced by Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Joshua Kimmich departs the field of play to be replaced by Rafinha (Bayern Munich).
Peter Gulacsi (RB Leipzig) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Marco Fritz had an easy-decision to make.
Jean-Kevin Augustin joins the action as a substitute, replacing Timo Werner (RB Leipzig).
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
Marco Hoger (Koln) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Goal! Leonardo Bittencourt displays great vision and sends a pass to Yuya Osako (Koln), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. The score is 1:0.

Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) must think that he is playing a different sport because his behaviour has nothing to do with football and the referee has no choice but to show him a straight red card!
Dominique Heintz (Koln) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Harm Osmers had an easy-decision to make.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Heiko Herrlich makes a half-time substitution. Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on in place of Tin Jedvaj.
Half-time substitution. Julian Baumgartlinger will not participate anymore and Joel Pohjanpalo (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming on.

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot towards the right side of the goal, but Timo Horn pulls off a brilliant save.
Substitution. Salih Ozcan (Koln) has come on for Marco Hoger.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
GOAL! A terrible mistake leads to a goal. The defender ends up losing possession, allowing Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln) to pick up the ball before slotting it into the back of the net to make it 2:0.
Substitution. Leonardo Bittencourt walks off the pitch and Christian Clemens (Koln) comes on as a substitute.
Heiko Herrlich has decided to substitute Leon Bailey and he is replaced by Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen).
Simon Zoller goes off the pitch and Claudio Pizarro (Koln) comes on.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) smacks a great volley at goal from inside the box, but sends the effort just wide of the left post.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
Post! Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund) latches on to a sweet pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which only hits the right post. What an unlucky moment for him.
Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) has a great chance inside the box following a rebound off a defender, but somehow he gets underneath the ball and it flies high over the bar.
What a goal! Andre Schurrle swings a cross into the box and Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund) scores a magnificent back-heel goal! 1:0.
Pirmin Schwegler (Hannover) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Patrick Ittrich had an easy-decision to make.

Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the roof of the net. His effort, however, is blocked by Philipp Tschauner, who pulls off a stunning save!
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Peter Stoger decided to make a change. Omer Toprak is replaced by Sokratis (Dortmund).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Gonzalo Castro will be replaced by Julian Weigl (Dortmund).
Here is a change. Christian Pulisic is going off and Peter Stoger gives the last tactical orders to Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Niclas Fullkrug trots off the pitch and is replaced by Noah-Joel Sarenren-Bazee (Hannover).
It's time for a substitution. Iver Fossum (Hannover) comes on in place of Oliver Sorg.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Manuel Akanji (Dortmund) was quite harsh and Patrick Ittrich didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
A goal, which was scored by Julian Korb (Hannover), was disallowed due to offside.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marvin Bakalorz leaves the pitch and Linton Maina (Hannover) comes on.

Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund) reacts well to latch onto a rebound inside the box, but his shot is well blocked. The ball goes behind for a corner. Dortmund will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Sokratis (Dortmund) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) times his run into the box beautifully and plants a good looking header at goal from the corner, but the ball flashes just wide of the left post.

Matija Nastasic (Schalke) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the right-hand post. Koen Casteels is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him. Schalke force their opponents to concede a corner.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Domenico Tedesco has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Breel Embolo (Schalke) replacing Amine Harit.
Benjamin Stambouli will be replaced by Pablo Insua (Schalke).

Pablo Insua (Schalke) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the right post. Koen Casteels is alert and denies him with a nice save. Schalke have a corner.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Breel Embolo (Schalke), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.
Matija Nastasic (Schalke) commits a foul after bringing down his opponent with a slide tackle. It's a penalty! Wolfsburg have an opportunity to score from the penalty spot.
Penalty saved! Paul Verhaegh (Wolfsburg) sends the penalty towards the left hand side of the goal, but Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a wonderful save to deny him.
Substitution. Riechedly Bazoer walks off the pitch and Victor Osimhen (Wolfsburg) comes on as a substitute.
Here is a change. Guido Burgstaller is going off and Domenico Tedesco gives the last tactical orders to Franco Di Santo (Schalke).
Pablo Insua (Schalke) takes out his opponent with a nasty challenge and is relieved when the referee only gives him a booking.
What bad luck! Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) got in the way of a pass and unintentionally sent the ball past his own goalkeeper. The score is 0:1.
It will be a substitution. Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) is ready to enter the pitch as Josip Brekalo walks off.
Substitution. Paul Verhaegh makes way for Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg).
Nany Landry Dimata (Wolfsburg) is afforded space inside the box after collecting a pass, but the chance is wasted as his shot goes harmlessly over the crossbar.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) collects a rebound and produces a mid-range attempt. The ball goes to the bottom left corner, but Marwin Hitz keeps it out with an amazing save.
Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Marwin Hitz with a strike into the bottom left corner. He makes it 0:1.
Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Augsburg will have a goal kick.

Jiri Pavlenka makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) on the edge of the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the top right corner. The referee blows his whistle, Augsburg are awarded a corner kick.

Marwin Hitz pulls off a great save to deny Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal. The referee points to the corner flag and Werder Bremen will take a corner.
Gojko Kacar (Augsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Sascha Stegemann had an easy-decision to make.
A shot is blocked but the rebound lands at the feet of Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen) who fires the ball into the back of the net.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Manuel Baum makes a switch. Jan Moravek (Augsburg) is coming on in place of Gojko Kacar at the start of the second period.
Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he fails to change the score as his effort deflects away off the bar.

Jiri Pavlenka hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) shoots from the edge of the box towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. Corner kick. Augsburg will have an opportunity.
Rani Khedira (Augsburg) scores from quite a difficult position as he leaps high to connect with a cross and powers his header low inside the right post. Excellent finish.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Thomas Delaney will be replaced by Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen).
Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) connects with a cross from out wide in the six-yard box, but only plants his header onto the bar.

Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) takes the free kick from just outside the box and unleashes a fine shot to the right side of the goal, but his effort is thwarted by Jiri Pavlenka who parries it onto the post.
Jiri Pavlenka (Werder Bremen) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) will replace Marco Richter.
A yellow card for bad language! Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) couldnt remain silent and the result is obvious.

It's in! Ishak Belfodil spots his teammate in a good position on the edge of the box and provides him with a nice pass. Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) doesn't think twice and curls a first-time shot into the top left corner. The score is now 1:3.
Here is a change. Florian Kainz is going off and Florian Kohfeldt gives the last tactical orders to Marco Friedl (Werder Bremen).
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to make a change. Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) replaces Ishak Belfodil.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) connects with the ball from the resulting corner and places a powerful header past the stranded goalkeeper and into the roof of the net. The opposing players are staring at each other, unable to understand what happened. Who will take the blame for that one? Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) has a reason to celebrate!

Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the middle of the goal. Oliver Baumann shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Raul Bobadilla is being substituted because of an injury. Dieter Hecking sends Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) on the pitch.
CHANCE! Nico Schulz finds Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) with a sweet pass, but he can't find the target as his effort from inside the box goes just wide of the left post!
Goal! Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) slots the ball into an unguarded net from close range after a shot rebounds off a defender. 1:1.
Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Martin Petersen had an easy-decision to make.

A pass into the box finds Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the roof of the net, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Oliver Baumann denies him. B. Monchengladbach win a corner.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
That's the end of the game for Eugen Polanski, who is replaced by Mark Uth (Hoffenheim).
Martin Petersen blows his whistle after Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle. The referee points to the penalty spot. PENALTY to Hoffenheim!
Goal! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) puts the ball into the left side of the goal past the outstretched arm of Yann Sommer.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Patrick Herrmann.

Goal! Great link up play between Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) and Jonas Hofmann gives the former a clear sight of goal on the edge of the box. He doesn't disappoint and beats the keeper in the bottom right corner. 2:2.

GOAL! Superb work from Mark Uth, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim), who beats Yann Sommer with a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. 2:3.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) replacing Serge Gnabry.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) gets to the rebound and shoots, but the effort is blocked.

Oliver Baumann pulls off a brilliant save! Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach) launched himself and met a cross into the box, but his header to the right post is saved. The ball goes out for a corner. B. Monchengladbach can continue in their attacking effort.
Here's the change. Oscar Wendt leaves the pitch and Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) comes on as a substitute.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to substitute Nadiem Amiri and he is replaced by Havard Nordtveit (Hoffenheim).

Great first touch by Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim) after collecting a pass deep into the box. He smashes the ball towards the roof of the net, but the keeper makes a fantastic reflex save and pushes it onto the bar. Brilliant goalkeeping!

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Matthias Ginter (B. Monchengladbach). Raffael plays a fantastic through ball and finds Matthias Ginter (B. Monchengladbach), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom left corner. 3:3.

Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the right post. Yann Sommer pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
What a hit! Kevin-Prince Boateng (Eintracht Frankfurt) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
Goal! Ante Rebic tees up Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) inside the box, and he keeps his cool to score low into the middle of the goal. 2:0.
A pass into the box finds Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) unmarked. He carefully places a shot low towards the middle of the goal, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Florian Muller denies him.
Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) breaks through before collecting a brilliant pass and producing a precise strike to beat the goalkeeper. The ball went into the bottom left corner.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Nigel De Jong comes off for Danny Latza (Mainz).
Sandro Schwarz makes a half-time substitution. Levin Oztunali (Mainz) comes on in place of Alexandru Maxim.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Anthony Ujah leaves the pitch and Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) comes on.
Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Florian Muller makes a great save to stop his effort.
Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) latches on to a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a brilliant shot towards the goal, but he hits the crossbar!
The substitution has been made. Taleb Tawatha (Eintracht Frankfurt) has replaced Ante Rebic.
Niko Kovac prepares a substitution. Kevin-Prince Boateng is replaced by Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Levin Oztunali (Mainz) was quite harsh and Daniel Siebert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Substitution. Jetro Willems leaves the pitch and is replaced by Gelson Fernandes (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) anticipates the lofted pass and races into the box with just the keeper to beat. He shoots early towards the bottom left corner, but Julian Pollersbeck pulls off a great save to deny him. The referee blows his whistle, Hertha Berlin are awarded a corner kick.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.

A superb goal from great team play! Douglas Santos (Hamburger) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent low shot into the middle of the net. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.
Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.

Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) gets on the end of a cross inside the box and sweeps the ball goalwards towards the middle of the goal, but Julian Pollersbeck is well positioned and easily deals with the effort.
Rick Van Drongelen (Hamburger) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier. Free kick. Hertha Berlin will probably just try to cross the ball in from here.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Although Thomas Kraft (Hertha Berlin) is just on the bench, Robert Kampka has awarded him with a yellow card. Unsporting behavior says the referee.
Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin) converts a killer cross with a precise low shot that goes into the bottom left corner. What a brilliant finish!
That will be all from Maximilian Mittelstadt who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin).
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home into the top of the net. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Here is a change. Lewis Holtby is going off and Christian Titz gives the last tactical orders to Bobby Wood (Hamburger).
Robert Kampka shows a yellow card to Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) for a tough tackle.

Julian Pollersbeck can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin). The ball would have probably ended up inside the right post. Hertha Berlin force a corner. They send men into the box.
Substitution. Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) in, Vedad Ibisevic out.
Christian Titz decides to make a substitution. Tatsuya Ito will be replaced by Bakery Jatta (Hamburger).
Here comes a substitution. Jann-Fiete Arp is given a rest as he is replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger).
Pal Dardai has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) replacing Arne Maier.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.

Perfectly taken free kick! Dennis Aogo sends a cross in and Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes into the middle of the net and the score changes to 0:1.
Benjamin Brand shows a yellow card to Andreas Beck (VfB Stuttgart) for a tough tackle.

Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) had a good chance to change the score. He ran towards the goal and unleashed a shot from just outside the penalty area which went towards the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper was ready and made an amazing save.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) goes close to scoring with a shot from inside the box, but he drags his effort wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Christian Streich gives a chance to Florian Kath (Freiburg) and Lucas Holer is off.
GOAL - 1:1! Nicolas Hofler found Nils Petersen (Freiburg) inside the box, he spotted goalkeeper Ron-Robert Zieler off his line and chipped the ball into the net. What a cheeky lob!
The referee allows time for a substitution. Erik Thommy will be replaced by Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart).

Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) anticipates the lofted pass and races into the box with just the keeper to beat. He shoots early towards the middle of the goal, but Alexander Schwolow pulls off a great save to deny him.
Goal! Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) has the simplest of tasks to roll the ball into an empty net from close range after a rebound left the keeper stranded. 1:2.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) argues with the referee and receives a yellow card for dissent.
Janik Haberer (Freiburg) picks up a yellow card.
Substitution. Lukas Kubler did his best and is replaced by Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg).
Tayfun Korkut prepares a substitution. Daniel Ginczek is replaced by Marcin Kaminski (VfB Stuttgart).
That will be all from Marco Terrazzino who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg).
Tayfun Korkut has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Orel Mangala (VfB Stuttgart) replacing Santiago Ascacibar.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.
Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) perfectly latches on to a cross from the corner kick and blasts the ball into the bottom left corner. What a goal!
A fine solo run by Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen) takes him deep into the box, but it comes to nothing as his shot flies high over the bar.
Benjamin Brand shows a yellow card to Frederik Sorensen (1. FC Koln) for a tough tackle. Werder Bremen have a free kick from a promising distance.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Benjamin Brand starts the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Stefan Ruthenbeck probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Frederik Sorensen. He is replaced by Salih Ozcan (1. FC Koln).
The game is over for Simon Terodde. Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln) comes on for the second half.

A superb goal from great team play! Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent shot into the top left corner. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.
Goal - 2:1! Florian Kainz tees up Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom right corner and past Timo Horn.
Dominique Heintz (1. FC Koln) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Benjamin Brand ignores the protests. That's a free kick to Werder Bremen.
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to make a change. Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen) replaces Milot Rashica.

A precise cross aimed towards the penalty spot was met by Claudio Pizarro (Koln). He outjumped the defence and produced a decent header which went a whisker wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Werder Bremen.
A yellow card for a tackle by Salih Ozcan (1. FC Koln). Benjamin Brand doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Stefan Ruthenbeck has decided to substitute Marco Hoger and he is replaced by Jhon Cordoba (Koln).
Substitution. Florian Kainz makes way for Sebastian Langkamp (Werder Bremen).
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) unleashes a shot straight into the bottom right corner. Good team effort!
The referee allows time for a substitution. Max Kruse will be replaced by Robert Bauer (Werder Bremen).
What a huge chance for Jhon Cordoba (Koln). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) is given a fully deserved yellow card.

What a chance that is! Christian Pulisic swings the ball into the box, and Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) gets in front of his man and powers his header just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Eintracht Frankfurt.
An unfortunate own goal is conceded by Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt), who attempted to block the ball after a cross, but instead he sends it inside the bottom left corner of his own goal.
Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Deniz Aytekin had an easy-decision to make.
Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Manuel Akanji (Dortmund) is shown a yellow card by the referee for a bad sliding tackle on an opponent.
Carlos Salcedo (Eintracht Frankfurt) has tested the patience of referee Deniz Aytekin and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Deniz Aytekin has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Ante Rebic will not participate anymore and Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt) is coming on.
Peter Stoger makes a switch. Julian Weigl (Dortmund) is coming on in place of Mahmoud Dahoud at the start of the second period.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch for Maximilian Philipp.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Sebastien Haller.

The ball from the free kick finds its way to Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) who finds himself some space and scores with a thunderous header into the bottom left corner. An incredible long-range header!
Goal! Christian Pulisic shows great vision to find Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund) with a cheeky pass inside the box, and his first-time shot is precise and sails into the bottom left corner. 2:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Carlos Salcedo departs the field of play to be replaced by Danny Blum (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund) bursts into the box and pulls the trigger, but he can't beat the goalkeeper. He directed his daisy-cutter towards the left post, but one of the defenders reacted brilliantly to block it. The ball is out of play. Dortmund win a corner kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marco Reus leaves the pitch and Sokratis (Dortmund) comes on.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Roman Burki (Dortmund) is given a yellow card.

Goal! Danny da Costa displays great vision and sends a pass to Danny Blum (Eintracht Frankfurt), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. The score is 2:2.
Goal - 3:2! Lukasz Piszczek tees up Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund) inside the box and he curls the ball into the left side of the net and past Lukas Hradecky.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.

Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off a great save to deny Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! RB Leipzig have been awarded a corner kick.
Lovely run from Timo Werner (RB Leipzig). He finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper, lines up a shot, but the keeper boldly launches himself to intercept the ball.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Tobias Stieler has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Ralph Hasenhuttl gives a chance to Bruma (RB Leipzig) and Ademola Lookman is off.
Lukas Klostermann (RB Leipzig) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Tobias Stieler had an easy-decision to make.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) plays a lovely through ball to Yussuf Poulsen, but he can't beat Ron-Robert Zieler and loses the ball.
Today's match ends for Yussuf Poulsen who will be replaced by Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig).
Bernardo (RB Leipzig) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Tayfun Korkut has decided to substitute Erik Thommy and he is replaced by Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart).
Timo Werner will be replaced by Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig).

Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) has a great chance! He climbs highest deep in the penalty box and strikes a powerful header towards the net. Next time he should aim better as his effort ends wide of the left post.
Great ball in from Naby Keita. Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker over the crossbar.
Substitution. Santiago Ascacibar is replaced by Marcin Kaminski (VfB Stuttgart).
The referee signals a substitution. Orel Mangala (VfB Stuttgart) is brought on as a substitute for Daniel Ginczek.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) is ready on the edge of the six-yard box and duly receives the cross, but his header fizzes just wide of the left post.
Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and coolly sends the ball into the back of the net.
Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) finds himself unmarked on the edge of the box, but he drags his shot just wide of the right post.
Robert Hartmann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The foul by Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Robert Hartmann.

Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) blows a clear opportunity to score a goal. He was one-on-one with Yann Sommer inside the six-yard box and attempted to put the ball into the middle of the target, but was denied by a great save.
Here is a change. Raul Bobadilla is going off and Dieter Hecking gives the last tactical orders to Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee signals a substitution. Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) is brought on as a substitute for Leon Bailey.
Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach) sees a yellow card from Robert Hartmann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Tony Jantschke.
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) for a tough tackle.
Substitution. Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) has come on for Denis Zakaria.
Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails narrowly wide of the right post!
The manager makes a subsitution with Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) coming on for Kai Havertz.
What a wasted chance that was! A precise cross into the box finds Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen), whose header flies narrowly wide of the right post.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Wendell will be replaced by Panagiotis Retsos (Bayer Leverkusen).

Lucas Alario sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot into the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 2:0.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Christian Dingert ignores the protests.

Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) weaves his way past several defenders and finds himself in a one-on-one with the keeper. His dummy throws the keeper off balance and he simply puts the ball into the back of net.

Joshua Kimmich produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) rises high to head the ball low into the middle of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 2:0.

What a goal! David Alaba plays it to Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Christian Mathenia into the right side of the goal. 3:0.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Vasilije Janjicic (Hamburger) will replace Dennis Diekmeier.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Rick Van Drongelen (Hamburger) for a tough tackle. Bayern Munich earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) clutches his head in despair after blowing a huge opportunity! He receives the ball after the free kick and takes good first touch to unleash a low shot from close range, but Christian Mathenia makes a nice save.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Christian Dingert blows his whistle to start the second half.
Half-time substitution. Jupp Heynckes decided to make a change. Arturo Vidal is replaced by Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich).

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Hamburger SV will have a goal kick.
What a beauty from just outside the box! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power inside the left post.
Jupp Heynckes has decided to substitute Arjen Robben and he is replaced by Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich).
Corentin Tolisso doesn't have to suffer any longer with the painful injury as Sebastian Rudy (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch to replace him.

A pass into the box finds Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the bottom left corner, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Christian Mathenia denies him. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Bayern Munich.
Bernd Hollerbach has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Josha Vagnoman (Hamburger) replacing Walace.

What a chance that is! Sebastian Rudy (Bayern Munich) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the right post.
Douglas Santos (Hamburger) sees a yellow card from Christian Dingert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Ambitious effort from Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well wide of the left post.

An amazing individual effort from Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball into the right side of the goal and makes it 5:0. Christian Mathenia was helpless.
Christian Dingert blows his whistle after Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Hamburger) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle. PENALTY! Wonderful opportunity to score for Bayern Munich.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) doesn't keep his cool and fails to convert the penalty. He skies the ball way over the bar and into the stands.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Aaron Hunt departs the field of play to be replaced by Bakery Jatta (Hamburger).
Poor challenge! Filip Kostic (Hamburger) is penalised for tripping and Christian Dingert blows his whistle. It's a penalty for Bayern Munich!
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) runs up to the ball, stops and waits for Christian Mathenia to commit before slotting the penalty into the right of the goal.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.

A nice pass finds Philipp Max (Augsburg) in space. He sets himself up and hammers in a fantastic shot from distance that looks bound for the bottom right corner, but Philipp Tschauner pulls off a breathtaking save to deny him.

Miiko Albornoz (Hannover) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a sitter. His shot was directed under the crossbar, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him. The ball goes out of play. Hannover are awarded a corner kick.

Francisco Caiuby sends a superb cross into the box. Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) latches on to it and from close range plants a header into the bottom right corner, leaving Philipp Tschauner beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 0:1.
What a save from Philipp Tschauner! Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.

Felix Klaus (Hannover) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Marwin Hitz makes a decent save to deny his effort directed to the bottom right corner.

Salif Sane (Hannover) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes inside the right post. He couldn't have done it any better. 1:1.
Iver Fossum (Hannover) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Goal! Francisco Caiuby swings the ball deep into the box and finds Gojko Kacar (Augsburg) unmarked, and his close-range header flies past the keeper into the middle of the goal. 1:2.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Bastian Dankert blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to substitute Oliver Sorg and he is replaced by Pirmin Schwegler (Hannover).
Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
The booking goes to Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg).
Waldemar Anton (Hannover) attempts to convert a cross into goal, but his promising header from near the penalty spot towards the top left corner is denied by a decent save from Marwin Hitz.
The substitution has been made. Jonathas (Hannover) has replaced Martin Harnik.
Manuel Baum decides to make a substitution. Marco Richter will be replaced by Marcel Heller (Augsburg).
We are about to witness a substitution. Christoph Janker (Augsburg) is replacing Jonathan Schmid.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Martin Hinteregger (Augsburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Goal! Philipp Max produces a great pass that finds Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot high into the net. 1:3.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Martins Felipe walks off the pitch to be replaced by Kenan Karaman (Hannover).
Manuel Baum prepares a substitution. Daniel Baier is replaced by Sergio Cordova (Augsburg).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) gets on the end of a cross from Valentino Lazaro, but his shot goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Problems for Christian Streich as Amir Abrashi is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) replaces him.
The end of the first half.
Sven Jablonski blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Substitution. Vedad Ibisevic is replaced by Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin).
Pal Dardai has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) replacing Salomon Kalou.
Arne Maier (Hertha Berlin) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Sven Jablonski ignores the protests.
Arne Maier goes off the pitch and Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) comes on.
Here comes a substitution. Florian Kath (Freiburg) is brought on as a substitute for Lucas Holer.
Here is a change. Tim Kleindienst is going off and Christian Streich gives the last tactical orders to Marc-Oliver Kempf (Freiburg).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! The rebound fell to Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim) and he fired home from close range. The score is 1:0.
Serge Gnabry (Hoffenheim) fires a shot from close range, but he is somehow only able to hit the crossbar!

Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) receives a diagonal pass, bursts into the box and shoots towards the right side of the goal. Koen Casteels is well positioned, though, and it's a comfortable save. Hoffenheim get a corner.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Divock Origi as he is replaced by Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg).
Julian Nagelsmann is forced to make a change. Dennis Geiger is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim).
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Josip Brekalo is being substituted because of an injury. Bruno Labbadia sends Nany Landry Dimata (Wolfsburg) on the pitch.
Here comes a substitution. Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) is brought on as a substitute for Andrej Kramaric.
Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) is given a yellow card.
Close! Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post.
Serge Gnabry (Hoffenheim) scores! He latches on to a pass and produces a perfect strike from the edge of the box. The ball goes into the bottom right corner and past the goalkeeper.
Substitution. Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) has come on for Florian Grillitsch.
Here is an example of luck not being on your side. Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) puts the ball into the back of the net but, unfortunately for him, it's into his own goal!
Here is a change. Yunus Malli is going off and Bruno Labbadia gives the last tactical orders to Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg).
Jeffrey Bruma (Wolfsburg) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Felix Brych starts the second half.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Alessandro Schopf is replaced by Leon Goretzka (Schalke).
Here comes a substitution. Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) is brought on as a substitute for Danny Latza.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Marko Pjaca will be replaced by Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke).

Goal! Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the top right corner. Florian Muller had no chance of reaching it. The score is 0:1.
It will be a substitution. Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) is ready to enter the pitch as Nigel De Jong walks off.
Suat Serdar (Mainz) picks up a pass, lines up a shot and strikes from 23 metres out, but Ralf Fahrmann thwarts the effort which is headed to the bottom left corner.
Here comes a substitution. Franco Di Santo is given a rest as he is replaced by Breel Embolo (Schalke).
The foul by Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Felix Brych.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Anthony Ujah trots off the pitch and is replaced by Levin Oztunali (Mainz).
Levin Oztunali (Mainz) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the left side of the goal. However, Ralf Fahrmann anticipates the shot and makes a brilliant save.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Having seen unsporting behavior, Felix Brych shows a yellow card to one of the players sitting on the bench. And Franco Di Santo (Schalke) is the recipient.
Robin Quaison (Mainz) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.

Lucas Holer (Freiburg) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom right corner. Sven Ulreich guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. It will be a corner kick for Freiburg.
Alexander Schwolow (Freiburg) scores an unfortunate own goal after deflecting the ball into his own net!

Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich) scores an incredible goal! He receives a pass, makes some space for himself and unleashes a long-range thunderbolt of a shot past the goalkeeper into the top right corner.
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Christian Streich probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Philipp Lienhart. He is replaced by Florian Kath (Freiburg).
Half-time substitution. Amir Abrashi will not participate anymore and Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) is coming on.
Goal! 0:3. Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich) taps home from almost on the goal line after a lucky rebound fell at his feet.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Yoric Ravet (Freiburg) comes onto the pitch so that Lucas Holer can be given a rest.
Robin Koch (Freiburg) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) scores from the resulting corner. The ball slips through the box to Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) and he smashes it into the top right corner, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Thiago Alcantara walks off the pitch to be replaced by Sebastian Rudy (Bayern Munich).
Substitution. Thomas Muller walks off the pitch and Rafinha (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
Jupp Heynckes prepares a substitution. Arturo Vidal is replaced by Niklas Sule (Bayern Munich).
Frank Willenborg is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal - 1:0! Yuya Osako tees up Claudio Pizarro (1. FC Koln) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom right corner and past Ron-Robert Zieler.

Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball is out of play. Stuttgart will have a chance to score from a corner.
What a chance! The ball is inside the box and Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart) takes a first-time shot on goal, but his volley goes narrowly wide of the right post.
Simon Terodde (Koln) drives into the box and hits a tremendous shot that, unluckily for him, flashes just wide of the left post.
Holger Badstuber (VfB Stuttgart) has tested the patience of referee Soren Storks and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The goal by Yuya Osako (Koln) won't count as it has been disallowed on the advice of the video assistant referee!
Goal! Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 1:1. He was ably assisted there by Erik Thommy.
Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) fires a knuckleball of a shot towards goal from outside the penalty area and the ball goes into the back of the net after the goalkeeper makes a complete howler!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Soren Storks shows a yellow card to Frederik Sorensen (1. FC Koln) for a tough tackle.
Andreas Beck (VfB Stuttgart) picks up the ball on the edge of the penalty box and produces a moment of magic with a brilliant shot that goes into the left side of the goal!

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Vincent Koziello (Koln) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot towards the bottom left corner, but Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off a brilliant save.
Substitution. Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) in, Claudio Pizarro out.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Dennis Aogo (VfB Stuttgart) for Santiago Ascacibar.
Stefan Ruthenbeck has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jhon Cordoba (Koln) replacing Frederik Sorensen.
It will be a substitution. Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) is ready to enter the pitch as Erik Thommy walks off.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) fires a shot well wide of the right post from inside the box after latching onto a short pass.
Substitution. Vincent Koziello makes his way off the pitch and Milos Jojic (Koln) comes on as his replacement.

Timo Baumgartl (VfB Stuttgart) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card. Another situation results in a direct free kick for FC Koln.
Milos Jojic (Koln) perfectly hits the free kick from just outside the box, sending the ball into the top left corner. Football fans are always happy to see such a fabulous goal.
Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Soren Storks's book.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marcin Kaminski (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Daniel Ginczek.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
A great solo run by Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) took him deep inside the box, but his weak effort towards the middle of the goal was easily caught by Roman Burki.
Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his shot towards the roof of the net, but the keeper makes a superb save!
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
A goal, which was scored by Marco Reus (Dortmund), was disallowed due to offside.
Goal! Naby Keita shows great vision to find Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) with a cheeky pass inside the box, and his first-time shot is precise and sails into the right side of the goal. 1:0.
Julian Weigl (Dortmund) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Brych had an easy-decision to make.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) runs on to a clever pass from Mahmoud Dahoud and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He still has work to do but finishes with aplomb into the back of the net.
Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Felix Brych starts the second half.
Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
Here's the change. Emil Forsberg leaves the pitch and Bruma (RB Leipzig) comes on as a substitute.
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
The game has come to an end for Kevin Kampl. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig).
We are about to witness a substitution. Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) is replacing Jean-Kevin Augustin.
A substitution has been made. Mario Gotze is replaced by Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) was quite harsh and Felix Brych didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
A great run from Bruma (RB Leipzig) ends with a shot inside the box that flashes just past the right post.
The manager makes a subsitution with Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) coming on for Marco Reus.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

That was a nice football moment. Serge Gnabry (Hoffenheim) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the bottom left corner. Marwin Hitz guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save!
A great run from Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg) ends with a shot inside the box that flashes just over the bar.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) reacts well to a deflected cross from Benjamini Hubner and places a close-range header beyond the keeper into the left of the goal. 0:1.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.
Goal! Andrej Kramaric puts the ball across the area and Serge Gnabry (Hoffenheim) has the easiest task in the world to tuck the ball into an empty net. 0:2.
The referee signals a substitution. Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Killian Jakob.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Kevin Danso walks off the pitch to be replaced by Shawn Parker (Augsburg).
Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim) sees a yellow card from Patrick Ittrich after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) replacing Serge Gnabry.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Lukas Rupp will be replaced by Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim).
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Shawn Parker (Augsburg) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Andrej Kramaric leaves the pitch and Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) comes on.
Here is a change. Marcel Heller is going off and Manuel Baum gives the last tactical orders to Marco Richter (Augsburg).
What a chance that is! Jonathan Schmid swings the ball into the box, and Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) gets in front of his man and powers his header just wide of the right post.
Patrick Ittrich shows a yellow card to Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.
Simon Falette (Eintracht Frankfurt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Marco Fritz ignores the protests.
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a tough tackle.
Danny da Costa (Eintracht Frankfurt) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:0.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Half-time substitution. Simon Falette will not participate anymore and Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) is coming on.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Miiko Albornoz (Hannover) comes on the pitch for Matthias Ostrzolek.
Yellow card! It's like Miiko Albornoz (Hannover) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Marco Fritz agrees and books him.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) comes onto the pitch so that Marvin Bakalorz can be given a rest.
Oliver Sorg comes off the pitch to be replaced by Jonathas (Hannover).

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot low towards the middle of the goal, but Philipp Tschauner pulls off a comfortable save. The ball goes behind for a corner. Eintracht Frankfurt will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Here comes a substitution. Kevin-Prince Boateng (Eintracht Frankfurt) is brought on as a substitute for Sebastien Haller.
Pirmin Schwegler (Hannover) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.

Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Referee Markus Schmidt blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Sven Schipplock (Hamburger) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot towards the bottom left corner, but Florian Muller pulls off a brilliant save. Hamburger SV win a corner.
What was Gerrit Holtmann (Mainz) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.

Filip Kostic (Hamburger) connects with a cross inside the penalty area and attempts a shot towards the roof of the net. The ball is met by one of the defending players who luckily deflects it onto the crossbar. Hamburger SV force their opponents to concede a corner.
The goal by Filip Kostic (Hamburger) won't count as it has been disallowed on the advice of the video assistant referee!
Yellow card. Walace (Hamburger) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Leon Balogun (Mainz) receives a yellow card from the referee as expected.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Sandro Schwarz decided to make a change. Gerrit Holtmann is replaced by Daniel Brosinski (Mainz).
Half-time substitution. Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) is replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt.
Rick Van Drongelen (Hamburger) fires a rebound from close range onto the bar!
The referee signals a substitution. Andre Hahn (Hamburger) is brought on as a substitute for Bakery Jatta.
Leon Balogun (Mainz) gives away a foul for a fierce tackle on an opponent. A penalty is given to Hamburger SV!
RED CARD! Leon Balogun (Mainz) will not finish today's game. The second caution means he can have an early bath.
Filip Kostic (Hamburger) has a great chance to score from the penalty. He shoots to the bottom left corner, but Florian Muller leaps out to thwart his attempt.
Markus Schmidt shows a yellow card to Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) for his blatant foul.
Substitution. Jann-Fiete Arp (Hamburger) in, Gideon Jung out.

Douglas Santos (Hamburger) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Markus Schmidt had an easy-decision to make.
Christian Mathenia (Hamburger) goes into the book for bad language. His vulgar comments could have made it worse. Luckily for him, it's a yellow card.

Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin) finds himself some space around the penalty spot and leaps high to meet the free kick. He tries to put his header into the right side of the goal, but Ralf Fahrmann keeps it out. The referee signals a corner kick to Hertha Berlin.
Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
Goal - 1:0! Franco Di Santo laid the ball off to Marko Pjaca (Schalke), who shot from close range into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Karim Rekik (Hertha Berlin) latches onto the free kick from Marvin Plattenhardt, but heads just over the bar from close range.

Domenico Tedesco decides to make a substitution. Marko Pjaca will be replaced by Alessandro Schopf (Schalke).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) comes onto the pitch for Davie Selke.
The substitution is prepared. Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Peter Pekarik.
Domenico Tedesco has decided to make a change. Weston McKennie (Schalke) replaces Breel Embolo.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Max Meyer will be replaced by Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke).
What was Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.

Foul! Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) is penalised for pulling back his opponent. PENALTY! Wonderful opportunity to score for Bayer Leverkusen.
Goal! Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Koen Casteels into right side of the goal.
The match has reached half-time.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Sven Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) is replaced by Tin Jedvaj.
Paul Verhaegh (Wolfsburg) is cautioned by the referee.
Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
OFF THE BAR! Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) strikes a brilliant shot towards goal from the free kick, but his effort rattles the crossbar.
Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) is awarded a yellow card.
