The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Josip Brekalo departs the field of play to be replaced by Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg).
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) earns the yellow card.
Heiko Herrlich has decided to make a change. Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Karim Bellarabi.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Divock Origi leaves the pitch and Nany Landry Dimata (Wolfsburg) comes on.
Goal! Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) gets to the ball inside the box, sees the goalkeeper off his line and lifts the ball over him and into the back of the net. 0:2.
What a beauty from just outside the box! Admir Mehmedi (Wolfsburg) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power inside the right post.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and William (Wolfsburg) receives a yellow card!
Bruno Labbadia prepares a substitution. Maximilian Arnold is replaced by Riechedly Bazoer (Wolfsburg).
The yellow card is received by Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee signals a substitution. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) is brought on as a substitute for Julian Baumgartlinger.
Riechedly Bazoer (Wolfsburg) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
William (Wolfsburg) is given a yellow card by Felix Zwayer and because it's his second one today, the game is over for him.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 1:0.
Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Ludwig Augustinsson (Werder Bremen) gets to the rebound and shoots, but the effort is blocked. The ball is out of play. Werder Bremen win a corner kick.

Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen) swept past a couple of defenders inside the box and tried to score in the left side of the goal, but great anticipation by Yann Sommer allowed him to make a comfortable save. Werder Bremen will take a corner kick.
Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Benjamin Cortus had an easy-decision to make.
An unfortunate own goal is conceded by Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen), who attempted to block the ball after a cross, but instead he sends it into the bottom right corner of his own goal.
Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) pounced on a rebound on the edge of the box and his shot goes a whisker over the crossbar.
Raul Bobadilla (B. Monchengladbach) received a pass and didn't think long what to do with it. He fired a powerful long-range shot which went painfully close to the bar.

Well-positioned Raul Bobadilla (B. Monchengladbach) was first to the rebound and fired in a shot towards the bottom right corner, but Jiri Pavlenka reacted superbly to keep the ball out. The fans could not believe their eyes. It was a miraculous stop!
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Dieter Hecking gives a chance to Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach) and Denis Zakaria is off.
Florian Kohfeldt has made a change at the break. Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) has come on in place of Robert Bauer.
The cross fools the defence and leaves Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen) with an easy chance inside the box, but he mistimes his shot and sends it just wide of the right post.

Goal! The ball is swung into the box from the resulting corner kick and finds Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen), who jumps highest and tries his luck with a header from around the penalty spot. His effort is both strong and precise enough to go into the top right corner. The score changes to 2:1.
Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Christoph Kramer limps off the pitch to be replaced by Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach).
Here is a change. Marco Friedl is going off and Florian Kohfeldt gives the last tactical orders to Jerome Gondorf (Werder Bremen).
Goal! Maximilian Eggestein plays a pass to the feet of Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen), and he shoots into the bottom right corner from inside the box. It's 2:2.
The substitution is prepared. Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Reece Oxford.
Florian Kohfeldt is forced to make a change. Ishak Belfodil is unable to continue due to injury, Sebastian Langkamp (Werder Bremen) comes on.
Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) was quite harsh and Benjamin Cortus didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Benjamin Cortus is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and coolly sends the ball into the back of the net.

Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg) releases a promising shot from the free kick on the edge of the box. His effort towards the bottom left corner is comfortably saved by Roman Burki. Augsburg will take a corner kick.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Raphael Framberger will be replaced by Marcel Heller (Augsburg).
Here's the change. Gonzalo Castro leaves the pitch and Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund) comes on as a substitute.
Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) gets into a great position in the box after a pass, but sends his shot just wide of the left post.
Kevin Danso (Augsburg) scores from the resulting corner. The ball slips through the box to Kevin Danso (Augsburg) and he slams it into the roof of the net, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
Jan Moravek (Augsburg) has tested the patience of referee Manuel Grafe and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund) shakes off the attention of a defender and from mid-range lets fly towards the right side of the goal, but Marwin Hitz is well positioned to make a comfortable save. The ball is out of play and Dortmund manage to earn a corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) replaces Marco Reus.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Jan Moravek leaves the pitch to be replaced by Shawn Parker (Augsburg).
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Shawn Parker (Augsburg) for his blatant foul.
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
The game has come to an end for Francisco Caiuby. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Gojko Kacar (Augsburg).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
Goal! Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) has the simplest of tasks to roll the ball into an empty net from close range after a rebound left the keeper stranded. 1:0.
Marco Hoger (Koln) receives a yellow card.

Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) produces a stunning solo run from the middle of the pitch, all the way to the penalty area. He unleashes a decent strike which goes narrowly wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and FC Koln will have a goal kick.
Bruma links up with Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig), who fires just wide of the left post from the edge of the box. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for FC Koln.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Jorge Mere (1. FC Koln) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Harm Osmers blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Ralph Hasenhuttl decides to make a substitution. Ademola Lookman will be replaced by Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig).
That's the end of the game for Jannes-Kilian Horn, who is replaced by Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln).

Nice move, nice attempt! Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) is teed up with a simple pass after a nice flowing move. His first time shot from mid-range looks like it's going in but curls just wide of the right post.
A substitution has been made. Jean-Kevin Augustin goes off and Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) comes on.
Goal! Vincent Koziello (1. FC Koln) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot inside the left post. It's 1:1.
Substitution. Emil Forsberg walks off the pitch and Diego Demme (RB Leipzig) comes on as a substitute.
Goal Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln)! Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln) was put through by Marcel Risse and he showed brilliant composure to tuck it home from inside the box. 1:2.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Salih Ozcan comes onto the pitch for Yuya Osako (Koln).
Kevin Kampl (RB Leipzig) gets booked for the first time in this match.
That will be all from Vincent Koziello who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Matthias Lehmann (Koln).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Bernd Leno with a strike into the left side of the goal. He makes it 0:1.

Leon Goretzka (Schalke) leaps highest in the penalty area to get on the end of a cross from the free kick, and he produces a promising goal-bound header to the bottom right corner, but Bernd Leno pulls off a decent save to deny him.
Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Daniel Siebert had an easy-decision to make.
RED CARD! Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Daniel Siebert. He can have an early bath.
Yellow card. Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) will miss the next game because of that yellow card.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Max Meyer (Schalke) was quite harsh and Daniel Siebert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Daniel Siebert starts the second half.
The game has come to an end for Max Meyer. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke).
Domenico Tedesco has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Amine Harit (Schalke) replacing Guido Burgstaller.

Breel Embolo (Schalke) receives a neat pass inside the box and instantly thumps the ball goalward, but a defender makes a last ditch block to deny him. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Schalke.
Bastian Oczipka sends over an inswinging corner and Naldo (Schalke) gets his head on the ball, but it goes just wide of the right post.
Breel Embolo (Schalke) has tested the patience of referee Daniel Siebert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Kevin Volland goes off the pitch and Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
The ball is crossed into the box and Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) reacts quickest to send a shot flying towards the middle of the goal, but Ralf Fahrmann gets a glove on it to thwart him.
Domenico Tedesco has decided to make a change. Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) replaces Leon Goretzka.
Amine Harit (Schalke) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Tin Jedvaj.
Heiko Herrlich has decided to substitute Julian Brandt and he is replaced by Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen).

Breel Embolo (Schalke) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the roof of the net. Bernd Leno guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Schalke.
Panagiotis Retsos (Bayer Leverkusen) fouls an opponent. At least that's what referee Daniel Siebert signals. Schalke are given a penalty!
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Panagiotis Retsos (Bayer Leverkusen) for his blatant foul.
Goal! Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Bernd Leno into right side of the goal.
Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Daniel Siebert had an easy-decision to make.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Felix Zwayer blows his whistle and the second half starts.
A short pass finds Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) in acres of space on the edge of the box and he decides to go for glory. His efforts looks in for all the world but just creeps past the left post.
Bakery Jatta (Hamburger) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Zwayer didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The referee gives a yellow card to Ludwig Augustinsson (Werder Bremen).
That was close by Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.
Substitution. Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen) in, Florian Kainz out.
Bernd Hollerbach has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Bobby Wood (Hamburger) replacing Bakery Jatta.
Here is a change. Zlatko Junuzovic is going off and Florian Kohfeldt gives the last tactical orders to Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen).
Here is an example of luck not being on your side. Rick Van Drongelen (Hamburger) puts the ball into the back of the net but, unfortunately for him, it's into his own goal!
We are about to witness a subsitution. Jann-Fiete Arp (Hamburger) for Gideon Jung.
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to substitute Philipp Bargfrede and he is replaced by Jerome Gondorf (Werder Bremen).
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
A brilliant cross into the box finds Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who directs his header towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper shows his agility and makes an astonishing save.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) weaves through the defence and gets one-on-one with the keeper, but fails to score.
Arjen Robben plays a pass to Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich), but he fails to get a decent shot away from inside the box and the ball goes high over the bar.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Rune Jarstein guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Jupp Heynckes decides to make a substitution. Franck Ribery will be replaced by Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich) replaces Thomas Muller.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Davie Selke as he is replaced by Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin).
Jupp Heynckes has decided to substitute Thiago Alcantara and he is replaced by Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich).
We are about to witness a substitution. Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) is replacing Salomon Kalou.
That's it for today, Guido Winkmann has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) is caught off guard a bit when the ball lands at his feet, causing him to rush a first-time shot that is easily blocked by an opposition player.
Andre Breitenreiter is forced to make a change. Felix Klaus is unable to continue due to injury, Sebastian Maier (Hannover) comes on.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) latches onto a lofted pass on the edge of the six-yard box, but powers a header just over the bar.
The substitution has been made. Oliver Sorg (Hannover) has replaced Pirmin Schwegler.
Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) controls the ball on the edge of the box, runs inside and thunders a shot against the crossbar.
Julian Korb (Hannover) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Robert Kampka had an easy-decision to make.
Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) controls the ball with an excellent first touch on the edge of the penalty box after receiving a splendid pass and smashes the ball into the top right corner!
Josip Elez will be replaced by Jonathas (Hannover).
We are about to witness a substitution. Mandela Egbo (B. Monchengladbach) is replacing Denis Zakaria.
The expression of the referee Robert Kampka is crystal clear. This behaviour won't be tolerated. Salif Sane (Hannover) is shown a yellow card.
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Thorgan Hazard.
Raul Bobadilla (B. Monchengladbach) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Vincenzo Grifo (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Raul Bobadilla.
That's it for today, Robert Kampka has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Dennis Geiger (Hoffenheim) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the roof of the net. Alexander Schwolow guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) controls a cross inside the six-yard box, but unbelievably sends his shot over the bar.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Serge Gnabry (Hoffenheim) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the right post. Alexander Schwolow guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. Now Hoffenheim have a corner.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) takes a brilliant free kick and curls the ball inside the right post to give the goalkeeper no chance!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Florian Kath (Freiburg) comes onto the pitch for Marco Terrazzino.
Here is a change. Robert Zulj is going off and Julian Nagelsmann gives the last tactical orders to Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim).
Christian Dingert blows the whistle, Kevin Vogt (Hoffenheim) is penalised for a foul. The referee gives a penalty to Freiburg!
Goal! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Oliver Baumann into right side of the goal.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) is coming onto the pitch as Adam Szalai cannot continue after picking up an injury.
What a chance that is! Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) leaps high to meet a lofted pass inside the six-yard box, but his header crashes off the crossbar!
Christian Streich decides to make a substitution. Lucas Holer will be replaced by Yoric Ravet (Freiburg).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Kevin Akpoguma as he is replaced by Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim).

That was a nice football moment. Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the roof of the net. Alexander Schwolow guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Janik Haberer (Freiburg) was quite harsh and Christian Dingert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Dennis Geiger (Hoffenheim) has tested the patience of referee Christian Dingert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Here's the change. Janik Haberer leaves the pitch and Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg) comes on as a substitute.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Danny da Costa (Eintracht Frankfurt) controls the ball on the edge of the box, runs inside and thunders a shot against the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stuttgart.
Goal! Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:0.
Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Bibiana Steinhaus has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Marco Russ comes off for Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt).
A substitution has been made. Sebastien Haller is replaced by Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Tayfun Korkut has decided to substitute Erik Thommy and he is replaced by Dennis Aogo (VfB Stuttgart).
It must be a yellow card. It is. Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Aymen Barkok (Eintracht Frankfurt) will replace Danny da Costa.
Substitution. Santiago Ascacibar walks off the pitch and Orel Mangala (VfB Stuttgart) comes on as a substitute.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
Here's the change. Daniel Ginczek leaves the pitch and Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) comes on as a substitute.
Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.

Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) volleys the ball on the edge of the box after a rebound. It's a great effort and has Ron-Robert Zieler scrambling, but it flies just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stuttgart.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
A rebound finds its way to Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) and he scores with a powerful strike, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
OFF THE BAR! Jeffrey Bruma (Wolfsburg) finds some space to meet the corner kick and unleashes a shot that only crashes against the bar!
Robin Quaison (Mainz) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his shot to the middle of the goal is smartly dealt with by Koen Casteels.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) will replace Emil Berggreen.
Goal! Gerrit Holtmann tees up Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) inside the box, and he keeps his cool to find the right side of the goal. 1:1.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) gets there first and whips in a shot at goal that flies just wide of the right post.
Substitution. Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) replaces Yunus Malli.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to substitute Suat Serdar and he is replaced by Pablo De Blasis (Mainz).
That's the end of the game for Josip Brekalo, who is replaced by Admir Mehmedi (Wolfsburg).
OFF THE POST! Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) takes a shot from outside the box and hits the right post!
Sandro Schwarz prepares a substitution. Robin Quaison is replaced by Anthony Ujah (Mainz).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.

Konrad Laimer is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a precise shot into the bottom left corner to make the score 0:1.
Goal! David Abraham puts the ball on a plate for Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 1:1.

What a goal! Ante Rebic plays it to Kevin-Prince Boateng (Eintracht Frankfurt), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Peter Gulacsi low into the middle of the net. 2:1.
Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) was probably a bit loose with his words to Felix Zwayer, who decides to show him a yellow.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Marius Wolf (Eintracht Frankfurt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

A fine pass finds Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) in space inside the box, he looks up and drills a low shot towards the middle of the goal, but the Peter Gulacsi reacts superbly to deny him. The ball is out of play. Eintracht Frankfurt will have a chance to score from a corner.
The end of the first half.
The match will be interrupted for a while due to some disturbances.
The second half gets underway.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has made a change at the break. Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) has come on in place of Diego Demme.
Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Zwayer ignores the protests.
A yellow card for a tackle by Willi Orban (RB Leipzig). Felix Zwayer doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Danny da Costa (Eintracht Frankfurt) fires a shot high over the bar from inside the box after latching onto a short pass.
Ralph Hasenhuttl is forced to make a change. Naby Keita is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig).
Today's referee Felix Zwayer rightly decides to book Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his harsh tackle.
Kevin-Prince Boateng (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a yellow card from Felix Zwayer after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

A dangerous towering header by Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) from around the penalty spot goes just wide of the right post. This corner kick didn't change the score. The ball goes out of play and RB Leipzig will have a goal kick.
Niko Kovac decides to make a substitution. Kevin-Prince Boateng will be replaced by Gelson Fernandes (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Felix Zwayer shows the yellow card to Simon Falette (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a heavy challenge.
Here is a change. Ademola Lookman is going off and Ralph Hasenhuttl gives the last tactical orders to Timo Werner (RB Leipzig).
Niko Kovac has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) replacing Ante Rebic.
The foul by Lukas Klostermann (RB Leipzig) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Felix Zwayer.
Substitution. Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) on for Marius Wolf.
That's it for today, Felix Zwayer has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels low towards the middle of the target, but Roman Burki easily deals with the threat.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Raul Bobadilla (B. Monchengladbach) receives a yellow card!
Marco Reus (Dortmund) unleashes a magnificent shot goalwards from the edge of the box and the ball deflects in off the crossbar. Excellent finish!
Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund) is yellow-carded. A mid-range free kick is awarded to B. Monchengladbach.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) finds space inside the box but rifles his effort just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Dortmund will have a goal kick.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) unleashed a rocket of a shot aiming towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper denies his attempt with a stunning save.

Roman Burki can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Raul Bobadilla (B. Monchengladbach). The ball would have probably ended up in the bottom left corner.
It's a yellow card for Reece Oxford (B. Monchengladbach).

Marco Reus (Dortmund) finds himself in space on the edge of the box and smashes a glorious looking effort towards the roof of the net, but Yann Sommer thwarts him with a great two-handed save. The linesman makes the right call and Dortmund will have a corner.
The booking goes to Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund).
Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach) gets a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Jonas Hofmann.
Peter Stoger has decided to make a change. Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) replaces Mario Gotze.
Raul Bobadilla (B. Monchengladbach) skips past a few defenders in the penalty area and strikes a low shot towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper denies his effort with a superb save.
Here is a change. Marco Reus is going off and Peter Stoger gives the last tactical orders to Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund).
A substitution has been made. Raul Bobadilla is replaced by Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Denis Zakaria trots off the pitch and is replaced by Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach).
Peter Stoger has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Omer Toprak (Dortmund) replacing Andre Schurrle.
Roman Burki (Dortmund) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Kevin Danso (Augsburg) makes a really bad tackle on his opponent and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.

Goal! Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the bottom right corner. Marwin Hitz is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 0:1.
Ron-Robert Zieler (VfB Stuttgart) is booked for saying more than Tobias Stieler was willing to tolerate.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Tobias Stieler has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half gets underway.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Rani Khedira (Augsburg) was quite harsh and Tobias Stieler didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Substitution. Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) on for Kevin Danso.
Manuel Baum decides to make a substitution. Marcel Heller will be replaced by Jan Moravek (Augsburg).

Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He latches on to a precise pass and fires a decent first-time shot towards the top of the net from a promising distance, but Marwin Hitz denies him. Stuttgart have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Dennis Aogo (VfB Stuttgart) comes onto the pitch for Erik Thommy.
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Tobias Stieler had an easy-decision to make.
Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) easily beats an opponent inside the box and goes for goal, but his effort flies just wide of the right post.
Raphael Framberger (Augsburg) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
We are about to witness a substitution. Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg) is replacing Raphael Framberger.
Substitution. Berkay Ozcan (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Daniel Ginczek.
Tayfun Korkut has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Marcin Kaminski (VfB Stuttgart) replacing Santiago Ascacibar.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
That's it for today, Tobias Stieler has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
Goal! Leon Goretzka finds Thilo Kehrer (Schalke) with a headed pass and the latter glances a header past the goalkeeper to make it 1:0.
Benjamin Brand shows a yellow card to Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim) for his blatant foul.
The goal by Breel Embolo (Schalke) won't count as it has been disallowed on the advice of the video assistant referee!
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Breel Embolo (Schalke), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 2:0.
Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half gets underway.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to substitute Nico Schulz and he is replaced by Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim).
Kevin Vogt (Hoffenheim) is booked by the referee.

Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) misses a big chance from point-blank range as he struck the ball towards the middle of the goal. His promising effort following the corner kick was, to his disappointment, thwarted by Oliver Baumann with a fabulous save.
A substitution has been made. Ermin Bicakcic is replaced by Robert Zulj (Hoffenheim).
Substitution. Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim) on for Nadiem Amiri.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Leon Goretzka (Schalke) was quite harsh and Benjamin Brand didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Franco Di Santo as he is replaced by Marko Pjaca (Schalke).
Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Goal! Pavel Kaderabek swings the ball deep into the box and finds Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) unmarked, and his close-range header flies past the keeper into the bottom left corner. 2:1.
Breel Embolo comes off the pitch to be replaced by Amine Harit (Schalke).
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Benjamin Brand had an easy-decision to make.
Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Bastian Oczipka (Schalke) is coming onto the pitch as Alessandro Schopf cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) picked up a yellow card for talking out of turn to the referee. He has to be careful for the remainder of the match.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) does well to control a poor pass on the edge of the box then shoots towards the bottom left corner. Timo Horn is out of position but leaps to make a brilliant save.
Goal! Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) fires the rebound into the top right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
Today's referee Markus Schmidt rightly decides to book Simon Terodde (1. FC Koln) for his harsh tackle.

A big opportunity is wasted by Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover), who makes a yard for himself and produces a mid-range rocket of a shot towards the right side of the goal. Unfortunately for him, Timo Horn pulls off a fantastic save to stop the effort.
Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and drills the ball into the bottom right corner. Magnificent finish!

Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for FC Koln.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Markus Schmidt starts the second half.
Josip Elez (Hannover) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Markus Schmidt didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Julian Korb (Hannover).
It's like he was asking for a caution. Salif Sane (Hannover) receives a yellow card.
Problems for Stefan Ruthenbeck as Simon Terodde is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln) replaces him.
Julian Korb will be replaced by Kenan Karaman (Hannover).
Stefan Ruthenbeck decides to make a substitution. Milos Jojic will be replaced by Vincent Koziello (1. FC Koln).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Felix Klaus walks off the pitch to be replaced by Martin Harnik (Hannover).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Claudio Pizarro (Koln) is coming onto the pitch as Salih Ozcan cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Iver Fossum goes off the pitch and Florian Hubner (Hannover) comes on.
The goal by Claudio Pizarro (Koln) won't count as it has been disallowed on the advice of the video assistant referee!
Marcel Risse (Koln) has received a yellow card for his foul.
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) trips an opposition player and Robert Hartmann signals a foul. Penalty awarded! Freiburg will take a penalty kick.
Goal! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) calmly steps up and places the ball into the bottom right corner.
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Amir Abrashi (Freiburg) for his blatant foul.
The match has reached half-time.
Robert Hartmann blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Janik Haberer (Freiburg) has tested the patience of referee Robert Hartmann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
It will be a substitution. Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen) is ready to enter the pitch as Maximilian Eggestein walks off.
Christian Streich prepares a substitution. Marco Terrazzino is replaced by Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen) will replace Aron Johannsson.
Christian Streich has decided to substitute Lucas Holer and he is replaced by Florian Kath (Freiburg).
Here is a change. Philipp Bargfrede is going off and Florian Kohfeldt gives the last tactical orders to Jerome Gondorf (Werder Bremen).
Substitution. Lukas Kubler (Freiburg) in, Pascal Stenzel out.
Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) robs an opponent of the ball and explodes in anger when Robert Hartmann blows for a foul. PENALTY! One of the players from Freiburg is about to take a penalty kick.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) was quite harsh and Robert Hartmann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Janik Haberer (Freiburg) fails to score from the penalty as his shot only hits the right post.
Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Robert Hartmann had an easy-decision to make.
That's it for today, Robert Hartmann has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Mergim Mavraj (Hamburger) receives a yellow card.
Substitution. Wendell makes way for Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen).
Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) jumps for a cross in the goal area and produces a fine header which goes narrowly wide of the left post! What a huge opportunity!
Goal! The ball breaks to Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) after some poor defending, he finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and calmly puts the ball into the back of the net! He makes it 0:1.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
Bernd Hollerbach makes a half-time substitution. Andre Hahn (Hamburger) comes on in place of Mergim Mavraj.

GOAL! Superb work from Benjamin Henrichs, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen), who beats Christian Mathenia with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner. 0:2.
Panagiotis Retsos (Bayer Leverkusen) is the one who receives a yellow card.
Substitution. Jann-Fiete Arp is replaced by Bobby Wood (Hamburger).

Bobby Wood (Hamburger) receives a slide-rule pass inside the box and has just the keeper to beat. His shot towards the bottom right corner lacks power and Bernd Leno easily makes the save. Hamburger SV earn a corner.
GOAL! Andre Hahn (Hamburger) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Bernd Leno, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 1:2.
Substitution. Julian Brandt did his best and is replaced by Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen).
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Sejad Salihovic (Hamburger).
Here is a change. Sejad Salihovic is going off and Bernd Hollerbach gives the last tactical orders to Aaron Hunt (Hamburger).
The referee gives a yellow card to Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen).
We are about to witness a substitution. Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen) is replacing Kai Havertz.
Bobby Wood (Hamburger) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and shoots towards goal, but it goes well wide of the right post.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.

Goal! Yunus Malli clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg), who gets on the end of it and steers a bullet header from the centre of the box into the right side of the goal. Sven Ulreich had no chance of stopping that. 1:0.
Sebastian Jung (Wolfsburg) picks up a yellow card for an infringement. Bayern Munich earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.
Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Sascha Stegemann had an easy-decision to make.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) has tested the patience of referee Sascha Stegemann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Sascha Stegemann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) commits a rough challenge and Sascha Stegemann blows his whistle for a foul. No point in arguing there. Bayern Munich will take a penalty kick.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) was quite harsh and Sascha Stegemann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) takes a penalty kick. The shot goes in the direction of the left post, but Koen Casteels reacts superbly and stops it, deflecting the ball onto the woodwork!

Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich) gets on the end of a cross inside the box and sweeps the ball goalwards towards the middle of the goal, but Koen Casteels is well positioned and easily deals with the effort.
Thiago Alcantara will be replaced by Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich).

Arjen Robben showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich) meets the cross and gets himself onto the scoresheet with a header down into the middle of the net. It's 1:1.
Today's match ends for Franck Ribery who will be replaced by David Alaba (Bayern Munich).
Sebastian Jung is substituted due to injury. Martin Schmidt gives a chance to William (Wolfsburg).
Substitution. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) replaces Sandro Wagner.
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) for his blatant foul.
Martin Schmidt decides to make a substitution. Renato Steffen will be replaced by Victor Osimhen (Wolfsburg).

Gian-Luca Itter (Wolfsburg) pulls the jersey of one of the opposition players and Sascha Stegemann blows his whistle for a foul. The referee makes a quick call and points to the penalty spot. Big scoring opportunity for Bayern Munich.
Gian-Luca Itter (Wolfsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Sascha Stegemann had an easy-decision to make.
Goal! Koen Casteels gets a hand on the penalty from Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), but can't stop it from flying into the bottom right corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Yunus Malli trots off the pitch and is replaced by Nany Landry Dimata (Wolfsburg).
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) is yellow-carded.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Emil Berggreen (Mainz) latches on to a precise lofted cross inside the box, controls the ball and unleashes a fine strike towards the middle of the goal. His dangerous effort is blocked by Rune Jarstein, who makes a glorious save! The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Mainz.
Vedad Ibisevic is being substituted because of an injury. Pal Dardai sends Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) on the pitch.

Robin Quaison (Mainz) is strong enough to get to the ball and produces a header from close range. Even though the header was directed under the crossbar, Rune Jarstein didn't have a hard time stopping the attempt as it wasn't powerful enough. Mainz have been awarded a corner kick.

Robin Quaison (Mainz) scores with a great individual effort! He makes a good run, skips past defenders and fires the ball from the edge of the box past the diving goalkeeper. The shot went inside the left post. Absolutely phenomenal!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Close! Robin Quaison (Mainz) unleashes a rocket of a shot from the edge of the box and his shot flies just a few inches over the crossbar.
Substitution. Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) in, Per Skjelbred out.
Danny Latza (Mainz) had a good opportunity from long range. His shot was directed towards the left side of the goal, but Rune Jarstein was alert and made a comfortable save. Mainz have a corner.
Leon Balogun (Mainz) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Goal - 0:2! Jean-Philippe Gbamin tees up Robin Quaison (Mainz) inside the box and he slams the ball past Rune Jarstein.
Substitution. Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) has come on for Robin Quaison.
Pal Dardai prepares a substitution. Salomon Kalou is replaced by Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Suat Serdar departs the field of play to be replaced by Pablo De Blasis (Mainz).
Danny Latza (Mainz) sees a yellow card from Martin Petersen after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Here is a change. Emil Berggreen is going off and Sandro Schwarz gives the last tactical orders to Anthony Ujah (Mainz).
Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Martin Petersen didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
That's it for today, Martin Petersen has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
The corner from Zlatko Junuzovic goes into a dangerous area and finds Ludwig Augustinsson (Werder Bremen), who outjumps the defence and glances a header into the back of the net. 1:0.

Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) jumps above the defenders in order to convert a lofted cross with a nice header. Koen Casteels makes a reflexive save to block his effort from hitting the net. Werder Bremen have a corner.
Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) struck from medium range. He buried the ball inside the right post.
Ludwig Augustinsson (Werder Bremen) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Deniz Aytekin ignores the protests.
Deniz Aytekin has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Victor Osimhen (Wolfsburg) latches onto a cross and shoots from close-range, but Jiri Pavlenka makes a terrific save to deny him. Good work from Wolfsburg as they win a corner.

Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen) pulls the jersey of one of the opposition players and Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle for a foul. The referee blows his whistle and awards Wolfsburg a penalty after chaos inside the box.
Paul Verhaegh (Wolfsburg) has a great chance to score from the penalty. He shoots to the bottom left corner, but Jiri Pavlenka leaps out to thwart his attempt.
Paul Verhaegh (Wolfsburg) gets to a ball from a rebound on the edge of the six-yard box and then it's a piece of cake to score.
That will be all from Philipp Bargfrede who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen).
Substitution. Jerome Gondorf (Werder Bremen) replaces Aron Johannsson.
Martin Schmidt has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) replacing Josip Brekalo.
Here's the change. Josuha Guilavogui leaves the pitch and Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) comes on as a substitute.
Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems fires the ball into the back of the net.
Substitution. Nany Landry Dimata (Wolfsburg) has come on for Admir Mehmedi.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Zlatko Junuzovic walks off the pitch to be replaced by Robert Bauer (Werder Bremen).
The foul by Jeffrey Bruma (Wolfsburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Deniz Aytekin.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The main referee, Deniz Aytekin, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) is given a yellow card for dissent.
Paul Verhaegh (Wolfsburg) uses the wrong choice of words while trying to explain something to the referee and receives a yellow card for dissent.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
That was close by Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the right post.

It's in the back of the net! Mario Gomez slips the ball through to Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:0.
Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but the effort is well over the bar.

Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the bottom right corner. Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Dieter Hecking makes a half-time substitution. Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) comes on in place of Vincenzo Grifo.

Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) hits a shot towards the top left corner from the edge of the box, but it's a weak attempt and is easily saved by Ron-Robert Zieler. Corner kick. B. Monchengladbach will have an opportunity.
What a huge chance for Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Timo Baumgartl (VfB Stuttgart) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Frank Willenborg ignores the protests.
Here's the change. Denis Zakaria leaves the pitch and Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) comes on as a substitute.

Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) had a great opportunity from mid-range. His powerful volley was directed towards the left side of the goal, but Ron-Robert Zieler was alert and made an astonishing save! The referee blows his whistle, B. Monchengladbach are awarded a corner kick.
That will be all from Erik Thommy who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Holger Badstuber (VfB Stuttgart).
Tayfun Korkut has decided to substitute Dennis Aogo and he is replaced by Orel Mangala (VfB Stuttgart).
Here comes a substitution. Raul Bobadilla (B. Monchengladbach) is brought on as a substitute for Jonas Hofmann.

Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a fine cross from the resulting corner and attempts to finish from the edge of the box. His shot, however, misses the target narrowly wide of the left post.
Tayfun Korkut decides to make a substitution. Santiago Ascacibar will be replaced by Marcin Kaminski (VfB Stuttgart).
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) fires the rebound inside the right post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Max Meyer (Schalke) gets booked.

David Alaba (Bayern Munich) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the bottom right corner. Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post.

Franco Di Santo (Schalke) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes straight into the bottom right corner. He couldn't have done it any better. 1:1.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems stabs the ball low inside the left post.
Today's referee Tobias Stieler rightly decides to book James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) for his harsh tackle.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Tobias Stieler rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Guido Burgstaller (Schalke).
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Max Meyer will be replaced by Bastian Oczipka (Schalke).
Domenico Tedesco decides to make a substitution. Guido Burgstaller will be replaced by Amine Harit (Schalke).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jerome Boateng leaves the pitch and Niklas Sule (Bayern Munich) comes on.

Breel Embolo (Schalke) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the bottom left corner is blocked by Sven Ulreich, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Peter Hermann prepares a substitution. Franck Ribery is replaced by Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich).
Substitution. Franco Di Santo leaves the pitch and is replaced by Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke).
Peter Hermann has decided to substitute James Rodriguez and he is replaced by Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich).
Tobias Stieler is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) gets a yellow card.
Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) picks up a yellow card.
Goal! Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin) collects a pass and without hesitation fires an unstoppable shot into the bottom right corner.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Problems for Pal Dardai as Jordan Torunarigha is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) replaces him.
A substitution has been made. Benjamin Henrichs goes off and Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
Goal! Some very poor defending from the opponent allows Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) the chance to get to the edge of the box and he makes no mistake with a lovely finish. It's 0:2.
Julian Brandt will be replaced by Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen).

Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) controls the ball from the resulting set piece in the six-yard box and releases a strike. If it hadn't been blocked by one of the defenders it could have ended up in the bottom right corner.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) fires a rebound from close range onto the bar!
The substitution has been made. Joel Pohjanpalo (Bayer Leverkusen) has replaced Dominik Kohr.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin) replaces Salomon Kalou.

OFF THE BAR! Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin) found himself some space to take a shot from just outside the box, but Bernd Leno came up with a save and tipped the ball onto the bar. Hertha Berlin will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Here comes a substitution. Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin) is brought on as a substitute for Vladimir Darida.
Panagiotis Retsos (Bayer Leverkusen) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
The end of the first half.
Marco Fritz blows his whistle and the second half starts.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund). Christian Pulisic plays a fantastic through ball and finds Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
A substitution has been made. Bobby Wood is replaced by Jann-Fiete Arp (Hamburger).
Bernd Hollerbach has decided to make a change. Sejad Salihovic (Hamburger) replaces Aaron Hunt.
Peter Stoger is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Shinji Kagawa suffers an injury and Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund) comes on.

Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) beats the defender inside the box and lashes a shot towards the right side of the goal, but Christian Mathenia makes a brilliant reflex save to deny him. Goalkeeping at its best!
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Gideon Jung (Hamburger) for his blatant foul.
Substitution. Albin Ekdal makes his way off the pitch and Andre Hahn (Hamburger) comes on as his replacement.
Peter Stoger has decided to substitute Marco Reus and he is replaced by Mario Gotze (Dortmund).
Sejad Salihovic (Hamburger) has a sight of goal and shoots from long range but his ambitious effort flies just over the bar.
Here's the change. Christian Pulisic leaves the pitch and Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) comes on as a substitute.
GOAL! Mario Gotze (Dortmund) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Christian Mathenia, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 2:0.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Luka Jovic is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a precise shot into the bottom left corner to make the score 1:0.

Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) latches on to a lofted pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a sweet strike. Unfortunately for him, the ball only rattles the right post. What a goal that would have been!

What an opportunity! Frederik Sorensen (1. FC Koln) wastes a huge chance as he latches on to a perfect pass and produces a first-time blast from point blank range. It goes towards the right side of the goal, but Lukas Hradecky reacts superbly to keep the ball out.
Daniel Siebert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half gets underway.
Omar Mascarell (Eintracht Frankfurt) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) commits an ugly tackle on his opponent, but there is no caution from the referee. Penalty awarded! FC Koln will take a penalty kick.
Goal! Simon Terodde (Koln) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Lukas Hradecky into the bottom right corner.
Here is a change. Milos Jojic is going off and Stefan Ruthenbeck gives the last tactical orders to Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln).
It will be a substitution. Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) is ready to enter the pitch as Luka Jovic walks off.

Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) celebrates a stunning goal. He manages to win himself just enough space inside the box to meet the free kick and powers a perfectly placed header into the top right corner of the goal.
Jorge Mere (1. FC Koln) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Daniel Siebert ignores the protests.
Here's the change. Jhon Cordoba leaves the pitch and Marcel Risse (Koln) comes on as a substitute.
Goal! Simon Falette (Eintracht Frankfurt) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the middle of the net. It's 3:1.

Brilliant finish! Marius Wolf (Eintracht Frankfurt) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Danny da Costa, then produced a nice strike into the bottom left corner. The score is 4:1.
Daniel Siebert shows the yellow card to Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a heavy challenge.
Stefan Ruthenbeck has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Vincent Koziello (Koln) replacing Matthias Lehmann.
Substitution. Kevin-Prince Boateng walks off the pitch and Gelson Fernandes (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as a substitute.

Perfectly taken free kick! Marcel Risse sends a cross in and Simon Terodde (Koln) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes low inside the right post and the score changes to 4:2.
That's the end of the game for Ante Rebic, who is replaced by Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
A goal, which was scored by Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln), was disallowed due to offside.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
Great touch by Nils Petersen (Freiburg) as he receives a precise pass deep inside the box and rips a shot goalwards, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save!
Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg) picks up the rebound on the edge of the box and shoots. His effort, however, only finds the gloves of the opponent's goalkeeper.
Wonderful finish from Waldemar Anton (Hannover). He drills a low shot precisely into the bottom left corner. No chance for the goalkeeper.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Manuel Grafe blows his whistle and the second half starts.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Christian Streich probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Marc-Oliver Kempf. He is replaced by Florian Kath (Freiburg).
Goal! Felix Klaus (Hannover) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Ihlas Bebou, then sends the ball into the bottom right corner. 2:0.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Tim Kleindienst walks off the pitch to be replaced by Marco Terrazzino (Freiburg).
Manuel Grafe shows the yellow card to Marco Terrazzino (Freiburg) for a heavy challenge.
It looked like the long-range shot by Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) would end up in the net, but the effort went painfully wide of the right post. The goalkeeper was quite lucky this time.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg) comes onto the pitch so that Lukas Kubler can be given a rest.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Felix Klaus trots off the pitch and is replaced by Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover).
Christian Gunter (Freiburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Manuel Grafe ignores the protests.
Substitution. Martin Harnik (Hannover) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Ihlas Bebou walks off.
Philipp Tschauner pulls off a great save to block a header from Robin Koch (Freiburg) after a nice lofted cross.
Manuel Gulde (Freiburg) scores with a header from inside the box after a goalmouth scramble.
Iver Fossum will be replaced by Florian Hubner (Hannover).
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
What an opportunity! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) disappointed the fans as he smashed a first-time shot from inside the box against the right post!
Alexander Hack (Mainz) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) latches onto a nice cross into the area around the penalty spot, but plants his header just over the bar.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) beats an opponent and drives towards the edge of the penalty area. He steadies himself and hits a tremendous shot that flashes a whisker past the right post.
Goal! Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) takes a short pass from Serge Gnabry in his stride in the box, jinks inside his man and unleashes an unstoppable shot low into the middle of the goal. 1:0.

It's in the back of the net! Daniel Brosinski floated in the free kick and the ball found the head of Emil Berggreen (Mainz), whose powerful header from near the penalty spot went straight into the roof of the net. The score is 1:1.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim) is given a yellow card.

Serge Gnabry (Hoffenheim) weaves through the defence with ease and gets one-on-one with the keeper, but fails to score with his strike towards the bottom right corner as Robin Zentner produces a good save.
Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) blows an opportunity from close range as he heads a rebound onto to the crossbar!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Benjamin Cortus has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot low towards the middle of the goal, but Robin Zentner pulls off a comfortable save.
Here's the change. Danny Latza leaves the pitch and Suat Serdar (Mainz) comes on as a substitute.
Fine attempt! Dennis Geiger (Hoffenheim) collects a pass and manages to hold off the defender, then rifles in a shot from mid-range which unluckily swerves inches past the left post.
Emil Berggreen (Mainz) watches the cross all the way and heads at goal from near the penalty spot, but his effort flashes narrowly wide of the left post.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Dennis Geiger (Hoffenheim).
Nadiem Amiri will be replaced by Mark Uth (Hoffenheim).
Abdou Diallo (Mainz) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Goal! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) slots the ball into an unguarded net from close range after a shot rebounds off a defender. 2:1.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) will replace Nico Schulz.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to make a change. Robin Quaison (Mainz) replaces Alexander Hack.
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) unleashes a shot straight into the bottom left corner. Good team effort!
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
A substitution has been made. Nigel De Jong goes off and Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) comes on.
Goal! Emil Berggreen (Mainz) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 3:2.
Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) picks up a yellow card.
Julian Nagelsmann decides to make a substitution. Serge Gnabry will be replaced by Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim).
Leon Balogun (Mainz) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) scores a great goal from the resulting free kick from mid-range. He sends the ball directly inside the left post.
Robin Quaison (Mainz) misses the left post by a whisker with a mid-range rebound. What a chance that was!
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Raphael Framberger (Augsburg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Sven Jablonski didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick shot to the left side of the goal, but he can't get the power to direct it past Marwin Hitz, who keeps it out. The ball goes out of play. RB Leipzig are awarded a corner kick.

Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) connects with a cross on the edge of the box, controls the ball and pulls the trigger. Marwin Hitz makes a beautiful save to deny his effort which would have ended inside the right post.
Goal! The rebound fell to Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig) and he fired home from close range. The score is 1:0.
Rani Khedira (Augsburg) picks up a yellow card.

Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom left corner. Peter Gulacsi guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
Manuel Baum has made a change at the break. Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg) has come on in place of Marcel Heller.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) receives a pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Marwin Hitz makes a great save to stop his effort.
A defence splitting pass into the box is almost received by Timo Werner (RB Leipzig), but Marwin Hitz is quick enough and comes off his line to intercept the pass.

A big opportunity is wasted by Daniel Baier (Augsburg), who makes a yard for himself and produces a mid-range rocket of a shot towards the left side of the goal. Unfortunately for him, Peter Gulacsi pulls off a fantastic save to stop the effort. The linesman points to the corner flag, Augsburg are going to take it.
Goal! Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) takes the resulting free-kick from the edge of the box, but the ball takes a deflection off a defender and goes past the helpless Marwin Hitz and into the net. 2:0.
Substitution. Michael Gregoritsch leaves the pitch and is replaced by Sergio Cordova (Augsburg).
Kevin Kampl (RB Leipzig) fires the ball from the free kick and it smashes against the crossbar!
The referee signals a substitution. Ademola Lookman (RB Leipzig) is brought on as a substitute for Naby Keita.

Marwin Hitz was forced into action to thwart Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom left corner but couldn't beat the keeper.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Yussuf Poulsen as he is replaced by Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig).
Manuel Baum has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jan Moravek (Augsburg) replacing Francisco Caiuby.
Bruma comes off the pitch to be replaced by Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig).
That's it for today, Sven Jablonski has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) wastes a big chance! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box and it goes narrowly over the crossbar.
Bobby Wood (Hamburger) is first to the cross from Bobby Wood, but fires his header just past the left post from close range.

What a beautiful moment! Iver Fossum (Hannover) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way inside the left post. Christian Mathenia just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 0:1.
What a miss! Bobby Wood (Hamburger) is left standing right in front of goal with only the keeper to beat after a clever pass, but he somehow contrives to toe poke the ball just past the right post.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
Half-time substitution. Bernd Hollerbach decided to make a change. Dennis Diekmeier is replaced by Tatsuya Ito (Hamburger).
Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Christian Mathenia.
A substitution has been made. Aaron Hunt goes off and Jann-Fiete Arp (Hamburger) comes on.
Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Hamburger) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Substitution. Felix Klaus walks off the pitch and Martin Harnik (Hannover) comes on as a substitute.
It's time for a substitution. Sejad Salihovic (Hamburger) comes on in place of Albin Ekdal.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover) replacing Ihlas Bebou.
Yellow card. Matthias Ostrzolek (Hannover) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Goal! Filip Kostic (Hamburger) finds some space inside the box to meet a beautiful cross and fires the ball inside the back of the net.
Close! Martin Harnik (Hannover) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post.
The game has come to an end for Pirmin Schwegler. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Kenan Karaman (Hannover).
Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Hamburger) receives a second yellow card and is sent off.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
Goal! Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) fires the rebound into the bottom left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) connects with a cross near the penalty spot and produces a header which hits the right post!
Harm Osmers shows a yellow card to Simon Falette (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a tough tackle.
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) gets on the end of a cross from Philipp Max, but his shot goes a whisker wide of the right post.

Lukas Hradecky makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) inside the box and he drills a strike goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the middle of the target.
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Marcel Heller (Augsburg) receives a precise pass in the box and takes the shot early. The ball heads low towards the middle of the goal, but Lukas Hradecky shows off his skills and makes a brilliant save to deny him.
Here comes a substitution. Mijat Gacinovic is given a rest as he is replaced by Gelson Fernandes (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Today's referee Harm Osmers rightly decides to book Raphael Framberger (Augsburg) for his harsh tackle.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Marco Fabian (Eintracht Frankfurt) is coming onto the pitch as Kevin-Prince Boateng cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Manuel Baum prepares a substitution. Jan Moravek is replaced by Marco Richter (Augsburg).
GOAL! A cross into the box is headed down by Francisco Caiuby and Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) does brilliantly to get to the ball and fire home. 2:0.

Marius Wolf (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Marwin Hitz guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
That's the end of the game for Marcel Heller, who is replaced by Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg).
Niko Kovac has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Danny da Costa (Eintracht Frankfurt) replacing Sebastien Haller.
Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) latches onto a short pass just on the edge of the box and shoots. The effort beats the keeper but comes back off the right post. Close!
GOAL! Marco Richter (Augsburg) gets to the ball on the edge of the box after a huge mistake by an opponent and slams it into the back of the net. He makes it 3:0.
Harm Osmers is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.

Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) displays brilliant individual ability, gets inside the box and pulls the trigger. His promising effort is blocked by one of the defenders. The ball is out of play. B. Monchengladbach will have a chance to score from a corner.

A pass into the box finds Bruma (RB Leipzig) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the top right corner, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Tobias Sippel denies him. The linesman makes the right call and RB Leipzig will have a corner.
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) lunges into his opponent and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Tobias Stieler has ended it.
The second half has just started.
Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) gets on the end of a pass and produces a promising first-time shot at goal. His effort is blocked by Tobias Sippel with a brilliant diving save!
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) picks up a precise pass deep inside the box, but his strike is saved by the keeper.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach) comes onto the pitch for Patrick Herrmann.

Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) does well to control a poor pass on the edge of the box then shoots towards the top left corner. Tobias Sippel is out of position but leaps to make a brilliant save. RB Leipzig force their opponents to concede a corner.
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Tobias Stieler had an easy-decision to make.
Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
Here comes a substitution. Ademola Lookman (RB Leipzig) is brought on as a substitute for Bruma.

Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) fires in a promising strike from the free kick just outside the penalty area. His nice effort flies towards the top right corner but is denied by Tobias Sippel, who pulls off a glorious save! The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for RB Leipzig.
Ademola Lookman (RB Leipzig) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Tobias Sippel with a strike into the bottom left corner. He makes it 0:1.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the bottom left corner, but Peter Gulacsi pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Ralph Hasenhuttl is forced to make a change. Diego Demme is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.
Christian Gunter (Freiburg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Robert Kampka didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a superb cross into the box and hits the left post with a fine header. What a chance!
Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg) collects a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a low drive to the middle, but Bernd Leno makes a save.
Lukas Kubler (Freiburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Robert Kampka had an easy-decision to make.
Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) latches onto a lofted pass from Kai Havertz on the edge of the six-yard box, but misdirects his header and sends it just wide of the left post.
Robert Kampka shows a yellow card to Amir Abrashi (Freiburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Kampka ignores the protests.
