The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Robert Kampka shows a yellow card to Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) for his blatant foul.
Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg) gets to the rebound just outside the box, but his attempt is blocked by one of the defending players.
Heiko Herrlich has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) replacing Leon Bailey.
The substitution has been made. Florian Kath (Freiburg) has replaced Lucas Holer.
Janik Haberer (Freiburg) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Substitution. Dominik Kohr is replaced by Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Karim Bellarabi trots off the pitch and is replaced by Joel Pohjanpalo (Bayer Leverkusen).
Christian Streich has decided to substitute Janik Haberer and he is replaced by Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg).
A yellow card for a tackle by Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg). Robert Kampka doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Florian Kath (Freiburg) is given a yellow card.
Robert Kampka is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
Kerem Demirbay has picked up an injury and is replaced by Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim).
Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle. Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) commits a foul after dangerous play. PENALTY to Hoffenheim!
Goal! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) runs up to the ball, stops and waits for Thomas Kraft to commit before slotting the penalty into the bottom right corner.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
Here is a change. Alexander Esswein is going off and Pal Dardai gives the last tactical orders to Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin).

Valentino Lazaro showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) meets the cross and gets himself onto the scoresheet with a header into the middle of the goal. It's 1:1.
The referee signals a substitution. Robert Zulj (Hoffenheim) is brought on as a substitute for Adam Szalai.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim) was quite harsh and Deniz Aytekin didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The substitution has been made. Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) has replaced Andrej Kramaric.
What was Dennis Geiger (Hoffenheim) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Here comes a substitution. Salomon Kalou is given a rest as he is replaced by Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a great shot into the bottom right corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Robin Zentner, so the score changes to 0:1.
It's a yellow card for Sebastian Rudy (Bayern Munich).
Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich) is booked by the referee.
Goal! Corentin Tolisso shows great vision to find James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) with a cheeky pass inside the box, and his first-time shot is precise and sails into the bottom right corner. 0:2.
Soren Storks has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half gets underway.
Sandro Schwarz makes a half-time substitution. Robin Quaison (Mainz) comes on in place of Levin Oztunali.
We are about to witness a substitution. Suat Serdar (Mainz) is replacing Alexandru Maxim.
Here is a change. Sandro Wagner is going off and Jupp Heynckes gives the last tactical orders to Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and David Alaba (Bayern Munich) is coming onto the pitch as Sebastian Rudy cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Sandro Schwarz prepares a substitution. Gerrit Holtmann is replaced by Emil Berggreen (Mainz).
Robin Quaison (Mainz) gets inside the box and only has the keeper to beat, but smashes his shot just inches past the left post. He should have scored!
Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) picks up a yellow card.
The game has come to an end for Franck Ribery. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich).
That's it for today, Soren Storks has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Matija Nastasic (Schalke) makes a really bad tackle on his opponent and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) fires a knuckleball of a shot towards goal from outside the penalty area and the ball goes into the back of the net after the goalkeeper makes a complete howler!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen) was quite harsh and Guido Winkmann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Domenico Tedesco probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Nabil Bentaleb. He is replaced by Leon Goretzka (Schalke).
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot low towards the middle of the goal was comfortably saved by Jiri Pavlenka.
Franco Di Santo (Schalke) produces a good strike that sails towards the left post, but the goalkeeper shows great reflexes and dives to keep the effort from hitting the net.
Corner kick. Bastian Oczipka (Schalke) is ready to send the ball into the box.

A cross following the corner kick finds its way to Naldo (Schalke) inside the box and he manages to steer it to the bottom left corner. He is about to start celebrating a goal, but Jiri Pavlenka makes a save in the nick of time to maintain the current score. The ball goes out of play. Schalke are awarded a corner kick.
We are about to witness a substitution. Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) is replacing Milot Rashica.
A substitution has been made. Franco Di Santo is replaced by Guido Burgstaller (Schalke).
Substitution. Evgen Konoplyanka will be replaced by Marko Pjaca (Schalke).
Florian Kohfeldt decides to make a substitution. Jerome Gondorf will be replaced by Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen).
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) picks up a pass and unleashes a strong shot from inside the box, but the goalkeeper is equal to it!
An infringement by Matija Nastasic (Schalke) results in a yellow card and as it's the second time today, he also sees a red and is dismissed by Guido Winkmann.
Goal! Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) fires the rebound into the bottom left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:1.
OFF THE POST! Marko Pjaca (Schalke) picks up the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot which smashes against the right post.
Thilo Kehrer (Schalke) violates the laws of the game and is shown a yellow card by the referee, but it could have been a straight red as well.
Goal! Maximilian Eggestein passes the ball to the feet of Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 1:2.
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to substitute Ishak Belfodil and he is replaced by Sebastian Langkamp (Werder Bremen).
That's it for today, Guido Winkmann has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) finds space in the box and tries a looping header at goal from the corner, but the ball goes just wide of the right post. Unlucky!
Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) doesn't hesitate to lash home from just outside the box. He hits the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and it nestles in the net.
Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) steadies himself and bends in a shot from the edge of the box towards the bottom left corner, but Ron-Robert Zieler has it covered and makes a comfortable save.
Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Hartmann ignores the protests.
Robert Hartmann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Tayfun Korkut has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) comes on the pitch for Anastasios Donis.
Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) scores from the corner kick. The ball slipped through the box to Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) and he slotted it past the goalkeeper.
It will be a substitution. Admir Mehmedi (Wolfsburg) is ready to enter the pitch as Renato Steffen walks off.
The free kick from a promising distance is taken by Jeffrey Bruma (Wolfsburg), who fires in a direct effort just wide of the left post. What a chance!

That was a nice football moment. Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the right post. Koen Casteels guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save!
A substitution has been made. Daniel Didavi goes off and Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) comes on.
Tayfun Korkut prepares a substitution. Dennis Aogo is replaced by Orel Mangala (VfB Stuttgart).
Robert Hartmann shows the yellow card to Orel Mangala (VfB Stuttgart) for a heavy challenge.
Robert Hartmann is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
A pass into the box finds Milos Jojic (Koln) unmarked. He carefully places a shot low towards the middle of the goal, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Roman Burki denies him.
Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) hits the crossbar with a rebound from just outside the box.

Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it.
Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.

GOAL! Superb work from Jeremy Toljan, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund), who beats Timo Horn with a brilliant shot into the left side of the net. 0:1.
Yellow card. Milos Jojic (Koln) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
The video assistant referee intervenes and the referee disallows the goal as Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund) was in an offside position.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Christian Clemens comes off for Simon Zoller (Koln).
Sehrou Guirassy (Koln) has to stretch for the ball in the box and sends it just wide of the right post.
Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Timo Horn.
Simon Zoller (Koln) gets to a rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball into the bottom left corner, and thus alter the score to 1:1.
It's in the back of the net! Christian Pulisic picks out Michy Batshuayi (Dortmund) with a sweet pass, and he latches on to it deep inside the box and beats the goalkeeper. 1:2.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mahmoud Dahoud departs the field of play to be replaced by Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund).
Here is a change. Sehrou Guirassy is going off and Stefan Ruthenbeck gives the last tactical orders to Jhon Cordoba (1. FC Koln).
Jorge Mere (Koln) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the bottom left corner. The score is 2:2.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jadon Sancho (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch so that Christian Pulisic can be given a rest.
Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) tricks his way to edge of the area and unleashes a howitzer of a shot towards the bottom left corner, but Timo Horn earns his money with a fine reflex save.

Goal! Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the top left corner. Timo Horn had no chance of reaching it. The score is 2:3.
Stefan Ruthenbeck has decided to substitute Marco Hoger and he is replaced by Claudio Pizarro (Koln).
Substitution. Manuel Akanji (Dortmund) replaces Andre Schurrle.
Jonas Hector (1. FC Koln) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Benjamin Brand didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.

Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the left side of the goal. Philipp Tschauner shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Marcel Tisserand (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow card from Felix Brych after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Yannick Gerhardt (Wolfsburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Brych ignores the protests.
The game is interrupted. Pirmin Schwegler (Hannover) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Substitution. Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) replaces Josip Elez.
Nice piece of skill by Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) as he collected a pass and fired an unstoppable thunderbolt into the roof of the net, leaving the goalkeeper stranded.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Pirmin Schwegler as he is replaced by Kenan Karaman (Hannover).
Martin Harnik (Hannover) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Brych didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Elvis Rexhbecaj (Wolfsburg) comes onto the pitch so that Daniel Didavi can be given a rest.
Andre Breitenreiter prepares a substitution. Oliver Sorg is replaced by Charlison Benschop (Hannover).

OFF THE BAR! Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the crossbar! It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) picks up a yellow card.
Sebastian Jung (Wolfsburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Yunus Malli.
That's it for today, Felix Brych has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) was quite harsh and Frank Willenborg didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Bayer Leverkusen.
Nigel De Jong (Mainz) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Frank Willenborg had an easy-decision to make.
Problems for Heiko Herrlich as Julian Baumgartlinger is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces him.
Great ball in from Wendell. Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker wide of the left post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Frank Willenborg has ended it.
The second half has just started.
Goal! Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) is teed up on the edge of the box by Lucas Alario, and his howitzer of a shot inside the left post gives the keeper no chance. 1:0.
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) takes a short pass in his stride and attempts to beat the keeper from mid-range, but the shot screeches just wide of the right post.
Sandro Schwarz decides to make a substitution. Nigel De Jong will be replaced by Gerrit Holtmann (Mainz).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Daniel Brosinski will be replaced by Emil Berggreen (Mainz).
Substitution. Lars Bender did his best and is replaced by Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen).
Giulio Donati (Mainz) is penalised for holding. Frank Willenborg signals a set piece. The referee's verdict is crystal clear. A penalty is awarded to Bayer Leverkusen!
It's a yellow card for Giulio Donati (Mainz).
Goal! Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Robin Zentner into right side of the goal.
Substitution. Yoshinori Muto is replaced by Anthony Ujah (Mainz).
Julian Brandt will be replaced by Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen).
Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) jumps inside the box to meet the resulting set piece and aims a header towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper shows his reflexes and makes a superb save.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
Jerome Gondorf (Werder Bremen) decided to surprise the goalkeeper with a quick shot from the edge of the box, but his effort came back off the left post!
The Werder Bremen players can't believe it after the referee disallows the goal after the intervention of the video assistant referee.
A yellow card for a tackle by Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen). Bastian Dankert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Bastian Dankert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Fabian Lustenberger is substituted due to injury. Pal Dardai gives a chance to Jordan Torunarigha (Hertha Berlin).
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) takes a first-time shot from the edge of the box, but his effort is well blocked by the defender.
Bastian Dankert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
This is a yellow card! Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
It will be a substitution. Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin) is ready to enter the pitch as Ondrej Duda walks off.
Davie Selke will be replaced by Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin).
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to substitute Philipp Bargfrede and he is replaced by Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen).
Thomas Kraft makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the right-hand post by Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) after a cross from the side.
Jerome Gondorf (Werder Bremen) can't believe his eyes as he misses a big opportunity to convert a rebound. The ball brushes the left post.
Florian Kohfeldt prepares a substitution. Jerome Gondorf is replaced by Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen).

Thomas Kraft can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen). The ball would have probably ended up low inside the middle of the net.
Florian Kohfeldt decides to make a substitution. Zlatko Junuzovic will be replaced by Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen).
Bastian Dankert shows the yellow card to Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) for a heavy challenge.
The referee Bastian Dankert awards Ludwig Augustinsson (Werder Bremen) a yellow card.
Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) has a crack at goal from inside the box, but the defender somehow makes the block to deny him.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.

Referee Manuel Grafe sees the trip by Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) and doesn't hesitate to blow his whistle. PENALTY to Hoffenheim! Almost the entire opposition team is gathered around the referee and complaining. However, the decision has been made and it's final.
Serge Gnabry (Hoffenheim) has a great chance to score from the penalty. He shoots to the bottom left corner, but Sven Ulreich leaps out to thwart his attempt.
Goal! Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 0:1.
Serge Gnabry (Hoffenheim) gets to the rebound and from long range fires the ball into the back of the net.
Goal! Joshua Kimmich takes aim and his effort deflects off Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) to beat the goalkeeper. 1:2.
Today's referee Manuel Grafe rightly decides to book Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) for his harsh tackle.
Goal! Arjen Robben swings the ball deep into the box and finds Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) unmarked, and his close-range header flies past the keeper into the bottom left corner. 2:2.
Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Manuel Grafe had an easy-decision to make.
David Alaba (Bayern Munich) gets there first and whips in a shot at goal that flies just wide of the right post.
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) finds himself with a great opportunity! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which whizzes just wide of the right post!
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
Julian Nagelsmann makes a half-time substitution. Kevin Akpoguma (Hoffenheim) comes on in place of Ermin Bicakcic.
Here comes a substitution. Lukas Rupp is given a rest as he is replaced by Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim).

Brilliant finish! Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Robert Lewandowski, then produced a nice strike into the bottom right corner. The score is 4:2.
We are about to witness a substitution. Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) is replacing Corentin Tolisso.
Goal! The corner is whipped in and Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) is in the right place at the right time, planting his header straight into the top right corner. He makes it 4:2.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) replacing Benjamini Hubner.
That's the end of the game for Arjen Robben, who is replaced by Rafinha (Bayern Munich).
It's time for a substitution. Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich) comes on in place of Joshua Kimmich.
Goal! Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich) beautifully controls a strongly hit pass from Rafinha inside the box. He cuts inside his marker and rifles the ball low into the middle of the goal. 5:2.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
What a goal-scoring opportunity! Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) finds some space inside the box and gets in a strike, but the shot is brilliantly blocked by one of the defending players sliding in.
Goal! Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) fires the rebound inside the left post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) received a delightful pass inside the box before slotting the ball past the goalkeeper. What a brilliant finish!
Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
A fine move culminates with a precision cross onto the head of Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) in the centre of the box. It's a good attempt but goes just over the bar.
Roman Burki receives ovations from the crowd. He manages to block a first-time effort from Lukas Kubler (Freiburg), whose strike from the edge of the box was headed for the bottom right corner.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Peter Stoger probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Gonzalo Castro. He is replaced by Mario Gotze (Dortmund).
Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) storms into the box to get on the end of a pass, but smashes his shot straight onto the left post. Unlucky!
Here is a change. Christian Pulisic is going off and Peter Stoger gives the last tactical orders to Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund).
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) scores a cracking goal from long range. The goalkeeper was helpless and could do nothing with that shot.
Rafal Gikiewicz makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded by Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) after a cross from the side.
The game has come to an end for Nuri Sahin (Dortmund). He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Alexander Isak.
Lucas Holer goes off the pitch and Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg) comes on.
Christian Streich prepares a substitution. Janik Haberer is replaced by Mohamed Drager (Freiburg).

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Jeremy Toljan (Dortmund) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a daisy-cutter into the middle of the goal. Even though his attempt wasn't very accurate, Rafal Gikiewicz couldn't stop it, so the score changes to 2:2.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Problems for Stefan Ruthenbeck as Marco Hoger is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Matthias Lehmann (1. FC Koln) replaces him.

Simon Terodde (1. FC Koln) receives a precise pass in the box and takes the shot early. The ball heads towards the bottom right corner, but Marwin Hitz shows off his skills and makes a brilliant save to deny him. The ball is out of play. FC Koln win a corner kick.
What a chance! The ball is inside the box and Christian Clemens (Koln) takes a first-time shot on goal, but his volley goes narrowly wide of the right post.
Milos Jojic (1. FC Koln) scores from a free kick after smashing the ball over the defensive wall and into the top left corner of the goal!

Yuya Osako (Koln) wastes a great chance from the resulting corner. He times his header superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross, but can't aim better than into the middle of the goal, straight into the arms of the goalkeeper.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Ja-Cheol Koo is replaced by Marcel Heller (Augsburg).
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Jeffrey Gouweleeuw comes off for Kevin Danso (Augsburg).
Salih Ozcan (Koln) volleys the ball on the edge of the box after a rebound. It's a great effort and has Marwin Hitz scrambling, but it flies just wide of the left post.
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Christian Clemens will be replaced by Lukas Klunter (Koln).
Stefan Ruthenbeck prepares a substitution. Yuya Osako is replaced by Sehrou Guirassy (1. FC Koln).
Rani Khedira (Augsburg) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Substitution. Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) has come on for Rani Khedira.

Goal! The ball is swung into the box from the resulting corner kick and finds Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg), who jumps highest and tries his luck with a header from around the penalty spot. His effort is both strong and precise enough to go inside the right post. The score changes to 1:1.

Milos Jojic (1. FC Koln) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the right post only for Marwin Hitz to dive and make a save. FC Koln have been awarded a corner kick.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Lukas Klunter (Koln) receives a yellow card!
Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Salih Ozcan (Koln) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
It's a yellow card for Matthias Lehmann (Koln).
Sehrou Guirassy (1. FC Koln) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just wide of the left post.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Bruma (RB Leipzig) leaps to connect with a lovely cross and scores with a header that bounces off the ground and goes inside the right post. The goalkeeper had no chance to make a save.
Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Benjamin Cortus had an easy-decision to make.
Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) finds space inside the box but rifles his effort just wide of the right post.
Filip Kostic (Hamburger) beats the offside trap and bears down on goal. With just the keeper to beat he coolly shoots past him from the edge of the box.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Benjamin Cortus starts the second half.
Substitution. Diego Demme did his best and is replaced by Naby Keita (RB Leipzig).
Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Hamburger) takes out his opponent with a horrible challenge and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Today's match ends for Jean-Kevin Augustin who will be replaced by Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig).
Bernd Hollerbach prepares a substitution. Bobby Wood is replaced by Jann-Fiete Arp (Hamburger).
Here is a change. Bruma is going off and Ralph Hasenhuttl gives the last tactical orders to Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Sejad Salihovic (Hamburger) is coming onto the pitch as Aaron Hunt cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Bernd Hollerbach has decided to make a change. Andre Hahn (Hamburger) replaces Walace.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.

Perfectly executed free kick. Daniel Caligiuri floats the ball in and Naldo (Schalke) leaps high to connect with it near the penalty spot. His bullet header flicks off the post into the bottom left corner. The score is now 0:1.

Jacob Bruun Larsen (VfB Stuttgart) robs an opponent of the ball and explodes in anger when Felix Zwayer blows for a foul. The crowd is going crazy! The referee makes a call and gives the penalty to Schalke.
Goal! Amine Harit (Schalke) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Ron-Robert Zieler into the bottom right corner.
Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Matija Nastasic (Schalke) was quite harsh and Felix Zwayer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) collects a rebound and produces a mid-range attempt. The ball goes to the left side of the target, but Ralf Fahrmann keeps it out with an amazing save.
Felix Zwayer has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Hannes Wolf makes a switch. Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) is coming on in place of Jacob Bruun Larsen at the start of the second period.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Hannes Wolf gives a chance to Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) and Berkay Ozcan is off.
Domenico Tedesco prepares a substitution. Leon Goretzka is replaced by Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke).
Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Ron-Robert Zieler (VfB Stuttgart) receives a yellow card!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) will replace Franco Di Santo.
Hannes Wolf has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) replacing Chadrac Akolo.

Ron-Robert Zieler can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Guido Burgstaller (Schalke). The ball would have probably ended up in the roof of the net. Schalke force a corner. They send men into the box.
The substitution is prepared. Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Evgen Konoplyanka.

Naldo (Schalke) outjumps the defence to meet the resulting corner and heads the ball towards the top right corner. His long-range header is not powerful enough, and the keeper comfortably makes a save. The ball goes out for a corner. Schalke can continue in their attacking effort.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Chance! Marius Wolf (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Ante Rebic, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the left post.
Omar Mascarell (Eintracht Frankfurt) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Problems for Dieter Hecking as Yann Sommer is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Tobias Sippel (B. Monchengladbach) replaces him.
Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Goal! Kevin-Prince Boateng (Eintracht Frankfurt) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Timothy Chandler. The score is 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Marco Fritz blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Dieter Hecking has made a change at the break. Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach) has come on in place of Oscar Wendt.
What a chance that is! Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the crossbar!
The referee gives a yellow card to Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Aymen Barkok (Eintracht Frankfurt) on for Ante Rebic.
Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) runs onto a pass and from the edge of the box tries his luck with a dipping shot. Unfortunately for him, the effort fizzes just over the bar.
Carlos Salcedo (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Aymen Barkok (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Christoph Kramer did his best and is replaced by Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach).
Referee Marco Fritz sees the trip by Kevin-Prince Boateng (Eintracht Frankfurt) and doesn't hesitate to blow his whistle. PENALTY! A huge scoring opportunity for B. Monchengladbach.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) misses the penalty as he smashes the ball against the crossbar!
The referee has issued a yellow card to Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach).
That will be all from Sebastien Haller who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Niko Kovac has decided to substitute Mijat Gacinovic and he is replaced by Gelson Fernandes (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home into the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a yellow card.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
The foul by Julian Korb (Hannover) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Martin Petersen.
Marko Pjaca (Schalke) latches on to a precise pass inside the penalty box and produces a sweet strike that beats the goalkeeper as it goes into the bottom right corner, bouncing off the post.
That was absolutely fantastic! Felix Klaus (Hannover) tries his luck with a hammer shot from long range, but his effort only rattles the left post! Here is an example of luck not being on your side.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Marko Pjaca walks off the pitch to be replaced by Breel Embolo (Schalke).
A yellow card for a tackle by Alessandro Schopf (Schalke). Martin Petersen doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Here comes a substitution. Leon Goretzka is given a rest as he is replaced by Weston McKennie (Schalke).
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to make a change. Martin Harnik (Hannover) replaces Julian Korb.
Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) controls a reverse pass deep inside the box and smacks the ball low towards the middle of the goal, but the Ralf Fahrmann anticipates well and smothers the ball.
Half-chance! Weston McKennie (Schalke) plays a pass into the box, but Philipp Tschauner reacts well to snuff out the attack.
Substitution. Kenan Karaman (Hannover) in, Pirmin Schwegler out.
Martin Petersen shows a yellow card to Naldo (Schalke), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Weston McKennie is substituted due to injury. Domenico Tedesco gives a chance to Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke).
Matthias Ostrzolek will be replaced by Charlison Benschop (Hannover).
Goal! Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 1:1.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
A yellow card for a tackle by Robert Bauer (Werder Bremen). Robert Kampka doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Ludwig Augustinsson plays a hopeful lofted pass into the box. Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) luckily gets his head to the ball and sends it narrowly wide of the right post from near the penalty spot.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Jerome Gondorf (Werder Bremen). Max Kruse plays a fantastic through ball and finds Jerome Gondorf (Werder Bremen), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom left corner. 0:1.
Niklas Sule (Bayern Munich) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.

What a wonderful finish! Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) latches on to an inch-perfect cross into the box and drills a low shot into the bottom right corner. There are not enough superlatives to describe that goal.
The match has reached half-time.
Robert Kampka blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Half-time substitution. Florian Kohfeldt decided to make a change. Robert Bauer is replaced by Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen).
It will be a substitution. Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) is ready to enter the pitch as Javi Martinez walks off.
Jupp Heynckes has decided to substitute Arjen Robben and he is replaced by Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich).
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) connects with the ball in the six-yard box after the resulting free kick and shoots towards the leftside of the goal, but Jiri Pavlenka makes a magnificent save!
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header into the roof of the net from close range. The score is 2:1.
Robert Kampka shows the yellow card to Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) for a heavy challenge.
Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Jerome Gondorf.
It's an own goal! An unlucky moment for Niklas Sule (Bayern Munich), who heads the corner kick behind his own keeper. The score is 2:2.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) scores from quite a difficult position as he leaps high to connect with a cross and powers his header low inside the right post. Excellent finish.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich) is coming onto the pitch as Robert Lewandowski cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) steadies himself and bends in a shot from the edge of the box towards the bottom left corner, but Sven Ulreich has it covered and makes a comfortable save. Werder Bremen earn a corner.
Substitution. Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Philipp Bargfrede walks off.
Goal! James Rodriguez tees up Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) inside the box, and he keeps his cool to find the bottom right corner. 4:2.
Robert Kampka is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.
Andre Hahn (Hamburger) misses a big opportunity after striking the ball towards the middle of the goal and the goalkeeper makes an easy save.
Guido Winkmann shows a yellow card to Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Hamburger) for a tough tackle.

Timo Horn hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Filip Kostic (Hamburger) shoots from the edge of the box towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. Hamburger SV have been awarded a corner kick.

Yuya Osako produces a cross from the resulting corner and finds Simon Terodde (Koln) inside the box. He pulls the trigger and scores, sending the ball into the bottom right corner. What a brilliant finish. 0:1.
Gideon Jung (Hamburger) sees a yellow card from Guido Winkmann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Vasilije Janjicic (Hamburger) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Guido Winkmann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Filip Kostic (Hamburger) is quickest to the rebound and shoots towards the middle of the net, but the goalkeeper pulls off a comfortable save to deny him.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Guido Winkmann has ended it.
Frederik Sorensen (Koln) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Jonas Hector (1. FC Koln) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Guido Winkmann ignores the protests.
That will be all from Yuya Osako who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Matthias Lehmann (Koln).
Here is a change. Vasilije Janjicic is going off and Markus Gisdol gives the last tactical orders to Bobby Wood (Hamburger).

Stunning strike! Simon Terodde (Koln) latches on to a precise through ball from Milos Jojic and surprises the goalkeeper with a low shot from the edge of the box that goes into the middle of the goal. The score is now 0:2.
Guido Winkmann shows a yellow card to Jorge Mere (1. FC Koln), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
OFF THE POST! Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) produces a stunning shot towards goal from the free kick, but the ball rattles the right post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Tatsuya Ito (Hamburger) replaces Lewis Holtby.
Stefan Ruthenbeck has decided to make a change. Lukas Klunter (1. FC Koln) replaces Christian Clemens.
A substitution has been made. Milos Jojic is replaced by Claudio Pizarro (Koln).
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Thorgan Hazard delivers a well-placed cross from the corner. Matthias Ginter (B. Monchengladbach) wins the ball and powers an unstoppable header in off the inside of the right post. The score now reads 1:0.

Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Marwin Hitz makes a great save to stop the effort going into the top of the net.
Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the middle of the goal is comfortably saved by the goalkeeper.
Daniel Opare (Augsburg) is lucky to receive a yellow card from the referee because he could easily have been given a red card for his foul.

Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The linesman makes the right call and B. Monchengladbach will have a corner.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) is replaced by Jonathan Schmid.
Half-time substitution. Daniel Opare will not participate anymore and Raphael Framberger (Augsburg) is coming on.

What a great touch by Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the right side of the goal, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Ja-Cheol Koo will be replaced by Sergio Cordova (Augsburg).
Dieter Hecking has decided to substitute Patrick Herrmann and he is replaced by Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach).
Raffael will be replaced by Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach).

Goal! Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom left corner. Marwin Hitz had no chance of reaching it. The score is 2:0.
Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Vincenzo Grifo (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Lars Stindl.
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Bruma (RB Leipzig) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Christian Streich is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Alexander Schwolow suffers an injury and Rafal Gikiewicz (Freiburg) comes on.

Peter Gulacsi is a nightmare for the offensive players! Lucas Holer (Freiburg) meets a cross on the edge of the penalty area, takes a good first touch and fires a rocket of a shot towards the left post, but the goalkeeper produces a wonderful save.
What a chance that is! Christian Gunter (Freiburg) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.
Christian Gunter (Freiburg) peels away from his marker to receive a lofted pass, but sends his rocket of a shot just wide of the right post from inside the box.
Benjamin Brand has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.

Alexander Schwolow gets a well deserved ovation! Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) produces a decent first-time strike towards the left post, but the goalkeeper is positioned well to block it. Nice goalkeeping skills. RB Leipzig get a corner.

Marcel Sabitzer looks around to decide who he is going to pass to. He picks out Timo Werner (RB Leipzig), who collects the ball perfectly and unleashes a terrific shot from just outside of the box towards the bottom left corner and it ricochets in off the post. The score is 0:1.
The manager makes a subsitution with Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) coming on for Jean-Kevin Augustin.
Goal! Janik Haberer (Freiburg) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top of the net. It's 1:1.

Goal! Christian Gunter sent in a fine cross from the corner kick. The perfect pass found Robin Koch (Freiburg) and his bullet header from around the penalty spot went straight into the right side of the goal. The score is 2:1.
Here is a change. Janik Haberer is going off and Christian Streich gives the last tactical orders to Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg).
Substitution. Bruma is replaced by Ibrahima Konate (RB Leipzig).
Christian Streich has decided to make a change. Caleb Stanko (Freiburg) replaces Lucas Holer.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Dennis Geiger (Hoffenheim) tries his luck with a shot from the edge of the box, but the ball crashes against the crossbar! It would have been a superb goal.
Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Goal! Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) latches onto the ball inside the box and scores a fantastic back-heel goal. He makes it 0:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Patrick Ittrich blows his whistle to start the second half.
OFF THE POST! Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim) takes a shot from outside the box and hits the right post!
Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Patrick Ittrich ignores the protests.

Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen) received a pass and blasted a beautiful rocket of a shot from just outside the penalty area into the bottom left corner. He was given an ovation. Excellent finish.
The substitution is prepared. Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Lukas Rupp.
Here is a change. Ermin Bicakcic is going off and Julian Nagelsmann gives the last tactical orders to Mark Uth (Hoffenheim).
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim) receives a yellow card!
Here comes a substitution. Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) is brought on as a substitute for Florian Grillitsch.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the right post.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Panagiotis Retsos (Bayer Leverkusen) for Lars Bender.
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) unleashes a shot straight into the bottom right corner. Good team effort!
It will be a substitution. Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) is ready to enter the pitch as Julian Brandt walks off.
Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Wendell.
GOAL! Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Bernd Leno, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 1:3.
Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and coolly sends the ball into the back of the net.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot towards the bottom left corner, but Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off a brilliant save. The ball goes behind for a corner. Mainz will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

Robin Zentner makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the roof of the net by Berkay Ozcan (VfB Stuttgart) after a cross from the side. Stuttgart will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Emiliano Insua (VfB Stuttgart) was quite harsh and Harm Osmers didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Goal! Holger Badstuber (VfB Stuttgart) fires the rebound into the roof of the net after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 0:1.
The Mainz players can't believe it after the referee disallows the goal after the intervention of the video assistant referee.
Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) received a brilliant pass and arrowed the ball into the top right corner. It couldn't have gone in a better place, what a beautiful long-range goal.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Hannes Wolf decided to make a change. Emiliano Insua is replaced by Marcin Kaminski (VfB Stuttgart).
Harm Osmers shows a yellow card to Nigel De Jong (Mainz) for his blatant foul.
Hannes Wolf decides to make a substitution. Mario Gomez will be replaced by Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart).

A sweeping move ends with a pass to Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) inside the box. He lets fly low towards the middle of the goal, but Ron-Robert Zieler was watching it all the way and makes a comfortable save.
Goal! Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) fires the rebound low into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:1.
What was Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.

Gerrit Holtmann (Mainz) scores a very lucky goal with a knuckleball of a shot from outside the penalty area after the ball changes direction in the air and results in the goalkeeper making a complete howler!
The substitution is prepared. Giulio Donati (Mainz) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Gerrit Holtmann.
Hannes Wolf has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Dzenis Burnic (VfB Stuttgart) replacing Anastasios Donis.

Robin Quaison (Mainz) finds some space on the edge of the box after some nice individual play and curls a shot in on goal, but the ball flies just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Stuttgart will have a goal kick.
It is time for a substitution. Stefan Bell (Mainz) is on for Suat Serdar.
Dzenis Burnic (VfB Stuttgart) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Harm Osmers had an easy-decision to make.
Benjamin Pavard (VfB Stuttgart) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
It will be a substitution. Emil Berggreen (Mainz) is ready to enter the pitch as Yoshinori Muto walks off.

Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) receives a clever pass and shoots from mid-range. His shot looks like it's going inside the right post, but Robin Zentner has other ideas and makes a brilliant save. The linesman points to the corner flag, Stuttgart are going to take it.

Christian Gentner produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) rises high to head the ball into the middle of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 3:2.
Robin Zentner (Mainz) gets booked for the first time in this match.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Goal - 0:1! Marius Wolf tees up Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) inside the box and he curls the ball into the top right corner and past Koen Casteels.
Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) slams the ball goalwards from 50 metres out, but his decent effort flies a whisker over the crossbar.
It's in the back of the net! Marius Wolf is the provider as he slips the ball to Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 0:2.
Markus Schmidt shows the yellow card to Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) for a heavy challenge.
Markus Schmidt shows a yellow card to Nany Landry Dimata (Wolfsburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.
Martin Schmidt has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) comes on the pitch for Josip Brekalo.

Yellow card! It's like Marius Wolf (Eintracht Frankfurt) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Markus Schmidt agrees and books him.
Simon Falette (Eintracht Frankfurt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Markus Schmidt didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) struck with a perfectly taken free kick from the edge of the box. He curled the ball straight into the top left corner. A technically perfect strike!
Nany Landry Dimata (Wolfsburg) is sent off after receiving a second yellow card from the referee!
Substitution. Yannick Gerhardt (Wolfsburg) replaces William.
Niko Kovac prepares a substitution. Ante Rebic is replaced by Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Mijat Gacinovic will be replaced by Gelson Fernandes (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Goal! Sebastien Haller gets to the ball and heads it over the defence to Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt), who meets it nicely and fires in into the back of the net. 1:3.
Martin Schmidt decides to make a substitution. Josuha Guilavogui will be replaced by Victor Osimhen (Wolfsburg).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Timothy Chandler leaves the pitch and Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
A yellow card for a tackle by Christian Pulisic (Dortmund). Christian Dingert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin) executes a nice mid-range free kick. His effort only flies inches wide of the left post. Today is obviously not his lucky day.
Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) rises above the defence inside the box to power a fine header, but the goalkeeper is lucky as the ball flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Christian Dingert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Goal - 1:0! Valentino Lazaro laid the ball off to Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin), who unleashed a strong shot from close range into the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

A pass into the box finds Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the right side of the goal, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Thomas Kraft denies him. The ball goes out of play. Dortmund are awarded a corner kick.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Peter Stoger decides to make a substitution. Mario Gotze will be replaced by Alexander Isak (Dortmund).
Goal! A great cross from Jadon Sancho finds Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund), who scores with a simple header into an empty net. 1:1.
Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin) picks up a yellow card.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) is given a yellow card.
Pal Dardai has decided to substitute Ondrej Duda and he is replaced by Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin).
Here's the change. Salomon Kalou leaves the pitch and Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) comes on as a substitute.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Christian Pulisic departs the field of play to be replaced by Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund).
Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
A lofted pass into the box is met by Jadon Sancho (Dortmund), who rifles a shot just wide of the left post.
Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund) does well inside the box to bring down a pass from Lukasz Piszczek. He gets away a decent shot but it creeps just past the right post.

Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball is out of play. Wolfsburg will have a chance to score from a corner.
Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot low towards the middle of the goal was comfortably saved by Roman Burki.
Post! Alexander Isak (Dortmund) latches on to a sweet pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which only hits the right post. What an unlucky moment for him.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Tobias Stieler has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
CHANCE! Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund) fires just over the crossbar from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Mario Gotze.
Jadon Sancho (Dortmund) latches onto a pass inside the box, steps inside his marker and smacks a shot against the left post.
Substitution. Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund) on for Mario Gotze.
A substitution has been made. Daniel Didavi goes off and Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) comes on.
It will be a substitution. Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) is ready to enter the pitch as Alexander Isak walks off.

Roman Burki makes a brilliant save! William (Wolfsburg) easily weaves through the defence and unleashes a shot from just outside of the box. His effort goes towards the top right corner but is saved by the keeper! Wolfsburg get a corner.

Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Tobias Stieler is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.

Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) receives a fine cross inside the box and attempts to score a goal, but his shot flies just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for FC Koln.
Goal! The ball from the resulting free kick arrives at the feet of Frederik Sorensen (1. FC Koln) inside the box, and he fires a low shot into the middle of the net.
Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Zwayer ignores the protests.
Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) gets into a great position in the box after a pass, but sends his shot just wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Dieter Hecking gives a chance to Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) and Vincenzo Grifo is off.
Felix Zwayer shows the yellow card to Lukas Klunter (1. FC Koln) for a heavy challenge.
It is time for a substitution. Christian Clemens (Koln) is on for Simon Zoller.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

That will be all from Christoph Kramer who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach).
Simon Terodde (1. FC Koln) sees a yellow card from Felix Zwayer after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

A pass travels right across the box to Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) and gives him a sight of goal. He tries to beat the keeper low in the middle of the goal, but Timo Horn denies him with a decent save.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) reacts well to latch onto a rebound inside the box, but his shot is well blocked.

One of the defending players blocks an attempt and the ball falls at the feet of Raffael (B. Monchengladbach). He unleashes an incredible rocket of a shot which goes in off the crossbar, leaving the goalkeeper stranded.
Matthias Ginter (B. Monchengladbach) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Zwayer didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
It will be a substitution. Konstantin Rausch (Koln) is ready to enter the pitch as Jonas Hector walks off.
Christian Clemens (Koln) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
Stefan Ruthenbeck has decided to substitute Milos Jojic and he is replaced by Sehrou Guirassy (Koln).
Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) is furious with himself as he misses a golden opportunity from inside the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post.

Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post.

Konstantin Rausch showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Simon Terodde (Koln) meets the cross and gets himself onto the scoresheet with a header inside the right post. It's 2:1.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) shakes off the attention of a defender and from mid-range lets fly towards the right side of the goal, but Peter Gulacsi is well positioned to make a comfortable save.
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) is given a yellow card.
Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke) brings his opponent down. Deniz Aytekin has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle for a foul. RB Leipzig have been awarded a penalty kick!
Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) wastes a huge opportunity to score from the penalty spot. He attempts to slot into the right side of the target, but Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a superb save.
GOAL 1:0! Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) brilliantly slaloms his way forward past a few defenders and unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which is deflected and goes into the back of the net.

The game restarts for the second half.
OFF THE POST! Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) fires the ball from the free kick, but it only rattles the left post.

Franco Di Santo goes off the pitch and Breel Embolo (Schalke) comes on.
Domenico Tedesco prepares a substitution. Alessandro Schopf is replaced by Marko Pjaca (Schalke).

The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) comes onto the pitch so that Jean-Kevin Augustin can be given a rest.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) replacing Naby Keita.
It's in the back of the net! Konrad Laimer plays it into the box, and Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 2:1.
Goal! Bruma (RB Leipzig) collects a pass and without hesitation fires an unstoppable shot into the middle of the net.

Bruma (RB Leipzig) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the bottom right corner is blocked by Ralf Fahrmann, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.

Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the roof of the net that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance. It will be a corner kick for RB Leipzig.
Amine Harit comes off the pitch to be replaced by Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke).
Here is a change. Bruma is going off and Ralph Hasenhuttl gives the last tactical orders to Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig).
Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) is cautioned by the referee.
That's it for today, Deniz Aytekin has blown his whistle and the game is over.

Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and shoots towards goal, but it goes well wide of the right post.
Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.

Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) picks up a pass and tries his luck from mid-range towards the roof of the net, but Julian Pollersbeck is equal to it and makes an easy save. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Augsburg.
Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) leaps to meet an excellent cross and steers a fantastic header past the goalkeeper, inside the left post.
The end of the first half.

Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Douglas Santos (Hamburger), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

Here's the change. Daniel Baier leaves the pitch and Gojko Kacar (Augsburg) comes on as a substitute.

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot towards the left side of the goal, but Alexander Schwolow pulls off a brilliant save.

Alexander Schwolow gets a well deserved ovation! Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt) produces a decent first-time strike towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper is positioned well to block it. The ball goes out of play. Eintracht Frankfurt are awarded a corner kick.
Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) latches onto the free kick from Marius Wolf, but heads just over the bar from close range.

Christian Streich has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Mohamed Drager (Freiburg) replacing Bartosz Kapustka.
