Niko Kovac is forced to make a change. Marco Russ is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Danny da Costa (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Kevin-Prince Boateng clips a neat ball into the box towards Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt), whose header from the centre of the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Karim Guede (Freiburg) is coming onto the pitch as Lucas Holer cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Niko Kovac decides to make a substitution. Mijat Gacinovic will be replaced by Aymen Barkok (Eintracht Frankfurt).
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) for his blatant foul.
Waldemar Anton (Hannover) is in the right place at the right time to meet a rebound and attempts a header towards the left side of the goal. Robin Zentner is alert and denies him with a quick save.
Goal! Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) pounced on a loose ball inside the penalty area and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 0:1.

It's in the back of the net! Alexandru Maxim flights the free kick into the box, where Alexander Hack (Mainz) peels off his marker and heads straight inside the upright from the edge of the six-yard box. He makes it 0:2.
GOAL! The corner is whipped in and Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) is in the right place at the right time, planting his header straight into the top left corner. He makes it 1:2.

Nigel De Jong (Mainz) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Bastian Dankert blows his whistle for an infringement. Hannover are awarded a penalty! The opposing players are protesting, but the referee had an easy-decision to make.
Goal! Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Robin Zentner into the bottom left corner.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Bastian Dankert has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Iver Fossum (Hannover) comes on the pitch for Julian Korb.
Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) spurned a good chance! He gets a shot away from inside the penalty box, but it goes inches wide of the left post.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Pirmin Schwegler leaves the pitch to be replaced by Kenan Karaman (Hannover).
Sandro Schwarz has decided to make a change. Giulio Donati (Mainz) replaces Alexandru Maxim.
Alexander Hack (Mainz) violates the laws of the game and is shown a yellow card by the referee, but it could have been a straight red as well.
Alexander Hack (Mainz) times his run into the box beautifully and plants a good looking header at goal from the corner, but the ball flashes just wide of the right post.
Goal! Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the left side of the goal. It's 3:2.
A defender mistimes his tackle on the edge on the box and let's in Kenan Karaman (Hannover). It's a decent effort but his shot flies just wide of the right post.
The substitution has been made. Emil Berggreen (Mainz) has replaced Nigel De Jong.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to substitute Yoshinori Muto and he is replaced by Anthony Ujah (Mainz).
Robin Quaison (Mainz) decided to surprise the goalkeeper with a quick shot from the edge of the box, but his effort came back off the left post!
The referee signals a substitution. Florian Hubner (Hannover) is brought on as a substitute for Ihlas Bebou.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
What an opportunity! Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin) disappointed the fans as he smashed a first-time shot from inside the box against the right post!

Dennis Aogo (VfB Stuttgart) drives into the box and hits a tremendous shot that, unluckily for him, flashes just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Hertha Berlin will have a goal kick.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
What a wasted chance that was! A precise cross into the box finds Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin), whose header goes wide of the goal. The ball goes out of play and Stuttgart will have a goal kick.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Anastasios Donis leaves the pitch and Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Chadrac Akolo will be replaced by Emiliano Insua (VfB Stuttgart).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) is coming onto the pitch as Davie Selke cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Here is an example of luck not being on your side. A slightly disorientated Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) puts the ball into his own net.
Hannes Wolf has decided to substitute Berkay Ozcan and he is replaced by Holger Badstuber (VfB Stuttgart).
Substitution. Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Valentino Lazaro walks off.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) was quite harsh and Felix Brych didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Robert Hartmann shows the yellow card to Dennis Geiger (Hoffenheim) for a heavy challenge.
It's a goal! Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) bravely launches himself at a cross from Serge Gnabry and gives Jiri Pavlenka no chance with a close-range bullet header into the roof of the net. 0:1.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Robert Hartmann starts the second half.
Today's referee Robert Hartmann rightly decides to book Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) for his harsh tackle.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jerome Gondorf (Werder Bremen) will replace Ishak Belfodil.
Julian Nagelsmann decides to make a substitution. Mark Uth will be replaced by Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim).
Dennis Geiger will be replaced by Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim).

Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) finds his way to a cross from the corner kick and heads it in via a deflection off the bar. There was absolutely nothing Oliver Baumann could do with it. The score changes to 1:1.
The ball is crossed into the box and Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) reacts quickest to send a shot flying towards the middle of the goal, but Jiri Pavlenka gets a glove on it to thwart him.

Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) replaces Serge Gnabry.
Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the box but his shot is blocked.
The substitution has been made. Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) has replaced Florian Kainz.
Yellow card! It's like Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Robert Hartmann agrees and books him.
Kevin Vogt (Hoffenheim) infringed the rules and goes into the book. Robert Hartmann pulls out a yellow card.
Substitution. Robert Bauer (Werder Bremen) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Zlatko Junuzovic walks off.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) receives a neat pass inside the box and instantly thumps the ball goalward, but a defender makes a last ditch block to deny him.
Daniel Siebert shows the yellow card to Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) for a heavy challenge.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) for a tough tackle.
Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) watches the corner all the way, but places his header a whisker wide of the left post from close range.
James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) creates a yard of space for himself and tries an effort from the edge of the box, but it goes just wide of the left post.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) gets to the ball swung in from the corner and plants a close-range header low towards goal, but it's blocked then cleared away.
Goal! Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) fires the rebound inside the left post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 0:1.

Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his effort goes narrowly wide of the left post. This should be a big warning for the defence.
Rafinha (Bayern Munich) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
The end of the first half.
Daniel Siebert blows his whistle and the second half starts.
It should have been a goal! Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) fires a rocket of a shot but it only hits the crossbar!
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) gets there first and whips in a shot at goal that flies just wide of the right post.
It's 0:2! James Rodriguez feeds Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the left side of the net.
Here is a change. Karim Bellarabi is going off and Heiko Herrlich gives the last tactical orders to Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen).
Substitution. Dominik Kohr leaves the pitch and is replaced by Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen).
Jupp Heynckes prepares a substitution. Arjen Robben is replaced by Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich).

GOAL 1:2! Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) brilliantly slaloms his way forward past a few defenders and unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which is deflected and goes into the back of the net.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Julian Brandt trots off the pitch and is replaced by Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen).
Jupp Heynckes decides to make a substitution. Franck Ribery will be replaced by Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich).

Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) deprives his opponent of the ball, but the referee blows his whistle for a foul. He's not happy with the decision! Bayern Munich earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.
James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) takes a wonderful free kick and curls the ball into the top left corner with an absolutely phenomenal strike!
Today's match ends for Thomas Muller who will be replaced by Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich).
Daniel Siebert is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
Bruma (RB Leipzig) tricks his way to edge of the area and unleashes a howitzer of a shot towards the inside the left post, but Rune Jarstein earns his money with a fine reflex save.
Goal! Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) shows perfect technique and produces a first-time effort from just outside the box that goes into the top right corner. It's 0:1.
That was really pointless! Jordan Torunarigha (Hertha Berlin) made a mindless challenge and the referee Frank Willenborg showed him a red card.
Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig) fires the ball in from a mid-range free kick, but the effort goes just wide of the right post.

Goal! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) peels away from his marker to meet the resulting free kick from Valentino Lazaro, and he steers a powerful header from the centre of the box into the top right corner. What a finish that is - 0:2!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Diego Demme (RB Leipzig) replaces Ibrahima Konate.
Diego Demme (RB Leipzig) picks up a rebound and fires in from mid-range, but the ball crashes against the right post!
The whistle blows and Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) is booked for an infringement.
A mistake by the defender lets in Timo Werner (RB Leipzig), but his first-time shot flies just over the bar.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
The game is over for Yussuf Poulsen. Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) comes on for the second half.
Half-time substitution. Pal Dardai decided to make a change. Peter Pekarik is replaced by Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin).

Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) meets a delivery on the edge of the penalty area and shoots towards to the bottom left corner. He didn't put enough power into the effort, though, and Peter Gulacsi pulls off an easy save.

Arne Maier (Hertha Berlin) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the bottom left corner that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance. Hertha Berlin force their opponents to concede a corner.

Valentino Lazaro produces a cross from the resulting corner and finds Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) inside the box. He pulls the trigger and scores, sending the ball into the bottom left corner. What a brilliant finish. 0:3.
Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) gets on the end of a cross inside the box and sweeps the ball goalwards towards the middle of the goal, but Rune Jarstein is well positioned and easily deals with the effort.
Here comes a substitution. Lukas Klostermann is given a rest as he is replaced by Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig).

Bruma sends a superb cross into the box. Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header inside the right post, leaving Rune Jarstein beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:3.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Davie Selke leaves the pitch and Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) comes on.
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) replaces Salomon Kalou.
Frank Willenborg shows the yellow card to Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) for a heavy challenge.

Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Rune Jarstein makes a decent save to deny his effort directed to the left side of the target.
The foul by Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Frank Willenborg.
Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Frank Willenborg didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig) scores from quite a difficult position as he leaps high to connect with a cross and powers his header inside the right post. Excellent finish.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

That didn't go as planned. Felix Klaus (Hannover) tried his luck from the edge of the box, but his effort towards the left side of the goal was too weak to get past Bernd Leno, who easily kept it out.
Goal! Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) shows perfect technique and produces a first-time effort from just outside the box that goes into the bottom right corner. It's 0:1.
Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) gets on the end of a fine cross and heads the ball into the top left corner!

Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Soren Storks blows his whistle for an infringement. PENALTY to Hannover! Great chance to score.
Goal! Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Bernd Leno into the bottom right corner.
Goal - 2:2! Karim Bellarabi laid the ball off to Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen), who shot from close range into the bottom right corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Goal - 3:2! Felix Klaus (Hannover) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the roof of the net. Niclas Fullkrug provided an assist for the goal.
Soren Storks has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Heiko Herrlich decides to make a substitution. Sven Bender will be replaced by Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) will replace Lars Bender.

It's in the back of the net! Kai Havertz slips the ball through to Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 3:3.
Today's referee Soren Storks rightly decides to book Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) for his harsh tackle.
Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) changes the scoreline after getting on the end of a brilliant pass and firing a precise shot that goes inside the right post!
Substitution. Charlison Benschop (Hannover) replaces Oliver Sorg.
Heiko Herrlich has decided to substitute Julian Brandt and he is replaced by Andre Ramalho (Bayer Leverkusen).
Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) zig-zags his way into the box and drills a low shot towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a superb stop.
Substitution. Noah-Joel Sarenren-Bazee (Hannover) in, Felix Klaus out.
Goal! Julian Korb (Hannover) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 4:4.
Andre Breitenreiter prepares a substitution. Pirmin Schwegler is replaced by Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.
Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund) is first to react to a loose pass inside the box, but slices his shot just wide of the right post.
Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund) makes a good run with the ball into the box, but mishits his shot as it goes high over the bar.
Goal! Pavel Kaderabek finds Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) with a clever pass. He steps inside his man on the edge of the box and whips a tremendous shot into the bottom right corner. Fantasy football! 0:1.
The end of the first half.
Referee Harm Osmers blows his whistle to start the second half.

Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) wastes a huge opportunity! He receives a precise cross inside the penalty area and releases a quick shot that sails towards the bottom right corner. His effort, however, lacks power and the goalkeeper dives to make a stunning save.
Stefan Posch (Hoffenheim) jumps into a tackle and Harm Osmers blows his whistle for a foul. The referee makes a call and blows his whistle for an infringement. Dortmund are awarded a penalty.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) comes onto the pitch for Serge Gnabry.
Goal! Oliver Baumann gets a hand on the penalty from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), but can't stop it from flying into the bottom right corner.
Substitution. Mark Uth makes way for Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
Peter Stoger decides to make a substitution. Andriy Yarmolenko will be replaced by Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund).
Goal! Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) fires the rebound low into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:1.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to make a change. Kevin Akpoguma (Hoffenheim) replaces Stefan Posch.
Here comes a substitution. Neven Subotic is brought on as a substitute for Christian Pulisic (Dortmund).
That's it for today, Harm Osmers has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Goal! Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) fires the rebound low into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
A lofted pass into the box is met by Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg), who rifles a shot just over the bar.
Goal! A great through ball by Tim Kleindienst sets up Christian Gunter (Freiburg) inside the box, and he makes no mistake and bangs the ball low into the middle of the goal. 1:1.
Manuel Baum is forced to make a change. Daniel Opare is unable to continue due to injury, Raphael Framberger (Augsburg) comes on.

A sweeping move ends with a pass to Yoric Ravet (Freiburg) inside the box. He lets fly towards the middle of the goal, but Marwin Hitz was watching it all the way and makes a comfortable save. Freiburg force a corner. They send men into the box.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Daniel Baier (Augsburg) for his blatant foul.
Christian Dingert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the bottom right corner. The score is 1:2.
Yellow card. Janik Haberer (Freiburg) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.

Nils Petersen (Freiburg) meets a perfect cross from Tim Kleindienst deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces a low shot into the middle of the goal. The score has changed to 1:3.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Christian Dingert had an easy-decision to make.
Manuel Baum has decided to make a change. Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) replaces Marcel Heller.
Substitution. Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg) on for Rani Khedira.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Tim Kleindienst will be replaced by Florian Kath (Freiburg).
Caglar Soyuncu (Freiburg) has tested the patience of referee Christian Dingert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Christian Streich prepares a substitution. Marco Terrazzino is replaced by Caleb Stanko (Freiburg).

A perfect lofted pass from Philipp Max finds Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header straight into the bottom right corner. His effort was both strong and precise, and Alexander Schwolow had no chance of stopping that. 2:3.

It's a goal! Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) makes it 3:3. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Michael Gregoritsch and planted his close-range header into the middle of the goal. Alexander Schwolow was helpless.
Yoric Ravet comes off the pitch to be replaced by Bartosz Kapustka (Freiburg).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Goal! Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 1:0. He was ably assisted there by Mijat Gacinovic.
Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Kampka ignores the protests.
Kevin-Prince Boateng (Eintracht Frankfurt) beats his marker in the air and aims a header at goal from the free kick, but the close-range effort flashes just over the bar.
Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) looks up on the edge of the box and rifles in a screamer of a shot that flies just over the bar.
Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Robert Kampka shows a yellow card to Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his blatant foul.
A pass travels right across the box to Amine Harit (Schalke) and gives him a sight of goal. He tries to beat the keeper in the middle of the goal, but Lukas Hradecky denies him with a decent save.
Substitution. Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) has come on for Jetro Willems.

Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the top left corner. Lukas Hradecky is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) will replace Ante Rebic.
Domenico Tedesco prepares a substitution. Amine Harit is replaced by Franco Di Santo (Schalke).
Robert Kampka shows a yellow card to Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) for a tough tackle.
Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the bottom left corner, but Ralf Fahrmann pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Goal! A rebound wrong foots everyone except Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt), and he slams the ball into the open net from close range. 2:0.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Breel Embolo (Schalke) comes onto the pitch so that Evgen Konoplyanka can be given a rest.
Franco Di Santo (Schalke) has too much to say to the referee and receives a yellow card.
Matija Nastasic (Schalke) fires the ball in from a mid-range free kick, but the effort goes just wide of the right post.
CHANCE! Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) fires just wide of the left post from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Marius Wolf.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alessandro Schopf trots off the pitch and is replaced by Weston McKennie (Schalke).
It's in the back of the net! Guido Burgstaller is the provider as he slips the ball to Breel Embolo (Schalke) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 2:1.
Niko Kovac decides to make a substitution. Luka Jovic will be replaced by Aymen Barkok (Eintracht Frankfurt).
A yellow card for a tackle by Simon Falette (Eintracht Frankfurt). Robert Kampka doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Goal! Naldo (Schalke) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the bottom right corner. Lukas Hradecky is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 2:2.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Benjamin Brand blows his whistle to start the second half.
OFF THE WOODWORK! Milos Jojic (Koln) picks up the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot that smashes against the crossbar!
Benjamin Brand shows the yellow card to Frederik Sorensen (1. FC Koln) for a heavy challenge.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Matthias Lehmann trots off the pitch and is replaced by Marco Hoger (Koln).
Martin Schmidt prepares a substitution. William is replaced by Marcel Tisserand (Wolfsburg).
Substitution. Birk Risa walks off the pitch and Christian Clemens (Koln) comes on as a substitute.
Benjamin Brand shows a yellow card to Marco Hoger (Koln) for his blatant foul.

It's a goal! Christian Clemens (Koln) shows off his superb ability as he volleys the ball from inside the box into the right side of the target. The assist goes to Milos Jojic and the score changes to 1:0.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) was quite harsh and Benjamin Brand didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Here comes a substitution. Chris Fuhrich is given a rest as he is replaced by Tim Handwerker (Koln).
Lukas Klunter (Koln) squanders a golden opportunity after striking the ball onto the post of the goal!
Jeffrey Bruma (Wolfsburg) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots low to the middle of the goal, but Timo Horn pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
The substitution has been made. Victor Osimhen (Wolfsburg) has replaced Yannick Gerhardt.
Martin Schmidt has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Nany Landry Dimata (Wolfsburg) replacing Paul Verhaegh.
Benjamin Brand is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Chance! Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) gets to the rebound on the edge of the box and smashes the ball towards the bottom right corner, but Sven Ulreich is alert and makes a great save to deny him. The referee blows his whistle, Stuttgart are awarded a corner kick.
Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.

Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich) receives a clever pass and shoots from mid-range. His shot looks like it's going in the bottom right corner, but Ron-Robert Zieler has other ideas and makes a brilliant save.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Patrick Ittrich has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Rafinha (Bayern Munich) picks up a yellow card.
A substitution has been made. Simon Terodde goes off and Marcin Kaminski (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
The yellow card goes to Dennis Aogo (VfB Stuttgart).
James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) perfectly wins the ball from the free kick, but his effort from the edge of the penalty area isn't accurate enough and the ball goes a few inches over the bar!

That was a nice football moment. Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the bottom right corner. Ron-Robert Zieler guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save! The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Bayern Munich.
Today's match ends for Corentin Tolisso who will be replaced by Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich).

Ron-Robert Zieler makes a good save! Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) easily weaves through the defence and fires in from long range. His shot goes towards the roof of the net but is saved by the keeper! Bayern Munich get a corner.
Substitution. Niklas Sule (Bayern Munich) replaces Mats Hummels.
Booking. Andreas Beck (VfB Stuttgart) receives a caution from the referee.
Goal! Kingsley Coman tees up Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the bottom left corner. 0:1.
The manager makes a subsitution with Takuma Asano (VfB Stuttgart) coming on for Dennis Aogo.
Hannes Wolf has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Josip Brekalo (VfB Stuttgart) replacing Andreas Beck.
That will be all from Kingsley Coman who is being replaced by the fresh legs of David Alaba (Bayern Munich).

Holger Badstuber (VfB Stuttgart) failed to beat Sven Ulreich, who expertly stopped his header from the centre of the box towards the roof of the net after a rebound. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Stuttgart will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

A substitution has been made. Ja-Cheol Koo is replaced by Rani Khedira (Augsburg).
Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Yellow card. Karim Rekik (Hertha Berlin) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
Substitution. Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) on for Alfred Finnbogason.
GOAL! Niklas Stark meets a cross inside the box and heads the ball across the goal, where Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) lurks and pokes it into the back of the net. 1:1.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
Caution goes to Dennis Geiger (Hoffenheim).
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
The end of the first half.
Referee Markus Schmidt blows his whistle to start the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Julian Nagelsmann gives a chance to Kevin Akpoguma (Hoffenheim) and Dennis Geiger is off.
Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) is punished with the yellow card.
The whistle blows and Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) is booked for an infringement.
Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) has a great chance inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.
Lukas Rupp comes off the pitch to be replaced by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
Andre Breitenreiter prepares a substitution. Ihlas Bebou is replaced by Oliver Sorg (Hannover).
Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Pirmin Schwegler (Hannover).
Kevin Vogt (Hoffenheim) picks up a yellow card.
Substitution. Steven Zuber is replaced by Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim).
Andre Breitenreiter decides to make a substitution. Niclas Fullkrug will be replaced by Martin Harnik (Hannover).
That's the end of the game for Charlison Benschop, who is replaced by Kenan Karaman (Hannover).
Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) picks up a caution.
Martin Harnik (Hannover) climbs high to thump home a brilliant header from the free kick. The ball bounced off the bottom of left post and into the net, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
The match has just finished.
There is a heavy snowfall and I am afraid that the match will be delayed.
The first half has started.
After receiving a beautiful pass, Lukas Klunter (1. FC Koln) had a huge opportunity. He coolly unleashed a perfect low shot, which went in off the right post.
Julian Schuster (Freiburg) pulls the jersey of one of the opposition players and Robert Kampka blows his whistle for a foul. The referee points to the penalty spot. PENALTY to FC Koln!
Goal! Sehrou Guirassy (Koln) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Alexander Schwolow into the bottom left corner.
Christian Streich is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Philipp Lienhart suffers an injury and Caleb Stanko (Freiburg) comes on.
Here's the change. Julian Schuster leaves the pitch and Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg) comes on as a substitute.
Lukas Klunter (Koln) is penalised.
Salih Ozcan (Koln) picked up a yellow card from referee.
This is definitely not what Caleb Stanko (Freiburg) wanted. Attempting to intercept an offensive pass, he scored an own goal and made it 3:0.
What a hit! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the top of the net. 3:1.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
It's a goal! The author of the penalty kick is Nils Petersen (Freiburg).
It's like he was asking for a caution. Janik Haberer (Freiburg) receives a yellow card.
Substitution. Marco Terrazzino makes his way off the pitch and Florian Kath (Freiburg) comes on as his replacement.
Janik Haberer (Freiburg) is the first to get to the rebound and quickly sends it back towards goal. One of the opponents gets in way of his effort and deflects the ball onto the post.

Goal! Yoric Ravet sent in a fine cross from the corner kick. The perfect pass found the head of Janik Haberer (Freiburg) and his precise header from around the penalty spot ended up in the bottom right corner. The score is 3:2.
Stefan Ruthenbeck has decided to make a change. Yann Aurel Bisseck (1. FC Koln) replaces Milos Jojic.
A substitution has been made. Konstantin Rausch is replaced by Birk Risa (Koln).
Substitution. Lukas Klunter did his best and is replaced by Christian Clemens (Koln).
Robert Kampka shows a yellow card to Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) for his blatant foul.
Salih Ozcan (Koln) makes a slide tackle, but referee Robert Kampka blows for a foul. Freiburg are given a penalty!
Goal! Timo Horn gets a hand on the penalty from Nils Petersen (Freiburg), but can't stop it from flying into the bottom right corner.
Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg) has tested the patience of referee Robert Kampka and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

The referee gives a penalty to Freiburg after a quick talk with the linesman, who had apparently seen the situation from a better perspective. Sehrou Guirassy (Koln) touches the ball with his hand inside the box!
Sehrou Guirassy (Koln) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.
Goal! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) puts the ball into the bottom left corner past the outstretched arm of Timo Horn.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.

Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) misses a big chance from point-blank range as he struck the ball low towards the middle of the goal. His promising effort following the corner kick was, to his disappointment, thwarted by Ralf Fahrmann with a fabulous save.
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach) for his blatant foul.
GOAL! Matthias Ginter meets a cross inside the box and heads the ball across the goal, where Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) lurks and pokes it into the back of the net. 1:0.

OFF THE CROSSBAR! Vincenzo Grifo (B. Monchengladbach) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
The referee shows the yellow card to Amine Harit (Schalke).
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Sascha Stegemann has ended it.
The second half gets underway.

Great solo effort by Amine Harit (Schalke) as he tricks his way through two defenders before firing a drive from just outside of the box towards the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper is ready and produces a stunning save.
Here is a change. Breel Embolo is going off and Domenico Tedesco gives the last tactical orders to Guido Burgstaller (Schalke).
An unfortunate own goal is conceded by Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach), who attempted to block the ball after a cross, but instead he sends it into the bottom right corner of his own goal.
It's time for a substitution. Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke) comes on in place of Thilo Kehrer.
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) volleys the ball on the edge of the box after a rebound. It's a great effort and has Yann Sommer scrambling, but it flies just wide of the right post.
A substitution has been made. Vincenzo Grifo is replaced by Raul Bobadilla (B. Monchengladbach).
Dieter Hecking prepares a substitution. Christoph Kramer is replaced by Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Matija Nastasic (Schalke) was quite harsh and Sascha Stegemann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Substitution. Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) in, Amine Harit out.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) unleashed a long-range shot, but it misses narrowly over the bar. It could have been the goal of the month, at least.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) struck the ball which rebounded to the edge of the box. His attempt went narrowly over the crossbar.

A good lofted pass from Max Kruse finds Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) on the edge of the area. He collects the ball and rips in a wonderful shot which ends up inside the left post. The score is now 0:1.
Fin Bartels is substituted due to injury. Florian Kohfeldt gives a chance to Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen).
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Peter Bosz prepares a substitution. Andriy Yarmolenko is replaced by Andre Schurrle (Dortmund).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Nuri Sahin (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch so that Raphael Guerreiro can be given a rest.

Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) finds himself in space on the edge of the box and smashes a glorious looking effort towards the roof of the net, but Jiri Pavlenka thwarts him with a great two-handed save. Dortmund will take a corner kick.
Florian Kohfeldt is forced to make a change. Zlatko Junuzovic is unable to continue due to injury, Jerome Gondorf (Werder Bremen) comes on.
It's a goal! Shinji Kagawa sends a long raking pass onto the head of Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), who makes no mistake from close in and sends the ball into the right side of the goal. 1:1.
Golden chance! Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.

Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) steadies himself and bends in a shot from the edge of the box towards the bottom right corner, but Roman Burki has it covered and makes a comfortable save. The linesman makes the right call and Werder Bremen will have a corner.

Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) outjumps the defence inside the six-yard box to meet the corner kick and scores with a great header aimed low into the middle of the goal. The keeper had no chance to react. The score is 1:2.

A huge opportunity is squandered by Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund)! The ball arrived at his feet inside the six-yard box after a cross from the side. He could have easily shot into an open net, but instead struck it without thinking and hit one of his teammates standing in front of him.
Mahmoud Dahoud comes off the pitch to be replaced by Alexander Isak (Dortmund).
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Robert Bauer (Werder Bremen) replacing Florian Kainz.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) sees a yellow card from Harm Osmers after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground. Eintracht Frankfurt win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.

Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) has the opportunity to threaten the opponent's goal via a free kick on the edge of the box. He hits a fine strike towards the left side of the goal, but Tom Starke denies him with a great save.
Harm Osmers shows a yellow card to Gelson Fernandes (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a tough tackle.
Goal! Joshua Kimmich swings the ball deep into the box and finds Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) unmarked, and his close-range header flies past the keeper into the middle of the goal. 0:1.
A brilliant individual effort! Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) tricks his way past challenges into the box and drags his shot narrowly wide of the right post.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Harm Osmers blows his whistle to start the second half.
Rafinha (Bayern Munich) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Harm Osmers didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
That's the end of the game for Arturo Vidal, who is replaced by Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich).
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) infringed the rules and goes into the book. Harm Osmers pulls out a yellow card.
Here comes a substitution. Franck Ribery is given a rest as he is replaced by David Alaba (Bayern Munich).
Here is a change. Gelson Fernandes is going off and Niko Kovac gives the last tactical orders to Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Harm Osmers shows a yellow card to Marius Wolf (Eintracht Frankfurt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The referee signals a substitution. Taleb Tawatha (Eintracht Frankfurt) is brought on as a substitute for Jetro Willems.
Niko Kovac has decided to substitute Aymen Barkok and he is replaced by Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Kingsley Coman makes way for Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich).
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Jann-Fiete Arp (Hamburger) easily beats an opponent inside the box and goes for goal, but his effort flies just wide of the left post.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half gets underway.
Here is a change. Divock Origi is going off and Martin Schmidt gives the last tactical orders to Paul Ntep de Madiba (Wolfsburg).
Paul Ntep de Madiba (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow card from Christian Dingert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Substitution. Tatsuya Ito makes his way off the pitch and Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger) comes on as his replacement.
The foul by Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Christian Dingert.

Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Koen Casteels makes a great save to stop the effort going into the left side of the goal. Hamburger SV force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Today's referee Christian Dingert rightly decides to book Filip Kostic (Hamburger) for his harsh tackle.
William (Wolfsburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Christian Dingert ignores the protests.
It will be a substitution. Yannick Gerhardt (Wolfsburg) is ready to enter the pitch as Yunus Malli walks off.
Markus Gisdol prepares a substitution. Walace is replaced by Albin Ekdal (Hamburger).
A substitution has been made. Jann-Fiete Arp is replaced by Andre Hahn (Hamburger).
It's time for a substitution. Victor Osimhen (Wolfsburg) comes on in place of Daniel Didavi.
Christian Dingert is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) volleys the ball on the edge of the box after a rebound. It's a great effort and has Robin Zentner scrambling, but it flies just wide of the left post.
Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Patrick Ittrich had an easy-decision to make.
Fantastic team goal! Kevin Kampl (RB Leipzig) was set free in the area by Diego Demme and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the top left corner. 1:0.
Patrick Ittrich shows a yellow card to Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) for his blatant foul. Mainz will take a free kick.
Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) sends a direct shot in from the free kick that's in a promising position. The ball sails to the top right corner, but the goalkeeper makes a quick save to deny him.
Goal! Robin Quaison (Mainz) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:1.
Patrick Ittrich shows a yellow card to Abdou Diallo (Mainz) for a tough tackle.
Leon Balogun (Mainz) manages to dispossess his opponent of the ball, but he commits a foul in the process and the referee blows his whistle. Mainz are given a penalty!
Goal! Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) runs up to the ball, stops and waits for Robin Zentner to commit before slotting the penalty low into the middle of the goal.
Patrick Ittrich has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Konrad Laimer will not participate anymore and Bruma (RB Leipzig) is coming on.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Marvin Compper (RB Leipzig) comes on the pitch for Stefan Ilsanker.
The manager makes a subsitution with  coming on for Gerrit Holtmann (Mainz).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by  was quite harsh and Patrick Ittrich didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Suat Serdar (Mainz) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
Fabian Frei will be replaced by Alexandru Maxim (Mainz).
Sandro Schwarz prepares a substitution. Robin Quaison is replaced by Jairo Samperio (Mainz).
Substitution. Dominik Kaiser is replaced by Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig).
outjumps the defence inside the six-yard box to meet the corner kick and scores with a great header into the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper had no chance to react. The score is now 2:2.
Danny Latza (Mainz) unleashes a superb first-time shot from the edge of the box, but it flies narrowly wide of the left post.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. Bayer Leverkusen will take a corner kick.
Goal - 0:1! Leon Bailey tees up Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom right corner and past Ron-Robert Zieler.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Heiko Herrlich gives a chance to Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen) and Panagiotis Retsos is off.

A sweet pass finds Emiliano Insua (VfB Stuttgart) on the edge of the box, and he drills the ball towards the top left corner. Bernd Leno is almost caught out but pulls off a brilliant save at the last second. The ball goes out for a corner. Stuttgart can continue in their attacking effort.

Berkay Ozcan (VfB Stuttgart) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the left post is blocked by Bernd Leno, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. The ball is out of play. Stuttgart win a corner kick.
The manager makes a subsitution with Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen) coming on for Admir Mehmedi.

Bernd Leno receives ovations from the crowd. He manages to block a first-time effort from Emiliano Insua (VfB Stuttgart), whose strike from the edge of the box was headed towards the left side of the goal. Stuttgart earn a corner.
Jonathan Tah swings the cross over. Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) gets his head to it but it goes just wide of the left post.
Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen) pounced on a rebound on the edge of the box and his shot goes a whisker over the crossbar.
It's time for a substitution. Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) comes on in place of Marcin Kaminski.
Tempers flare after Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) commits a foul. He receives a yellow card for his bad challenge and surely must be relieved at not receiving a red card.
Heiko Herrlich prepares a substitution. Julian Brandt is replaced by Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen).
A loose pass is instantly latched onto by Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen). He tries his luck from the edge of the box with a measured shot, but it hits the right post and is cleared to safety.
Substitution. Christian Gentner makes way for Orel Mangala (VfB Stuttgart).
The foul by Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Deniz Aytekin.

Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) outjumps the defence inside the six-yard box to meet the corner and scores with a great header into the right side of the goal. The keeper had no chance to react. The score is now 0:2.

He should have scored! Berkay Ozcan (VfB Stuttgart) latches onto a pull back in the box right in front of goal, but his shot aimed inside the left post is pretty weak and Bernd Leno makes an easy save.
Chance! Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Karim Bellarabi, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the left post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Berkay Ozcan leaves the pitch and Takuma Asano (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Mario Gomez, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low accurate shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 1:0.
A rebound falls to Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) in space inside the box. He looks up and fires in a powerful shot at goal that flies just wide of the right post.
Vincenzo Grifo (B. Monchengladbach) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the top left corner only for Koen Casteels to dive and make a save.
GOAL! Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Yann Sommer, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 2:0.
Problems for Dieter Hecking as Tony Jantschke is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach) replaces him.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
The end of the first half.
Referee Benjamin Cortus blows his whistle to start the second half.

Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) dribbled past his opponents before finding himself in a great position to strike. His attempt from just outside of the box went towards the bottom right corner, but it wasn't dangerous and Yann Sommer made a comfortable save. The referee points to the corner flag and Wolfsburg will take a corner.
Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
William (Wolfsburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Gian-Luca Itter.
What an absolute cracking goal! Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) hits a perfect volley from far out and the ball flies inside the left post. Take a bow.
Substitution. Daniel Didavi leaves the pitch and is replaced by Paul Ntep de Madiba (Wolfsburg).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) is coming onto the pitch as Thorgan Hazard cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Dieter Hecking decides to make a substitution. Raffael will be replaced by Raul Bobadilla (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.

The opposition back off Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin), who needs no second invitation to shoot from inside the box. It's a decent effort towards the bottom right corner, but Lukas Hradecky denies him with the save. Hertha Berlin win a corner.
Yellow card. Kevin-Prince Boateng (Eintracht Frankfurt) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Fantastic team goal! Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) was set free in the area by Mathew Leckie and he made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) leaps high to meet a lofted pass inside the six-yard box, but his header flies yards wide of the right post.

Rune Jarstein pulls off a great save to deny Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Eintracht Frankfurt.

The ball hits the back of the net! Jetro Willems delivers the corner, Marius Wolf (Eintracht Frankfurt) finds himself some space on the edge of the box and unleashes an unstoppable shot which goes into the top of the net and past the helpless goalkeeper. 1:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Here comes a substitution. Aymen Barkok (Eintracht Frankfurt) is brought on as a substitute for Mijat Gacinovic.
Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) picked up a yellow card for saying too much to the referee.
Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Here is a change. Maximilian Mittelstadt is going off and Pal Dardai gives the last tactical orders to Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin).
The referee signals a substitution. Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) is brought on as a substitute for Arne Maier.
Goal! Kevin-Prince Boateng (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot into the top left corner. 1:2.
Substitution. Vedad Ibisevic did his best and is replaced by Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin).
A loose pass is instantly latched onto by Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin). He tries his luck from the edge of the box with a measured shot, but it hits the crossbar and is cleared to safety.
Niko Kovac decides to make a substitution. Ante Rebic will be replaced by Taleb Tawatha (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Sebastien Haller leaves the pitch and is replaced by Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.
A long pass into the box is latched onto by Guido Burgstaller (Schalke), who looks up and slams a terrific shot past the keeper but onto the crossbar. He did everything right but score!

Yuya Osako (Koln) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Ralf Fahrmann to get hold of the ball.
Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Tobias Stieler didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Goal Guido Burgstaller (Schalke)! Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) was put through by Daniel Caligiuri and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. 1:0.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Peter Stoger gives a chance to Yann Aurel Bisseck (1. FC Koln) and Jorge Mere is off.
Sehrou Guirassy (1. FC Koln) scores! He controls the ball from the free kick inside the 6-yard box and drills a superb strike into the middle of the goal.
Here's the change. Weston McKennie leaves the pitch and Leon Goretzka (Schalke) comes on as a substitute.
The substitution is prepared. Breel Embolo (Schalke) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Evgen Konoplyanka.
Peter Stoger has decided to substitute Milos Jojic and he is replaced by Christian Clemens (Koln).
Goal! Guido Burgstaller provides Amine Harit (Schalke) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom left corner. 2:1.
Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke) touches the ball with his hand. PENALTY to FC Koln! Let's see who will take responsibility.
Goal! Sehrou Guirassy (Koln) puts the ball into the bottom right corner past the outstretched arm of Ralf Fahrmann.
Substitution. Tim Handwerker (Koln) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Sehrou Guirassy walks off.
Domenico Tedesco decides to make a substitution. Matija Nastasic will be replaced by Alessandro Schopf (Schalke).
Naldo (Schalke) reacts well and displays good awareness inside the box to get on the end of the corner kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the left post.
An infringement by Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) results in a yellow card and as it's the second time today, he also sees a red and is dismissed by Tobias Stieler.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
Peter Bosz is forced to make a change. Maximilian Philipp is unable to continue due to injury, Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) comes on.

Sven Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) outjumped the defenders to meet the ball from the free kick and plants a precise header from deep inside the box towards the net! The goalkeeper shows his reflexes and superbly keeps the ball out! The linesman points to the corner flag, Bayer Leverkusen are going to take it.
What a chance that is! Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) leaps high to meet a lofted pass inside the six-yard box, but his header crashes off the crossbar!
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) runs on to a clever pass from Kai Havertz and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He still has work to do but finishes with aplomb into the back of the net.

Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Roman Burki guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Nuri Sahin (Dortmund) was quite harsh and Robert Hartmann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
We have witnessed a sending-off! Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) is given a red card for his dangerous challenge. Robert Hartmann's decision is final.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Gonzalo Castro leaves the pitch to be replaced by Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund).
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Heiko Herrlich makes a switch. Panagiotis Retsos (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming on in place of Benjamin Henrichs at the start of the second period.
Today's referee Robert Hartmann rightly decides to book Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) for his harsh tackle.
Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) latches onto a pass inside the box, steps inside his marker and smacks a shot against the left post.
It is time for a substitution. Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen) is on for Aranguiz.
Here is a change. Julian Weigl is going off and Peter Bosz gives the last tactical orders to Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund).
Goal! Andre Schurrle manages to prod the ball to Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund) after a melee inside the box, and he needs no second invitation to slot the ball into the bottom right corner. 1:1.
Heiko Herrlich prepares a substitution. Kevin Volland is replaced by Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen).
Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) is cautioned by the referee.
Neven Subotic (Dortmund) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Hartmann ignores the protests.
Robert Hartmann is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
POST! Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) unleashes a thunderous effort from the edge of the box and the ball crashes against the right post. What a strike that was!
Goal Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich)! Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) was put through by Thomas Muller and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the right side of the net. 1:0.

This was a piece of cake for Philipp Tschauner. Rafinha (Bayern Munich) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went low to the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper.
The video assistant referee intervenes and the referee disallows the goal as Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) was in an offside position.
Sven Ulreich (Bayern Munich) fouls an opponent. At least that's what referee Guido Winkmann signals. A penalty is given to Hannover!
A yellow card for a tackle by Sven Ulreich (Bayern Munich). Guido Winkmann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) has a great chance to score from the penalty. He shoots to the bottom left corner, but Sven Ulreich leaps out to thwart his attempt.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) drives into the box and hits a tremendous shot that, unluckily for him, flashes just wide of the left post.
Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Gooal! Felix Klaus takes over corner duties. Charlison Benschop (Hannover) gets his head on the ball from the corner and puts it into the bottom right corner. 1:1.
Julian Korb (Hannover) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Guido Winkmann blows his whistle to start the second half.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Manuel Schmiedebach walks off the pitch to be replaced by Iver Fossum (Hannover).

Philipp Tschauner can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich). The ball would have probably ended up low inside the middle of the net.
James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) latches onto a good pass inside the box and shoots. The effort beats the keeper, but deflects off the crossbar to safety.
Substitution. Javi Martinez walks off the pitch and Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) was quite harsh and Guido Winkmann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) receives a quality cross and unleashes an accurate shot into the top of the net and behind the goalkeeper.
Andre Breitenreiter decides to make a substitution. Charlison Benschop will be replaced by Martin Harnik (Hannover).
The game has come to an end for Oliver Sorg. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Miiko Albornoz (Hannover).
Jupp Heynckes prepares a substitution. Thomas Muller is replaced by David Alaba (Bayern Munich).

Martin Harnik (Hannover) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Guido Winkmann blows his whistle for an infringement. PENALTY to Bayern Munich! Let's see who will take responsibility.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) puts the ball into the left side of the goal past the outstretched arm of Philipp Tschauner.
The manager makes a subsitution with Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) coming on for Kingsley Coman.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Goal! Lukas Rupp plays in Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim), who shows great determination to get to the ball before a couple of defenders and from inside the box slots it into the bottom left corner 1:0.
Dennis Geiger (Hoffenheim) is shown a yellow card by the referee for a bad sliding tackle on an opponent.
What a chance for Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) as he produced a stunning snap shot from the edge of the box! The goalkeeper was a bit lucky as the ball goes inches over the crossbar.

Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the top right corner. Unfortunately for him, Peter Gulacsi makes a great save to stop his effort.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) for his blatant foul.
Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim) has a goal ruled out for offside!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Ralph Hasenhuttl makes a half-time substitution. Bruma (RB Leipzig) comes on in place of Lukas Klostermann.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Dayot Upamecano is replaced by Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig).
Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) has a sight of goal and shoots towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper makes a superb save.

A superb goal from great team play! Serge Gnabry (Hoffenheim) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent shot into the middle of the net. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.
A wonderful pass found its target. Serge Gnabry (Hoffenheim) received it well and shot from about 40 metres out. He did really well to send the ball past the goalkeeper and under the bar.
Today's match ends for Serge Gnabry who will be replaced by Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim).
The manager makes a subsitution with Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) coming on for Nadiem Amiri.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) replacing Yussuf Poulsen.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Benjamini Hubner as he is replaced by Havard Nordtveit (Hoffenheim).
Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) has an effort from close range after latching on to a precise pass, but he can't beat one of the defenders who makes a good block.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a great shot into the bottom right corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Peter Gulacsi, so the score changes to 4:0.
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Danny Latza (Mainz) attempts to test the goalkeeper after collecting a cross inside the penalty area. Luck doesn't appear to be on his side today as his attempt rattles the left post.

Great save! Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot towards the bottom right corner was brilliantly saved by Robin Zentner. Corner kick. Augsburg will have an opportunity.
Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) struck with a long-range free kick. His attempt flew just wide of the left post. The goalkeeper was lucky there.
Goal - 0:1! Philipp Max laid the ball off to Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg), who slots it into the back of the net from close range, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Unlucky! A great strike from Erik Thommy (Augsburg) near the edge of the box had the keeper scrambling but flew just over the bar.
Danny Latza (Mainz) gets a shot from inside the penalty area and it flies just wide of the left post.
Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) fires a shot well wide of the left post from inside the box after latching onto a short pass.
Substitution. Erik Thommy makes way for Marcel Heller (Augsburg).
Goal! Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Robin Zentner into left side of the goal.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Sandro Schwarz gives a chance to  and Levin Oztunali (Mainz) is off.
The game is over for Pablo De Blasis. Suat Serdar (Mainz) comes on for the second half.
Frank Willenborg shows a yellow card to Danny Latza (Mainz) for a tough tackle.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ja-Cheol Koo trots off the pitch and is replaced by Kevin Danso (Augsburg).
Frank Willenborg shows the yellow card to Abdou Diallo (Mainz) for a heavy challenge.
Daniel Opare (Augsburg) argues with the referee and is booked for dissent.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Giulio Donati leaves the pitch and Viktor Fischer (Mainz) comes on.

The defending players give Gerrit Holtmann (Mainz) far too much free space and he knows how to take advantage of it. He produces a howitzer in the direction of the bottom right corner. Marwin Hitz was taken unawares by his effort and the score is 1:2.
Goal! Francisco Caiuby takes aim and his effort deflects off Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) to beat the goalkeeper. 1:3.
The referee has issued a yellow card to Viktor Fischer (Mainz).
Substitution. Alfred Finnbogason did his best and is replaced by Sergio Cordova (Augsburg).
Stefan Bell (Mainz) sees a yellow card from Frank Willenborg after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Takuma Asano (VfB Stuttgart) gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the area, but he drags his shot just wide of the right post.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) for a tough tackle.
The main referee, Bastian Dankert, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) is given a yellow card for dissent.

Stunning strike! Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) latches on to a precise through ball from Fin Bartels before unleashing an unstoppable shot into the bottom right corner from the edge of the area. Fantastic goal. The score is now 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
The goal by Werder Bremen won't count as it has been disallowed due to offside on the advice of the video assistant referee.
Substitution. Takuma Asano makes way for Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart).
Here is a change. Emiliano Insua is going off and Hannes Wolf gives the last tactical orders to Simon Terodde (VfB Stuttgart).

Jiri Pavlenka was forced into action to thwart Josip Brekalo (VfB Stuttgart). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the right post but couldn't beat the keeper.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) comes onto the pitch so that Berkay Ozcan can be given a rest.
The free kick from the edge of the box is taken by Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen), who fires in a direct effort just wide of the right post. What a chance!
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Lamine Ludovic Sane (Werder Bremen) replacing Philipp Bargfrede.
Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Andreas Beck (VfB Stuttgart) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the bottom left corner, but Jiri Pavlenka easily deals with the threat.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) comes onto the pitch for Fin Bartels.
What a wasted chance that is! A precise cross into the box found Holger Badstuber (VfB Stuttgart), whose header floated just over the bar.
Substitution. Maximilian Eggestein leaves the pitch and is replaced by Jerome Gondorf (Werder Bremen).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.

Nils Petersen (Freiburg) receives a clever pass and shoots from mid-range. His shot looks like it's going into the roof of the net, but Christian Mathenia has other ideas and makes a brilliant save. Freiburg will take a corner kick.
Julian Schuster sends over an inswinging corner and Nils Petersen (Freiburg) gets his head on the ball, but it goes just wide of the right post.
CHANCE! Christian Gunter (Freiburg) fires just wide of the left post from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Nils Petersen.
Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Alexander Schwolow makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the roof of the net.
Benjamin Brand shows a yellow card to Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg) for a tough tackle.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

Janik Haberer (Freiburg) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the roof of the net that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance. The ball goes behind for a corner. Freiburg will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Yoric Ravet (Freiburg) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Benjamin Brand ignores the protests.
Bobby Wood (Hamburger) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) drives into the box and hits a tremendous shot that, unluckily for him, flashes just wide of the left post.
Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) misses the left post by a whisker with a mid-range rebound. What a chance that was!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Walace (Hamburger) comes onto the pitch for Aaron Hunt.
Christian Streich prepares a substitution. Marco Terrazzino is replaced by Florian Kath (Freiburg).
Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Substitution. Yoric Ravet is replaced by Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg).
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Gideon Jung (Hamburger) is given a yellow card.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Andre Hahn (Hamburger) will replace Bobby Wood.
It will be a substitution. Sven Schipplock (Hamburger) is ready to enter the pitch as Jann-Fiete Arp walks off.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Karim Rekik (Hertha Berlin) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the resulting corner, but he sends his header straight at the goalkeeper.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) makes a good run to meet a precise cross just outside the box. He latches on to it and strikes the ball, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.
Half-time substitution. Milos Jojic is replaced by Tim Handwerker (Koln).
Half-time substitution. Pal Dardai decided to make a change. Sebastian Langkamp is replaced by Jordan Torunarigha (Hertha Berlin).

Claudio Pizarro (1. FC Koln) blows a good opportunity. He has a lot of space around him and fires a terrific shot from the edge of the box towards the top of the net, but Rune Jarstein makes a brilliant save! FC Koln earn a corner.

Matthias Lehmann (1. FC Koln) trips an opponent with a slide tackle. Bibiana Steinhaus stops the game and he could give him a card, but eventually decides on just a warning. The referee gives a penalty kick to Hertha Berlin!!
Goal! Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) sends the keeper the wrong way and scores into the right side of the goal.

Yuya Osako (Koln) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Yuya Osako (Koln). This could have been a legendary goal.
Peter Stoger has decided to substitute Yuya Osako and he is replaced by Anas Ouahim (Koln).
That's a clear yellow card. Jorge Mere (Koln) goes into the book.
Substitution. Mathew Leckie will be replaced by Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin).
Here is a change. Vedad Ibisevic is going off and Pal Dardai gives the last tactical orders to Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin).
Substitution. Matthias Lehmann walks off the pitch and Nikolas Nartey (Koln) comes on as a substitute.
Sehrou Guirassy (Koln) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
Bibiana Steinhaus is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Serge Gnabry (Hoffenheim) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post.
Own goal! Kevin Akpoguma (Hoffenheim) suffers a good deal of misfortune as he accidentally puts a pass from one of the attacking players into his own net. The score is 1:0.
Kevin Vogt (Hoffenheim) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Filip Kostic (Hamburger) does well to control a poor pass on the edge of the box then shoots towards the bottom left corner. Oliver Baumann is out of position but leaps to make a brilliant save. Hamburger SV win a corner.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
OFF THE POST! Good play from Bobby Wood (Hamburger) as skips past two defending players and from the edge of the box unleashes a decent strike that smashes the left post!
Julian Nagelsmann prepares a substitution. Serge Gnabry is replaced by Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim).
Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
That will be all from Steven Zuber who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
