Julian Nagelsmann has decided to make a change. Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) replaces Steven Zuber.
Jann-Fiete Arp (Hamburger) latches onto a loose ball inside the box but slams it just wide of the left post.

Jann-Fiete Arp (Hamburger) jinks his way past multiple challenges and fires the ball from the edge of the box to the right side of the goal, but Oliver Baumann shows his agility and makes a save. Hamburger SV will have a chance to score from a corner kick.

A sweet pass finds Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim) on the edge of the box, and he drills the ball towards the bottom right corner. Christian Mathenia is almost caught out but pulls off a brilliant save at the last second. Hoffenheim have been awarded a corner kick.
Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Aaron Hunt will be replaced by Rick Van Drongelen (Hamburger).
Filip Kostic (Hamburger) fires the ball from the free kick with a knuckleball of a shot from distance, the ball changes direction in the air and forces the goalkeeper into making a complete howler!
Substitution. Bobby Wood will be replaced by Sven Schipplock (Hamburger).
Goal! Dennis Diekmeier shows great vision to find Gideon Jung (Hamburger) with a cheeky pass inside the box, and his first-time shot is precise and sails into the left side of the goal. 3:0.
Here is a change. Jann-Fiete Arp is going off and Markus Gisdol gives the last tactical orders to Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
Christoph Kramer is substituted due to injury. Dieter Hecking gives a chance to Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach).
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post.

What a chance that is! Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross from the free kick, but he steers his header narrowly over the crossbar.

Yann Sommer receives ovations from the crowd. He manages to block a first-time effort from Sebastian Rudy (Bayern Munich), whose strike from the edge of the box was headed towards the roof of the net.
Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Manuel Grafe didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Niklas Sule (Bayern Munich) probably handled the ball inside the penalty area. PENALTY to B. Monchengladbach! Let's see who will take responsibility.
Goal! Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) puts the ball into the bottom left corner past the outstretched arm of Sven Ulreich.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the left post! What an opportunity that was!
It's a goal! Lars Stindl plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Matthias Ginter (B. Monchengladbach). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 2:0.
Substitution. Juan Bernat makes his way off the pitch and Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) comes on as his replacement.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Manuel Grafe blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Half-time substitution. James Rodriguez is replaced by Marco Friedl (Bayern Munich).
The game is over for Tony Jantschke. Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) comes on for the second half.
Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the resulting corner, but he sends his header straight at the goalkeeper.
Today's referee Manuel Grafe rightly decides to book Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach) for his harsh tackle.

Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) latches on to a pin-point pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a daisy-cutter shot towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper produces an amazing acrobatic dive to deny him. The ball bounces off his gloves and hits the post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sebastian Rudy trots off the pitch and is replaced by Kwasi Okyere Wriedt (Bayern Munich).
What an absolute cracking goal! Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) hits a perfect volley from long range and the ball flies into the bottom right corner. Take a bow son.
The ball is laid off to Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) on the edge of the box. He shoots through a crowd of players towards the bottom right corner and forces Yann Sommer to make a decent save.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) comes onto the pitch for Raffael.
Golden chance! Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
The game is interrupted as Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) is sent off by the referee.

Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Augsburg will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Manuel Baum is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Rani Khedira suffers an injury and Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) comes on.
Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) pounces on a pass inside the box but flashes his shot just over the bar. That was a great chance!
Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot towards the middle of the goal was easily saved by Koen Casteels.

What a beautiful moment! Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way into the middle of the goal. Marwin Hitz just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 0:1.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Erik Thommy (Augsburg) for a tough tackle.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) was quite harsh and Tobias Stieler didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The end of the first half.
Referee Tobias Stieler blows his whistle to start the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Manuel Baum gives a chance to Martin Hinteregger (Augsburg) and Kevin Danso is off.
Martin Schmidt makes a switch. Yannick Gerhardt (Wolfsburg) is coming on in place of Daniel Didavi at the start of the second period.

Daniel Opare (Augsburg) sends a chip pass into the box, but Koen Casteels is quickest to intercept the ball. Close! Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) is a whisker away from finishing-off the move he started. His close-range effort flies just over the bar.
Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) is deemed to be in an offside position by the linesman and it looks like it is the right decision despite being a very close call.
Goal! Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) takes a short pass from Alfred Finnbogason in his stride in the box, jinks inside his man and unleashes an unstoppable shot into the bottom left corner. 1:1.
Martin Schmidt decides to make a substitution. John Brooks will be replaced by Felix Uduokhai (Wolfsburg).
Today's referee Tobias Stieler rightly decides to book Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) for his harsh tackle.
Goal! Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Philipp Max. The score is 2:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nany Landry Dimata (Wolfsburg) comes onto the pitch for Paul Verhaegh.
Manuel Baum has decided to substitute Erik Thommy and he is replaced by Marcel Heller (Augsburg).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
Weston McKennie (Schalke) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Ralf Fahrmann is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 1:0.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) latches onto a long ball into the box and unleashes a fine volley at goal, but flashes the effort just over the bar. That would have been a great goal!
OWN GOAL! The free kick is whipped in and the ball hits Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke), who finds the back of his own net. 2:0.

Goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang hands Mario Gotze (Dortmund) the simplest of tasks from close range after the cross evaded the keeper, and he makes no mistake with his header into the middle of the goal. 3:0.
Tempers flare after Thilo Kehrer (Schalke) commits a foul. He receives a yellow card for his bad challenge and surely must be relieved at not receiving a red card.
What a hit! Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot inside the right post. 4:0.
Here is a change. Franco Di Santo is going off and Domenico Tedesco gives the last tactical orders to Leon Goretzka (Schalke).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Amine Harit (Schalke) is coming onto the pitch as Weston McKennie cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The referee cannot ignore such behaviour. Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) sees a yellow card and needs to watch himself for the rest of the game.
The end of the first half.
Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle and the second half starts.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Domenico Tedesco probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Thilo Kehrer. He is replaced by Matija Nastasic (Schalke).
Sokratis (Dortmund) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
The video assistant referee intervenes and the referee disallows the goal as Naldo (Schalke) was in an offside position.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Roman Weidenfeller.
Bastian Oczipka (Schalke) struck the ball which rebounded to the edge of the box. His attempt went narrowly over the crossbar.

This was a piece of cake for Ralf Fahrmann. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went towards the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper.
What a sweet header! Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) leaps high to connect with a cross on the edge of the box and scores with a trademark header.
Amine Harit (Schalke) meets a perfect cross from Evgen Konoplyanka deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike inside the right post. The score is 4:2.
This would have been a magnificent goal from Guido Burgstaller (Schalke), who collected the ball inside the box and prodded a first-time shot on goal that flew just narrowly wide of the right post.
Marc Bartra (Dortmund) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Andriy Yarmolenko.
RED CARD! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Deniz Aytekin. He can have an early bath.

Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) climbs highest near the penalty spot to meet a cross from the free kick. He attempts to steer a header into the middle of the goal, but Roman Weidenfeller punches the ball away, deflecting it onto the post.
Mario Gotze just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) replaces him.
Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) has tested the patience of referee Deniz Aytekin and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
We are about to witness a substitution. Dan-Axel Zagadou (Dortmund) is replacing Raphael Guerreiro.

An amazing individual effort from Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball precisely into the top left corner and makes it 4:3. Roman Weidenfeller was helpless.
Tempers flare after a clattering challenge by Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke), who receives a yellow card from the referee. It could have been worse for him!
The score has changed  4:4. Evgen Konoplyanka sends a fantastic cross into the box from the corner. Naldo (Schalke) jumps highest and plants a header into the top of the net.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Although Nuri Sahin (Dortmund) is just on the bench, Deniz Aytekin has awarded him with a yellow card. Unsporting behavior says the referee.
Ralf Fahrmann (Schalke) gets a yellow card after the final whistle for unsporting behaviour.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Tempers flare after Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) commits a foul. He receives a yellow card for his bad challenge and surely must be relieved at not receiving a red card.
Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) volleys the ball on the edge of the box after a rebound. It's a great effort and has Lukas Hradecky scrambling, but it flies just over the bar.
David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) takes out his opponent with a horrific tackle and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) finds his way to the ball from the free kick inside the box, but his header only hits the left post.
The ball rebounds to Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) inside the box after a goalmouth scramble, but he whips the ball high over bar.

OFF THE POST! Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the right post! It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Patrick Ittrich had an easy-decision to make.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Patrick Ittrich has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) releases a powerful first-time effort from the edge of the box which goes in the direction of the middle of the target, but the keeper reacts quickly enough to deny him. Excellent goalkeeping! Eintracht Frankfurt earn a corner.

Marius Wolf (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom left corner. Bernd Leno guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.

Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) releases a powerful first-time effort from the edge of the box which goes in the direction of the right-hand post, but the keeper leaps like a salmon to deny him. Excellent goalkeeping!
Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) wins himself enough space to meet the resulting corner and fires the ball at goal, but the keeper does well to stop his effort.
The rebound finds Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) in space inside the box, but his shot goes well wide of the left post. That was a promising chance!
Here's the change. Lucas Alario leaves the pitch and Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on as a substitute.
Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot towards the middle of the goal was easily saved by Lukas Hradecky.
Niko Kovac has decided to make a change. Daichi Kamada (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Marc Stendera.
Patrick Ittrich shows a yellow card to Simon Falette (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his blatant foul.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) converts a killer cross with a powerful low shot that goes into the middle of the net.
Carlos Salcedo (Eintracht Frankfurt) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
Substitution. Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) did his best and is replaced by .
Niko Kovac decides to make a substitution. Carlos Salcedo will be replaced by Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) was quite harsh and Patrick Ittrich didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Substitution. Kevin Volland makes his way off the pitch and Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on as his replacement.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Levin Oztunali (Mainz), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.
Danny Latza (Mainz) reacts well to get to the rebound and takes a shot from the edge of the box, but he fails to get the ball through the players standing between him and the goal.
Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Daniel Siebert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Julian Schuster (Freiburg) shoots at goal from the free kick from some 25 metres out. His attempt was quite precise and another few inches and it would have ended up inside the left post.
Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and has an effort on goal. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies inches high over the bar.
Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) volleys the ball on the edge of the box after a rebound. It's a great effort and has Alexander Schwolow scrambling, but it flies just over the bar.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) picks up a yellow card.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Christian Streich decided to make a change. Bartosz Kapustka is replaced by Ryan Kent (Freiburg).
Here is a change after the half-time break. Alexandru Maxim is replaced by Suat Serdar (Mainz).

Marco Terrazzino (Freiburg) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Marco Terrazzino (Freiburg). This could have been a legendary goal.
Goal! It's a catastrophic error from the opponent which has gifted a chance to Nils Petersen (Freiburg), who rolls the ball into the back of the net from close range. 1:0.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) for a tough tackle.
Julian Schuster (Freiburg) stands over the resultant free kick from mid-range, but his shot goes just over the crossbar. It could have been a fantastic goal!

That was absolutely fantastic! Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) tries his luck with a hammer shot from long range, but his effort only rattles the crossbar! Here is an example of luck not being on your side.
Alexander Schwolow makes a wonderful save! Kenan Kodro (Mainz) got to the rebound and sent in a fine header to the middle of the goal, but he couldn't beat the keeper.
Julian Schuster (Freiburg) attempts to discuss the decision with Daniel Siebert, but he soon realises that it's not the right thing to do as he sees the yellow.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marco Terrazzino departs the field of play to be replaced by Caleb Stanko (Freiburg).
Here is a change. Viktor Fischer (Mainz) is going off and Sandro Schwarz gives the last tactical orders to .
A substitution has been made. Levin Oztunali goes off and Robin Quaison (Mainz) comes on.
Substitution. Florian Kath (Freiburg) has come on for Janik Haberer.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Robin Quaison (Mainz).
Florian Kath (Freiburg) slots the ball inside the back of the net and alters the score!
The ball hits the back of the net and  is the one who put it there!
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.

Diego Demme (RB Leipzig) receives a precise pass in the box and takes the shot early. The ball heads towards the top left corner, but Jiri Pavlenka shows off his skills and makes a brilliant save to deny him. Good work from RB Leipzig as they win a corner.
Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) waited for a rebound on the edge of the box and left the goalkeeper stranded with his beautiful attempt which went into the bottom left corner, glancing off the post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Sascha Stegemann has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Ralph Hasenhuttl decided to make a change. Marcel Halstenberg is replaced by Bernardo (RB Leipzig).

Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick shot to the right side of the goal, but he can't get the power to direct it past Peter Gulacsi, who keeps it out.
Substitution. Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) in, Philipp Bargfrede out.

Peter Gulacsi pulls off a superb save! He leapt to block the shot Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) fired on target from the rebound. His effort from inside the box was directed low to the middle of the goal.

Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) latches on to a lovely pass inside the box and fires towards the right side of the net, but the effort is smothered by the keeper. The referee points to the corner flag and Werder Bremen will take a corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) replaces Timo Werner.
Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) lacks options so goes solo. It's a fine run and good shot from inside the box, but it's a whisker past the right post.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen) for Lamine Ludovic Sane.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to substitute Emil Forsberg and he is replaced by Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig).

Jiri Pavlenka makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Bernardo (RB Leipzig) on the edge of the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the bottom left corner. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for RB Leipzig.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Bernardo (RB Leipzig) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Jiri Pavlenka. 2:0.
Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen) is cautioned by the referee.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Goal! Takuma Asano (VfB Stuttgart) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 0:1.
Andreas Beck (VfB Stuttgart) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Christian Dingert had an easy-decision to make.
Berkay Ozcan (VfB Stuttgart) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Benjamin Pavard (VfB Stuttgart) was quite harsh and Christian Dingert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. Hannover have been awarded an indirect free kick.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Christian Dingert blows his whistle to start the second half.
Here comes a substitution. Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) is brought on as a substitute for Martin Harnik.
Felix Klaus (Hannover) has tested the patience of referee Christian Dingert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Takuma Asano (VfB Stuttgart) for his blatant foul.
Holger Badstuber (VfB Stuttgart) has tested the patience of referee Christian Dingert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

OFF THE POST! Salif Sane (Hannover) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the right post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Substitution. Dennis Aogo (VfB Stuttgart) has come on for Josip Brekalo.
Andre Breitenreiter prepares a substitution. Oliver Sorg is replaced by Kenan Karaman (Hannover).
The manager makes a subsitution with Simon Terodde (VfB Stuttgart) coming on for Takuma Asano.

Holger Badstuber (VfB Stuttgart) clearly holds his opponent to prevent him from getting the ball and the referee immediately stops play. The referee makes a quick call and points to the penalty spot. Big scoring opportunity for Hannover.
Goal! Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Ron-Robert Zieler into the top left corner.
Dennis Aogo (VfB Stuttgart) picks up a lucky rebound inside the box from the clearance, beats an opponent but drills his shot inches over the bar.
Substitution. Berkay Ozcan is replaced by Ailton (VfB Stuttgart).
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
GOAL! Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Michael Esser, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 1:0.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Benjamin Cortus has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

It's in! Philipp Bargfrede spots his teammate in a good position on the edge of the box and provides him with a nice pass. Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) doesn't think twice and rifles a first-time shot into the top of the net. The score is now 2:0.
Substitution. Sebastian Maier leaves the pitch and is replaced by Ihlas Bebou (Hannover).
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) received a delightful pass inside the box before slotting the ball past the goalkeeper. What a brilliant finish!
Substitution. Philipp Bargfrede will be replaced by Jerome Gondorf (Werder Bremen).
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to make a change. Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) replaces Jonathas.
Substitution. Martin Harnik walks off the pitch and Manuel Schmiedebach (Hannover) comes on as a substitute.
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to unleash a great effort which ends up in the bottom left corner.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Florian Hubner (Hannover) was quite harsh and Benjamin Cortus didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Here is a change. Zlatko Junuzovic is going off and Florian Kohfeldt gives the last tactical orders to Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen).
Here comes a substitution. Max Kruse is given a rest as he is replaced by Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Robert Hartmann blows for a foul after Gideon Jung (Hamburger) was too aggressive in the battle for the ball. The referee uncompromisingly points to the spot and it's a penalty to Schalke.
Goal! Franco Di Santo (Schalke) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Christian Mathenia into the bottom left corner.
Tatsuya Ito (Hamburger) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Robert Hartmann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Tatsuya Ito walks off the pitch to be replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger).
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Robert Hartmann has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Domenico Tedesco gives a chance to Breel Embolo (Schalke) and Franco Di Santo is off.
Naldo (Schalke) is booked.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Breel Embolo (Schalke) was quite harsh and Robert Hartmann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) picks up an accurate pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that smashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Bobby Wood (Hamburger) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Gotoku Sakai.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Gideon Jung (Hamburger).
A yellow-coloured card is received by Max Meyer (Schalke).
Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Hamburger) receives a yellow card for infringement.
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Evgen Konoplyanka, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low accurate shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 2:0.
Substitution. Filip Kostic walks off the pitch and Andre Hahn (Hamburger) comes on as a substitute.
Here is a change. Evgen Konoplyanka is going off and Domenico Tedesco gives the last tactical orders to Alessandro Schopf (Schalke).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Max Meyer as he is replaced by Matija Nastasic (Schalke).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Goal! Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot inside the left post. He makes it 0:1.
The whistle blows and Karim Rekik (Hertha Berlin) is booked for an infringement.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Rune Jarstein to move before rolling the ball into the middle of the goal!
Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) is well placed to meet a cross and sends a difficult header towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper reacts well to stop the effort.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) collected a pass and decided to shoot from about 24 metres out. He hit it perfectly! The ball zoomed around the goalkeeper and ended up in the top right corner.

Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low drive is headed for the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him.
What a hit! Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the middle of the net. 0:1.

Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the corner, but his fine header towards the top left corner is brilliantly saved by the diving goalkeeper. The referee blows his whistle, Hertha Berlin are awarded a corner kick.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header inches over the bar.

Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) decides to strike the ball towards goal, but his effort fails to threaten the goalkeeper after being well blocked by one of the defenders. Hertha Berlin force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.

This was a piece of cake for Rune Jarstein. Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went towards the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin) comes onto the pitch so that Alexander Esswein can be given a rest.
GOAL! Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) got to the ball in front of the goal and he couldn't miss from there. His low drive went in off the left-hand post. The score is 0:1.
Here comes a substitution. Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) is brought on as a substitute for Fabian Johnson.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems stabs the ball inside the left post.
We are about to witness a substitution. Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin) is replacing Salomon Kalou.
Substitution. Raffael makes way for Vincenzo Grifo (B. Monchengladbach).
Dieter Hecking decides to make a substitution. Thorgan Hazard will be replaced by Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach).
Bastian Dankert shows the yellow card to Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) for a heavy challenge.
Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) has received a yellow card for his foul.
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

The game is interrupted. Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) has violated the rules in the battle for the ball. No protests or gestures are being made as he is quite aware of what he did. The referee gives a penalty to RB Leipzig!
Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
Goal! Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Bernd Leno into left side of the goal.
Unlucky! Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) hits a thunderous volley on the edge of the box that just flies just wide of the left post.
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) has a chance after receiving a pass. He measures his shot from the edge of the box but it sails just wide of the left post.
Goal! Dominik Kohr produces a great pass that finds Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom left corner. 1:1.
Harm Osmers has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Heiko Herrlich decided to make a change. Admir Mehmedi is replaced by Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen).
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) climbs highest in the middle of the box after a cross from the wing, but sends a good looking header narrowly wide of the left post.
Harm Osmers has issued a yellow card to Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee blows his whistle, a clear handball by Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen). The referee points to the penalty spot. It's a penalty for RB Leipzig!
Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen) is red-carded. He has to leave the pitch.
Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Bernd Leno to move before slotting the ball low into the middle of the goal!
That will be all from Naby Keita who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig).
A yellow card for a tackle by Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen). Harm Osmers doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Bernd Leno (Bayer Leverkusen) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Harm Osmers lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.
A substitution has been made. Willi Orban goes off and Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig) comes on.
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Fine attempt! Kevin Kampl (RB Leipzig) collects a pass and manages to hold off the defender, then rifles in a shot from mid-range which unluckily swerves inches past the left post.
Goal! Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) unleashes a first-time shot from inside the box and beats the goalkeeper inside the left post. 2:2.
Harm Osmers shows a yellow card to Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) sees a yellow card from Harm Osmers after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Substitution. Emil Forsberg is replaced by Bruma (RB Leipzig).
Heiko Herrlich has decided to substitute Dominik Kohr and he is replaced by Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen).
Kevin Volland goes off the pitch and Panagiotis Retsos (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Markus Schmidt shows the yellow card to Rani Khedira (Augsburg) for a heavy challenge.

Marwin Hitz pulls off a great save to deny Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the left side of the goal. The ball is out of play. Bayern Munich win a corner kick.
Daniel Opare (Augsburg) has tested the patience of referee Markus Schmidt and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Markus Schmidt shows a yellow card to Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg) for his blatant foul.
Fantastic team goal! Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) was set free in the area by Niklas Sule and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the top right corner. 1:0.
Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) tries his luck from a long-range free kick and the ball is aimed to the bottom right corner, but Sven Ulreich is alert and thwarts the effort.
Goal! Arturo Vidal tees up Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) inside the box, and he keeps his cool to find the bottom left corner. 2:0.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) meets a perfect cross from Joshua Kimmich deep inside the box, and he produces an accurate strike which goes into the bottom right corner. He makes it 3:0.
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball glanced away off the bar!
Here comes a substitution. Marcel Heller is given a rest as he is replaced by Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg).
Manuel Baum prepares a substitution. Francisco Caiuby is replaced by Konstantinos Stafylidis (Augsburg).
Jupp Heynckes has decided to substitute Juan Bernat and he is replaced by David Alaba (Bayern Munich).
A substitution has been made. Arjen Robben is replaced by Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich).
The substitution has been made. Sebastian Rudy (Bayern Munich) has replaced Arturo Vidal.
Manuel Baum has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) replacing Alfred Finnbogason.
That's the end of the match.

Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot towards the left side of the goal, but Lukas Hradecky pulls off a brilliant save.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The manager makes a subsitution with Serge Gnabry (Hoffenheim) coming on for Lukas Rupp.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) was quite harsh and Felix Zwayer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marc Stendera departs the field of play to be replaced by Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to substitute Sandro Wagner and he is replaced by Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is coming onto the pitch as Sebastien Haller cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Today's match ends for Dennis Geiger who will be replaced by Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim).
Niko Kovac has decided to make a change. Gelson Fernandes (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Mijat Gacinovic.

Oliver Baumann can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt). The ball would have probably ended up inside the left post.
Great save! Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot towards the right side of the goal was brilliantly saved by Lukas Hradecky.
Goal! Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) beautifully controls a strongly hit pass from Serge Gnabry inside the box. He cuts inside his marker and rifles the ball into the right side of the goal. 1:1.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) rises high to meet a perfect cross, but powers his header just wide of the left post.
Close! Sehrou Guirassy (1. FC Koln) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot narrowly over the bar.
Peter Stoger is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Simon Zoller suffers an injury and Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln) comes on.
Konstantin Rausch (Koln) tackles a bit over-zealously and Felix Brych blows for a foul. The advantage of a penalty kick is given to Mainz.
Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) smoothly converts the penalty with a beautiful low drive into the right side of the goal.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Peter Stoger has decided to make a change. Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) replaces Salih Ozcan.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Suat Serdar (Mainz) replacing Alexandru Maxim.
The ball spins to Suat Serdar (Mainz) on the edge of the box. He hits across the ball and sends it goalwards, but it goes just wide of the left post.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
A card of the red variety is shown to Giulio Donati (Mainz). He has been sent off.
Substitution. Jhon Cordoba leaves the pitch and is replaced by Claudio Pizarro (Koln).
Sandro Schwarz has decided to substitute Pablo De Blasis and he is replaced by Gerrit Holtmann (Mainz).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Frederik Sorensen (1. FC Koln) was quite harsh and Felix Brych didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Here comes a substitution. Levin Oztunali is given a rest as he is replaced by Kenan Kodro (Mainz).
Milos Jojic (Koln) misses the left post by a whisker with a mid-range rebound. What a chance that was!
Felix Brych is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
Goal! Yannick Gerhardt (Wolfsburg) beautifully controls a strongly hit pass from Daniel Didavi inside the box. He cuts inside his marker and rifles the ball into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
Goal! Daniel Didavi plays a simple square pass into the feet of Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) in the box, who composes himself and lashes the ball into the bottom right corner. 2:0.
Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) looks up on the edge of the box and rifles in a screamer of a shot that flies just over the bar.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Robin Koch (Freiburg) for a tough tackle.
Marcel Tisserand (Wolfsburg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Manuel Grafe didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
Manuel Grafe shows the yellow card to Florian Kath (Freiburg) for a heavy challenge.
Christian Streich prepares a substitution. Karim Guede is replaced by Bartosz Kapustka (Freiburg).

Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Alexander Schwolow anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going into the middle of the target.
Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) latches on to an accurate pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a strong shot towards goal, but his effort is denied by the well positioned keeper.
Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg) collects a rebound and produces a mid-range attempt. The ball goes to the middle of the target, but Koen Casteels keeps it out.
Goal! Bartosz Kapustka (Freiburg) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the top left corner. He makes it 2:1.
Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and coolly buries the ball low inside the right post.
The game has come to an end for Florian Kath. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Yoric Ravet (Freiburg).
Christian Streich has decided to make a change. Marco Terrazzino (Freiburg) replaces Julian Schuster.
Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) tries to find Mario Gomez, but he puts too much power on the pass.
The referee signals a substitution. Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Daniel Didavi.
Here is a change. Yunus Malli is going off and Martin Schmidt gives the last tactical orders to Riechedly Bazoer (Wolfsburg).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
CHANCE! Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) fires just wide of the right post from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Andriy Yarmolenko.
Goal! Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) seizes on the loose ball after a huge error from Roman Burki and finds the back of the net from inside the box. 1:0.

Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund) receives a slide-rule pass inside the box and has just the keeper to beat. His shot towards the right side of the goal lacks power and Ron-Robert Zieler easily makes the save.
Jeremy Toljan (Dortmund) sprays a pass out to Shinji Kagawa, but he can't beat his man to get to the ball. The ball goes out of play. Dortmund are awarded a corner kick.
Mario Gotze (Dortmund) shakes off the attention of a defender and from mid-range lets fly towards the roof of the net, but Ron-Robert Zieler is well positioned to make a comfortable save.
Daniel Ginczek is substituted due to injury. Hannes Wolf gives a chance to Takuma Asano (VfB Stuttgart).

Benjamin Pavard (VfB Stuttgart) clearly handles the ball, but he is surprised when the referee blows his whistle. PENALTY to Dortmund! Almost the entire opposition team is gathered around the referee and complaining. However, the decision has been made and it's final.
Penalty saved! Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) sends the penalty towards the left hand side of the goal, but Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off a wonderful save to deny him.
Goal! Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund) fires the rebound into the roof of the net after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:1.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Sokratis comes off for Dan-Axel Zagadou (Dortmund).
Half-time substitution. Chadrac Akolo will not participate anymore and Josip Brekalo (VfB Stuttgart) is coming on.

Josip Brekalo (VfB Stuttgart) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Roman Burki is just a bystander as the ball flies into bottom right corner. The score is 2:1.
Frank Willenborg shows the yellow card to Timo Baumgartl (VfB Stuttgart) for a heavy challenge.
The substitution has been made. Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund) has replaced Shinji Kagawa.
Takuma Asano (VfB Stuttgart) races towards goal but the defender gets back well to make a challenge.
Berkay Ozcan (VfB Stuttgart) comes close to scoring. He peels away from his marker and gets on the end of a cross from Takuma Asano, but he hits a shot just over the crossbar.
A goal, which was scored by Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund), was disallowed due to offside.

Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) receives a short pass inside a congested penalty area and takes a first-time shot. The effort heads towards the middle of the goal but Ron-Robert Zieler blocks the shot with his legs.
Andre Schurrle goes off the pitch and Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) comes on.
Hannes Wolf has decided to make a change. Dennis Aogo (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Berkay Ozcan.

Josip Brekalo (VfB Stuttgart) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Roman Burki guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Frank Willenborg shows a yellow card to Dennis Aogo (VfB Stuttgart) for a tough tackle.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Goal! Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Valentino Lazaro, then sends the ball into the bottom right corner. 0:1.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as John Brooks (Wolfsburg) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.

Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) makes an unfair challenge by holding his opponent to prevent him from getting the ball. The referee gives a penalty to Wolfsburg after a quick talk with the linesman, who had apparently seen the situation from a better perspective.
Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) misses the penalty as he smashes the ball against the crossbar!
The video assistant referee intervenes and the referee disallows the goal as Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) was in an offside position.
Substitution. Niklas Stark makes his way off the pitch and Arne Maier (Hertha Berlin) comes on as his replacement.
Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the right post.
Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) gets to a rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball inside the left post, and thus alter the score to 1:1.

Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper. He quickly drills a shot to the bottom left corner and scores! His effort went in off the post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The ball is whipped in from the free kick and finds Karim Rekik (Hertha Berlin), who rises and produces an amazing header into the top of the net.
Substitution. Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin) has come on for Peter Pekarik.
Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home inside the right post. The goalkeeper was helpless.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) for Salomon Kalou.
Martin Schmidt decides to make a substitution. Divock Origi will be replaced by Jakub Blaszczykowski (Wolfsburg).
Goal! Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) fires the rebound into the bottom left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 3:3.
Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) pings a header narrowly wide of the left post from around the penalty spot following a decent cross.
Marcel Tisserand (Wolfsburg) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
CLOSE! Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the right post!
Oliver Baumann blocks a long-range effort from Pawel Olkowski (1. FC Koln) towards the right side of the goal. Now FC Koln have a corner.
Dennis Geiger (Hoffenheim) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and coolly sends the ball into the back of the net.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) races through the centre to the edge of the box then lets fly with a rocket of a shot that flies a whisker wide of the right post.

Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Timo Horn stops the ball from going inside right post. Hoffenheim force their opponents to concede a corner.
Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the resulting corner, but his fine header towards the bottom right corner is brilliantly saved by the diving goalkeeper.
The whistle blows and Kevin Vogt (Hoffenheim) is booked for an infringement.
Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) produced a promising shot towards the bottom left corner after his wonderful solo run, but Timo Horn thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same.
Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln) is booked for saying more than Deniz Aytekin was willing to tolerate.

Dennis Geiger (Hoffenheim) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Dennis Geiger (Hoffenheim) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. Corner kick. Hoffenheim will have an opportunity.
Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Deniz Aytekin ignores the protests.
Yuya Osako (Koln) gets into a shooting position! What a long-range cannonball of a shot! His nice effort, however, only crashes against the right post. Aim better, sir.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) shakes off the attention of a defender and from mid-range lets fly towards the right side of the goal, but Timo Horn is well positioned to make a comfortable save.
Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) picks up a caution.

Pawel Olkowski (1. FC Koln) robs an opponent of the ball and explodes in anger when Deniz Aytekin blows for a foul. The referee makes a quick call and points to the penalty spot. Big scoring opportunity for Hoffenheim.
Pawel Olkowski (Koln) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) converts the penalty with ease by slotting the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal after the goalkeeper guesses wrong and dives the opposite way!
Peter Stoger has decided to make a change. Milos Jojic (1. FC Koln) replaces Salih Ozcan.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Milos Jojic (Koln) receives a yellow card.
Tim Handwerker (Koln) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Simon Zoller.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to substitute Nadiem Amiri and he is replaced by Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim).

Pawel Olkowski (Koln) picks up a pass and tries his luck from mid-range towards the roof of the net, but Oliver Baumann is equal to it and makes an easy save. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for FC Koln.
Milos Jojic (Koln) receives a quality pass inside the box and fires a first-time shot. His effort towards the left post is saved by the goalkeeper.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Sehrou Guirassy (Koln) smacks a great volley at goal from inside the box, but sends the effort just wide of the right post.
We are about to witness a substitution. Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) is replacing Dennis Geiger.
Here is a change. Matthias Lehmann is going off and Peter Stoger gives the last tactical orders to Frederik Sorensen (1. FC Koln).
Goal! Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) unleashes a first-time shot from inside the box and beats the goalkeeper inside the right post. 0:3.
It will be a substitution. Havard Nordtveit (Hoffenheim) is ready to enter the pitch as Sandro Wagner walks off.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Tobias Stieler shows the yellow card to Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) for a heavy challenge.

It's in! James Rodriguez spots his teammate in a good position on the edge of the box and provides him with a nice pass. Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) doesn't think twice and rifles a first-time shot into the left side of the goal. The score is now 0:1.
Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund) controls a reverse pass deep inside the box and smacks the ball low towards the middle of the goal, but the Sven Ulreich anticipates well and smothers the ball.

Superb touch by Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) as he receives a precise pass into the box, but the goalkeeper stops the ball as it heads towards the top of the net. Brilliant save! The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Bayern Munich.
A long pass from defence releases Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) on the edge of the box, but his snap shot somehow flies just past the right post. The crowd thought it was in!
GOAL! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) finishes off a sublime move with a delightful back-heel goal. Joshua Kimmich provided the assist with a brilliant pass. 0:2.
Sokratis is being substituted because of an injury. Peter Bosz sends Jeremy Toljan (Dortmund) on the pitch.

Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
Tobias Stieler has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

What a save from Roman Burki! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising low header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Omer Toprak (Dortmund) sees a yellow card from Tobias Stieler after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
David Alaba (Bayern Munich) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Tobias Stieler didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
David Alaba (Bayern Munich) struck from medium range. He buried the ball inside the right post.
Here is a change. Shinji Kagawa is going off and Peter Bosz gives the last tactical orders to Mario Gotze (Dortmund).
A substitution has been made. David Alaba is replaced by Rafinha (Bayern Munich).
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Andriy Yarmolenko will be replaced by Jadon Sancho (Dortmund).
Jupp Heynckes has decided to substitute Javi Martinez and he is replaced by Sebastian Rudy (Bayern Munich).
That will be all from James Rodriguez who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich).
Gonzalo Castro finds Marc Bartra (Dortmund) with a sweet pass inside the penalty box, who then smashes the ball inside the right post. What a clinical finish to make it 1:3.
Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) finds space inside the box to shoot after collecting a short pass, but it's a wasted effort as it flies well wide of the left post.
That's it for today, Tobias Stieler has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
The expression of the referee Christian Dingert is crystal clear. This behaviour won't be tolerated. Daniel Opare (Augsburg) is shown a yellow card.

Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen) wasted a great chance as he climbed high to connect with a cross from the free kick inside the penalty area. He produced a header which went wide of the left by a whisker.

Rani Khedira (Augsburg) gets to the ball from the resulting corner and tries his luck with a shot, but one of the defenders steps in to block the effort. The ball goes behind for a corner. Augsburg will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Sven Bender limps off the pitch to be replaced by Panagiotis Retsos (Bayer Leverkusen).
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Panagiotis Retsos (Bayer Leverkusen) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Christian Dingert ignores the protests.
The yellow card is received by Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen).
Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg) gets booked for the first time in this match.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.

GOAL! A terrible mistake leads to a goal. The defender ends up losing possession, allowing Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) to pick up the ball before slotting it into the back of the net to make it 0:1.

Bernd Leno makes a beautiful save from Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg), who latched on to an accurate lofted pass and produced a timely header. The goalkeeper was able to tip the ball onto the bar and away.
An unlucky rebound falls to Kevin Danso (Augsburg) and he scores with a bullet header.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Julian Baumgartlinger departs the field of play to be replaced by Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen).
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) connects with a cross near the penalty spot and produces a header which hits the right post!
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Julian Brandt walks off the pitch to be replaced by Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen).
The substitution has been made. Erik Thommy (Augsburg) has replaced Marcel Heller.
It's time for a substitution. Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) comes on in place of Ja-Cheol Koo.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.

Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) takes a shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball heads into the top right corner, but the goalkeeper denies him with a fantastic save. The ball goes out of play. Mainz are awarded a corner kick.
Abdou Diallo (Mainz) outjumps the defenders inside the six-yard box to meet the corner and scores with a header into the middle of the goal. The keeper had no chance to react. The score is now 0:1.
The ball rebounds off the defender into the path of Raffael (B. Monchengladbach), who immediately strikes for goal from inside the box but sends it a whisker wide of the right post.
Goal disallowed! Levin Oztunali (Mainz) scores but Sven Jablonski blows his whistle for a foul.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Sven Jablonski blows his whistle to start the second half.
The game has come to an end for Tony Jantschke. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach).
Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Denis Zakaria.

Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach) outjumps the defence inside the six-yard box to meet the resulting corner and scores with a great header into the roof of the net. The goalkeeper had no chance to react. The score is now 1:1.
We are about to witness a substitution. Viktor Fischer (Mainz) is replacing Pablo De Blasis.
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Raffael.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alexandru Maxim departs the field of play to be replaced by Fabian Frei (Mainz).
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) is booked.
Sven Jablonski is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.

OFF THE POST! Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Oh, what a chance! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) was quickest to the rebound but the ball hit the right post.
Bartosz Kapustka (Freiburg) gets a shot from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the crossbar!
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.

Nils Petersen (Freiburg) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Ralf Fahrmann. Freiburg force a corner. They send men into the box.
Mike Frantz doesn't have to suffer any longer with the painful injury as Amir Abrashi (Freiburg) comes onto the pitch to replace him.
Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) strikes the ball towards goal and finds a gap inside the right post!
Domenico Tedesco has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Amine Harit (Schalke) replacing Evgen Konoplyanka.
Here comes a substitution. Bartosz Kapustka is given a rest as he is replaced by Florian Kath (Freiburg).
Christian Streich prepares a substitution. Nils Petersen is replaced by Marco Terrazzino (Freiburg).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Breel Embolo (Schalke) comes onto the pitch for Franco Di Santo.
Florian Kath (Freiburg) is penalised.
Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke) is booked.
Guido Burgstaller comes off the pitch to be replaced by Fabian Reese (Schalke).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his shot to the middle of the goal is smartly dealt with by Christian Mathenia. The referee points to the corner flag and Stuttgart will take a corner.
Guido Winkmann shows the yellow card to Dzenis Burnic (VfB Stuttgart) for a heavy challenge.
RED CARD! Dzenis Burnic (VfB Stuttgart) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Guido Winkmann. He can have an early bath.
Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) bends his technical strike from the 25-metre free kick. The ball goes in off the left hand post and ends in the back of the net.
Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off a great save to deny Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Douglas Santos (Hamburger) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Guido Winkmann ignores the protests.
Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) probably handled the ball inside the penalty area. PENALTY! One of the players from Stuttgart is about to take a penalty kick. Let's see how this ends.
Goal! Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Christian Mathenia into left side of the goal.
Goal! Dennis Diekmeier picks out Filip Kostic (Hamburger) with a perfect cross, and he has no problem to nod the ball into an empty net. It's 2:1.
It's time for a substitution. Orel Mangala (VfB Stuttgart) comes on in place of Berkay Ozcan.
Markus Gisdol decides to make a substitution. Tatsuya Ito will be replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger).

Jann-Fiete Arp (Hamburger) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Ron-Robert Zieler is just a bystander as the ball flies into the bottom left corner. The score is 3:1.
Guido Winkmann shows a yellow card to Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Hamburger) for a tough tackle.
That will be all from Daniel Ginczek who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Simon Terodde (VfB Stuttgart).
Golden chance! Filip Kostic (Hamburger) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post.
Here is a change. Aaron Hunt is going off and Markus Gisdol gives the last tactical orders to Andre Hahn (Hamburger).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ailton (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Chadrac Akolo.
The substitution is prepared. Vasilije Janjicic (Hamburger) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Albin Ekdal.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.
A goal, which was scored by Timo Werner (RB Leipzig), was disallowed due to offside.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Substitution. Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) in, Bruma out.
Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover) picks up a yellow card.
Jonathas (Hannover) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems stabs the ball in the middle of the goal.
Ralph Hasenhuttl prepares a substitution. Konrad Laimer is replaced by Naby Keita (RB Leipzig).
Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig) has tested the patience of referee Martin Petersen and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
A great run by Felix Klaus (Hannover) gets him into the box, but his powerful shot is bravely blocked by a defender.
That's the end of the game for Felix Klaus, who is replaced by Martin Harnik (Hannover).
Goal! Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Timo Werner. The score is 1:1.
It's time for a substitution. Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) comes on in place of Jonathas.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post.

Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover) receives a slide-rule pass inside the box and has just the keeper to beat. His shot towards the bottom left corner lacks power and Peter Gulacsi easily makes the save. The linesman makes the right call and Hannover will have a corner.
Yellow card! It's like Pirmin Schwegler (Hannover) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Martin Petersen agrees and books him.

Goal! Emil Forsberg displays great vision and sends a pass to Timo Werner (RB Leipzig), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 2:1.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Julian Korb walks off the pitch to be replaced by Sebastian Maier (Hannover).
Oliver Sorg (Hannover) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Martin Petersen had an easy-decision to make.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to make a change. Kevin Kampl (RB Leipzig) replaces Timo Werner.
Martin Petersen shows a yellow card to Salif Sane (Hannover) for his blatant foul.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes inside the right post. He couldn't have done it any better. 1:0.
Goal 1:1! Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls it and sends it straight at Lukas Hradecky, who makes a comfortable save.

Superb touch by Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) as he receives a precise pass into the box, but the goalkeeper stops the ball as it heads towards the top of the net. Brilliant save! Now Werder Bremen have a corner.

That didn't go as planned. Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) tried his luck from the edge of the box, but his effort towards the left side of the goal was too weak to get past Lukas Hradecky, who easily kept it out. The ball is out of play and Werder Bremen manage to earn a corner.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

What a wasted opportunity by Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt)! He unleashed a powerful low shot from the centre of the box, but Jiri Pavlenka makes a decent save to thwart him. The referee points to the corner flag and Eintracht Frankfurt will take a corner.
Marius Wolf (Eintracht Frankfurt) throws the chance away as he attempts to produce a shot from inside the box. His attempt simply rattles the right post. The goalkeeper can remain calm.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marc Stendera leaves the pitch and Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
Florian Kohfeldt decides to make a substitution. Philipp Bargfrede will be replaced by Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes onto the pitch so that Ante Rebic can be given a rest.
Substitution. Taleb Tawatha (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Jetro Willems.
It's in the back of the net! Taleb Tawatha plays it into the box, and Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets on the end of the cross to put it inside the left post. 2:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen) comes onto the pitch for Maximilian Eggestein.
Florian Kohfeldt prepares a substitution. Ludwig Augustinsson is replaced by Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.

Caglar Soyuncu (Freiburg) is sent off! He receives a red card and the match ends for him. He attempts to argue, but the referee's decision is final. Stuttgart win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
The foul by Dzenis Burnic (VfB Stuttgart) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Tobias Stieler.

What a sweet touch by Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) after latching on to a fine pass on the edge of the box! He finds some space and unleashes a cannonball towards the middle of the net. The goalkeeper makes a reflex save, pushing the ball onto the post.

Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) rises above the defenders and places a towering header towards the left post, but Alexander Schwolow is prepared and dives to thwart him. The ball is out of play and Stuttgart manage to earn a corner.
Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart) meets a perfect cross from Berkay Ozcan deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces a strike into the middle of the goal. The score is 1:0.

It's in the back of the net! Berkay Ozcan flights in the free kick and the ball finds the head of Benjamin Pavard (VfB Stuttgart), whose excellent bullet header from the centre of the box goes into the right side of the goal. 2:0.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Florian Niederlechner is replaced by Florian Kath (Freiburg).
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Christian Streich gives a chance to Ryan Kent (Freiburg) and Marco Terrazzino is off.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) for a tough tackle.
Hannes Wolf has decided to substitute Daniel Ginczek and he is replaced by Simon Terodde (VfB Stuttgart).
Hannes Wolf is forced to make a change. Chadrac Akolo is unable to continue due to injury, Ailton (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
The referee signals a substitution. Nils Petersen (Freiburg) is brought on as a substitute for Janik Haberer.
A yellow card for a tackle by Andreas Beck (VfB Stuttgart). Tobias Stieler doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Goal! Simon Terodde (VfB Stuttgart) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the net. He makes it 3:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Anto Grgic (VfB Stuttgart) comes onto the pitch for Dzenis Burnic.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.

Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Jiri Pavlenka makes a decent save to deny his effort directed to the bottom right corner. Augsburg will take a corner kick.
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) has a crack at goal from inside the box, but the defender somehow makes the block to deny him.
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Marwin Hitz stops the ball from going inside the left post.
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) hits the crossbar with a rebound from just outside the box.
Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) scores from quite a difficult position as he leaps high to connect with a cross and powers his header low inside the right post. Excellent finish.
Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen) trips an opposition player and Soren Storks signals a foul. The referee makes the call - penalty to Werder Bremen!
Goal! Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) lashes the penalty into the middle of the goal, giving the keeper no chance.
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Alexander Nouri gives a chance to Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) and Robert Bauer is off.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Maximilian Eggestein comes off for Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen).
Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.

What a chance that is! Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross from the free kick, but he steers his header narrowly wide of the left post.

Marwin Hitz can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen). The ball would have probably ended up low inside the middle of the net.
Goal! A great through ball by Francisco Caiuby sets up Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) inside the box, and he makes no mistake and bangs the ball into the bottom right corner. 0:3.
What a wasted chance that is! A precise cross into the box found Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg), whose header floated just over the bar.
Rani Khedira (Augsburg) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots low to the middle of the goal, but Jiri Pavlenka pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Manuel Baum decides to make a substitution. Alfred Finnbogason will be replaced by Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marcel Heller leaves the pitch and Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg) comes on.
Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Rani Khedira (Augsburg) gets inside the box and only has the keeper to beat, but lashes his shot well wide of the right post.
Substitution. Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) has come on for Michael Gregoritsch.
That's it for today, Soren Storks has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.

Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) reacts well and displays good awareness inside the box to get on the end of the corner kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for RB Leipzig.
Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) makes a horror tackle on his opponent and receives a red card from the referee!

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) has the opportunity to threaten the opponent's goal via a free kick on the edge of the box. He hits a fine strike towards the left side of the goal, but Peter Gulacsi denies him with a great save. Bayern Munich will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Goal! Arjen Robben plays a pass to the feet of James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich), and he shoots into the bottom right corner from inside the box. It's 1:0.
Tactical substitution due to red card. Timo Werner departs the field of play to be replaced by Ibrahima Konate (RB Leipzig).
