Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) collects a sweet pass and fires a low shot into the bottom right corner, leaving the keeper helpless.
Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header inches over the bar. The ball goes out of play and RB Leipzig will have a goal kick.
Robert Lewandowski is being substituted because of an injury. Jupp Heynckes sends Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) on the pitch.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Daniel Siebert blows his whistle to start the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Ralph Hasenhuttl gives a chance to Bruma (RB Leipzig) and Marcel Sabitzer is off.

Close! David Alaba (Bayern Munich) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for RB Leipzig.
The substitution is prepared. Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Emil Forsberg.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) is furious with himself as he misses a clear opportunity. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for RB Leipzig.

That's unlucky! James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) side steps a tackle after receiving a pass, advances then hits a booming shot from mid-range which only rises at the last second to fly just over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for RB Leipzig.
Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
We are about to witness a substitution. Rafinha (Bayern Munich) is replacing Joshua Kimmich.
Jupp Heynckes has decided to make a change. Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich) replaces Arjen Robben.
Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) connects with a cross and powers a header goalwards, but his effort goes just over the bar. The ball goes out of play and RB Leipzig will have a goal kick.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.

Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayer Leverkusen.
Goal! Frederik Sorensen passes the ball to the feet of Sehrou Guirassy (1. FC Koln), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 0:1.
What was Simon Zoller (Koln) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Dominique Heintz (Koln) gets to the rebound just outside the box, but his attempt is blocked by one of the defending players. It's going to be a corner kick.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Heiko Herrlich has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on the pitch for Panagiotis Retsos.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Kai Havertz comes off for Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen).
Dominic Maroh is being substituted because of an injury. Peter Stoger sends Lukas Klunter (1. FC Koln) on the pitch.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) smacks a great volley at goal from inside the box, but sends the effort just inches over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for FC Koln.
Kevin Volland passes to Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen), who gets one-on-one with the keeper. His dummy grounds the keeper and he has a simple task lifting the ball over him into the net.
That's a clear yellow card. Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) goes into the book.
Here comes a substitution. Yuya Osako is given a rest as he is replaced by Tim Handwerker (Koln).

What a wasted opportunity by Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the bottom right corner, but Timo Horn makes an astonishing save to thwart him.
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his low drive towards the right post, but the keeper dives low to keep the ball out.

Tim Handwerker (1. FC Koln) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the roof of the net is blocked by Bernd Leno, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. FC Koln have been awarded a corner kick.
GOAL - 2:1! The corner comes over and Jonathan Tah flicks on with his head to Sven Bender (Bayer Leverkusen), who makes no mistake and fires the ball into the back of the net.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Here's the change. Matthias Lehmann leaves the pitch and Milos Jojic (Koln) comes on as a substitute.
The goal by Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) won't count as it has been disallowed on the advice of the video assistant referee!
Here is a change. Leon Bailey is going off and Heiko Herrlich gives the last tactical orders to Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) was quite harsh and Manuel Grafe didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Manuel Grafe is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
Goal! Jonathas (Hannover) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Roman Burki into the bottom left corner.
Goal! Dan-Axel Zagadou (Dortmund) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 1:1.
Good chance! Christian Pulisic laid the ball off to Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund) inside the box, he ducked inside his man and rifled a shot in at goal that skimmed the top of the bar.
Goal! A great through ball by Jonathas sets up Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) inside the box, and he makes no mistake and bangs the ball into the bottom right corner. 2:1.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Peter Bosz has made a change at the break. Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) has come on in place of Gonzalo Castro.
Goal! Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 2:2.
Dan-Axel Zagadou (Dortmund) is sent off! He receives a red card and the match ends for him. He attempts to argue, but the referee's decision is final.
Felix Klaus (Hannover) scores from a free kick after smashing the ball over the defensive wall and into the top left corner of the goal!
Peter Bosz has decided to make a change. Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) replaces Nuri Sahin.
A yellow card for a tackle by Jonathas (Hannover). Patrick Ittrich doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Peter Bosz has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) replacing Andriy Yarmolenko.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Felix Klaus as he is replaced by Martin Harnik (Hannover).

Roman Burki can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Ihlas Bebou (Hannover). The ball would have probably ended up in the bottom left corner. Hannover will take a corner kick.
Andre Breitenreiter decides to make a substitution. Jonathas will be replaced by Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover).
Philipp Tschauner (Hannover) receives a yellow card.
Wonderful finish from Ihlas Bebou (Hannover). He drills a low shot precisely into the bottom left corner. No chance for the goalkeeper.

Martin Harnik (Hannover) meets a cross inside the penalty area and unloads a good attempt towards the bottom left corner. Roman Burki is prepared, though, and denies him with a fantastic save. Good work from Hannover as they win a corner.
That's the end of the game for Ihlas Bebou, who is replaced by Sebastian Maier (Hannover).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
The whistle blows and Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) is booked for an infringement.

Marvin Plattenhardt sends over a killer cross from the resulting corner and expertly finds Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the top left corner. It's 1:0.

Rune Jarstein hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Douglas Santos (Hamburger) shoots from the edge of the box towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. The ball goes out for a corner. Hamburger SV can continue in their attacking effort.
Filip Kostic (Hamburger) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Mitchell Weiser sends in a great cross from the corner and finds Karim Rekik (Hertha Berlin), who outjumps the defence to finish into the top left corner with a header. The score is 2:0.
Peter Pekarik (Hertha Berlin) is punished with the yellow card.
Substitution. Albin Ekdal did his best and is replaced by Jann-Fiete Arp (Hamburger).
Markus Gisdol has decided to substitute Bobby Wood and he is replaced by Tatsuya Ito (Hamburger).

Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the bottom left corner, but Christian Mathenia pulls off an exquisite save to deny him. The ball is out of play and Hertha Berlin manage to earn a corner.
Aaron Hunt (Hamburger) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Andre Hahn.
Vedad Ibisevic goes off the pitch and Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) comes on.
GOAL! Jann-Fiete Arp (Hamburger) got to the ball in front of the goal and he couldn't miss from there. His low drive went in off the left-hand post. The score is 2:1.
Christian Mathenia pulls off a great save to deny Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Valentino Lazaro trots off the pitch and is replaced by Arne Maier (Hertha Berlin).
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. Jordan Torunarigha (Hertha Berlin) replaces Salomon Kalou.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header just wide of the left post.
CHANCE! Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) fires just wide of the left post from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Jonas Hofmann.
Problems for Dieter Hecking as Jonas Hofmann is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) replaces him.
Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) smacks a great volley at goal from inside the box, but sends the effort just inches over the bar.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Vincenzo Grifo (B. Monchengladbach) decided to surprise the goalkeeper with a quick shot from the edge of the box, but his effort came back off the right post!

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a magnificent shot into the top left corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Yann Sommer, so the score changes to 1:0.
Kevin Vogt (Hoffenheim) sees a yellow card from Harm Osmers after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Vincenzo Grifo (B. Monchengladbach) takes the set piece from outside the box. His shot heads towards the top right corner, but Oliver Baumann dives and saves the effort, punching it onto the post.
Mark Uth just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) replaces him.
Matthias Ginter (B. Monchengladbach) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim) replacing Pavel Kaderabek.

Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach) outjumps the defence to meet the resulting corner and heads the ball towards the bottom left corner. The long-range header is not powerful enough, and the keeper comfortably makes a save. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. B. Monchengladbach will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

It's a goal! Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) scores with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Vincenzo Grifo. The score is now 1:1.
Harm Osmers shows a yellow card to Stefan Posch (Hoffenheim) for his blatant foul.
Vincenzo Grifo (B. Monchengladbach) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) weaves his way through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his effort to the right post is thwarted by Yann Sommer.
Substitution. Tony Jantschke leaves the pitch and is replaced by Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach).
Goal - 1:2! Vincenzo Grifo tees up Matthias Ginter (B. Monchengladbach) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom left corner and past Oliver Baumann.
Goal! Nico Elvedi gets up really well from the corner and heads the ball into the six-yard box where Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach) glances a header into the net. 1:3.
Here is a change. Stefan Posch is going off and Julian Nagelsmann gives the last tactical orders to Philipp Ochs (Hoffenheim).
Substitution. Lars Stindl is replaced by Reece Oxford (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Naldo (Schalke) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) is penalised for holding. Markus Schmidt signals a set piece. The referee points to the penalty spot. Schalke are awarded a penalty kick!
The game is interrupted. Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Goal! Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty low past Koen Casteels into the middle of the goal.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) has tested the patience of referee Markus Schmidt and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) receives a yellow card!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
It looks like Naldo (Schalke) saw red with that tackle. Markus Schmidt won't tolerate such behaviour on the pitch and blows for a foul. Wolfsburg are about to take a penalty!
Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) doesn't keep his cool and fails to convert the penalty. He skies the ball way over the bar and into the stands.
Marcel Tisserand will be replaced by Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg).
A substitution has been made. Franco Di Santo goes off and Fabian Reese (Schalke) comes on.
Domenico Tedesco decides to make a substitution. Nabil Bentaleb will be replaced by Weston McKennie (Schalke).
It will be a substitution. Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) is ready to enter the pitch as Josuha Guilavogui walks off.
Amine Harit (Schalke) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Markus Schmidt had an easy-decision to make.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) was quite harsh and Markus Schmidt didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Martin Schmidt prepares a substitution. Jakub Blaszczykowski is replaced by Nany Landry Dimata (Wolfsburg).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) comes onto the pitch for Amine Harit.
Markus Schmidt shows a yellow card to Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) for his blatant foul.
GOAL! Mario Gomez meets a cross inside the box and heads the ball across the goal, where Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) lurks and pokes it into the back of the net. 1:1.
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
What bad luck! Stefan Bell (Mainz) got in the way of a pass and unintentionally sent the ball past his own goalkeeper. The score is 0:1.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Sascha Stegemann starts the second half.

Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) weaves through the defence with ease and gets one-on-one with the keeper, but fails to score with his strike towards the middle of the target as Robin Zentner produces a good save.
The referee signals a substitution. Suat Serdar (Mainz) is brought on as a substitute for Fabian Frei.
David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a yellow card from Sascha Stegemann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Goal! Suat Serdar (Mainz) collects a pass and without hesitation fires an unstoppable shot into the roof of the net.
Niko Kovac has decided to substitute Ante Rebic and he is replaced by Danny Blum (Eintracht Frankfurt).
That's the end of the game for Levin Oztunali, who is replaced by Viktor Fischer (Mainz).
Niko Kovac has decided to make a change. Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Mijat Gacinovic.
It's time for a substitution. Kenan Kodro (Mainz) comes on in place of Yoshinori Muto.
Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt) is booked.
Here is a change. Marc Stendera is going off and Niko Kovac gives the last tactical orders to Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.
Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim) gets on the end of a defence splitting pass inside the box and immediately directs a low shot towards the middle of the goal, but the Koen Casteels makes a great save.
One of the Hoffenheim players commits a holding foul and the referee reaches for his whistle. That is a penalty kick for Wolfsburg.

Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) has a great chance to score from the penalty. He shoots to the middle of the goal, but only into the gloves of a well-prepared Oliver Baumann. The ball goes out for a corner. Wolfsburg can continue in their attacking effort.
The foul by Stefan Posch (Hoffenheim) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Felix Zwayer.
Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending the ball towards the bottom left corner only for Oliver Baumann to dive and make a save.

What a chance that is! Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass on the edge of the box and fires towards the net. Unfortunately for him, he only hits the crossbar!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Felix Zwayer starts the second half.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Kevin Akpoguma (Hoffenheim) comes on the pitch for Stefan Posch.
What a huge chance for Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Martin Schmidt prepares a substitution. Nany Landry Dimata is replaced by Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg).

A neat pass is well received by Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the left post, but the goalkeeper makes an incredible save to block his shot. Wolfsburg have been awarded a corner kick.

Felix Uduokhai (Wolfsburg) volleys the ball on the edge of the box after a rebound. It's a great effort and has Oliver Baumann scrambling, but it flies just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Hoffenheim will have a goal kick.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Steven Zuber as he is replaced by Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim).
Martin Schmidt has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Mario Gomez (Wolfsburg) replacing Divock Origi.

Marcel Tisserand (Wolfsburg) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Felix Zwayer blows his whistle for an infringement. PENALTY! A huge scoring opportunity for Hoffenheim.
Goal! Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Koen Casteels into the top right corner.
Felix Zwayer shows the yellow card to Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) for a heavy challenge.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) for a tough tackle.
Martin Schmidt has decided to substitute Gian-Luca Itter and he is replaced by Yannick Gerhardt (Wolfsburg).
Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) sees a yellow card from Felix Zwayer after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Today's match ends for Florian Grillitsch who will be replaced by Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim).

A perfectly taken corner kick. Felix Uduokhai (Wolfsburg) gets on the end of it and produces a fantastic bullet header from around the penalty spot which goes inside the left post, increasing the score of today's match  1:1.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the right post. Unfortunately for him, Alexander Schwolow makes a great save to stop his effort.
A decent cross gives Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) a chance to score, but he sends his header inches over the bar from close range.
Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Philipp Lienhart (Freiburg).
Caglar Soyuncu (Freiburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Guido Winkmann ignores the protests.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) receives a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Pal Dardai makes a switch. Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) is coming on in place of Vedad Ibisevic at the start of the second period.
Guido Winkmann has a clear sight and sees a foul from Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin). It's a penalty for Freiburg!
Goal! Janik Haberer (Freiburg) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Rune Jarstein into the bottom left corner.
Guido Winkmann shows a yellow card to Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
A substitution has been made. Ondrej Duda is replaced by Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin).
Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) receives a yellow card.
That will be all from Janik Haberer who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Nils Petersen (Freiburg).
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. Arne Maier (Hertha Berlin) replaces Fabian Lustenberger.
Julian Schuster (Freiburg) makes an overly-aggressive challenge and Guido Winkmann blows his whistle for a foul. Hertha Berlin are given a penalty!
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) misses the penalty! His poor effort goes well over the crossbar.

Guido Winkmann blows his whistle after Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle. The referee uncompromisingly points to the spot and it's a penalty to Hertha Berlin.
Goal! Alexander Schwolow gets a hand on the penalty from Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin), but can't stop it from flying into the bottom left corner.

Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin) receives a precise pass in the box and takes the shot early. The ball heads towards the bottom left corner, but Alexander Schwolow shows off his skills and makes a brilliant save to deny him.
Marco Terrazzino goes off the pitch and Florian Kath (Freiburg) comes on.
Christian Streich has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Robin Koch (Freiburg) replacing Philipp Lienhart.
Julian Schuster (Freiburg) takes the free kick from just outside the box and unleashes a fine shot to the top right corner, but his effort is thwarted by Rune Jarstein who parries it onto the post.
Mike Frantz (Freiburg) takes a shot after receiving a good pass, but his effort from the edge of the box goes just over the crossbar.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Jiri Pavlenka pulls off a fine save! Sehrou Guirassy (1. FC Koln) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header low towards the middle, but the effort is kept out.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) wastes an opportunity to score with a header from deep inside the box. His effort flies well over the bar.
Salih Ozcan (1. FC Koln) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Kampka ignores the protests.
Today's referee Robert Kampka rightly decides to book Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen) for his harsh tackle.

A sweeping move ends with a pass to Sehrou Guirassy (1. FC Koln) inside the box. He lets fly towards the bottom right corner, but Jiri Pavlenka was watching it all the way and makes a comfortable save.
Robert Kampka has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
Alexander Nouri makes a half-time substitution. Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) comes on in place of Fin Bartels.
The foul by Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Robert Kampka.
Robert Kampka shows a yellow card to Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) for a tough tackle.
Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
We are about to witness a substitution. Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen) is replacing Ishak Belfodil.
Milos Jojic (Koln) gets booked for the first time in this match.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Simon Zoller as he is replaced by Tim Handwerker (Koln).
Substitution. Lukas Klunter (Koln) in, Yuya Osako out.
Sehrou Guirassy (Koln) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Sehrou Guirassy (Koln) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Florian Kainz trots off the pitch and is replaced by Max Kruse (Werder Bremen).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Milos Jojic walks off the pitch to be replaced by Frederik Sorensen (Koln).
Chance! Sehrou Guirassy (Koln) took a nice pass in his stride in the box, but scuffed his shot just wide of the left post.

Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) takes a nice touch on the edge of the box as he meets a pass and produces a shot towards the roof of the net. What an excellent save by the goalkeeper! The ball goes out of play. Werder Bremen are awarded a corner kick.

The ball from the corner kick lands at the feet of Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen) deep inside the box and he takes a shot. The strike heads towards the bottom right corner, but it's deflected away thanks to a brilliant intervention by one of the defenders. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Werder Bremen will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
Gideon Jung (Hamburger) receives a red card after his awful challenge. He completely lost his temper and referee Marco Fritz sends him off the pitch.
James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Marco Fritz ignores the protests.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Jupp Heynckes makes a half-time substitution. Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) comes on in place of James Rodriguez.
Goal - 0:1! Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich) receives a precise pass inside the box from Thomas Muller and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the bottom right corner.

Andre Hahn (Hamburger) had a great opportunity from mid-range. His powerful volley was directed towards the top left corner, but Sven Ulreich was alert and made an astonishing save! Hamburger SV have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Problems for Jupp Heynckes as Thomas Muller is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) replaces him.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) for Aaron Hunt.

What a chance that is! Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass on the edge of the box and fires towards the net. Unfortunately for him, he only hits the left post!
The foul by Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Marco Fritz.
Today's referee Marco Fritz rightly decides to book Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich) for his harsh tackle.
Markus Gisdol decides to make a substitution. Rick Van Drongelen will be replaced by Tatsuya Ito (Hamburger).
Substitution. Filip Kostic (Hamburger) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Andre Hahn walks off.

Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) reacts well and displays good awareness inside the box to get on the end of the resulting corner kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the right post.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he produced a shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the middle of the goal, but Christian Mathenia made an astonishing save!
Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich) rises high to connect with a cross from the corner kick, but his powerful header from center of the box hits the left post!
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) smacks a great volley at goal from inside the box, but sends the effort just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hamburger SV.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) is free in the box and Kingsley Coman finds him with a pass, but his powerful shot skims just past the right post. Good chance!
The manager makes a subsitution with Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) coming on for Kingsley Coman.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
A great run from Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) ends with a shot inside the box that flashes just past the right post.

Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The linesman points to the corner flag, Augsburg are going to take it.

Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) gets into a good scoring position. He creates some space for himself and tries his luck from distance. His decent effort towards the left post is, however, superbly saved by Philipp Tschauner! Augsburg force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Sascha Stegemann shows the yellow card to Rani Khedira (Augsburg) for a heavy challenge.
Jonathas (Hannover) is punished with the yellow card.
A fine move culminates with a precision cross onto the head of Martin Harnik (Hannover) in the centre of the box. It's a good attempt but goes just over the bar.
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Kenan Karaman (Hannover) for his blatant foul.
Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) picks it up in space and from the edge of the box lashes in a shot that is deflected past the helpless Philipp Tschauner. 1:0.

Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the roof of the net. Philipp Tschauner has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Andre Breitenreiter gives a chance to Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover) and Kenan Karaman is off.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) for Iver Fossum.
Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) picks up the ball, dribbles to the edge of the penalty area and unleashes a brilliant shot to the bottom left corner, but is thwarted by a great save from Marwin Hitz.
Substitution. Alfred Finnbogason did his best and is replaced by Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg).
Manuel Baum has decided to substitute Jonathan Schmid and he is replaced by Marcel Heller (Augsburg).
Substitution. Pirmin Schwegler makes his way off the pitch and Sebastian Maier (Hannover) comes on as his replacement.
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) attempts to score from a difficult angle on the edge of the box, but sends his effort narrowly wide of the left post.
Wonderful movement! Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) perfectly times his run onto a brilliant cross and smashes the ball from deep inside the box straight into the roof of the net. What a finish.
Jonathas (Hannover) receives a short pass inside a congested penalty area and takes a first-time shot. The effort heads towards the middle of the goal but Marwin Hitz blocks the shot with his legs.

A nice lofted cross finds Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) unmarked and he displays an excellent touch to control the ball. Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) drills a low shot towards the middle of the net, but doesn't give the goalkeeper anything to worry about. An easy save.
Manuel Baum has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jan Moravek (Augsburg) replacing Rani Khedira.
Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) breaks through before collecting a brilliant pass and producing a precise strike to beat the goalkeeper. The ball went into the bottom right corner.
Jonathas (Hannover) picks up a pass and tries his luck from mid-range towards the middle of the goal, but Marwin Hitz is equal to it and makes an easy save.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.

Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) meets a perfect cross from Thorgan Hazard deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike into the bottom left corner via the post. It's 1:0.

Bernd Leno gets a well deserved ovation! Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) produces a decent first-time strike towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper is positioned well to block it. Nice goalkeeping skills.
Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) misses a great chance after he found some space in the box! His effort goes inches wide of the left post.
The game is interrupted. Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) latches onto a loose ball inside the box but slams it just wide of the left post.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
The referee signals a substitution. Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) is brought on as a substitute for Lucas Alario.
Goal! Sven Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) seizes on the loose ball after a huge error from Yann Sommer and finds the back of the net from inside the box. 1:1.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach) gets booked.
Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems stabs the ball low inside the left post.
Goal! Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the net. He makes it 1:3.
Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) gets a yellow card.
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Fabian Johnson.
Here is a change. Mickael Cuisance is going off and Dieter Hecking gives the last tactical orders to Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach).
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) unleashes a shot straight into the bottom right corner. Good team effort!
OFF THE WOODWORK! Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot that smashes against the crossbar!
We are about to witness a subsitution. Joel Pohjanpalo (Bayer Leverkusen) for Kevin Volland.
Goal - 1:5! Julian Brandt laid the ball off to Joel Pohjanpalo (Bayer Leverkusen), who shot from close range low into the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Heiko Herrlich prepares a substitution. Leon Bailey is replaced by Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Lars Stindl leaves the pitch and Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) comes on.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Marc Bartra feeds the ball through to Nuri Sahin (Dortmund), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the bottom left corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:1!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Timothy Chandler trots off the pitch and is replaced by Carlos Salcedo (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Robert Hartmann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Today's referee Robert Hartmann rightly decides to book Julian Weigl (Dortmund) for his harsh tackle.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Goal! Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund) finds some space for a shot from the edge of the box and his attempt goes low inside the right post. Fantastic finish.
Kevin-Prince Boateng (Eintracht Frankfurt) is awarded a yellow card.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Dan-Axel Zagadou (Dortmund) for Julian Weigl.
Peter Bosz prepares a substitution. Gonzalo Castro is replaced by Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund).
Substitution. Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt) on for Marco Russ.
A goal, which was scored by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), was disallowed due to offside.

Roman Burki (Dortmund) should know this behaviour is beyond the rules. He was too careless with his challenge and left Robert Hartmann no option but to blow his whistle. The crowd is going crazy! The referee makes a call and gives the penalty to Eintracht Frankfurt.
The foul by Roman Burki (Dortmund) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Robert Hartmann.
Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) brillantly executes a penalty kick!

Lukas Hradecky can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stopped the close-range effort from Christian Pulisic (Dortmund). The ball would have probably ended up in the bottom right corner. Dortmund earn a corner.

Marius Wolf (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a nice pass just outside the penalty area, controls the ball and releases a powerful shot which is also precise enough to beat the goalkeeper, ending in the bottom left corner.
We are about to witness a substitution. Taleb Tawatha (Eintracht Frankfurt) is replacing Marius Wolf.
Here's the change. Maximilian Philipp leaves the pitch and Jadon Sancho (Dortmund) comes on as a substitute.
Marc Bartra (Dortmund) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Hannes Wolf is forced to make a change. Dennis Aogo is unable to continue due to injury, Dzenis Burnic (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) collects a good pass and blasts the ball from medium range into the top left corner, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
Good team movement sets up Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post.
Sven Jablonski has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) comes onto the pitch for Timo Werner.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to make a change. Kevin Kampl (RB Leipzig) replaces Naby Keita.
Substitution. Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Takuma Asano.
Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the right side of the goal, but Peter Gulacsi pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
It will be a substitution. Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig) is ready to enter the pitch as Emil Forsberg walks off.
Here is a change. Andreas Beck is going off and Hannes Wolf gives the last tactical orders to Josip Brekalo (VfB Stuttgart).
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the right side of the target, but Ron-Robert Zieler easily deals with the threat.
Simon Terodde (VfB Stuttgart) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
A pass across the box picks out an unmarked Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) and he tries to place the ball towards the roof of the net, but it goes just over the bar.
Kevin Kampl (RB Leipzig) rips an amazing volley from deep inside the box that goes narrowly wide of the left post.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
GOAL - 1:0! Guido Burgstaller found Leon Goretzka (Schalke) inside the box, he spotted goalkeeper Rene Adler off his line and chipped the ball into the net. What a cheeky lob!
Naldo (Schalke) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Bibiana Steinhaus didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The match has reached half-time.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) zig-zags his way into the box and drills a low shot towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a great reaction save to stop the effort.
Franco Di Santo (Schalke) receives a slide-rule pass inside the box and has just the keeper to beat. His shot towards the middle of the goal lacks power and Rene Adler easily makes the save.
Substitution. Viktor Fischer (Mainz) on for Pablo De Blasis.
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) takes a nice first touch to control a cross and shoots at goal from near the penalty spot, but his effort only hits the right-hand post!
Here is a change. Franco Di Santo is going off and Domenico Tedesco gives the last tactical orders to Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Giulio Donati walks off the pitch to be replaced by Alexandru Maxim (Mainz).

Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. Schalke force a corner. They send men into the box.
Thilo Kehrer (Schalke) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the left side of the goal is brilliantly kept out by the goalkeeper.
A shot is blocked but the rebound lands at the feet of Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) who fires the ball into the back of the net.
The ball falls kindly for Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) inside the box and he goes for goal. It's a decent effort but flies just wide of the right post.
Leon Balogun comes off the pitch to be replaced by Kenan Kodro (Mainz).
Kenan Kodro (Mainz) threw away a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross inside the 6-yard box, but his shot missed the target close to the right post.
Domenico Tedesco has decided to substitute Guido Burgstaller and he is replaced by Fabian Reese (Schalke).
A tremendous drive by Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) from inside the box towards the middle of the goal looks like it's in, but Rene Adler makes a brilliant save.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Amine Harit as he is replaced by Coke (Schalke).
Bibiana Steinhaus shows the yellow card to Coke (Schalke) for a heavy challenge.
Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) is penalised.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) spurned a good chance! He gets a shot away from inside the penalty box, but it goes inches wide of the right post.

What a wasted opportunity by Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the bottom left corner, but Jiri Pavlenka makes an astonishing save to thwart him.
Goal! Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) fires the rebound inside the right post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 0:1.

Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach) jumps highest to meet the ball from the corner kick and finishes behind the helpless keeper with a fine header inside the right post. The defence stare motionlessly at each other. What a peach of a goal that is. Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach) has every right to celebrate!
What an opportunity! Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen) wins the ball from the resulting set piece and unleashes a precise shot from inside the goal area which goes just over the crossbar!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Markus Schmidt has ended it.
The second half has just started.
Half-time substitution. Milos Veljkovic is replaced by Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen).
Here is a change after the half-time break. Philipp Bargfrede is replaced by Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen).
Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow card from Markus Schmidt after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Fabian Johnson.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Ludwig Augustinsson walks off the pitch to be replaced by Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen).
Dieter Hecking decides to make a substitution. Raffael will be replaced by Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach).
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) connects with a cross near the penalty spot and produces a header which hits the right post!
The manager makes a subsitution with Vincenzo Grifo (B. Monchengladbach) coming on for Thorgan Hazard.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has started.
Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) meets a cross and produces a header down towards the middle of the net, but one of the defending players blocks the effort.
A cross is whipped in towards Sven Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) on the edge of the six-yard box. He wins the ball but sends his header just wide of the right post.

Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) unleashes a decent shot towards the roof of the net, but Koen Casteels thwarts him with a nice save. The ball is out of play. Bayer Leverkusen will have a chance to score from a corner.
Koen Casteels blocks Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen)'s effort from the edge of the box.
Goal! Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) pounced on a loose ball inside the penalty area and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:0.
A yellow card for a tackle by Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen). Patrick Ittrich doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) had a good opportunity from long range. His shot was directed towards the bottom right corner, but Bernd Leno was alert and made a comfortable save.
Patrick Ittrich shows the yellow card to Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) for a heavy challenge.
Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) heads the ball into the middle after a splendid cross. This timely header produces a wonderful moment.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
Goal! Wendell puts a cross into the box and finds Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the bottom left corner. He makes it 2:1.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) for Josuha Guilavogui.
Jakub Blaszczykowski (Wolfsburg) scores ! It's a nice solo effort and he beats the goalkeeper with an accurate strike into the bottom right corner.
Heiko Herrlich has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen) replacing Lars Bender.
A substitution has been made. Jakub Blaszczykowski is replaced by Nany Landry Dimata (Wolfsburg).
Dominik Kohr will be replaced by Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen).
Felix Uduokhai (Wolfsburg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Patrick Ittrich didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Here comes a substitution. Victor Osimhen (Wolfsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Divock Origi.
Heiko Herrlich prepares a substitution. Julian Brandt is replaced by Joel Pohjanpalo (Bayer Leverkusen).

Yunus Malli sprays a wonderful pass out to Victor Osimhen (Wolfsburg), who cannot get enough power or direction to cause Bernd Leno problems and the goalkeeper is able to watch the ball go just wide of the right post.
The foul by Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Patrick Ittrich.
That's it for today, Patrick Ittrich has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.

An amazing individual effort from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and makes it 1:0. Peter Gulacsi was helpless.

Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) is quickest to the rebound inside the box and produces a decent strike towards the bottom left corner. Nevertheless, the goalkeeper pulls off a spectacular save to keep the ball out of the net. Great goalkeeping!

Goal! Marcel Halstenberg peels away from his marker to connect with the resulting free kick and heads the ball towards Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig), who does brilliantly to nod the ball into the net. He makes it 1:1.
A yellow card for a tackle by Naby Keita (RB Leipzig). Deniz Aytekin doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Nuri Sahin (Dortmund) pounced on a rebound on the edge of the box and his shot goes a whisker over the crossbar.
Goal! Bruma passes the ball to the feet of Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 1:2.
Bernardo (RB Leipzig) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Deniz Aytekin ignores the protests.
Mario Gotze (Dortmund) collects a rebound and his promising attempt heads towards the bottom left corner, but Peter Gulacsi keeps it out with an amazing save.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Deniz Aytekin has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Peter Bosz has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) comes on the pitch for Jeremy Toljan.
The game is over for Nuri Sahin. Julian Weigl (Dortmund) comes on for the second half.
Half-time substitution. Naby Keita will not participate anymore and Diego Demme (RB Leipzig) is coming on.
Sokratis (Dortmund) is penalised after knocking an opponent down. It's a penalty! What an opportunity to score for RB Leipzig.
Deniz Aytekin shows a red card with no hesitation. Sokratis (Dortmund) can have an early bath and think about his challenge.
Roman Burki (Dortmund) is punished with the yellow card.
Goal! Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Roman Burki into the bottom right corner.
Here is a change. Maximilian Philipp is going off and Peter Bosz gives the last tactical orders to Marc Bartra (Dortmund).
The game is interrupted. Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.

Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) must have known he would be sent off for this foul, but he had to stop the opponent at all costs. Deniz Aytekin shows him a second yellow card and the game has ended for him.
Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle and signals a foul after Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig) brought his opponent down. The referee uncompromisingly points to the spot and it's a penalty to Dortmund.
Goal! Peter Gulacsi gets a hand on the penalty from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), but can't stop it from flying inside the right post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jean-Kevin Augustin leaves the pitch and Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig) comes on.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Gonzalo Castro, but he can't get on the end of the pass.
Mario Gotze (Dortmund) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Deniz Aytekin didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Diego Demme (RB Leipzig) for a tough tackle.

Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund) leaps highest in the penalty area to get on the end of a cross from the set piece, and he produces a promising goal-bound header towards the right side of the goal, but Peter Gulacsi pulls off a decent save to deny him.
Substitution. Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Marcel Sabitzer walks off.
A pass into the box finds Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the middle of the goal, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Peter Gulacsi denies him.
Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund) strikes the rebound, but it goes well over the bar.
Deniz Aytekin is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
This is definitely not what Julian Schuster (Freiburg) wanted. Attempting to intercept an offensive pass, he scored an own goal and made it 1:0.

Christian Gunter sets up Mike Frantz (Freiburg) with a lofted pass in the centre of the box, but his header flies just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayern Munich.
Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) gets to a rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball into the roof of the net, and thus alter the score to 2:0.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.

Mats Hummels passes to Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom right corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 3:0.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Ryan Kent.
Jupp Heynckes has decided to substitute Javi Martinez and he is replaced by Sebastian Rudy (Bayern Munich).
Today's match ends for Mike Frantz who will be replaced by Yoric Ravet (Freiburg).
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) is teed up on the edge of the box by Thomas Muller, and his howitzer of a shot into the bottom right corner gives the keeper no chance. 4:0.
The game has come to an end for Florian Niederlechner. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Marco Terrazzino (Freiburg).
Here is a change. Thomas Muller is going off and Jupp Heynckes gives the last tactical orders to Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich).
Substitution. Jerome Boateng will be replaced by Niklas Sule (Bayern Munich).
GOAL! Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) finishes off a sublime move with a delightful back-heel goal. Kingsley Coman provided the assist with a brilliant pass. 5:0.
That's it for today, Frank Willenborg has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
GOAL! Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Philipp Tschauner, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 0:1.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a tough tackle.
Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a yellow card from Bastian Dankert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Salif Sane (Hannover) jumped highest inside the box to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Pirmin Schwegler. His header bounced off the ground and went inside the left post behind the goalkeeper. It's 1:1.
Martin Harnik (Hannover) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post.
A yellow card for a tackle by Florian Hubner (Hannover). Bastian Dankert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Bastian Dankert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Niko Kovac has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on the pitch for Taleb Tawatha.

Marius Wolf (Eintracht Frankfurt) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the bottom left corner, but Philipp Tschauner easily deals with the threat. The referee points to the corner flag and Eintracht Frankfurt will take a corner.
Goal disallowed! Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) scores but Bastian Dankert blows his whistle for a foul.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Niclas Fullkrug will be replaced by Ihlas Bebou (Hannover).
Niko Kovac prepares a substitution. Marius Wolf is replaced by Aymen Barkok (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Felix Klaus (Hannover) comes onto the pitch so that Marvin Bakalorz can be given a rest.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Matthias Ostrzolek (Hannover), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Bastian Dankert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Salif Sane (Hannover) volleys the ball on the edge of the box after a rebound. It's a great effort and has Lukas Hradecky scrambling, but it flies just wide of the left post.
That will be all from Martin Harnik who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Jonathas (Hannover).
Bastian Dankert shows the yellow card to Felix Klaus (Hannover) for a heavy challenge.
What an absolute cracking goal! Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) hits a perfect volley from long range and the ball flies into the bottom left corner. Take a bow son.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ante Rebic leaves the pitch and Carlos Salcedo (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
Benjamin Brand shows a yellow card to Max Meyer (Schalke), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) receives a yellow card for infringement.
Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) receives a red card after his horrific challenge and is sent off!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Benjamin Brand has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Pal Dardai decided to make a change. Salomon Kalou is replaced by Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin).
Pal Dardai makes a switch. Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) is coming on in place of Ondrej Duda at the start of the second period.
PENALTY to Schalke! Great chance to score. Benjamin Brand blows his whistle and signals a foul after Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) brought his opponent down.
Goal! Rune Jarstein gets a hand on the penalty from Leon Goretzka (Schalke), but can't stop it from flying inside the left post.
Substitution. Mitchell Weiser walks off the pitch and Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin) comes on as a substitute.
Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Here is a change. Amine Harit is going off and Domenico Tedesco gives the last tactical orders to Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke).
Naldo passes to Guido Burgstaller (Schalke), who gets one-on-one with the keeper. His dummy grounds the keeper and he has a simple task lifting the ball over him into the net.
Domenico Tedesco has decided to make a change. Fabian Reese (Schalke) replaces Guido Burgstaller.
Substitution. Max Meyer makes his way off the pitch and Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) comes on as his replacement.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, but it is straight at Marwin Hitz.
Daniel Opare (Augsburg) connects with a cross from the side, but produces a header which goes way over the bar.
What a chance that is! Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the left post!
Close! Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post.

Marwin Hitz pulls off a great save to deny Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Manuel Grafe blows his whistle to start the second half.
Goal! Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) proves he's got the killer instinct as when totally unmarked inside the box he powers a crashing header past the helpless goalkeeper.
It's time for a substitution. Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) comes on in place of Kerem Demirbay.
Manuel Baum has decided to make a change. Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) replaces Alfred Finnbogason.
Stefan Posch (Hoffenheim) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails a few inches over the bar!
Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) plants his close-range header just wide of the left post after a cross into the box.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) attempts to score from a mid-range free kick, but he curls his effort a few inches over the crossbar.

Goal! Philipp Max puts Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) in the clear with just the keeper to beat. He takes his shot early from the edge of the box and scores beautifully into the right side of the goal. 1:1.
Substitution. Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim) on for Nadiem Amiri.
Manuel Baum has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jan Moravek (Augsburg) replacing Ja-Cheol Koo.
A substitution has been made. Steven Zuber goes off and Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim) comes on.

Goal! A terrific long pass from Florian Grillitsch picks out an unmarked Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) inside the box. He has time and space to pick his spot and slams the ball into the right side of the goal. 2:1.
Substitution. Kevin Danso walks off the pitch and Marco Richter (Augsburg) comes on as a substitute.
Own goal! Kevin Vogt (Hoffenheim) suffers a good deal of misfortune as he accidentally puts a pass from one of the attacking players into his own net. The score is 2:2.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) unleashes a shot straight into the bottom left corner. Good team effort!
Goal! Walace (Hamburger) fires the rebound into the bottom left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:1.
CHANCE! Bobby Wood (Hamburger) picks up a perfect pass inside the box, makes himself some space for a shot, but his effort goes just over the crossbar.
Levin Oztunali (Mainz) took a first-time shot from mid-range after he was put in the clear by a great pass, but the effort lacked a little accuracy and went just wide of the left post.

OFF THE POST! Danny Latza (Mainz) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.

OFF THE CROSSBAR! Andre Hahn (Hamburger) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Mergim Mavraj (Hamburger) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Brych ignores the protests.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
GOAL! Stefan Bell (Mainz) scores with a header from close range after Abdou Diallo headed a pin-point lofted cross into his path. It's 2:1.
Tatsuya Ito (Hamburger) beats the defender to the lofted pass inside the box, but can't control his shot and it flashes high over the bar.
Substitution. Tatsuya Ito makes his way off the pitch and Filip Kostic (Hamburger) comes on as his replacement.
Goal! Daniel Brosinski pulls the ball back for Danny Latza (Mainz) on the edge of the box, and he beats the keeper with a fine strike into the middle of the goal. 3:1.
Sandro Schwarz prepares a substitution. Alexandru Maxim is replaced by Suat Serdar (Mainz).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Walace leaves the pitch and Sven Schipplock (Hamburger) comes on.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) replacing Robin Quaison.
The referee shows the yellow card to Abdou Diallo (Mainz).
Substitution. Sejad Salihovic (Hamburger) on for Bobby Wood.
Levin Oztunali will be replaced by Kenan Kodro (Mainz).
The players claim that Abdou Diallo (Mainz) handled the ball inside the box and it seems they are right. The advantage of a penalty kick is given to Hamburger SV.
Goal! Sejad Salihovic (Hamburger) puts the ball into the right side of the goal past the outstretched arm of Rene Adler.
That's it for today, Felix Brych has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.
Yuya Osako (Koln) misses a great chance! He latches on to a fine cross into the box, but his effort misses the right post by a whisker.
Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) lacks options so goes solo. It's a fine run and good shot from inside the box, but it flies just over the bar.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Koln) produces a dangerous low pass into the penalty area, but the defence manage to cut it out.
Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) fails to turn the rebound in from a promising position. The goalkeeper pulls off a superb save and denies his effort. FC Koln win a corner.
Problems for Hannes Wolf as Marcin Kaminski is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Andreas Beck (VfB Stuttgart) replaces him.
Golden opportunity! Simon Zoller (Koln) lost his marker inside the box, only to shoot just wide of the left post after receiving a good pass.
It looked like the long-range shot by Matthias Lehmann (Koln) would end up in the net, but the effort went slightly over the bar. The goalkeeper was quite lucky this time.

Timo Horn doesn't have to worry about this one. Andreas Beck plays a pass into the feet of Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart), who is unable to find the target as his effort from inside the box goes well wide of the right post.
Benjamin Cortus shows a yellow card to Frederik Sorensen (1. FC Koln), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Wow, what an escape. Josip Brekalo (VfB Stuttgart) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked.

Well-positioned Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) was first to the rebound and fired in a shot towards the middle, but Timo Horn reacted superbly to keep the ball out. The fans could not believe their eyes. It was a miraculous stop!
Fantastic team goal! Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) was set free in the area by Simon Terodde and fired past Timo Horn. 1:0.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Peter Stoger has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Claudio Pizarro (1. FC Koln) comes on the pitch for Salih Ozcan.
The ball is laid off to Josip Brekalo (VfB Stuttgart) on the edge of the box. He shoots through a crowd of players towards the left side of the goal and forces Timo Horn to make a decent save.
Here's the change. Josip Brekalo leaves the pitch and Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) comes on as a substitute.
Benjamin Cortus has issued a yellow card to Konstantin Rausch (1. FC Koln).

Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the left post only for Timo Horn to dive and make a save. Stuttgart force a corner. They send men into the box.
Substitution. Sehrou Guirassy (Koln) has come on for Milos Jojic.
Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) received a killer pass and let fly from close range. Unluckily for him, it flew just wide of the left post.
Here is a change. Konstantin Rausch is going off and Peter Stoger gives the last tactical orders to Tim Handwerker (1. FC Koln).
Lukas Klunter (1. FC Koln) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Benjamin Cortus ignores the protests.
Goal! Dominique Heintz (Koln) is teed up on the edge of the box by Simon Zoller, and his howitzer of a shot into the top left corner gives the keeper no chance. 1:1.
The game has come to an end for Anastasios Donis. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart).
Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Benjamin Cortus didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

It's a goal! Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) displays superb quick feet and dribbling as he jinks his way through multiple challenges and takes a shot from inside the box, which is deflected and goes past stranded Timo Horn. 2:1.
Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) gets a yellow card. The referee Benjamin Cortus made the right call.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
Yuya Osako (Koln) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the left side of the goal is brilliantly kept out by the goalkeeper.
What a save from Peter Gulacsi! Yuya Osako (1. FC Koln) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig) hits the left post with a rebound from just outside the box.
The goalkeeper pulls off a remarkable reflex save to deny a rebound from Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig)! That was a huge opportunity!
Goal! Marcel Sabitzer tees up Lukas Klostermann (RB Leipzig) inside the box, and he keeps his cool to find the bottom right corner. 0:1.
Ibrahima Konate (RB Leipzig) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.

Konstantin Rausch (1. FC Koln) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the bottom right corner is blocked by Peter Gulacsi, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Diego Demme (RB Leipzig) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.

A sweet pass finds Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) on the edge of the box, and he drills the ball towards the right side of the goal. Timo Horn is almost caught out but pulls off a brilliant save at the last second.
Golden chance! Milos Jojic (Koln) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Felix Zwayer has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to substitute Ibrahima Konate and he is replaced by Kevin Kampl (RB Leipzig).
Substitution. Diego Demme makes way for Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Claudio Pizarro (Koln) will replace Jhon Cordoba.
A goal, which was scored by Leonardo Bittencourt (1. FC Koln), was disallowed due to offside.

What an opportunity! Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) wastes a huge chance as he latches on to a perfect pass and produces a first-time blast from point blank range. It goes low towards the middle of the goal, but Timo Horn reacts superbly to keep the ball out.
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) beats an opponent and drives towards the edge of the penalty area. He steadies himself and hits a tremendous shot that flashes a whisker past the right post.
Substitution. Tim Handwerker (Koln) has come on for Frederik Sorensen.
GOAL! Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) latches onto a cross and sends the ball into the top right corner with a powerful header!
It's a goal! Yuya Osako (Koln) bursts into the box to get on the end of a whipped in cross from Tim Handwerker and scores magnificently from close range into the right side of the goal. 1:2.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Lukas Klunter will be replaced by Marco Hoger (Koln).
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Bernardo (RB Leipzig) replacing Bruma.
That's it for today, Felix Zwayer has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Goal! A nice lofted pass into the box by Jerome Boateng is pounced on by Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich). His close-range header flashes past Rune Jarstein and into the left of the goal. 0:1.

Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) races through the centre to the edge of the box then lets fly with a rocket of a shot that flies a whisker wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayern Munich.

Chance! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Franck Ribery, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hertha Berlin.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) scores a great goal! He skips past the defending players, gets inside the penalty area and sends a low drive inside the left post. The keeper can't reach the ball which ends up inside the back of the net.

Goal! Genki Haraguchi displays great vision and sends a pass to Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 1:2.
Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Harm Osmers ignores the protests.
Goal! The ball from the resulting free kick arrives at the feet of Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) inside the box, and he fires a lovely shot into the bottom left corner.
It is time for a substitution. Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) is on for Arjen Robben.
Franck Ribery has picked up an injury and is replaced by Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich).
Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Harm Osmers's book.
That's the end of the game for Ondrej Duda, who is replaced by Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin).
Willy Sagnol has decided to make a change. Niklas Sule (Bayern Munich) replaces Jerome Boateng.
The substitution is prepared. Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Vladimir Darida.
Substitution. Genki Haraguchi will be replaced by Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin).
Harm Osmers is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Amazing piece of skill! Robin Hack (Hoffenheim) picks up a cross on the edge of the 18-yard box and hammers the ball precisely into the bottom left corner. What a finish!

Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) scores a goal after nicely controlling a pass and unleashing a powerful close-range shot into the bottom right corner. The keeper couldn't do anything to stop this wonderful effort.
Caglar Soyuncu (Freiburg) rises high to head the corner in the net and beyond the goalkeeper.
Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) earns the yellow card.
The booking goes to Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg).
Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) sees a yellow card from Daniel Siebert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Problems for Julian Nagelsmann as Robin Hack is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Philipp Ochs (Hoffenheim) replaces him.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Julian Nagelsmann gives a chance to Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim) and Lukas Rupp is off.
That will be all from Marco Terrazzino who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Yoric Ravet (Freiburg).
Substitution. Steven Zuber is replaced by Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim).
The foul by Janik Haberer (Freiburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Daniel Siebert.
Here is a change. Mike Frantz is going off and Christian Streich gives the last tactical orders to Nils Petersen (Freiburg).
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Dennis Geiger (Hoffenheim), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
It will be a substitution. Florian Kath (Freiburg) is ready to enter the pitch as Florian Niederlechner walks off.
Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and drills a shot into the bottom left corner in trademark fashion.
Julian Schuster (Freiburg) scores an own goal! No one would like to be in his position right now.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Robert Bauer (Werder Bremen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Deniz Aytekin had an easy-decision to make.
