That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Here comes a substitution. Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) is brought on as a substitute for Tatsuya Ito.
It will be a substitution. Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) is ready to enter the pitch as Florian Kainz walks off.
Alexander Nouri decides to make a substitution. Philipp Bargfrede will be replaced by Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen).
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Hamburger) for his blatant foul.
The game has come to an end for Albin Ekdal. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Walace (Hamburger).
Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) has tested the patience of referee Deniz Aytekin and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The manager makes a subsitution with Jann-Fiete Arp (Hamburger) coming on for Bobby Wood.
Alexander Nouri prepares a substitution. Fin Bartels is replaced by Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen).
Michael Zetterer (Werder Bremen) goes into the book for bad language. His vulgar comments could have made it worse. Luckily for him, it's a yellow card.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Goal! Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund) latches onto the ball inside the box and scores a fantastic back-heel goal. He makes it 0:1.

Philipp Max displays his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross deep into the box. Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) gets onto the scoresheet by superbly heading it into the roof of the net  1:1.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) picks up a pass and unleashes a strong shot from inside the box, but the goalkeeper is equal to it!
Goal! Andriy Yarmolenko finds Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) on the edge of the area, he times his run to perfection and beautifully chips the ball over the goalkeeper. 1:2.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) dribbles into the box, but Marwin Hitz is quick enough to come off his line and stop him.
Rani Khedira is being substituted because of an injury. Manuel Baum sends Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) on the pitch.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Marco Fritz has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
A substitution has been made. Mahmoud Dahoud goes off and Gonzalo Castro (Dortmund) comes on.
Marco Fritz shows the yellow card to Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) for a heavy challenge.
Here is a change. Andriy Yarmolenko is going off and Peter Bosz gives the last tactical orders to Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) replaces Michael Gregoritsch.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball towards the roof of the net. Marwin Hitz shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net. Corner kick. Dortmund will have an opportunity.
Jeremy Toljan (Dortmund) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Marco Fritz ignores the protests.
Marcel Heller (Augsburg) sees a yellow card from Marco Fritz after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) holds his opponent to prevent him from getting the ball and the referee blows for a foul after seeing the whole situation. The referee gives a penalty to Dortmund after a quick talk with the linesman, who had apparently seen the situation from a better perspective.
Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) picks up a yellow card.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) has a great chance to score from the penalty. He shoots to the middle of the goal, but only into the gloves of a well-prepared Marwin Hitz.
Manuel Baum has decided to make a change. Erik Thommy (Augsburg) replaces Marcel Heller.
Here comes a substitution. Omer Toprak (Dortmund) is brought on as a substitute for Shinji Kagawa.
Daniel Opare (Augsburg) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
That's it for today, Marco Fritz has blown his whistle and the game is over.
We have just got the news that the match will be delayed due to technical problems.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Martin Harnik (Hannover) connects with a cross and powers a header goalwards, but his effort goes just over the bar.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Christian Dingert starts the second half.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to substitute Felix Klaus and he is replaced by Sebastian Maier (Hannover).
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a pass on the edge of the box, but he can't get any power into the shot and fails to trouble Philipp Tschauner.
The substitution is prepared. Raul Bobadilla (B. Monchengladbach) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Raffael.

Matthias Ginter (B. Monchengladbach) outjumped the defenders to meet the ball from the free kick and plants a precise header from deep inside the box towards the net! The goalkeeper shows his reflexes and superbly keeps the ball out!
It's a yellow card for Pirmin Schwegler (Hannover).
Mickael Cuisance floats a lovely ball in from the free kick. Matthias Ginter (B. Monchengladbach) gathers the ball and strikes it into the bottom right corner, increasing the score to 1:0.
The referee shows the yellow card to Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) comes onto the pitch so that Marvin Bakalorz can be given a rest.
Pirmin Schwegler takes over corner duties and expertly finds Martin Harnik (Hannover), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the right side of the goal. The score is now 1:1.
A substitution has been made. Fabian Johnson is replaced by Vincenzo Grifo (B. Monchengladbach).
Dieter Hecking decides to make a substitution. Mickael Cuisance will be replaced by Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach).

OFF THE BAR! Martin Harnik (Hannover) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the crossbar! It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Substitution. Florian Hubner (Hannover) has come on for Ihlas Bebou.
Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach) gets in a header from close range after a lofted pass, but the effort flies just over the bar.
Poor challenge! Salif Sane (Hannover) is penalised for tripping and Christian Dingert blows his whistle. The referee uncompromisingly points to the spot and it's a penalty to B. Monchengladbach.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) strikes a great penalty kick that ends up in the back of the net!
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Brych had an easy-decision to make.
Goal! Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) pounced on a loose ball inside the penalty area and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:0.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Substitution. Jonathan de Guzman makes his way off the pitch and Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as his replacement.
That will be all from Santiago Ascacibar who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Simon Terodde (VfB Stuttgart).
It is time for a substitution. Josip Brekalo (VfB Stuttgart) is on for Andreas Beck.

Simon Terodde (VfB Stuttgart) jumped highest inside the box to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Dennis Aogo. His header bounced off the ground and went inside the right post behind the goalkeeper. It's 1:1.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Marc Stendera as he is replaced by Slobodan Medojevic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Simon Falette (Eintracht Frankfurt) makes an ugly challenge on his opponent and receives a red card from the referee!
A substitution has been made. Ante Rebic goes off and Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
It will be a substitution. Ebenzeer Ofori (VfB Stuttgart) is ready to enter the pitch as Chadrac Akolo walks off.
Goal! Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) unleashes a first-time shot from inside the box and beats the goalkeeper into the bottom left corner. 2:1.
Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) has tested the patience of referee Robert Hartmann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Koen Casteels pulls off a great save to deny Yoshinori Muto (Mainz), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal. The referee blows his whistle, Mainz are awarded a corner kick.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) was quite harsh and Robert Hartmann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Robert Hartmann blows his whistle to start the second half.
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Stefan Bell (Mainz) for his blatant foul.
Goal! The corner is whipped in and Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) is in the right place at the right time, planting his header perfectly into the left side of the goal. He makes it 1:0.
Fabian Frei comes off the pitch to be replaced by Alexandru Maxim (Mainz).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Pablo De Blasis will be replaced by Viktor Fischer (Mainz).
Stefan Bell (Mainz) had a golden opportunity. He volleyed from point blank range towards the bottom right corner, but Koen Casteels was alert and made an amazing save!
Levin Oztunali (Mainz) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Robert Hartmann had an easy-decision to make.
Goal! Levin Oztunali plays a hopeful cross into a crowded box. Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) times his jump perfectly and sends a header into the top left corner from close in. 1:1.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Giulio Donati (Mainz) was quite harsh and Robert Hartmann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Substitution. Daniel Didavi makes way for Paul-Georges N'Tep (Wolfsburg).
Martin Schmidt has decided to make a change. Riechedly Bazoer (Wolfsburg) replaces Josuha Guilavogui.
Today's match ends for Divock Origi who will be replaced by Victor Osimhen (Wolfsburg).
Sandro Schwarz has decided to substitute Levin Oztunali and he is replaced by Karim Onisiwo (Mainz).
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Danny Latza (Mainz) for his blatant foul.
Paul-Georges N'Tep picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
The free kick from the edge of the box is taken by Alexandru Maxim (Mainz), who fires in a direct effort just wide of the right post. What a chance!
The match has ended for Paul-Georges N'Tep as he picks up his second yellow card and referee Robert Hartmann pulls out a red card!
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Weston McKennie (Schalke), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.
Bastian Oczipka (Schalke) has an effort from distance and sends the ball towards the right post, but the goalkeeper is equal to it. The ball goes out of play. Schalke are awarded a corner kick.
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) can showcase his brilliant free kick ability, particularly from a distance like this. He hits the ball perfectly and it ends up inside the right post.

That didn't go as planned! Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) tried his luck from the edge of the box, but his effort towards the right side of the goal was too weak to get past Bernd Leno, who easily kept it out. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Schalke.
What a big chance! Bastian Oczipka (Schalke) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball well wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Guido Winkmann starts the second half.
Heiko Herrlich makes a switch. Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming on in place of Aranguiz at the start of the second period.
Half-time substitution. Heiko Herrlich decided to make a change. Karim Bellarabi is replaced by Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen).

Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a diagonal pass, bursts into the box and shoots towards the middle of the goal. Ralf Fahrmann is well positioned, though, and it's a comfortable save. The referee signals a corner kick to Bayer Leverkusen.
Here is a change. Breel Embolo is going off and Domenico Tedesco gives the last tactical orders to Guido Burgstaller (Schalke).
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) latches onto a loose ball inside the box but slams it high over the bar.
Goal! Lars Bender plays it to Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen), whose deflected shot from inside the box goes past the helpless Ralf Fahrmann. 1:1.
The referee Guido Winkmann awards Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) a yellow card.
Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Bastian Oczipka (Schalke) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Guido Winkmann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) sees a yellow card from Guido Winkmann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
A yellow card for a tackle by Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen). Guido Winkmann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
A terrific attempt by Amine Harit (Schalke) from the edge of the box slides just narrowly past the right post.
Julian Brandt goes off the pitch and Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
Domenico Tedesco has decided to make a change. Franco Di Santo (Schalke) replaces Evgen Konoplyanka.
The foul by Matija Nastasic (Schalke) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Guido Winkmann.
Here comes a substitution. Max Meyer (Schalke) is brought on as a substitute for Weston McKennie.
The goalkeeper denies the long-range shot from Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen). It wasn't such a big threat for him.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a great chance inside the box and drills a shot into the bottom right corner.
Walace (Hamburger) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Kampka ignores the protests.

Leon Bailey sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot into the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 2:0.
Robert Kampka shows a yellow card to Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Hamburger), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

A promising move ends with a clever pass to Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen), who hits a first-time shot at goal that rises just over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hamburger SV.
Robert Kampka shows a yellow card to Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) for a tough tackle.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Robert Kampka has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Markus Gisdol makes a switch. Bakery Jatta (Hamburger) is coming on in place of Sejad Salihovic at the start of the second period.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Walace comes off for Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger).
Substitution. Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Admir Mehmedi walks off.
Andre Hahn (Hamburger) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayer Leverkusen.
Bayer Leverkusen will have an indirect free kick from inside the box!
The foul by Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Robert Kampka.
It will be a substitution. Tatsuya Ito (Hamburger) is ready to enter the pitch as Andre Hahn walks off.
Goal! Lucas Alario puts the ball on a plate for Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 3:0.
Heiko Herrlich decides to make a substitution. Aranguiz will be replaced by Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen).
Substitution. Lucas Alario makes his way off the pitch and Joel Pohjanpalo (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on as his replacement.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Kenan Karaman plays a lofted ball in from the by-line towards Ihlas Bebou (Hannover), who places his header from near the edge of the six-yard box well wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and FC Koln will have a goal kick.

What a big chance! Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for FC Koln.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Frederik Sorensen (1. FC Koln), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Salif Sane (Hannover) wasted a great chance as he climbed high to connect with a cross from the free kick inside the penalty area. He planted a header against the bar and it glanced away off it.
Kenan Karaman (Hannover) was probably a bit loose with his words to Daniel Siebert, who decides to show him a yellow.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Daniel Siebert has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
Daniel Siebert shows the yellow card to Julian Korb (Hannover) for a heavy challenge.
Lukas Klunter (Koln) is first to react to a loose pass inside the box, but slices his shot just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hannover.
A yellow card for a tackle by Konstantin Rausch (1. FC Koln). Daniel Siebert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Substitution. Yuya Osako makes way for Sehrou Guirassy (Koln).
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Felix Klaus (Hannover) replacing Niclas Fullkrug.
Substitution. Pirmin Schwegler will be replaced by Manuel Schmiedebach (Hannover).
Here's the change. Jhon Cordoba leaves the pitch and Marco Hoger (Koln) comes on as a substitute.
Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Here is a change. Leonardo Bittencourt is going off and Peter Stoger gives the last tactical orders to Milos Jojic (1. FC Koln).
Manuel Schmiedebach (Hannover) sees a yellow card from Daniel Siebert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
That's the end of the game for Ihlas Bebou, who is replaced by Charlison Benschop (Hannover).
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) misses a great chance to score after his effort hits the left post!

Goal! Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a brilliant pass and fires a first-time shot inside the left post. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang assisted in the goal. 1:0.

It's a goal! Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund) shows off his superb ability as he volleys the ball from inside the box into the top left corner. The assist goes to Jeremy Toljan and the score changes to 2:0.
Goal! Maximilian Philipp passes the ball to the feet of Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 3:0.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a cross from the resulting free kick. He jumps high but his towering header lacks a little bit of accuracy and glances off the left-hand post.
Goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 4:0.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach) was quite harsh and Manuel Grafe didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
It will be a substitution. Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach) is ready to enter the pitch as Raffael walks off.
Goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 5:0. He was ably assisted there by Mahmoud Dahoud.
Peter Bosz decides to make a substitution. Christian Pulisic will be replaced by Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund).
Goal! Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) pounced on a loose ball inside the penalty area and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 5:1.
Here comes a substitution. Dan-Axel Zagadou (Dortmund) is brought on as a substitute for Lukasz Piszczek.
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Fabian Johnson.
A substitution has been made. Christoph Kramer goes off and Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) comes on.

Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Julian Weigl (Dortmund) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper into the top right corner of the net.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sokratis departs the field of play to be replaced by Marc Bartra (Dortmund).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.

Havard Nordtveit (Hoffenheim) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the free kick. His accurate header would have probably ended up in the top right corner, but Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him.
Goal! Dennis Geiger (Hoffenheim) collects a pass and without hesitation fires an unstoppable shot into the bottom left corner.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Max Meyer (Schalke) was quite harsh and Sascha Stegemann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Nadiem Amiri is being substituted because of an injury. Julian Nagelsmann sends Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim) on the pitch.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) gets to a rebound in the six-yard box and his effort smashes off the crossbar.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) for Serge Gnabry.
CLOSE! Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the right post!
Domenico Tedesco has decided to substitute Franco Di Santo and he is replaced by Guido Burgstaller (Schalke).
Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) gathers the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot. The ball only rattles the right post.
Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Sascha Stegemann had an easy-decision to make.
Substitution. Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim) in, Steven Zuber out.
Domenico Tedesco decides to make a substitution. Weston McKennie will be replaced by Leon Goretzka (Schalke).
We are about to witness a substitution. Breel Embolo (Schalke) is replacing Max Meyer.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim).
What an opportunity! Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) wins the ball from the resulting set piece and unleashes a precise shot from inside the goal area which goes just over the crossbar!
The main referee, Sascha Stegemann, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Breel Embolo (Schalke) is given a yellow card for dissent.
Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) gets a yellow card.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Goal! Ralf Fahrmann makes a huge mistake and Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim) has an easy task to put the ball into the back of the net. 2:0.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) receives a yellow card!
The referee has issued a yellow card to Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin).
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Karim Rekik (Hertha Berlin) gives away a foul for a clumsy challenge. Referee Tobias Stieler saw the whole situation. The referee makes a quick call and points to the penalty spot. Big scoring opportunity for Mainz.
Karim Rekik (Hertha Berlin) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Booking. Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) receives a caution from the referee.
Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) keeps his cool and scores from the penalty spot.
Here comes a substitution. Alexandru Maxim is given a rest as he is replaced by Levin Oztunali (Mainz).
Pal Dardai decides to make a substitution. Per Skjelbred will be replaced by Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Suat Serdar (Mainz) will replace Fabian Frei.
Ondrej Duda comes off the pitch to be replaced by Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin).
Pal Dardai prepares a substitution. Mathew Leckie is replaced by Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin).

Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) had a good opportunity from long range. His shot was directed towards the bottom right corner, but Rene Adler was alert and made a comfortable save. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Hertha Berlin will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Viktor Fischer (Mainz) comes onto the pitch so that Yoshinori Muto can be given a rest.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) is sent off with a straight red card. He can't believe his eyes, but the referee's call is final.
Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
Levin Oztunali (Mainz) picked up a yellow card from referee.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Niko Kovac is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Gelson Fernandes suffers an injury and Kevin-Prince Boateng (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
Goal! Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) fires the rebound into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
Benjamin Brand has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) wastes a promising chance! He tries his luck with a shot from mid-range, but his effort hits the left post! A few inches to the right and it could have been a sweet goal!
Substitution. Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) on for Daichi Kamada.
Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) takes the resulting free kick from the edge of the box. His rocket of a shot crashes against the crossbar! What a shot.
Kevin-Prince Boateng (Eintracht Frankfurt) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig) is cautioned by the referee.
Substitution. Sebastien Haller is replaced by Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Goal! Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot inside the left post. It's 2:0.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Jean-Kevin Augustin walks off the pitch to be replaced by Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig).

Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) meets a perfect cross from Marius Wolf deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces a low shot into the middle of the goal. The score has changed to 2:1.
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) gets to a rebound inside the goalmouth, but his header hits the bar and spins away!
The manager makes a subsitution with Bruma (RB Leipzig) coming on for Lukas Klostermann.
Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) is furious with himself as he misses a clear opportunity. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the right post.

Simon Falette (Eintracht Frankfurt) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from near the penalty spot wasn't accurate enough and the ball glanced away off the left post!
Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Benjamin Brand had an easy-decision to make.
It will be a substitution. Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig) is ready to enter the pitch as Timo Werner walks off.
That's it for today, Benjamin Brand has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Substitution. Ja-Cheol Koo did his best and is replaced by Jan Moravek (Augsburg).
Jan Moravek (Augsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Harm Osmers had an easy-decision to make.
The game has begun to heat up. Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Josip Brekalo leaves the pitch and Orel Mangala (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) has tested the patience of referee Harm Osmers and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Here comes a substitution. Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Francisco Caiuby.
Hannes Wolf has decided to substitute Anastasios Donis and he is replaced by Daniel Ginczek (VfB Stuttgart).
Substitution. Andreas Beck is replaced by Takuma Asano (VfB Stuttgart).
Alfred Finnbogason will be replaced by Sergio Cordova (Augsburg).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.

Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen) wasted a great chance as he climbed high to connect with a cross from the free kick inside the penalty area. He produced a header which went wide of the left by a whisker.
Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen) weaves through the defence and gets one-on-one with the keeper, but fails to score.
Robert Bauer (Werder Bremen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Benedikt Kempkes didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) is booked for saying more than Benedikt Kempkes was willing to tolerate.

Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) finds himself some space just outside the box, collects a rebound and sends an effort in on goal. Jiri Pavlenka pulls off a fantastic reflex save to stop the ball going in off the crossbar. The linesman points to the corner flag, Freiburg are going to take it.

Mike Frantz (Freiburg) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Jiri Pavlenka guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Lovely run from Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg). He finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper, lines up a shot, but the keeper boldly launches himself to intercept the ball.
Benedikt Kempkes shows a yellow card to Caglar Soyuncu (Freiburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Benedikt Kempkes blows his whistle to start the second half.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Marco Terrazzino as he is replaced by Ryan Kent (Freiburg).
Alexander Nouri has decided to substitute Philipp Bargfrede and he is replaced by Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen).
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Florian Niederlechner.
Philipp Lienhart (Freiburg) rises high to connect with a cross from the corner kick, but his powerful header from center of the box hits the left post!

Alexander Schwolow doesn't have to worry about this one. Fin Bartels plays a pass into the feet of Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen), who is unable to find the target as his effort from inside the box goes well wide of the right post.
CHANCE! Ludwig Augustinsson (Werder Bremen) picks up a perfect pass inside the box, makes himself some space for a shot, but his effort goes just over the crossbar.
Alexander Nouri has decided to make a change. Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) replaces Florian Kainz.
Today's match ends for Janik Haberer who will be replaced by Florian Kath (Freiburg).

Alexander Schwolow was forced into action to thwart Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom right corner but couldn't beat the keeper.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.

Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) gets to the ball from the resulting corner and tries his luck with a shot, but one of the defenders steps in to block the effort. Corner kick. Bayern Munich will have an opportunity.
Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Christian Dingert ignores the protests.
Marcel Tisserand (Wolfsburg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Christian Dingert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The free kick from a promising distance is taken by Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who fires in a direct effort just wide of the left post. What a chance!
It looked like the long-range shot by Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) would end up in the net, but the effort went slightly over the bar. The goalkeeper was quite lucky this time.
Today's referee Christian Dingert rightly decides to book William (Wolfsburg) for his harsh tackle.
Marcel Tisserand (Wolfsburg) makes a rough challenge and Christian Dingert blows his whistle for a foul. That's a penalty to Bayern Munich! They have a good chance to score now.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) calmly steps up and places the ball inside the right post.
Goal! Rafinha passes the ball to Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) and he fires in a shot from the edge of the box which is deflected. Koen Casteels couldn't do anything about it. 2:0.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Christian Dingert has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Here is a change after the half-time break. William is replaced by Jakub Blaszczykowski (Wolfsburg).
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) is afforded space inside the box after collecting a pass, but the chance is wasted as his shot goes harmlessly over the crossbar.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) sends a powerful shot from a long-range free kick and the ball goes into the back of the net after the goalkeeper makes a horrible mistake!
What a big chance! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
Substitution. Arturo Vidal walks off the pitch and Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
Martin Schmidt prepares a substitution. Ignacio Camacho is replaced by Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg).
Koen Casteels blocks a long-range effort from Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) towards the left side of the goal. Bayern Munich have been awarded a corner kick.
CHANCE! Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he blazes his shot well over the top.

The ball hits the back of the net! Paul Verhaegh crosses the ball in, Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) peels away from his marker near the penalty spot and plants a header past Sven Ulreich and in off the left post. He displayed his eye for goal there with an excellent finish. 2:2.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Divock Origi leaves the pitch and Riechedly Bazoer (Wolfsburg) comes on.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Arjen Robben will be replaced by James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich).
Carlo Ancelotti has decided to substitute Franck Ribery and he is replaced by Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
A pass into the box finds Mike Frantz (Freiburg) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the middle of the goal, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Philipp Tschauner denies him.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Tobias Stieler starts the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Andre Breitenreiter probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Florian Hubner. He is replaced by Ihlas Bebou (Hannover).
Waldemar Anton (Hannover) commits an ugly challenge. The referee sees it and immediately blows his whistle. PENALTY to Freiburg! Great chance to score.
Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) misses the penalty. His shot goes just wide of the right post.
Pirmin Schwegler (Hannover) sees a yellow card from Tobias Stieler after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Matthias Ostrzolek (Hannover) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Tobias Stieler didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket. Freiburg are awarded a mid-range free kick.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Manuel Schmiedebach (Hannover) is coming onto the pitch as Pirmin Schwegler cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Goal! A precise cut back on the goal line from Niclas Fullkrug finds Martin Harnik (Hannover) right in front of goal, and he easily buries the ball low into the middle of the goal. 0:1.
A yellow card for a tackle by Felix Klaus (Hannover). Tobias Stieler doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mike Frantz leaves the pitch and Nils Petersen (Freiburg) comes on.
Here is a change. Janik Haberer is going off and Christian Streich gives the last tactical orders to Ryan Kent (Freiburg).
Salif Sane (Hannover) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Tobias Stieler ignores the protests.
GOAL - 1:1! The corner comes over and Nicolas Hofler flicks on with his head to Nils Petersen (Freiburg), who makes no mistake and fires the ball into the back of the net.
The referee signals a substitution. Kenan Karaman (Hannover) is brought on as a substitute for Niclas Fullkrug.
Christian Streich decides to make a substitution. Marco Terrazzino will be replaced by Florian Kath (Freiburg).
Ryan Kent (Freiburg) gets booked for the first time in this match.
The foul by Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Tobias Stieler.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) doesn't hesitate to shoot inside the box after a neat pass from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang. It's a good effort but just misses the left post.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) latches on to a superb cross into the box and hits the right post with his header. A stroke of luck for the goalkeeper!
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Hamburger) for a tough tackle.
Goal! Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 0:1.
Roman Burki pulls off a decent save! Andre Hahn (Hamburger) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header towards the middle of the net, but the effort is kept out.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger) was quite harsh and Felix Zwayer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Excellent touch by Christian Pulisic (Dortmund)! He latches on to an inch-perfect pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper reacts superbly and makes a save.

Christian Mathenia pulls off a fantastic save! Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header to the top left corner of the goal, but his effort is kept out. The ball is out of play. Dortmund win a corner kick.
Felix Zwayer has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Markus Gisdol is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Gotoku Sakai suffers an injury and Douglas Santos (Hamburger) comes on.
Close! Mergim Mavraj (Hamburger) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.
Goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 0:2.
Peter Bosz prepares a substitution. Shinji Kagawa is replaced by Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund).
Peter Bosz has decided to make a change. Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund) replaces Andriy Yarmolenko.
The substitution has been made. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger) has replaced Sejad Salihovic.
Andre Hahn (Hamburger) collects a pass on the edge of the box but he slips the ball just wide of the right post.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Lewis Holtby (Hamburger), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Mahmoud Dahoud plays a neat ball into the path of Christian Pulisic (Dortmund), who makes room for a shot and fires in off the left post! 0:3.
Peter Bosz has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jacob Bruun Larsen (Dortmund) replacing Dan-Axel Zagadou.
The substitution is prepared. Vasilije Janjicic (Hamburger) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Bobby Wood.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.

A neat pass is well received by Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the right post, but the goalkeeper makes an incredible diving save to block his shot.

Goal! Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the top left corner. Bernd Leno had no chance of reaching it. The score is 1:0.
Goal - 2:0! Vedad Ibisevic sprays a pass towards the centre of the box and Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) shows great composure to head the ball into the back of the net!

Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) attempts to convert a cross into a goal, but his promising header from near the penalty spot towards the bottom of the right post is denied by a decent save from Bernd Leno.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) was quite harsh and Deniz Aytekin didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Heiko Herrlich has made a change at the break. Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) has come on in place of Karim Bellarabi.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen) comes onto the pitch so that Wendell can be given a rest.
Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) gets to the rebound just outside the box, but his attempt is blocked by one of the defending players.
Panagiotis Retsos (Bayer Leverkusen) makes a really bad tackle on his opponent and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) replaces Ondrej Duda.
The manager makes a subsitution with Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin) coming on for Vedad Ibisevic.
Here comes a substitution. Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) is brought on as a substitute for Lars Bender.
Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the left side of the target, but Rune Jarstein easily deals with the threat.
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) picks it up in space and from the edge of the box lashes in a shot that is deflected past the helpless Rune Jarstein. 2:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) replaces Salomon Kalou.

That was close by Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes by a whisker over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Hertha Berlin will have a goal kick.
Rune Jarstein (Hertha Berlin) picks up a caution. Rune Jarstein (Hertha Berlin) obviously intended to delay the restart of play and the referee blows the whistle.
Deniz Aytekin is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Danny Latza (Mainz) is in the right place at the right time and perfectly hits a rebound into the bottom right corner.
Half-chance! Giulio Donati (Mainz) plays a pass into the box, but Oliver Baumann reacts well to snuff out the attack.

An amazing individual effort from Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball precisely into the bottom left corner and makes it 2:0. Oliver Baumann was helpless.
Kevin Vogt (Hoffenheim) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Manuel Grafe didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) scores! He latches on to a pass and produces a perfect strike from the edge of the box that goes into the roof of the net and past the goalkeeper.
A yellow card for a tackle by Danny Latza (Mainz). Manuel Grafe doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

CHANCE! Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim) goes very close! He gathers a cross inside the box and fires a sublime shot towards the right side of the goal, but Rene Adler produces an excellent save. The ball is out of play. Hoffenheim win a corner kick.
That was close by Levin Oztunali (Mainz)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.
Viktor Fischer (Mainz) is the one to unleash a good effort towards the bottom right corner. His shot, however, is saved by the goalkeeper. What a save!

A perfectly taken corner kick. Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim) gets on the end of it and produces a fantastic bullet header from around the penalty spot which goes inside the right post, increasing the score of today's match  2:2.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Julian Nagelsmann gives a chance to Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) and Felix Passlack is off.

Oliver Baumann makes a good save! Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) easily weaves through the defence and fires in from long range. His shot goes towards the bottom left corner but is saved by the keeper! The ball is out of play. Mainz will have a chance to score from a corner.
Here comes a substitution. Eugen Polanski is given a rest as he is replaced by Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim).
Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) violates the laws of the game and is shown a yellow card by the referee, but it could have been a straight red as well.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Jairo Samperio (Mainz) for Viktor Fischer.
Suat Serdar (Mainz) goes for goal but he directs his effort just wide of the left post.
Dennis Geiger (Hoffenheim) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Nadiem Amiri.

What a wasted opportunity by Jairo Samperio (Mainz)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the right side of the goal, but Oliver Baumann makes an astonishing save to thwart him. Corner kick. Mainz will have an opportunity.
A substitution has been made. Levin Oztunali is replaced by Pablo De Blasis (Mainz).
Dennis Geiger (Hoffenheim) is booked.
Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) picks up a yellow card.
Jairo Samperio (Mainz) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Goal! Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 2:3.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) comes onto the pitch so that Leon Balogun can be given a rest.
That's it for today, Manuel Grafe has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Timo Horn (Koln) jumps into a tackle and Martin Petersen blows his whistle for a foul. The referee gives a penalty kick to Eintracht Frankfurt!!
Goal! Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Timo Horn into the bottom left corner.

Timo Horn hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Kevin-Prince Boateng (Eintracht Frankfurt) shoots from the edge of the box towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save.
The defender bravely blocks the shot from Simon Zoller (1. FC Koln) inside the box. The ball goes out for a corner. FC Koln can continue in their attacking effort.
The booking goes to Matthias Lehmann (Koln).
Konstantin Rausch (Koln) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.

Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Timo Horn stops the ball from going inside right post. Eintracht Frankfurt have a corner.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Peter Stoger decided to make a change. Simon Zoller is replaced by Marcel Risse (1. FC Koln).
The referee signals a substitution. Milos Jojic (Koln) is brought on as a substitute for Marco Hoger.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Lukas Klunter (Koln) replaces Frederik Sorensen.
The substitution is prepared. Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Ante Rebic.
Niko Kovac has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Marius Wolf (Eintracht Frankfurt) replacing Kevin-Prince Boateng.
Yuya Osako (Koln) latches onto a loose ball inside the box but slams it high over the bar.
Substitution. Mijat Gacinovic makes his way off the pitch and Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as his replacement.
Taleb Tawatha (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a yellow card for infringement.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Alfred Finnbogason produces a sweet pass and picks out Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the middle of the net and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 1:0!
A long pass from defence releases Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) on the edge of the box, but his snap shot somehow flies just past the right post. The crowd thought it was in!
A pass into the box finds Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the bottom right corner, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Marwin Hitz denies him.

Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) receives a short pass inside a congested penalty area and takes a first-time shot. The effort heads towards the middle of the goal but Marwin Hitz blocks the shot with his legs.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Ralph Hasenhuttl probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Marvin Compper. He is replaced by Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig).
Half-time substitution. Michael Gregoritsch is replaced by Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg).
A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Philipp Max (Augsburg) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot towards the middle of the goal, but Yvon Mvogo pulls off an easy save.
Jan Moravek (Augsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Daniel Siebert had an easy-decision to make.
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) receives a yellow card for talking out of turn to the referee.
Ralph Hasenhuttl prepares a substitution. Yussuf Poulsen is replaced by Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig).

Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig) finds some space after collecting a superb pass and unleashes a shot directly towards the top left corner. Despite his effort the goalkeeper pulls off a beautiful save to deny him. RB Leipzig have a corner.
Here is a change. Jan Moravek is going off and Manuel Baum gives the last tactical orders to Marcel Heller (Augsburg).
Chance! Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Marcel Sabitzer, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the left post.
Kevin Kampl (RB Leipzig) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Daniel Baier (Augsburg) for a tough tackle.
The manager makes a subsitution with Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig) coming on for Benno Schmitz.
Manuel Baum has decided to make a change. Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) replaces Alfred Finnbogason.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.

A big opportunity is wasted by Sebastian Rudy (Bayern Munich), who makes a yard for himself and produces a mid-range rocket of a shot towards the roof of the net. Unfortunately for him, Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a fantastic save to stop the effort.
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) picks up a pass and unleashes a strong shot from inside the box, but the goalkeeper is equal to it!
Naldo (Schalke) touches the ball with his hand. PENALTY! A huge scoring opportunity for Bayern Munich.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Ralf Fahrmann into the bottom left corner.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich). Corentin Tolisso plays a fantastic through ball and finds James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom right corner. 0:2.
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Domenico Tedesco has made a change at the break. Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) has come on in place of Amine Harit.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) leaps high to meet a lofted pass inside the six-yard box, but his header only flies onto the right post and away off it!
That was close by Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the right post.
It is time for a substitution. Breel Embolo (Schalke) is on for Weston McKennie.
Yellow card! It's like Breel Embolo (Schalke) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Marco Fritz agrees and books him.
Today's match ends for Robert Lewandowski who will be replaced by Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich).

Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) receives a precise pass in the box and takes the shot early. The ball heads low towards the middle of the goal, but Sven Ulreich shows off his skills and makes a brilliant save to deny him.
Here is a change. Corentin Tolisso is going off and Carlo Ancelotti gives the last tactical orders to Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich).
Fantastic team goal! Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) was set free in the area by James Rodriguez and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the top right corner. 0:3.
We are about to witness a substitution. Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) is replacing Javi Martinez.
Domenico Tedesco has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Franco Di Santo (Schalke) replacing Guido Burgstaller.
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) for a tough tackle.

Ralf Fahrmann was forced into action to thwart James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom right corner but couldn't beat the keeper. The ball goes out of play. Bayern Munich are awarded a corner kick.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.

Jiri Pavlenka pulls off a great save to deny Divock Origi (Wolfsburg), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal. The ball is out of play and Wolfsburg manage to earn a corner.
It's in the back of the net! Paul Ntep de Madiba is the provider as he slips the ball to Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 1:0.
Felix Brych shows the yellow card to Jerome Gondorf (Werder Bremen) for a heavy challenge.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Alexander Nouri decided to make a change. Jerome Gondorf is replaced by Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen).
Half-time substitution. Maximilian Eggestein will not participate anymore and Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen) is coming on.
Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.

It's a goal! Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) makes it 1:1. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Thomas Delaney and planted his close-range header into the left side of the goal. Koen Casteels was helpless.
Ignacio Camacho (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow card from Felix Brych after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

What a great effort! Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen) decides to unleash a long-range shot. Despite hitting it very well, it scorches inches wide of the right post. We could have witnessed a magnificent goal.
Martin Schmidt prepares a substitution. Ignacio Camacho is replaced by Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg).
What a chance that is! Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the right post!
Substitution. Nany Landry Dimata (Wolfsburg) has come on for Paul Ntep de Madiba.
Substitution. Daniel Didavi is replaced by William (Wolfsburg).
Alexander Nouri decides to make a substitution. Fin Bartels will be replaced by Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen).
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
What a wasted chance that is! An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Simon Terodde (VfB Stuttgart) who sends his header well wide of the left post.
Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) sent a pass onto Raffael, who didn't get a chance to finish.
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, but it goes straight at Ron-Robert Zieler.
Orel Mangala (VfB Stuttgart) collects a wonderful lead pass and creates some space to smash the ball goalwards from long range. His shot goes painfully close to the right post!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Dieter Hecking has made a change at the break. Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach) has come on in place of Christoph Kramer.
Close! Simon Terodde (VfB Stuttgart) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post.

It's a goal! Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) shows off his superb ability as he volleys the ball from inside the box into the middle of the target. The assist goes to Nico Elvedi and the score changes to 1:0.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Josip Brekalo (VfB Stuttgart) for Takuma Asano.
Dennis Aogo (VfB Stuttgart) latches on to an accurate pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a strong shot towards goal, but his effort is denied by the well positioned keeper.
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Patrick Herrmann.
The foul by Simon Terodde (VfB Stuttgart) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Soren Storks.

Dennis Aogo (VfB Stuttgart) pulls the jersey of one of the opposition players and Soren Storks blows his whistle for a foul. The referee points to the penalty spot. It's a penalty for B. Monchengladbach!
Goal! Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Ron-Robert Zieler into left side of the goal.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ailton (VfB Stuttgart) is coming onto the pitch as Dennis Aogo cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Hannes Wolf has decided to substitute Orel Mangala and he is replaced by Dzenis Burnic (VfB Stuttgart).
Simon Terodde (VfB Stuttgart) crashes a header just wide of the left post from close range after a searching cross. He should have scored!
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Raffael walks off the pitch to be replaced by Raul Bobadilla (B. Monchengladbach).
Andreas Beck (VfB Stuttgart) picks up the rebound after chaos in the box and directs a sweet strike towards the top right corner. The goalkeeper, however, denies him with a stunning save.
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Goal! Andriy Yarmolenko picks out Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund) with a perfect cross, and he has no problem to nod the ball into an empty net. It's 1:0.

A big opportunity is wasted by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), who makes a yard for himself and produces a mid-range rocket of a shot towards the left side of the goal. Unfortunately for him, Timo Horn pulls off a fantastic save to stop the effort. The ball goes out for a corner. Dortmund can continue in their attacking effort.
Matthias Lehmann (1. FC Koln) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Patrick Ittrich didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Goal! 2:0. The ball rebounds to Sokratis (Dortmund) after a melee in the box, and he easily beats the keeper from close range.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
The manager makes a subsitution with Simon Zoller (Koln) coming on for Leonardo Bittencourt.
Lukas Klunter (Koln) probably handled the ball. Dortmund are awarded a penalty! What an opportunity to score.
Patrick Ittrich rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Lukas Klunter (1. FC Koln).
Goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Timo Horn into the bottom left corner.
Goal! Lukasz Piszczek plays a pass to the feet of Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), and he shoots inside the right post from inside the box. It's 4:0.
Jhon Cordoba (1. FC Koln) attempts to discuss the decision with Patrick Ittrich, but he soon realises that it's not the right thing to do as he sees the yellow.
It will be a substitution. Milos Jojic (Koln) is ready to enter the pitch as Marco Hoger walks off.
Peter Stoger has decided to substitute Yuya Osako and he is replaced by Frederik Sorensen (Koln).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) for Andriy Yarmolenko.
The game has come to an end for Nuri Sahin. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Julian Weigl (Dortmund).
It's in the back of the net! Mahmoud Dahoud is the provider as he slips the ball to Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 5:0.

Lukas Klunter (Koln) doesn't hesitate and begins a run towards the opponent's goal. Defenders try to tackle him, but he manages to keep the ball at his feet and pulls the trigger in front of the goal. The strike, though, was not as successful as the solo run and the ball is easily stopped by the keeper.
Peter Bosz has decided to make a change. Alexander Isak (Dortmund) replaces Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang.
Alexander Isak (Dortmund) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has started.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a diagonal pass, bursts into the box and shoots towards the bottom right corner. Alexander Schwolow is well positioned, though, and it's a comfortable save. The ball is out of play. Bayer Leverkusen win a corner kick.
Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) misses a great chance after he found some space in the box! His effort goes inches wide of the left post.

What a spectacular moment! Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) skips past defenders and finds some space before blasting a long-range strike at goal. The fans are amazed when they see the ball go inside the left post. The scoreline is 1:0.
Problems for Christian Streich as Amir Abrashi is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Mike Frantz (Freiburg) replaces him.

Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) quickly gets to a rebound. He is not worried how far out he is and slams the ball towards the goal. To the amazement of all, it goes inside the left post. He makes it 2:0 with this magnificent strike.

Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Alexander Schwolow makes a great save to stop his effort.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) received a delightful pass inside the box before slotting the ball past the goalkeeper. What a brilliant finish!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Christian Streich makes a switch. Ryan Kent (Freiburg) is coming on in place of Tim Kleindienst at the start of the second period.
Marco Terrazzino (Freiburg) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the right post.
It's time for a substitution. Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on in place of Lars Bender.
That was close by Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes by a whisker over the crossbar.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Marco Terrazzino as he is replaced by Bartosz Kapustka (Freiburg).
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) puts the ball in the back of the net!
The main referee, Sven Jablonski, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Caglar Soyuncu (Freiburg) is given a yellow card for dissent.
Heiko Herrlich decides to make a substitution. Karim Bellarabi will be replaced by Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen).
Goal! No, wait. It's disallowed for a foul by Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Dominik Kohr will be replaced by Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen).
Aranguiz sends a cross in from the free kick. Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) wins the ball and smashes it low into the middle of the goal, increasing the score to 4:0.
Today's referee Sven Jablonski rightly decides to book Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) for his harsh tackle.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.

Goal! The ball is swung into the box from the resulting corner kick and finds Sandro Wagner (Hoffenheim), who jumps highest and tries his luck with a header from around the penalty spot. His effort is both strong and precise enough to go into the bottom left corner. The score changes to 1:0.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) receives a yellow card.
A dangerous towering header by Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) from around the penalty spot goes just over the bar. This corner kick didn't change the score.

Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Oliver Baumann makes a great save to stop the effort going low into the middle of the goal.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin) neatly controls a driven pass on the edge of the box, glances up and cracks a beautiful drive goalwards that sails just over the bar.

He should have scored! Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin) latches onto a pull back in the box right in front of goal, but his shot aimed inside the left post is pretty weak and Oliver Baumann makes an easy save. Hertha Berlin get a corner.

Goal! Marvin Plattenhardt hands Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin) the simplest of tasks from close range after the cross evaded the keeper, and he makes no mistake with his header into the left side of the goal. 1:1.
The game has come to an end for Sandro Wagner. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Mark Uth (Hoffenheim).
It must be a yellow card. It is. Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Felix Passlack (Hoffenheim) replacing Pavel Kaderabek.
Mitchell Weiser (Hertha Berlin) displays brilliant individual ability, gets inside the box and pulls the trigger. His promising effort is blocked by one of the defenders.
Substitution. Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin) in, Ondrej Duda out.
Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Markus Schmidt didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to substitute Steven Zuber and he is replaced by Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim).
Substitution. Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin) replaces Mitchell Weiser.
Substitution. Alexander Esswein makes way for Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin).
Markus Schmidt shows the yellow card to Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) for a heavy challenge.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.
What a big chance! Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and skies the ball well over the bar.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home into the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Goal! Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) runs up to the ball, stops and waits for Peter Gulacsi to commit before slotting the penalty into the bottom left corner.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig). Naby Keita plays a fantastic through ball and finds Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom left corner. 2:1.
Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Peter Gulacsi is alert and denies him.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) is furious with himself as he misses a clear opportunity. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the right post.
The end of the first half.
Referee Marco Fritz blows his whistle to start the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Dieter Hecking probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Jonas Hofmann. He is replaced by Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Jean-Kevin Augustin makes his way off the pitch and Diego Demme (RB Leipzig) comes on as his replacement.
A pass into the box finds Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the roof of the net, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Yann Sommer denies him.
Goal! Denis Zakaria slips it to Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) on the edge of the box and he finds the top right corner with a great effort. The score is 2:2.
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) has tested the patience of referee Marco Fritz and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) drives into the box and hits a tremendous shot that, unluckily for him, flashes just wide of the left post.
Substitution. Kevin Kampl will be replaced by Bruma (RB Leipzig).
Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) is shown a red card by the referee for chasing his opponent and bringing him down with a very nasty tackle!
Here's the change. Emil Forsberg leaves the pitch and Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) comes on as a substitute.
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) for his blatant foul.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Goal! Joshua Kimmich slips it to Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) on the edge of the box and he lashes the ball low into the middle of the net. The score is 1:0.
Robin Quaison (Mainz) unleashes a promising shot towards the left side of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Manuel Neuer thwarts the effort with a fabulous save. The score remains the same.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) takes a great touch after receiving a pass inside the box. He immediately unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal, but the keeper pulls off a decent save!

Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) collects a rebound and his promising attempt heads towards the bottom right corner, but Rene Adler keeps it out with an amazing save. The ball goes out of play. Bayern Munich are awarded a corner kick.

OFF THE BAR! Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the crossbar! It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) is furious with himself as he misses a golden opportunity from inside the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post.
Goal! Joshua Kimmich gets to the ball, slips Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) into the area and he scores with a delightful chipped finish to make it 2:0.
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Stefan Bell (Mainz) for his blatant foul.
Rafinha (Bayern Munich) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Sascha Stegemann had an easy-decision to make.
Sascha Stegemann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Danny Latza (Mainz) comes on the pitch for Pablo De Blasis.
It's in the back of the net! Thomas Muller plays it into the box, and Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the bottom left corner. 3:0.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball is out of play and Bayern Munich manage to earn a corner.
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Abdou Diallo (Mainz) for a tough tackle.
Sascha Stegemann shows the yellow card to Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) for a heavy challenge.
Carlo Ancelotti decides to make a substitution. Jerome Boateng will be replaced by Niklas Sule (Bayern Munich).
Carlo Ancelotti prepares a substitution. Arjen Robben is replaced by Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).
Sandro Schwarz has decided to substitute Daniel Brosinski and he is replaced by Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz).
Manuel Neuer stretches to his right and makes a brilliant save! Fabian Frei (Mainz) met a rebound outside the box and attempted to beat the keeper inside the left post. Mainz win a corner.

Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich) connects with an inch-perfect cross and from around the penalty spot he steers a header towards the top of the net, but Rene Adler pulls off a brilliant save and diverts the ball onto the crossbar.
Carlo Ancelotti has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sebastian Rudy (Bayern Munich) replacing Arturo Vidal.
Here is a change. Abdou Diallo is going off and Sandro Schwarz gives the last tactical orders to Yoshinori Muto (Mainz).

Goal! Joshua Kimmich clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who jumps highest and steers a bullet header from the centre of the box into the bottom right corner. Rene Adler had no chance of stopping that. 4:0.
Sebastian Rudy (Bayern Munich) receives a lofted pass from the side and shoots from the edge of the penalty area, but the ball flies onto the left post!

Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) evades challenges and shoots from the edge of the box. It's a good effort, but flies just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayern Munich.

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot towards the right side of the goal, but Rene Adler pulls off a brilliant save.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) collects a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender.

Philipp Max (Augsburg) unleashes a beautiful rocket of a shot from a long-range free kick. The ball goes into the bottom left corner and leaves the goalkeeper beaten. This takes hours and hours on the training ground. The score is 0:1.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Niko Kovac makes a half-time substitution. Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on in place of Carlos Salcedo.
What a chance that is! Kevin-Prince Boateng (Eintracht Frankfurt) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a pass on the edge of the box. His attempt goes just over the bar.
Chance! Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Mijat Gacinovic, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the left post.
Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Mijat Gacinovic as he is replaced by Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Booking. Rani Khedira (Augsburg) receives a caution from the referee.
