Substitution. Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Jonathan Schmid walks off.

Lukas Hradecky pulls off a great save to deny Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! Now Augsburg have a corner.

Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) scores one of the best goals in his career. His rocket of a shot from distance goes under the crossbar. They will be showing this on every football show for some time to come.
Niko Kovac prepares a substitution. Jetro Willems is replaced by Taleb Tawatha (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) outjumps the defence inside the six-yard box to meet the corner and scores with a great header into the bottom left corner. The keeper had no chance to react. The score is now 1:2.
Manuel Baum has decided to make a change. Konstantinos Stafylidis (Augsburg) replaces Philipp Max.
The foul by Daniel Opare (Augsburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Christian Dingert.
Manuel Baum decides to make a substitution. Alfred Finnbogason will be replaced by Sergio Cordova (Augsburg).
Marwin Hitz (Augsburg) gets a yellow card.
Simon Falette (Eintracht Frankfurt) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) shows off his amazing technique to get to the edge of the box by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the left post. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
Guido Winkmann shows a yellow card to Koen Casteels (Wolfsburg) for his blatant foul. Stuttgart are awarded a free kick.
Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) gets to the rebound inside the box and shoots to the middle of the goal, but his sidefooter is blocked by an alert Koen Casteels. What a save!
Goal! Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 1:0.
William (Wolfsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Guido Winkmann had an easy-decision to make.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
Half-time substitution. Andries Jonker decided to make a change. William is replaced by Paul Verhaegh (Wolfsburg).
Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) gets a yellow card.
Andries Jonker has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Paul Ntep de Madiba (Wolfsburg) replacing Nany Landry Dimata.
Josip Brekalo (VfB Stuttgart) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Anastasios Donis.
The referee signals a substitution. Takuma Asano (VfB Stuttgart) is brought on as a substitute for Simon Terodde.
Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Koen Casteels is alert and denies him.
What a big chance! Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and skies the ball well over the bar.
Problems for Hannes Wolf as Chadrac Akolo is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Orel Mangala (VfB Stuttgart) replaces him.
Substitution. Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) replaces Daniel Didavi.

Paul Ntep de Madiba (Wolfsburg) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Ron-Robert Zieler makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the bottom right corner.
Paul Verhaegh (Wolfsburg) receives a yellow card.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Andreas Beck (VfB Stuttgart) was quite harsh and Guido Winkmann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. Wolfsburg have a free kick.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Thilo Kehrer (Schalke) was quite harsh and Benjamin Brand didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Max Kruse has picked up an injury and is replaced by Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen).
Ludwig Augustinsson (Werder Bremen) rises high to connect with a cross from the corner kick, but his decent header crashes against the right post and ricochets away!
Goal! Lamine Sane (Werder Bremen) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the left side of the goal. It's 1:0.
Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) is totally disorientated and accidentally puts the ball into his own goal!

What a chance that is! Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the right post.
Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke) commits a nasty foul by bringing down his opponent.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Benjamin Brand blows his whistle to start the second half.
Half-time substitution. Domenico Tedesco decided to make a change. Benjamin Stambouli is replaced by Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke).
Evgen Konoplyanka will be replaced by Franco Di Santo (Schalke).
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Breel Embolo (Schalke) replaces Amine Harit.
GOAL - 1:2! The corner comes over and Matija Nastasic flicks on with his head to Leon Goretzka (Schalke), who makes no mistake and fires the ball into the back of the net.
Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Theodor Gebre Selassie.

Franco Di Santo (Schalke) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the bottom right corner. However, Jiri Pavlenka anticipates the shot and makes a brilliant save. The ball goes out of play. Schalke are awarded a corner kick.
Yellow card! It's like Izet Hajrovic (Werder Bremen) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Benjamin Brand agrees and books him.
That's it for today, Benjamin Brand has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Lewis Holtby (Hamburger) fires the ball in from a mid-range free kick, but the effort goes just wide of the right post.
Martins Felipe is substituted due to injury. Andre Breitenreiter gives a chance to Ihlas Bebou (Hannover).
Waldemar Anton (Hannover) sees a yellow card from Robert Hartmann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Robert Hartmann has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) meets a cross inside the box, but his header is blocked by an opposing player.
One of the defending players blocks a shot inside the box, but Martin Harnik (Hannover) pounces on the rebound and gives the goalkeeper no chance with a shot inside the net.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Sejad Salihovic (Hamburger) will replace Bakery Jatta.
Substitution. Albin Ekdal makes his way off the pitch and Torless Knoll (Hamburger) comes on as his replacement.
Here is a change. Kenan Karaman is going off and Andre Breitenreiter gives the last tactical orders to Felix Klaus (Hannover).
Goal! Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 2:0.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Martin Harnik walks off the pitch to be replaced by Florian Hubner (Hannover).
Markus Gisdol decides to make a substitution. Douglas Santos will be replaced by Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger).
That's it for today, Robert Hartmann has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.
Rough tackle by Orel Mangala (VfB Stuttgart). The referee blows his whistle for a foul. It's a penalty! Schalke have an opportunity to score from the penalty spot.
Goal! Ron-Robert Zieler gets a hand on the penalty from Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke), but can't stop it from flying inside the left post.

Benjamin Pavard (VfB Stuttgart) wasted a great chance as he climbed high to connect with a cross from the free kick inside the penalty area. He produced a header which went wide of the right post by a whisker.
Leon Goretzka sprays a pass out to Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke), but he produces a poor effort from inside the box which goes high over the bar.
Simon Terodde (VfB Stuttgart) blows a golden chance from inside the box, volleying the ball narrowly over the crossbar. What a miss!
It's a goal! Josip Brekalo plays the ball to the feet of Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart), who hits a tremendous first-time shot inside the right post. The goalkeeper was unable to keep it out. 1:1.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Domenico Tedesco has made a change at the break. Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) has come on in place of Max Meyer.
The game is over for Nabil Bentaleb. Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) comes on for the second half.

It's in the back of the net! Bastian Oczipka flights the free kick into the box, where Naldo (Schalke) peels off his marker and heads straight into the left side of the net from the edge of the six-yard box. He makes it 2:1.
GOAL! Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Ron-Robert Zieler, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 3:1.
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) dribbles into the box, but Ron-Robert Zieler is quick enough to come off his line and stop him.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Chadrac Akolo.
Hannes Wolf has decided to make a change. Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Orel Mangala.
Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Frank Willenborg didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Simon Terodde (VfB Stuttgart) in a great chance! He climbs highest deep in the penalty box and strikes with a powerful header towards the net. Next time he should aim better. His effort ends wide of the right post.
A substitution has been made. Andreas Beck is replaced by Takuma Asano (VfB Stuttgart).
Domenico Tedesco has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Weston McKennie (Schalke) replacing Amine Harit.
Naldo (Schalke) shoots at goal from the free kick from some 35 metres out. His attempt was quite precise and another few inches and it would have ended under the bar.
Ron-Robert Zieler makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the right-hand post by Weston McKennie (Schalke) after a cross from the side.
Weston McKennie (Schalke) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Frank Willenborg ignores the protests.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) was quite harsh and Bibiana Steinhaus didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
A stunning volley by Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin)! His low effort from inside the box finishes right in the middle of the net. Normally a shot such as this is saved, but this time its a goal!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Goal! Thomas Delaney (Werder Bremen) pounced on a loose ball inside the penalty area and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:1.
We are about to witness a substitution. Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) is replacing Alexander Esswein.
Pal Dardai prepares a substitution. Vladimir Darida is replaced by Valentin Stocker (Hertha Berlin).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Florian Kainz walks off the pitch to be replaced by Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen).
Alexander Nouri has decided to make a change. Ishak Belfodil (Werder Bremen) replaces Fin Bartels.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jerome Gondorf (Werder Bremen) comes onto the pitch so that Maximilian Eggestein can be given a rest.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) sprints into the box to get on the end of a cross and directs a shot goalwards that flies just over the bar. Unlucky!
Goal! Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 1:0.

Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) has tested the patience of referee Daniel Siebert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. Bayern Munich win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) neatly controls a driven pass on the edge of the box, glances up and cracks a beautiful drive goalwards that sails just over the bar.
Fantastic team goal! Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) was set free in the area by Steven Zuber and he made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom left corner. 2:0.
It will be a substitution. Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) is ready to enter the pitch as Sebastian Rudy walks off.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Dennis Geiger as he is replaced by Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) was quite harsh and Daniel Siebert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) for his blatant foul.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Steven Zuber trots off the pitch and is replaced by Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim).
Julian Nagelsmann is forced to make a change. Mark Uth is unable to continue due to injury, Philipp Ochs (Hoffenheim) comes on.
Substitution. Rafinha will be replaced by Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).
Carlo Ancelotti has decided to make a change. James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) replaces Thomas Muller.

Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) creates himself some space around the penalty spot and connects with the free kick. His accurate header would have probably ended up in the roof of the net, but Oliver Baumann pulls off a decent save to thwart him.

The game has begun to heat up. Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle. Hoffenheim are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
Goal! Philipp Max swings the ball deep into the box and finds Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) unmarked, and his close-range header flies past the keeper into the left side of the goal. 1:0.
A clumsy foul by Jonas Hector (Koln) and Tobias Stieler blows his whistle. Augsburg are given a huge opportunity to score - it's a penalty kick!
Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) steps up and confidently directs the penalty into the left side of the goal!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Tobias Stieler has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Peter Stoger has made a change at the break. Jorge Mere (1. FC Koln) has come on in place of Frederik Sorensen.
The referee signals a substitution. Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Michael Gregoritsch.
Substitution. Rani Khedira will be replaced by Jan Moravek (Augsburg).
Peter Stoger has decided to make a change. Sehrou Guirassy (1. FC Koln) replaces Lukas Klunter.

OFF THE POST! Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Manuel Baum has decided to substitute Marcel Heller and he is replaced by Erik Thommy (Augsburg).
Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) fires a brilliant shot from the edge of the box, but the effort rattles the right post! It could have been a superb goal.
Goal 3:0! Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Kevin-Prince Boateng (Eintracht Frankfurt) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Goal! Kevin-Prince Boateng (Eintracht Frankfurt) unleashes a first-time shot from inside the box and beats the goalkeeper into the bottom left corner. 0:1.
Chance! Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Patrick Herrmann, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the left post.
The match has reached half-time.
Robert Kampka blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The referee signals a substitution. Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is brought on as a substitute for Kevin-Prince Boateng.
Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Denis Zakaria.
Gelson Fernandes (Eintracht Frankfurt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Kampka ignores the protests.
Here's the change. Patrick Herrmann leaves the pitch and Raul Bobadilla (B. Monchengladbach) comes on as a substitute.
Substitution. Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Gelson Fernandes.
Niko Kovac decides to make a substitution. Jetro Willems will be replaced by Taleb Tawatha (Eintracht Frankfurt).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Oscar Wendt as he is replaced by Julio Villalba (B. Monchengladbach).
Robert Kampka shows a yellow card to Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach) for a tough tackle.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Robert Kampka didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
A yellow card for a tackle by Julio Villalba (B. Monchengladbach). Robert Kampka doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The main referee, Robert Kampka, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) is given a yellow card for dissent.
Robert Kampka is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Omer Toprak (Dortmund) is coming onto the pitch as Marc Bartra cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Yoric Ravet (Freiburg) makes a horror tackle on his opponent and receives a red card from the referee!
Peter Bosz is forced to make a change. Marcel Schmelzer is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Dan-Axel Zagadou (Dortmund).
Substitution. Vincent Sierro is replaced by Mike Frantz (Freiburg).
Benjamin Cortus has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.

Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and fires a quick shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Alexander Schwolow, who pulls off a stunning save! The ball is out of play and Dortmund manage to earn a corner.
Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund) pounces on a pass inside the box but flashes his shot just over the bar. That was a great chance!
The referee allows time for a substitution. Tim Kleindienst will be replaced by Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg).
Peter Bosz has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Andriy Yarmolenko (Dortmund) replacing Mario Gotze.
Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) rises above the defence inside the box, but his header flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Christian Streich decides to make a substitution. Marco Terrazzino will be replaced by Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

What an opportunity that was! The ball rebounded out to Danny Latza (Mainz), whose shot from the edge of the box goes a whisker wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayer Leverkusen.
Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) scores! He latches on to a pass and produces a perfect strike from the edge of the box that goes inside the left post and past the goalkeeper.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a yellow card.
Levin Oztunali (Mainz) latches on to a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a brilliant shot towards the goal, but he hits the crossbar!
It's in the back of the net! Daniel Brosinski plays it into the box, and Yoshinori Muto (Mainz) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 1:1.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Suat Serdar (Mainz) comes on the pitch for Danny Latza.
Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen) has tested the patience of referee Markus Schmidt and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Julian Brandt walks off the pitch to be replaced by Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen).

Superbly taken set piece! Levin Oztunali takes the resulting free kick and sends a cross into the six-yard box. Abdou Diallo (Mainz) flicks the ball lightly with his head towards the top left corner. Bernd Leno can't react quickly enough and the score changes to 2:1.
Markus Schmidt shows a yellow card to Suat Serdar (Mainz) for his blatant foul.
Heiko Herrlich has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Joel Pohjanpalo (Bayer Leverkusen) replacing Kevin Volland.
Glorious finish by Suat Serdar (Mainz) as he fires a first-time shot from the edge of the box into the bottom right corner, glancing in off the woodwork!

Pablo De Blasis (Mainz) receives a clever pass and shoots from mid-range. His shot looks like it's going in the bottom right corner, but Bernd Leno has other ideas and makes a brilliant save. The ball goes out for a corner. Mainz can continue in their attacking effort.
Sandro Schwarz decides to make a substitution. Pablo De Blasis will be replaced by Karim Onisiwo (Mainz).
The manager makes a subsitution with Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) coming on for Dominik Kohr.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Stefan Bell (Mainz) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Here comes a substitution. Yoshinori Muto is given a rest as he is replaced by Robin Quaison (Mainz).
That's it for today, Markus Schmidt has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Jonathas (Hannover) latches onto a long ball into the box and unleashes a fine volley at goal, but flashes the effort just wide of the left post. That would have been a great goal!
That was close by Divock Origi (Wolfsburg)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.
Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) sends a short pass into the box, Mario Gomez takes a touch to control the ball, but one of the defenders robs him of it and clears to safety.
Divock Origi (Wolfsburg) sends a short pass into the box, Mario Gomez takes a touch to control the ball, but one of the defenders robs him of it and clears to safety.
Andries Jonker is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Mario Gomez suffers an injury and Nany Landry Dimata (Wolfsburg) comes on.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.
Julian Korb (Hannover) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Zwayer didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Felix Klaus (Hannover) goes on a weaving run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his effort to the bottom left corner is thwarted by Koen Casteels.
Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) takes a brilliant free kick and curls the ball inside the right post to give the goalkeeper no chance!
Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) received a precise pass and hammers the ball at goal from close range. Unfortunately for him, his aim was a bit off and it flies just over the bar.
Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
We are about to witness a substitution. Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) is replacing Manuel Schmiedebach.
Andre Breitenreiter prepares a substitution. Felix Klaus is replaced by Kenan Karaman (Hannover).
Fine attempt! Daniel Didavi (Wolfsburg) collects a pass and manages to hold off the defender, then rifles in a shot from mid-range which unluckily swerves inches past the left post.
Goal! Martin Harnik (Hannover) latches onto the ball inside the box and scores a fantastic back-heel goal. He makes it 1:1.
It's time for a substitution. Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) comes on in place of Jonathas.
Andries Jonker decides to make a substitution. Daniel Didavi will be replaced by Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg).
A sweet pass inside the box gives Kenan Karaman (Hannover) time to measure a shot, but it's slightly mishit and goes just wide of the right post. That really was a great chance!
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) wastes a huge chance as he sends a first-time shot from inside the penalty area straight onto the left post!
Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) takes a first-time shot from the edge of the box, but his effort is well blocked by the defender. RB Leipzig have been awarded a corner kick.

Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) blows a clear opportunity to score a goal. He was one-on-one with Christian Mathenia inside the six-yard box and attempted to put the ball into the middle of the target, but was denied by a great save.
CHANCE! Filip Kostic (Hamburger) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he sends his shot well wide of the right post.
Filip Kostic comes off the pitch to be replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Hamburger).
Deniz Aytekin has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
The manager makes a subsitution with Lukas Klostermann (RB Leipzig) coming on for Bernardo.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) for his blatant foul.
What a beauty from just outside the box! Naby Keita (RB Leipzig) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power inside the right post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Kevin Kampl (RB Leipzig) comes onto the pitch for Bruma.
Markus Gisdol prepares a substitution. Rick Van Drongelen is replaced by Gotoku Sakai (Hamburger).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Albin Ekdal walks off the pitch to be replaced by Sven Schipplock (Hamburger).

An amazing individual effort from Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball into the left side of the goal and makes it 0:2. Christian Mathenia was helpless.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) for Jean-Kevin Augustin.
Kevin Kampl (RB Leipzig) steadies himself on the edge of the box and releases a precise effort on goal that just narrowly sails past the right post.
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) makes room to connect with a cross, but his strike from the penalty spot isn't accurate at all and the ball goes well over the bar.
Caution goes to Walace (Hamburger).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
Franco Di Santo (Schalke) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.

Salif Sane (Hannover) leaps highest in the penalty area to get on the end of a cross from the set piece, and he produces a promising goal-bound header towards the right side of the goal, but Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a decent save to deny him. Now Hannover have a corner.
Patrick Ittrich shows a yellow card to Leon Goretzka (Schalke) for a tough tackle.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Domenico Tedesco has decided to make a change. Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) replaces Franco Di Santo.
A short pass from Marvin Bakalorz puts Felix Klaus (Hannover) in the clear inside the box with just the keeper to beat, but his shot sails high over the bar.

He should have scored! Leon Goretzka (Schalke) latches onto a pull back in the box right in front of goal, but his shot low towards the middle of the goal is pretty weak and Philipp Tschauner makes an easy save.
Here comes a substitution. Niclas Fullkrug is given a rest as he is replaced by Jonathas (Hannover).
Goal - 1:0! Marvin Bakalorz tees up Jonathas (Hannover) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom right corner and past Ralf Fahrmann.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to substitute Felix Klaus and he is replaced by Kenan Karaman (Hannover).
Substitution. Amine Harit did his best and is replaced by Max Meyer (Schalke).
Martin Harnik (Hannover) sees a yellow card from Patrick Ittrich after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The referee signals a substitution. Sebastian Maier (Hannover) is brought on as a substitute for Martin Harnik.
Domenico Tedesco decides to make a substitution. Daniel Caligiuri will be replaced by Fabian Reese (Schalke).
Fabian Reese (Schalke) gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the area, but he drags his shot just wide of the right post.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
A mistake by the defender lets in Timo Werner (RB Leipzig), but his first-time shot flies just over the bar.

Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the roof of the net. Alexander Schwolow pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. The ball goes out of play and RB Leipzig have been awarded a corner kick.
Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) has a chance after receiving a pass. He measures his shot from the edge of the box but it sails just wide of the left post.
Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) receives a delightful pass inside the box and smashes a low shot into the bottom left corner. What a clinical finish!

Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) makes contact with a cross but fails to connect perfectly. His low drive heads straight towards the middle of the goal where the goalkeeper makes a decent save to deny him.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Christian Dingert starts the second half.
Alexander Schwolow blocks a long-range effort from Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) towards the bottom left corner. The referee points to the corner flag and RB Leipzig will take a corner.
Emil Forsberg takes over corner duties and expertly finds Timo Werner (RB Leipzig), who scores with a header that bounces up off the ground and goes into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:1.

That was a nice football moment. Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the top right corner. Alexander Schwolow guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save! RB Leipzig have a corner.

Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. Corner kick. RB Leipzig will have an opportunity.
Golden chance! Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
Florian Niederlechner is being substituted because of an injury. Christian Streich sends Onur Bulut (Freiburg) on the pitch.
Goal! Jean-Kevin Augustin puts the ball across the area and Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) has the easiest task in the world to tuck the ball into an empty net. 2:1.
Christian Dingert shows the yellow card to Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) for a heavy challenge.
Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Christian Dingert ignores the protests.
Christian Streich has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Nils Petersen (Freiburg) replacing Janik Haberer.
A substitution has been made. Marco Terrazzino goes off and Florian Kath (Freiburg) comes on.

Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) meets a perfect cross from Jean-Kevin Augustin deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike into the bottom left corner via the post. It's 3:1.
Diego Demme (RB Leipzig) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Substitution. Jean-Kevin Augustin will be replaced by Bruma (RB Leipzig).
Absolutely fantastic goal! Bruma (RB Leipzig) hits a perfect volley from far out and the ball flies into the top right corner. Take a bow.
Christian Dingert blows his whistle and Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.
Ralph Hasenhuttl has decided to substitute Diego Demme and he is replaced by Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Timo Werner walks off the pitch to be replaced by Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig).

A big opportunity is wasted by Dominik Kaiser (RB Leipzig), who makes a yard for himself and produces a mid-range rocket of a shot towards the right side of the goal. Unfortunately for him, Alexander Schwolow pulls off a fantastic save to stop the effort.
That's it for today, Christian Dingert has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! Nuri Sahin puts a cross into the box and finds Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:0.
Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the middle of the goal. However, Rune Jarstein anticipates the shot and makes a decent save.
Sokratis (Dortmund) picks up a yellow card.
Peter Bosz is forced to make a change. Sokratis is unable to continue due to injury, Omer Toprak (Dortmund) comes on.
Marco Fritz has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Great solo effort from Christian Pulisic (Dortmund)! He beat a couple of players and shot from the edge of the box, but the effort slips just wide of the right post.

Nuri Sahin (Dortmund) quickly gets to a rebound. He is not worried how far out he is and slams the ball towards the goal. To the amazement of all, it goes inside the right post. He makes it 2:0 with this magnificent strike.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Salomon Kalou trots off the pitch and is replaced by Genki Haraguchi (Hertha Berlin).
Pal Dardai decides to make a substitution. Vedad Ibisevic will be replaced by Alexander Esswein (Hertha Berlin).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Mario Gotze walks off the pitch to be replaced by Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund).
Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the resulting corner, but he sends his header straight at the goalkeeper.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) gets booked.
Substitution. Maximilian Philipp makes way for Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund).
Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot low towards the middle of the goal was comfortably saved by Rune Jarstein.
What an amazing save by Rune Jarstein! Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot towards the bottom right corner, but fails.

Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) takes a brilliant touch after he latches on to a pass on the edge of the box and strikes the ball to the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper dives low and saves his attempt.
Marco Fritz is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Michael Gregoritsch is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a precise shot into the bottom right corner to make the score 1:0.
Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and sends a low drive past the goalkeeper.
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) can count himself lucky for not being sent off after only receiving a caution from the referee.
Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) gets to a rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball into the bottom left corner, and thus alter the score to 1:2.
The yellow card is received by Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach).

Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball hits the right post and ricochets away.
Jannik Vestergaard (B. Monchengladbach) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg) gets a yellow card.
Sascha Stegemann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
Substitution. Denis Zakaria did his best and is replaced by Laszlo Benes (B. Monchengladbach).
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Patrick Herrmann.
A substitution has been made. Ja-Cheol Koo is replaced by Sergio Cordova (Augsburg).
Manuel Baum prepares a substitution. Jonathan Schmid is replaced by Marcel Heller (Augsburg).
Manuel Baum has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Rani Khedira (Augsburg) replacing Michael Gregoritsch.
Substitution. Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) on for Raffael.
Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) meets a perfect cross from Marcel Heller deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike inside the left post. It's 2:2.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) unleashes a decent effort from just outside the box which goes narrowly wide of the left post.
Admir Mehmedi plays a short pass through to Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) inside the box, but he scuffs his effort well wide of the right post.
The foul by Kevin Vogt (Hoffenheim) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Harm Osmers.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a yellow card.

Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) carelessly slides into the feet of his opponent and he'll be lucky to avoid punishment. Harm Osmers blows for the foul but keeps his cards in his pocket on this occasion. The referee gives a penalty kick to Bayer Leverkusen!!
The referee gives a yellow card to Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim).
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) easily converts the penalty kick as he sends the ball straight into the bottom right corner, ricocheting in off the post. Oliver Baumann was helpless.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Harm Osmers blows his whistle to start the second half.
Julian Nagelsmann has made a change at the break. Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) has come on in place of Lukas Rupp.

Sandro Wagner produces a sweet pass and picks out Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the bottom right corner and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 1:1!
Goal! Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 2:1.
Steven Zuber goes off the pitch and Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) comes on.
Mark Uth (Hoffenheim) meets a perfect cross from Kerem Demirbay deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces a strike into the middle of the goal. The score is 2:2.
Substitution. Nadiem Amiri makes his way off the pitch and Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim) comes on as his replacement.
Heiko Herrlich has decided to make a change. Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Julian Brandt.
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Kevin Volland.
Heiko Herrlich decides to make a substitution. Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) will be replaced by .
Today's referee Harm Osmers rightly decides to book Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) for his harsh tackle.
That's it for today, Harm Osmers has blown his whistle and the game is over.

Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) collects a pin-point pass inside the box and unleashes a snap shot directed into the top left corner, but the goalkeeper dives perfectly to deny him. The ball bounces off his gloves and brushes the post. That was a fantastic reflex save.

Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) controls a reverse pass deep inside the box and smacks the ball low towards the middle of the goal, but the Sven Ulreich anticipates well and smothers the ball.

A wonderful opportunity! Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich) strikes from close range and hits the ball nicely towards the bottom left corner. However, Bernd Leno makes a great save as he anticipates the shot and manages to parry it onto the post.
That was close by Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes by a whisker over the crossbar.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Here we go. The referee makes the decision and the match has to be interrupted due to severe rain.
Referee Tobias Stieler blows his whistle to start the second half.
Heiko Herrlich makes a switch. Aleksandar Dragovic (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming on in place of Sven Bender at the start of the second period.
Heiko Herrlich has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on the pitch for Leon Bailey.

Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) makes an overly-aggressive challenge and Tobias Stieler blows his whistle for a foul. Bayern Munich are awarded a penalty! The opposing players are protesting, but the referee had an easy-decision to make.
Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Tobias Stieler didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) steps up and confidently powers the spot kick into the right side of the goal.
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) gets on the end of a defence splitting pass inside the box and immediately directs a low shot towards the middle of the goal, but the Sven Ulreich makes a great save.
Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
Heiko Herrlich has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Kevin Kampl (Bayer Leverkusen) replacing Aranguiz.
Substitution. Thomas Muller makes his way off the pitch and Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) comes on as his replacement.

Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) leaps highest around the penalty spot to meet a cross from the free kick and produces a promising goal-bound header towards the bottom right corner, but Bernd Leno produces a fine save to deny him.
Substitution. Mats Hummels walks off the pitch and Rafinha (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Arturo Vidal (Bayern Munich), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

Julian Brandt is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Admir Mehmedi (Bayer Leverkusen) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a precise shot which bounces in off the bar to make the score 3:1.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Franck Ribery will be replaced by Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich).
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) get himself out of a tight corner inside the box then shoots. The keeper leaps for the ball but it flies just wide of the left post.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) creates a yard of space for himself and tries an effort from the edge of the box, but it goes just wide of the left post.
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) takes a short pass in his stride inside the box, but hits a poor shot at goal that goes well wide of the left post.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Bernd Leno is alert and denies him.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
